name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大（或多）的，可观的；值得考虑的；重要的【记忆】词根记忆：consider（考虑）+able（能…的）→能纳入考虑范围的→值得考虑的【同义】great adj. 大量的；很大程度的large adj. 巨大的much adv. 大量substantial adj. 可观的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: react
trans: v. 反应；反抗；起化学反应【搭配】react positively to a suggestion 赞成一项提议【同义】respond v. 反应

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: detect
trans: v. 察觉；侦查，探测【同根】undetected adj. 未被发现的detectable adj. 可发现的，可察觉的

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: signal
trans: n. 信号；暗号；标志；v. （向…）发信号；标志着【记忆】联想记忆：sign（签名）+al→用签名作为自己的标志→标志

sentences.english: He pressed the red alarm signal to see if it was on or off.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下红色报警信号钮，检查一下它是开著的还是关著的。

detailed_translations.english: important
a sound or action that you make in order to give information to someone or tell them to do something
to make a sound or action in order to give information or tell someone to do something

name: alien
trans: n. 外星人；adj. 外国的；相异的【搭配】alien species 外来物种

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: civilisation
trans: n. 文明（社会），文化【记忆】词根记忆：civilis(e)（使文明开化）+ ation（表名词）→文明

sentences.english: Perhaps intelligence and civilisation are not what we should be concentrating on.
sentences.chinese: 也许智能和文明不属于我们应该关注的问题。

sentences.english: If I have understood you correctly, you are proposing to do nothing to prevent the likely collapse of industrial civilisation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对你的理解正确的话，你在主张不做任何事情去防止可能的工业文明的崩溃。

sentences.english: Let us examine our history and see how men - the master race for all of our recorded history in almost every corner of every human civilisation - have fared so far.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，让我们检查一下我们的历史，并且看看男性——在我们所有现存历史，几乎每一个人类文明的角落都是统治者的族群，是如何发展的。

name: bicker
trans: vi. （为琐事）争吵【搭配】bicker over 为…争吵

sentences.english: I went into medicine to care for patients, not to waste time bickering over budgets.
sentences.chinese: 我从医是为了治病救人，不是为了预算争吵而浪费时间。

sentences.english: ...as states bicker over territory.
sentences.chinese: …当国与国之间为领土而争执不断时。

sentences.english: The election will end months of political bickering.
sentences.chinese: 这场选举将结束几个月以来的政治争论。

detailed_translations.english: When people bicker, they argue or quarrel about unimportant things

name: brawl
trans: n./vi.（在公共场合）争吵，打斗

sentences.english: Fans brawled outside the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们在体育馆外面闹事。

detailed_translations.english: to quarrel or fight in a noisy way, especially in a public place

name: contention
trans: n. 争辩【搭配】in contention 在争辩中

sentences.english: His case has become a source of contention between civil liberties activists and the government.
sentences.chinese: 他的案子已变成了公民自由活动家们和政府之间的争论缘由。

detailed_translations.english: a strong opinion that someone expresses

name: contentious
trans: adj. 爱争论的；有异议的

sentences.english: Sanctions are expected to be among the most contentious issues.
sentences.chinese: 制裁预计位居最具有争议的问题之列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诉讼的；有异议的，引起争论的；爱争论的
detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of argument and disagreement between people

name: controversial
trans: adj. 争论的【记忆】词根记忆：contro（相反）+vers（转）+ ial（…的）→反着转的→争论的

sentences.english: the controversial issue of welfare reform
sentences.chinese: 福利改革这一有争议的话题

sentences.english: a highly controversial (= very controversial ) plan to flood the valley in order to build a dam
sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

detailed_translations.english: causing a lot of disagreement, because many people have strong opinions about the subject being discussed

name: controversy
trans: n. 争论，辩论【搭配】beyond controversy 无可争论的

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: controvert
trans: v. 驳斥；反驳【记忆】词根记忆：contro（相反）+vert（转）→反着转→反驳

sentences.english: The statement of the last witness controvert the evidence of the first two.
sentences.chinese: 最后一个证人的陈述反驳了前两人的证词。

detailed_translations.english: to deny, refute, or oppose (some argument or opinion)

name: counter
trans: v. 反驳，反对；对抗，抵消

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: debatable
trans: adj. 可争辩的；有争议的【搭配】a debatable point 有争议的地方

sentences.english: a debatable point
sentences.chinese: 有争议的地方

sentences.english: Whether the object was used for rituals is highly debatable .
sentences.chinese: 这一物件是否曾用作礼器有很大的争议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 未决定的， 有争执的
detailed_translations.english: things that are debatable are not certain because people have different opinions about them

name: deny
trans: v. 驳斥，反对

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

name: disagreement
trans: n. 争论

sentences.english: We’ve had a few disagreements , but we’re still good friends.
sentences.chinese: 虽然有过一些分歧，但我们仍是好朋友。

sentences.english: There is disagreement between these two estimates.
sentences.chinese: 这两种估算不符。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people express different opinions about something and sometimes argue

name: disprove
trans: v. 反驳；证明…有误【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+prov（证明）+ e→证明不可行→证明…有误

sentences.english: These figures disproved Smith’s argument.
sentences.chinese: 这些数据证明史密斯的论点是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is wrong or not true

name: dispute
trans: v. 争端，纠纷；n. 论辩【搭配】in dispute在争议中

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: dissentious
trans: adj. 争论的

sentences.english: Ecological discourse' can thus be seen as the most productive cultural form for generating and mobilising ideological consensus and dissentious in modern societies.
sentences.chinese: 生态学讨论可被视为最有效的文化形式，它产生和推动现代社会的思想共识和争论。

detailed_translations.english: argumentative

name: eloquence
trans: n. 雄辩，口才【搭配】eloquence training 口才训练

sentences.english: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 他天生具有罕见的口才。

sentences.english: On the one hand to expand my insight, on the other hand exercise my eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 一方面扩大我的洞察力，另一方面锻炼我的口才。

sentences.english: I exercise in the race his eloquence and ability to cope, to learn some basic manners.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛中我锻炼了自己口才和应变能力， 学习到了一些基本的礼仪。

name: eloquent
trans: adj. 雄辩的【搭配】eloquent speech 雄辩的演讲

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: gainsay
trans: v. 否认，反驳

sentences.english: No one dared to gainsay him.
sentences.chinese: 没有人敢反驳他。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

name: quarrel
trans: v. 争论【同义】argue v. 争论，辩论

sentences.english: I wish you two would stop quarreling.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

sentences.english: Jacob left after a quarrel with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布和妻子吵了一架后走了。

detailed_translations.english: to have an argument
an angry argument or disagreement

name: rebut
trans: vt. 驳斥，反驳

sentences.english: He spent most of his speech rebutting criticisms of his foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分的演讲都用来反驳他在外交政策上受到的各种批评。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or a charge made against you is false

name: refute
trans: v. 反驳；否认

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: rejoinder
trans: n. （粗鲁的）回答【记忆】词根记忆：re（重新）+join（连接）+ der→（别人说完了）再接上→回答

sentences.english: He tried to think of a snappy rejoinder.
sentences.chinese: 他试图想出一句简短的话来反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a reply, especially a rude one

name: retort
trans: n./v. 反驳

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

name: squabble
trans: v. 争吵；口角【搭配】squabble with与…争吵

sentences.english: Mother is devoted to Dad although they squabble all the time.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈深爱着爸爸，虽然他们总是为琐事争吵。

sentences.english: There have been minor squabbles about phone bills.
sentences.chinese: 为电话账单已闹过口角。

detailed_translations.english: to argue about something unimportant
Squabble is also a noun

name: tiff
trans: n.（朋友或情侣之间的）争吵【搭配】tiff with sb. 与某人的争吵

detailed_translations.english: a slight argument between friends or people who are in love

name: wrangle
trans: vi. （长时间的）争论；n. （持久而复杂的）争辩

sentences.english: Don't wrangle with others over trifles.
sentences.chinese: 别为一些琐事与别人争吵。

sentences.english: In political terms, he will “own” health care: suddenly every shortcoming in America’s system—each delayed appointment, insurance wrangle or botched operation—will be his fault.
sentences.chinese: 在政治谈判中，他“拥有”医疗：美国政府系统突然出现的每个缺点，都将是他的错误——每次约定的推迟、保险的争论、行动的修补。

detailed_translations.english: a long and complicated argument
to argue with someone angrily for a long time

name: dweller
trans: n. 居住者，居民

sentences.english: City dwellers suffer higher pollution levels.
sentences.chinese: 城市居民承受的污染程度更严重。

detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

name: evolution
trans: n. 进化，演化；发展【搭配】the evolution of man 人类的进化过程

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: extract
trans:
v. 取出；提取；/ˈekstrækt/
 n. 摘录；提出物【搭配】extract from 从…中提取【同义】remove v. 移开，挪走cull v. 挑选，精选abstract n. 摘要，梗概

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: habitable
trans: adj. 可居住的【搭配】habitable space 居住空间

sentences.english: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for people to live in

name: humidity
trans: n. 湿度；潮湿【搭配】relative humidity 相对湿度

sentences.english: The room is kept at 72 degrees and 50% relative humidity.
sentences.chinese: 房间的温度保持在72度，相对湿度50%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of water contained in the air

name: inhospitable
trans: adj. 不适合居住的【搭配】inhospitable climate 不适合居住的气候

sentences.english: an inhospitable climate
sentences.chinese: 不宜人的气候

sentences.english: He trekked across some of the most inhospitable terrain in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他长途跋涉，穿越了世界上一些最荒凉的地带。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不好客的,不适于居住的
detailed_translations.english: an inhospitable place is difficult to live or stay in because the weather conditions are unpleasant or there is no shelter

name: inorganic
trans: adj. 无机的

sentences.english: inorganic matter
sentences.chinese: 无机物

detailed_translations.english: not consisting of anything that is living

name: lander
trans: n. 登陆者

name: manned space flight
trans: 载人航天飞机

name: microbial
trans: adj. 微生物的【搭配】microbial degradation 微生物降解

sentences.english: ...the question of whether microbial life exists, or once existed, on Mars.
sentences.chinese: ...这个火星上是否存在或曾经存在过微生物的问题。

sentences.english: Microbial infections now kill 17m people a year.
sentences.chinese: 细菌感染现在每年杀死1700万人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 微生物的,  由细菌引起的
detailed_translations.english: Microbial means relating to or caused by microbes

name: orbiter
trans: n. 轨道飞行器

name: organic
trans: adj. 器官的；有机的；有机体的【搭配】organic being 有机体organic food 有机食品

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: planetary
trans: adj. 行星的【搭配】planetary system 行星系

sentences.english: These disks are the remnants of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 这些圆盘是行星形成的剩余物质。

sentences.english: OK, this is the Bohr model, Bohr model of the atom is planetary or nuclear.
sentences.chinese: 好的，这就是波尔模型，波尔的原子模型是行星模型或者核心模型。

sentences.english: One question that has baffled planetary scientists is how oceans formed on the surface of terrestrial planets like Earth -- rocky planets made of silicate and metals.
sentences.chinese: 一个困扰着行星科学家的问题是：海洋是怎样在像地球这样由硅酸盐和金属组成的石质行星的表面形成的？

name: primitive microbe
trans: 原始微生物

name: reside in
trans: 居住

name: solar
trans: adj. 太阳的；太阳能的【记忆】词根记忆：sol（太阳）+ar→太阳的

sentences.english: a solar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 日食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sun

name: space probe
trans: 太空探测器

name: spacecraft
trans: n. 航天器，宇宙飞船【记忆】合成词：space（太空）+craft（技术）→太空技术→航天器

sentences.english: the world's largest and most expensive unmanned spacecraft
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大、最贵的无人航天器

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

name: ultraviolet radiation
trans: 紫外线

name: ultraviolet
trans: adj. 紫外线的【记忆】词根记忆：ultra（超出，…以外）+violet（紫罗兰色）→紫外线的

sentences.english: Ozone in the stratosphere is important because it absorbs some of the Sun’s dangerous ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 在平流层的臭氧是重要的，因为它吸收了一些太阳中危险的紫外线辐射。

sentences.english: Birds perceive the world differently tohumans, being able to see light in the ultraviolet range of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 鸟类感知世界的方式和人类不同，他们能够在紫外线光谱范围内看见光线。

sentences.english: But it also says there is no evidence to support disinfecting toothbrushes in the microwave or with ultraviolet devices on the market.
sentences.chinese: 但它也说，没有证据支持在微波炉或市面上销售的紫外线设备中对牙刷消毒。

detailed_translations.english: ultraviolet light cannot be seen by people, but is responsible for making your skin darker when you are in the sun

name: underground water
trans: 地下水

name: explore
trans: v. 探险，探索；仔细查阅，探究

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: ferret
trans: vi. 搜索，翻找

detailed_translations.chinese: 搜出，查获；驱出；用雪貂猎取
detailed_translations.english: to hunt rats and rabbits using a ferret
a small animal with a pointed nose, used to hunt rats and rabbits

name: grope
trans: v. （暗中）摸索

sentences.english: Ginny groped for her glasses on the bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 金尼在床头柜上摸着找眼镜。

sentences.english: We groped around in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我们在黑暗中摸索。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

name: risk
trans: v. 冒…的危险；n. 冒险；风险【搭配】run （take） the risk of... 冒…的风险at the risk of... 冒着…的危险

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: seek
trans: v. 寻找；探索；追求

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: venture
trans: n. 风险投资；（商业等的）风险项目；v. 冒险；敢于【搭配】venture into the unknown 闯入未知的领域

sentences.english: business/commercial venture
sentences.chinese: 商业风投

sentences.english: When darkness fell, he would venture out.
sentences.chinese: 天黑以后，他就会壮着胆子出去。

detailed_translations.english: a new business activity that involves taking risks
to go somewhere that could be dangerous

name: world war
trans: 世界大战

name: interrupt
trans: v. 中断，阻碍；打断（话），打扰【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+rupt（破，断裂）→在中间断裂→中断，中止【搭配】interrupt the work 打扰工作【同根】interruption n. 打扰，打断

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: raw
trans: adj. 未加工过的；生的；未经训练的；（伤口等）未愈的【搭配】raw material 原材料【同义】natural adj. 自然的；天生的

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

name: stifle
trans: v. 抑制；使窒息；扼杀【搭配】stifle in the cradle 防患于未然

sentences.english: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
sentences.chinese: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （马等的）后膝关节；（马等的）[动] 后膝关节病

name: silk
trans: n. 丝绸【搭配】silk ribbon 丝带

sentences.english: pure silk stockings
sentences.chinese: 生丝面料的漂亮连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: a thin smooth soft cloth made from very thin thread which is produced by a silkworm

name: industry
trans: n. 工业，产业【搭配】advertisement industry 广告产业

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: aggressiveness
trans: n. 侵略；争斗；攻击【同根】aggressively adv. 侵略地；有闯劲地

name: air war
trans: 空战

name: assault
trans: v./n. （武力或口头上的）攻击，袭击【搭配】assault carrier 航空母舰an assault force 突击队

sentences.english: Two men assaulted him after he left the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他离开酒吧之后遭到两名男子的袭击。

sentences.english: The refugee camp came under assault again last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚难民营再次遭袭。

detailed_translations.english: to attack someone in a violent way
a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

name: battle field
trans: 战场

name: besiege
trans: v. 围困，包围；烦扰【搭配】besiege sb. with sth. 使某人应接不暇

sentences.english: In April 655, Osman’s palace was besieged by rebels.
sentences.chinese: 公元655年4月，奥斯曼的宫殿遭到叛军围攻。

detailed_translations.english: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control

name: blockade
trans: n. 阻塞；对（某地的）封锁；vt. 封锁【记忆】词根记忆：block（阻塞）+ade（表动作）→阻塞→封锁

sentences.english: The ships blockaded the port.
sentences.chinese: 船只封锁了港口。

detailed_translations.english: to put a place under a blockade
something that is used to stop vehicles or people entering or leaving a place

name: bombing
trans: n. 轰炸

name: campaign
trans: n. 战役；活动；v. 参加活动【搭配】launch a campaign 发起活动campaign funds 竞选经费

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: classified
trans: adj. （文件等）机密的

sentences.english: He has a security clearance that allows him access to classified information.
sentences.chinese: 他有安全许可，这准许他接触机密。

detailed_translations.english: classified information, documents etc are ones which the government has ordered to be kept secret

name: cold war
trans: 冷战

name: collision
trans: n. 碰撞；冲突，抵触【参考】collide v. 冲撞

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: combat
trans: v./n. 战斗【同根】combative adj. 好斗的

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: confidential
trans: adj. 机密的【搭配】confidential employee 机要人员confidential information 机密消息

sentences.english: a confidential government report
sentences.chinese: 一份机密的政府报告

sentences.english: Doctors are required to keep patients’ records completely confidential .
sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

sentences.english: The information will be regarded as strictly confidential (= completely confidential ) .
sentences.chinese: 这一信息将被视为绝对机密。

detailed_translations.english: spoken or written in secret and intended to be kept secret

name: conquer
trans: v. 征服，占领【同根】conqueror n. 征服者

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: defeat
trans: v. 击败，战胜

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: defense
trans: n. 防御；答辩；[pl.]防务工事【记忆】来自defend（v. 防护，辩护）

sentences.english: Of course, we'll consult closely with our allies every step of the way, because the security and defense of our allies, both in Europe and Asia, is not negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们将在前行道路上就每一步骤与我们的盟国密切磋商，因为我们欧洲和亚洲盟国的安全与防卫是不容讨价还价的。

name: diplomacy
trans: n. 外交【同根】diplomatic adj. 外交的

sentences.english: international diplomacy
sentences.chinese: 国际外交

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交；外交手腕；交际手段
detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of managing the relationships between countries

name: disarm
trans: v. 解除武装【记忆】词根记忆：dis（除去）+arm（武装）→解除武装

sentences.english: Getting the rebels to disarm will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons

name: disarmament
trans: n. 解除武装；裁军【搭配】disarmament conference 裁军会议

sentences.english: a commitment to worldwide nuclear disarmament
sentences.chinese: 在全球范围内裁减核军备的承诺

detailed_translations.english: when a country reduces the number of weapons it has, or the size of its army, navy etc

name: encircle
trans: vt. 环绕，包围【记忆】词根记忆：en（加以）+circl（圆）+e→用圆加以环绕→包围

sentences.english: The island was encircled by a dusty road.
sentences.chinese: 那座岛屿为一条尘土飞扬的公路所环绕。

detailed_translations.english: to surround someone or something completely

name: encroach
trans: v. 侵入，侵占，侵害【记忆】词根记忆：en（进入）+croach（钩）→钩进去→侵占

sentences.english: The shrubs encroached ever more on the twisting drive.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛蚕食了越来越多蜿蜒的车道。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should

name: enlist
trans: v. 参军；谋取（帮助、支持等）【记忆】词根记忆：en（进入…之中）+list（名单）→进入（军队）名单→参军

name: envelop
trans: vt. 包围

sentences.english: the enveloping darkness
sentences.chinese: 笼罩四周的黑暗

detailed_translations.english: to cover or wrap something or someone up completely

name: exterminate
trans: vt. 消灭【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+termin（界限）+ ate（使…）→使出界限→消灭

sentences.english: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

detailed_translations.english: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist

name: insurrection
trans: n. 起义【搭配】insurrection against... 针对…的起义

sentences.english: They were plotting to stage an armed insurrection if negotiations with the government should fail.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在策划如果与政府的谈判失败就发动武装叛乱。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt by a large group of people within a country to take control using force and violence

name: intrude
trans: vi. 侵扰，侵入【记忆】词根记忆：in（进入）+trud（推）+e→推进去→侵入

sentences.english: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略【同根】invasion n. 入侵，侵略invader n. 入侵者

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: martial
trans: adj. 军事的；战争的【搭配】martial skill 军事技能

sentences.english: martial music
sentences.chinese: 军乐

detailed_translations.english: connected with war and fighting

name: onslaught
trans: n. 猛攻，猛袭

sentences.english: The press launched another vicious onslaught on the president.
sentences.chinese: 新闻界对这位总统进行了新一轮的恶毒抨击。

detailed_translations.english: a large violent attack by an army

name: outbreak
trans: n.（战争）爆发；（疾病）发作【记忆】合成词：out（出）+break（断裂）→断裂喷出→爆发

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: rebellion
trans: n. 谋反；反抗【同根】rebel v. 造反rebellious adj. 反抗的；造反的

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: repulse
trans: vt. 击退；排斥【同义】repel v. 击退；排斥

sentences.english: Government troops repulsed an attack by rebel forces.
sentences.chinese: 政府军击退了叛军的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone and successfully stop their attack on you

name: revolt
trans: v. 反叛；厌恶；n. 反抗；叛乱【搭配】quell a revolt 镇压叛乱in revolt 反抗

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

name: riot
trans: n. 暴乱，骚动；v. 骚乱

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

name: tactic
trans: n. 战略，策略【记忆】词根记忆：tact（接触）+ic→和（别人）接触的学问→策略

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: trespass
trans: v. 侵入；非法进入【记忆】词根记忆：tres（=trans横过）+pass（通过）→横穿而过→侵入

sentences.english: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
sentences.chinese: 他将因擅闯私地而被起诉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罪过；非法侵入；过失；擅自进入
detailed_translations.english: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission

name: truce
trans: n. 休战（协定）【记忆】词根记忆：tru（相信）+ce→相信对方而停战→休战

sentences.english: They agreed to call a truce .
sentences.chinese: 他们同意宣布休战。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

name: warfare
trans: n. 战争【搭配】guerrilla warfare 游击战

sentences.english: the realities of modern warfare
sentences.chinese: 现代战争的真实面貌

detailed_translations.english: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially when talking about particular methods of fighting

name: wreck
trans: vt. 破坏；拆毁；n. 失事【同根】wrecking n. 失事；遇难船

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

name: airfield
trans: n. 军用机场

sentences.english: The plane circled over the airfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在机场上空绕圈。

sentences.english: Yet inside a hanger at a Swiss airfield is the prototype of an aircraft (illustrated above) that does not use any fuel at all.
sentences.chinese: 但是在瑞士一个机场的飞机库里面却有一个完全不用燃料的飞机原型（如上图所示）。

sentences.english: Officials were unable to explain what the vehicles were doing on a nature reserve, or why there were windsocks nearby, which appeared to suggest the presence of an airfield.
sentences.chinese: 官员并不能解释这些运输工具在自然保护区的用途，或为什么附的有风向带，风向带表明有似乎有机场的存在。

detailed_translations.english: a place where planes can fly from, especially one used by military planes

name: armament
trans: n. 武器，军备【记忆】词根记忆：arma（=arm武器）+ment（具体物）→武器→兵力

sentences.english: nuclear armaments
sentences.chinese: 核武器

detailed_translations.english: the weapons and military equipment used by an army

name: cannon
trans: n. 加农炮，大炮

sentences.english: The cannons boom, the band plays.
sentences.chinese: 炮声隆隆，鼓乐齐鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大炮；加农炮；榴弹炮；机关炮
detailed_translations.english: a large heavy powerful gun that was used in the past to fire heavy metal balls

name: fortress
trans: n. 堡垒；要塞【记忆】词根记忆：fort（强壮的）+ress（表物）→堡垒

sentences.english: ...a 13th-century fortress.
sentences.chinese: …一座13世纪的城堡。

detailed_translations.english: a large strong building used for defending an important place

name: radar
trans: n. 雷达【搭配】navigation radar 导航雷达

sentences.english: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
sentences.chinese: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。

sentences.english: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

name: weapon
trans: n. 武器，兵器

sentences.english: They all had sticks which they planned to use as weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们都持有棍棒，打算当武器用。

detailed_translations.english: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun

name: armada
trans: n. 舰队【记忆】词根记忆：arm（武器）+ada→舰队

sentences.english: This armada of robots will be our eyes, ears, arms and legs in space, in the air, and on the ground, capable of responding to their environment without us, to explore and embrace the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 这个机器人舰队将是我们的眼睛、耳朵、手臂和腿，它们分布在太空中、大气层内，以及地面上，在没有我们的情况下也可以对自身所处的环境做出反应，接近并探测未知世界。

detailed_translations.english: An armada is a large group of warships

name: bellicose
trans: adj. 好战的，好斗的【记忆】词根记忆：bell（打斗）+ic+ose（多…的）→好战的

sentences.english: bellicose criticism
sentences.chinese: 咄咄逼人的批评

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is likely to start an argument or fight

name: fleet
trans: n. 舰队【记忆】联想记忆：舰队（fleet）遇到问题赶紧逃跑（flee）

sentences.english: Atalanta was fleet of foot (= able to run quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

detailed_translations.english: fast or quick
a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

name: flotilla
trans: n. 小舰队，小船队

name: militant
trans: adj. 好战的；n. 激进分子【记忆】词根记忆：milit（战斗）+ant→好战的

sentences.english: militant political activists
sentences.chinese: 激进的政治活动家

sentences.english: a militant animal rights group
sentences.chinese: 激进的动物权利保护团体

sentences.english: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后，黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

sentences.english: Even now we could not be sure that the militants would not find some new excuse to call a strike the following winter.
sentences.chinese: 即使到现在，我们也不能确定这些激进分子不会找到某个新的借口在下一年冬天号召一场罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有战斗性的人；好斗者；激进分子
detailed_translations.english: Militant is also a noun

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；n. [the ~]军队【记忆】词根记忆：milit（战斗）+ary（…的）→军事的

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: morale
trans: n. 士气【搭配】lift morale提升士气

sentences.english: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.english: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.english: the Prince’s morale-boosting (= intended to raise morale ) mission to the war﹣torn country
sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

name: mutiny
trans: n. 兵变；v. 兵变；反叛

name: navy
trans: n. 海军

sentences.english: the British Navy
sentences.chinese: 英国海军

sentences.english: He joined the navy during the war.
sentences.chinese: 他在战争期间参加了海军。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea

name: troop
trans: n. 军队

sentences.english: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
sentences.chinese: 两国都同意撤军。

sentences.english: troops stationed in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷的驻军

detailed_translations.english: soldiers in an organized group
if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

name: migration
trans: n. 迁徙，移居；迁徙【搭配】migration patterns 迁徙方式language migration 语言迁徙【同根】migrate vi. 迁移

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: issue
trans: v. 流出；发行；n. 发行（物）；问题【搭配】issue a statement 发表声明issue shares 发行股票at issue 讨论或争议中的environmental issues 环境问题

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: biologist
trans: n. 生物学家【记忆】词根记忆：bio（生命）+logist（…学家）→生物学家【同根】biology n. 生物学biological adj. 生物的，生物学的microbiology n. 微生物学

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or works in biology

name: define
trans: v. 下定义；限定；解释【搭配】define sth. as 把某物解释/定义为【同根】definition n. 定义

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

name: in part
trans: 部分地

name: sort
trans: n. 种，类；类型【搭配】all sorts of 各种各类的

sentences.english: Most of the victims developed psychological problems of one sort or another (= of various different types ).
sentences.chinese: 大多数受害者都出现了这样那样的心理问题。

sentences.english: They do burgers, pizzas, that sort of thing.
sentences.chinese: 他们供应汉堡包、比萨饼什么的。

sentences.english: The eggs are sorted according to size.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸡蛋是按大小分类的。

detailed_translations.english: a group or class of people, things etc that have similar qualities or features
to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc

name: bat
trans: n. 蝙蝠

sentences.english: A bat echolocates the direction.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠凭回声测定方向。

sentences.english: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.chinese: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。

sentences.english: It is technically incorrect to talk about bat ‘radar’, since they do not use radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 严密来说，说蝙蝠有“雷达”系统是错误的，因为他们并不使用无线电波。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

name: beast
trans: n. 兽，牲畜【搭配】beast of prey猛兽

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

name: beaver
trans: n. 海狸

sentences.english: ...a coat with a huge beaver collar.
sentences.chinese: …一件带有大海狸毛皮领的大衣。

detailed_translations.english: a North American animal that has thick fur and a wide flat tail, and cuts down trees with its teeth

name: buffalo
trans: n. 水牛【搭配】buffalo horn水牛角

sentences.english: The hunter trailed the wounded buffalo through the bush.
sentences.chinese: 猎人在灌木丛中追踪那只受伤的美洲野牛。

sentences.english: To remind American citizens to protect the environment, the government issued this buffalo nickel.
sentences.chinese: 为了提醒美国公民保护环境，政府就发行了这种野牛镍币。

sentences.english: Humans then may develop living communities where the deer, buffalo, elk and bear, or elephant, giraffe and hippo freely roam again.
sentences.chinese: 或许有一天，人类会组织生活社区，在那里鹿、野牛、麋鹿、熊、大象、长颈鹿和河马会再一次自由倘佯。

detailed_translations.english: an African animal similar to a large cow with long curved horns

name: camel
trans: n. 骆驼

sentences.english: The favorite, of course, is camel.
sentences.chinese: 最受欢迎的自然是驼色。

sentences.english: I wonder what the ECL on a half-camel is.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道半骆驼的有效人物等级是多少。

sentences.english: Earth tones are definitely big for this season, and camel will fit in with trends such as Queen's Country, Town meets Country and the like seamlessly.
sentences.chinese: 大地色无疑是这一季的主打，驼色也非常适合“王室风范”“大都市遭遇乡村风尚”这些流行系列，并且配合得天衣无缝。

detailed_translations.english: a large desert animal with a long neck and either one or two  hump s (= large raised parts )  on its back

name: chimpanzee
trans: n. 黑猩猩

sentences.english: So when you go from head to toe, you're seeing a mosaic creature that is neither chimpanzee, nor is it human.
sentences.chinese: 所以从头到脚，让人看到的是一个在黑猩猩和人类之间模棱两可的生物，这就是始祖地人猿。

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: It was, if I can give a chimpanzee language, I can empty the contents of his mind. He can tell me what he's thinking, how he sees the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的想法是，如果我能交给黑猩猩一种语言的话，我就可以掏空他的想法，他可以告诉我他在想什么，他是怎样看这个世界的。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent African animal that is like a large monkey without a tail

name: donkey
trans: n. 驴

detailed_translations.english: a grey or brown animal like a horse, but smaller and with long ears

name: fauna
trans: n. （某地区或某时期的）所有动物【记忆】联想记忆：来自Faunus（潘纳斯），罗马神话中的动物之神

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

name: genus
trans: n. 种，类

sentences.english: ...a genus of plants called Sinningia.
sentences.chinese: …大岩桐属植物。

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups into which scientists divide animals or plants, in which the animals or plants are closely related but cannot produce babies together. A genus includes fewer members than a  family  and more members than a  species  .

name: gibbon
trans: n. 长臂猿

sentences.english: Beverly: Why else would you grow a pancreas in a teenaged gibbon?
sentences.chinese: 要不然在年轻长臂猿体内培育人类胰腺干什么?

sentences.english: The Christian Coalition should adopt as their mascot the white-handed gibbon, with his perfect nuclear family of one loyal  gibbette and several gibblets.
sentences.chinese: 其中白交长臂猿拥有最忠实和完美的小家庭，基督教联盟完全可以将其作为最纯洁的吉祥物。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a monkey, with long arms and no tail, that lives in trees in Asia

name: giraffe
trans: n. 长颈鹿

sentences.english: I/ you/ we/ they like giraffe.
sentences.chinese: 我/你/我们/他们喜欢长颈鹿。

sentences.english: So they sent me a … giraffe!
sentences.chinese: 于是他们又送我一只…长颈鹿。

sentences.english: Can I get the mommy giraffe for Christmas?
sentences.chinese: 我在圣诞节能得到一个长颈鹿妈妈吗？

detailed_translations.english: a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs and dark spots on its yellow-brown fur

name: gorilla
trans: n. 猩猩

sentences.english: Lose yourself in the play. Be a dinosaur, or a gorilla, or a villain.
sentences.chinese: 放下自己的架子，扮演一只恐龙，或者是大猩猩，甚至是一个坏蛋。

sentences.english: In fact, he found that there was scarcely any information on gorilla cognition at all.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，他发现任何有关大猩猩认知的信息都非常稀少。

sentences.english: The most famous albino animal of all was Snowflake the gorilla, who lived at Barcelona Zoo from 1966 until his death from skin cancer in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的白化动物是大猩猩雪花。 自1966年以来，他一直生活在巴塞罗纳动物园，直到2003年死于皮肤癌。

detailed_translations.english: a very large African monkey that is the largest of the  apes

name: herd
trans: n. 兽群，人群【同根】herdsman n. 牧人

sentences.english: Chobe is also renowned for its large herds of elephant and buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 乔贝还以其大群的大象和水牛而闻名。

sentences.english: It was Tom’s duty to herd the cows.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的职责是放牛。

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
to make animals move together in a group

name: hippo
trans: n. 河马

sentences.english: This photo of a hippo at Disney World has absolutely nothing to do with this post and only serves to confuse things.
sentences.chinese: 这张迪斯尼世界河马照片绝对与本文章毫无关联，放这里只会让你莫名其妙。

sentences.english: "One thing we know about the Herto people, they had a taste for meat, especially hippos, " White said, brushing some sand off a hippo skull.
sentences.chinese: “我们知道赫托人已经开始吃肉了，尤其是河马肉，”怀特一边说着，一边将一具河马头骨上的沙土拭去。

sentences.english: Described as one of the most aggressive creatures in the animal kingdom, an adult hippo can apply several tons of pressure in a single bite.
sentences.chinese: 成年河马是动物王国里最有攻击力的家伙之一，它一嘴咬下来的压力就能有好几吨。

detailed_translations.english: a hippopotamus

name: horde
trans: n. 游牧部落；一大群【搭配】a horde of一群

sentences.english: This attracts hordes of tourists to Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 这吸引了一群群的旅客来到拉斯维加斯。

detailed_translations.english: a large crowd moving in a noisy uncontrolled way

name: horn
trans: n.（牛、羊、鹿等的）角

sentences.english: A mature cow has horns.
sentences.chinese: 成年母牛头上长有角。

detailed_translations.english: a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying  gunpowder  etc

name: koala
trans: n. 树袋熊，考拉【搭配】koala bear树袋熊

sentences.english: No thanks to the koala.
sentences.chinese: 真要感谢那只树熊？！

sentences.english: Dropbears - Dropbears are an evil species of koala that fall from trees and attack humans.
sentences.chinese: 无尾熊--无尾熊是属于一种树袋熊类的邪恶物种，它专门跳下树攻击人类。

detailed_translations.english: an Australian animal like a small grey bear with no tail that climbs trees and eats leaves

name: marmot
trans: n. 土拨鼠

name: niche
trans: n. 生态龛；壁龛

sentences.english: Amanda soon found her niche at the club.
sentences.chinese: 阿曼达很快就在俱乐部里找到了一份理想的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁龛；合适的职业；[亦称作 niche market]【商业】有利可图的市场(或形势等)
detailed_translations.english: a hollow place in a wall, often made to hold a statue

name: ox
trans: n. 牛

sentences.english: We must lead an ox by the halter.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛要牵牛鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: a bull whose sex organs have been removed, often used for working on farms

name: pony
trans: n. 矮马

sentences.english: My guess is that after years of being the trick pony, he wanted to see what it was like to be the ringmaster.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，可能是当了这么多年会变戏法的小马之后，他现在很想看看当马戏团主事什么感觉。

detailed_translations.english: a small horse

name: reindeer
trans: n. 驯鹿

sentences.english: ...a herd of reindeer.
sentences.chinese: …一群驯鹿。

detailed_translations.english: a large  deer  with long wide  antler s (= horns )  , that lives in cold northern areas

name: rhinoceros
trans: n. 犀牛

sentences.english: In this island is also found the rhinoceros, an animal less than the elephant, but larger than the buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 在这个岛上还能找到犀牛，一种比大象小一点的动物，可是比水牛大。

sentences.english: Contrary to its name, the black rhinoceros is actually grey in color.
sentences.chinese: 有别于它的名字，黑犀牛事实上是灰色的。

detailed_translations.english: a large heavy African or Asian animal with thick skin and either one or two horns on its nose

name: seal
trans: n. 海豹【搭配】a colony of seals一群海豹

sentences.english: The document carried the seal of the governor’s office.
sentences.chinese: 文件上盖有州长办公室的章。

sentences.english: He broke the wax seal and unrolled the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他揭去封蜡，把纸卷展开。

sentences.english: The window was sealed shut.
sentences.chinese: 这扇窗户被封了起来。

detailed_translations.english: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it

name: sloth
trans: n. 树懒

sentences.english: He admitted a lack of motivation and a feeling of sloth.
sentences.chinese: 他承认自己缺乏动力，感觉懒散。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怠惰，懒惰；[脊椎] 树懒
detailed_translations.english: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees

name: whale
trans: n. 鲸【搭配】sperm whale 抹香鲸

sentences.english: The receding tide stranded the whale.
sentences.chinese: 退潮把鲸鱼搁浅在海滩上。

sentences.english: So whale come out fish, because they are fish obviously.
sentences.chinese: 所以鲸鱼就是鱼，因为他们显然是鱼。

sentences.english: This sense of revelation is in part due to our changing attitude towards the whale.
sentences.chinese: 与鲸鱼感到关联部分是由于和我们对鲸鱼态度发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

name: woodpecker
trans: n. 啄木鸟

sentences.english: A woodcutter and a woodpecker lived in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 森林里居住着一个樵夫和一个啄木鸟。

sentences.english: Of course, it took years for the Army to hit on a workable strategy for the woodpecker — a lesson that is informing its conservation work today.
sentences.chinese: 当然，拿出一套对保护啄木鸟行之有效的方案，军方花了几年的功夫 ---- 这对于今天的生态保护工作不失为是一个教训。

sentences.english: Savour the silence, if that's what nature serves up, or thrill to the tap-tap of the woodpecker.
sentences.chinese: 如果这是大自然奉上的一份佳肴，给这份宁静加点作料吧，或是因为啄木鸟的叩击声而兴奋起来吧。

detailed_translations.english: a bird with a long beak that it uses to make holes in trees

name: yak
trans: n. 牦牛

sentences.english: We can sell the yak skins and the meat and hair.
sentences.chinese: 我们把牦牛皮、牦牛肉和牦牛的毛卖出去。

sentences.english: Back at the hotel, we slipped on Chinese slippers and ate tiny, crispy bamboo skewers of sesame-coated yak and spiced steamed pumpkin and potato with Tibetan bread.
sentences.chinese: 回到酒店，蹬着中式拖鞋，我们享受了丰盛的一餐：竹烤牦牛肉上还洒满了芝麻，辣味的蒸南瓜以及土豆配藏式面包。

sentences.english: The agriculture of Tibet is based on animal husbandry, with major livestock and fowl including sheep, goat, yak, yellow cat, dzo, horse, donkey, mule, Tibet chicken, and Tibet pig.
sentences.chinese: 农业以畜牧业为主。 主要家畜、家禽主要有绵羊、山羊、牦牛、黄牛、犏牛、马、驴、骡、藏鸡、藏猪等。

detailed_translations.english: an animal of central Asia that looks like a cow with long hair

name: zebra
trans: n. 斑马

sentences.english: The neck of the zebra was nipped by a lion.
sentences.chinese: 狮子咬断了那头斑马的脖子。

sentences.english: But what if your horse suddenly grows zebra stripes?
sentences.chinese: 可是如果那匹马突然长出了斑马的条纹呢？

sentences.english: Sixty acres of woods and ponds are home to camels, zebra, bison, water buffalo, ostrich and antelope.
sentences.chinese: 六十英亩的森林和池塘是骆驼，斑马，野牛，水牛，鸵鸟和羚羊的家园。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a horse but has black and white lines all over its body

name: zoology
trans: n. 动物学

sentences.english: The scholarship money she won helped her attend Cornell University, where she majored in zoology.
sentences.chinese: 她赢得的奖学金帮助她上康奈尔大学，在那里他主修动物学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

name: aquatic
trans: adj. 水生的，水中的【搭配】aquatic animal 水生动物aquatic plant 水生植物

sentences.english: an aquatic plant
sentences.chinese: 水生植物

detailed_translations.chinese: 水生的；水栖的；在水中或水面进行的
detailed_translations.english: living or growing in water

detailed_translations.chinese: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

name: carnivore
trans: n. 食肉动物【同根】carnivorous adj. 食肉的，（植物）食虫的

sentences.english: This is a delicious vegetarian dish that even carnivores love.

sentences.chinese: 自由游动的被囊动物；有时作为一个目。

sentences.english: This system found in some animals, and most of the coelenterate porous , they are Camp fixation living or planktonic life, from either side of the body to stimulate feelings or obtain food.
sentences.chinese: 这种体制见于部分多孔动物和多数腔肠动物，它们营固着生活或浮游生活，能够从身体的任何一面感受刺激或取得食物。

detailed_translations.english: any invertebrate of the phylum Cnidaria (formerly Coelenterata), having a saclike body with a single opening (mouth), which occurs in polyp and medusa forms
(loosely) any invertebrate of the phyla Cnidaria or Ctenophora

trans: adj. 本国的；家庭的；驯养的【记忆】词根记忆：dom（房屋）+estic（…的）→在房子里的→家庭的

sentences.english: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.
sentences.chinese: 我们驯养狗来帮助我们打猎。

trans: n. 科

sentences.chinese: 你认识隔壁那家人吗？

sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: " Cornett's attorney, Jack Johnston, said the tooth "looks like it would be from a herbivorous rodent of some type.
sentences.chinese: 科内特的律师杰克·约翰斯顿说，这颗牙“看起来像是某种食草的啮齿类动物的牙。”

sentences.chinese: “现在，没有大型陆生食草哺乳动物是不需要咀嚼的，”波恩大学的马丁·桑德教授说。

sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

name: offstage
trans: adj. 幕后的【搭配】offstage manoeuvring幕后活动

sentences.english: ...the tragedies of their off-stage lives.
sentences.chinese: ...他们现实生活中的悲剧。

detailed_translations.english: Offstage is used to describe the behaviour of actors or entertainers in real life, when they are not performing

name: playwright
trans: n. 剧作家【搭配】animation playwright动画编剧

sentences.english: The playwright does something remarkable in this scene, but without any impression of straining after an effect.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家在这场中有许多惊人妙笔，但并不给人留下竭力追求表面效果的印象。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成所有主要使用着的语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成世界上多种主要语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes plays

name: puppet
trans: n. 木偶【搭配】puppet play木偶戏

sentences.english: a 20-minute puppet show
sentences.chinese: 20分钟的木偶表演

sentences.english: When the invasion occurred he seized power and ruled the country as a puppet of the occupiers.
sentences.chinese: 他趁入侵之时夺取了政权，作为占领者的傀儡统治着这个国家。

sentences.english: The government is in danger of becoming a mere puppet of the military.
sentences.chinese: 政府面临沦为军方傀儡的危险。

detailed_translations.english: a model of a person or animal that you move by pulling wires or strings, or by putting your hand inside it

name: script
trans: n. 剧本【搭配】script error脚本错误

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

name: thespian
trans: adj. 戏剧的；悲剧性的【搭配】thespian trilogy悲剧三部曲

sentences.english: The actress demonstrated thespian talents at her first audition.
sentences.chinese: 这位女演员第一次试镜就展现出戏剧天分。

sentences.english: She enjoys acting in plays and joined the school's thespian club.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢戏剧表演，而且还加入了学校的戏剧社团。

sentences.english: Calligraphy class frame beat class ancient kite class thespian performance class.
sentences.chinese: 书法班、架子鼓班、古筝班、戏剧表演班等。

detailed_translations.english: Thespian means relating to drama and the theatre

name: black comedy
trans: 黑色喜剧，忧郁喜剧

name: dance drama
trans: 舞剧

name: farce
trans: n. 闹剧；滑稽剧【搭配】political farce 政治闹剧tragic farce 悲闹剧

sentences.english: She admitted that the interview had been a complete farce from start to finish.
sentences.chinese: 她承认，采访从头到尾完全是一场闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: an event or a situation that is very badly organized or does not happen properly, in a way that is silly and unreasonable

name: modern drama
trans: 话剧

name: music drama
trans: 音乐剧

name: musical comedy
trans: 音乐喜剧

name: opera
trans: n. 歌剧【搭配】Peking Opera京剧

sentences.english: We go to the opera (= go to a performance of opera ) regularly.
sentences.chinese: 我们常去听歌剧。

sentences.english: an opera singer
sentences.chinese: 歌剧演员

detailed_translations.english: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

name: pantomime
trans: n. 哑剧【同根】pantomimic adj. 哑剧的

sentences.english: They were made welcome with the usual pantomime of exaggerated smiles and gestures.
sentences.chinese: 他们以那种具有夸张的微笑和动作的一般闹剧受到欢迎。

detailed_translations.english: a method of performing using only actions and not words, or a play performed using this method

name: puppet show
trans: 木偶剧

name: satirical comedy
trans: 讽刺喜剧

name: sentimental comedy
trans: 伤感喜剧

name: situation comedy (sitcom)
trans: 情景喜剧

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧【搭配】love tragedy爱情悲剧

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: tragic
trans: adj. 悲惨的；悲剧（性）的【记忆】联想记忆：t+rag（破旧衣服）+ic→穿破旧衣服的→悲惨的

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: act
trans: n.（戏剧，歌剧的）一幕【搭配】the first act 第一幕

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

name: comedian
trans: n. 喜剧演员【记忆】词根记忆：comed(y)（喜剧）+ian（某种职业的人）→喜剧演员

sentences.english: He started as a stand-up comedian (= someone who tells jokes to an audience ) .
sentences.chinese: 他最初是一名单口喜剧演员。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to tell jokes and make people laugh

name: curtain call
trans: 谢幕

name: funnyman
trans: n. 滑稽演员【记忆】合成词：funny（滑稽的）+man（人）→滑稽演员

name: hero
trans: n. 男主人公；英雄【同根】heroic adj. 英勇的

sentences.english: He had dared to speak out against injustice, and overnight he became a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他敢于站出来抨击不公正的现象，一夜之间就成了国家英雄。

sentences.english: His father was a war hero , a former fighter pilot.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲是一位战争英雄，曾经是战斗机飞行员。

sentences.english: the unsung heroes who drove convoys of aid to Bosnia
sentences.chinese: 运载援助物品到波斯尼亚的那些无名英雄

sentences.english: A man hailed as a hero for 50 years has been unmasked as a traitor.
sentences.chinese: 50年来一直被誉为英雄的人被揭发为叛徒。

sentences.english: The hero of Doctor Zhivago dies in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 《日瓦戈医生》的男主人公于1929年去世。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is admired for doing something extremely brave

name: heroine
trans: n. 女主角【搭配】national heroine 民族女英雄

sentences.english: a heroine of the French Resistance
sentences.chinese: 法国抵抗运动的一位女英雄

sentences.english: The heroine is a senior TV executive.
sentences.chinese: 女主人公是一位电视台高级主管。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is admired for doing something extremely brave

name: impersonate
trans: v. 扮演【记忆】词根记忆：im（加以）+person（人）+ ate→饰演别人→扮演

sentences.english: In the film he amusingly impersonates a woman.
sentences.chinese: 影片中他模仿一个女人，非常好笑。

detailed_translations.english: to copy someone’s voice and behaviour, especially in order to make people laugh

name: interval
trans: n. 间隔；幕间休息【搭配】interval timer 间隔计时器

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: mime
trans: v. 模仿；n. 哑剧表演；哑剧（演员）【记忆】词根记忆：mim（假正经的）+e→假正经，装模作样→模仿

sentences.english: The children learn through role-play, dance and mime.
sentences.chinese: 儿童通过角色表演、舞蹈和哑剧来学习。

sentences.english: They will perform a short mime later.
sentences.chinese: 稍后他们将表演一个哑剧小品。

sentences.english: a professional mime artist
sentences.chinese: 专业的哑剧表演艺术家

detailed_translations.english: the use of movements to express what you want to say without using words, or a play where the actors use only movements
to describe or express something, using movements not words

name: repertoire
trans: n.（剧团等）常备剧目；（剧团、演员等的）全部节目

sentences.english: the behavioural repertoire of infants
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿的行为能力

detailed_translations.english: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform

name: stagehand
trans: n. 舞台管理

name: approach
trans: vt. 靠近；n. 方法，途径【搭配】approach to 接近；做某事的方法【同义】solution n. 解决方案

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: avenue
trans: n. 林荫道；途径，手段【搭配】a tree-lined avenue 树木成行的街道

sentences.english: Fifth Avenue
sentences.chinese: 第五大街

sentences.english: Shaftesbury Avenue
sentences.chinese: 沙夫茨伯里街

sentences.english: a tree-lined avenue
sentences.chinese: 林荫道

detailed_translations.english: used in the names of streets in a town or city

name: direct
trans: adj. 直接的【反义】indirect adj. 间接的

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: fashion
trans: n. 方式；流行款式【同根】fashionable adj. 时髦的

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: forthright
trans: adj. 直率的，直截了当的【记忆】合成词：forth（向前）+right（正）→直率的

sentences.english: She answered in her usual forthright manner .
sentences.chinese: 她以一贯的直率作了回答。

detailed_translations.english: direct and honest - used in order to show approval

name: means
trans: n. 方法，手段，工具【同义】tool n. 工具，手段

sentences.english: The only means of communication was sign language.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.english: The window was our only means of escape .
sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.english: Do you have any means of identification ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: art as a means of expression
sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: method
trans: n. 方法，办法【搭配】teaching method 教学法payment method 付款方式

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

name: mode
trans: n. 模式；方式；风格【搭配】mode of transportation交通方式

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: pathway
trans: n. 途径，路，径

sentences.english: Richard was coming up the pathway.
sentences.chinese: 理查德正沿路走来。

detailed_translations.english: a path

name: procedure
trans: n. 手续，步骤【搭配】regular procedure 正规手续the registration procedure 登记手续

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: recipe
trans: n. 食谱；方法，秘诀【同义】knack n. 技巧，诀窍

sentences.english: a recipe book
sentences.chinese: 一本烹饪书

detailed_translations.english: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

name: shortcut
trans: n. 捷径

sentences.english: I tried to take a shortcut and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 我试着走近路，结果迷路了。

sentences.english: Fame can be a shortcut to love and money.
sentences.chinese: 名望可以是得到爱情和金钱的捷径。

detailed_translations.english: a quicker way of getting somewhere than the usual route

name: tip
trans: n. 窍门

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
sentences.chinese: 你留小费了吗？

sentences.english: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 头盔向前耷拉下来，男孩把它往后推了推。

detailed_translations.english: the end of something, especially something pointed
to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this

name: via
trans: prep. 通过，借助于

sentences.english: We flew to Athens via Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们经由巴黎飞往雅典。

detailed_translations.english: travelling through a place on the way to another place

name: afraid
trans: adj. 恐怕，担心的【搭配】be afraid of害怕

sentences.english: There’s no need to be afraid.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要害怕。

sentences.english: He was afraid that the other kids would laugh at him.
sentences.chinese: 他担心其他孩子会嘲笑他。

detailed_translations.english: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

name: happen
trans: v. 发生【记忆】词根记忆：happ（=hap，机会）+en（使…）→使成为机会→发生

sentences.english: When did the accident happen?
sentences.chinese: 事故什么时候发生的？

sentences.english: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.chinese: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.english: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.chinese: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.english: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 这事注定早晚会发生。

sentences.english: This kind of thing happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这种事一直在发生。

sentences.english: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
sentences.chinese: 真巧，我正好认识一个人，这个人也许帮得上忙。

sentences.english: We happened to discover we had a friend in common.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰巧发现我们有个共同的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

name: magazine
trans: n. 杂志【搭配】magazine cover杂志封面

sentences.english: a magazine article
sentences.chinese: 杂志中的文章

sentences.english: She glanced over the magazine racks.
sentences.chinese: 她扫了一眼杂志架。

detailed_translations.english: a large thin book with a paper cover that contains news stories, articles, photographs etc, and is sold weekly or monthly

name: disappear
trans: v. 消失【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+appear（出现）→不出现→消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: row
trans: n. 行，排

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: alarm
trans: n. 警报；闹钟；vt. （使）惊恐；（使）担心【记忆】联想记忆：al+arm（武器）→受了惊吓，拿起武器→惊恐

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: anxious
trans: adj. 渴望的；忧虑的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: uneasy
trans: adj. 心神不安的；担心的【记忆】词根记忆：un（不）+easy（安心的）→不安心的→心神不安的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: evaporate
trans: v. （使）蒸发；消失【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+vapor（水气）+ ate （使…）→使水气出去→蒸发

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: evaporation
