trans: 变态心理学

name: criminal psychology
trans: 犯罪心理学

name: educational psychology
trans: 教育心理学

name: group psychology
trans: 从众心理、群体心理学

name: individual psychology
trans: 个体心理学

name: personality psychology
trans: 个性心理学、人格心理学

name: social psychology
trans: 社会心理学

name: acrophobia
trans: n. 恐高症【记忆】词根记忆：acro（高点）+phob（恐惧）+ ia（某种病）→恐高症

name: affective
trans: adj. 情感的【同根】affection n. 感情

sentences.english: affective disorders
sentences.chinese: 情感障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 感情的， 表达感情的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or having an effect on the emotions

name: allergy
trans: n. 过敏症

sentences.english: a food allergy
sentences.chinese: 食物过敏

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which you become ill or in which your skin becomes red and painful because you have eaten or touched a particular substance

name: apathy
trans: n. 无感情，无兴趣，冷漠【记忆】词根记忆：a（无）+pathy（感情）→无感情

sentences.english: The campaign failed because of public apathy.
sentences.chinese: 由于公众反应冷淡，这次运动失败了。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of not being interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things

name: assertive
trans: adj. 武断的【记忆】词根记忆：assert（断言）+ive（…的）→武断的

sentences.english: Women have become more assertive in the past decade.
sentences.chinese: 妇女在过去十年已变得更坚定自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肯定的；独断的；坚定而自信的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident way, so that people notice you

name: attributable
trans: adj. 可归因于【记忆】词根记忆：attribut(e)（把…归于）+ able（可…的）→可归因于

sentences.english: 10,000 deaths a year from chronic lung disease are attributable to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 每年1万个慢性肺病患者的死亡可能是由于吸烟导致的。

detailed_translations.english: likely to have been caused by something

name: claustrophobia
trans: n. 幽闭恐惧症【记忆】词根记忆：claustro（密闭空间）+phob（恐惧）+ia（某种病）→幽闭恐惧症

sentences.english: Excess sugar is known to cause claustrophobia, memory loss and other neurotic disorders.
sentences.chinese: 已知过多的糖会造成幽闭恐怖症、失忆和其他神经疾病。

sentences.english: Excess sugar is known to cause claustrophobia, memory loss and other neurotic disorders.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，过量的糖会引起幽闭恐怖症、记忆丧失和其他的神经紊乱。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of being in a small enclosed space or in a situation that limits what you can do

name: congenital
trans: adj. 先天的【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+genit（出生）+ al（…的）→与生俱来的，出生就带来的→先天的

sentences.english: congenital abnormalities
sentences.chinese: 先天畸形

sentences.english: a congenital defect
sentences.chinese: 先天性缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a congenital medical condition or disease has affected someone since they were born

name: delusion
trans: n. 迷惑，欺瞒【记忆】词根记忆：de+lus（玩）+ion→玩阴的（手段）→欺骗

sentences.english: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 我有一种错觉，他要娶我。

detailed_translations.english: a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in

name: deviance
trans: n. 偏常；异常行为（或特征）【记忆】词根记忆：de（偏离）+vi（路）+ant→偏离正规，不太正常→偏常【同根】deviant adj. 不正常的，偏离常规的

name: disorder
trans: n. 混乱；失调；vt. 扰乱，使失调【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+order（顺序）→无序→混乱【同根】disorderly adj. 混乱的，无秩序的

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

name: emotional
trans: adj. 感情（上）的，情绪（上）的；引起情感的；易动感情的【记忆】联想记忆：e（好似电子）+motion（运动）+al→电子的运动带来情感→感情上的

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: illusion
trans: n. 幻想中的事物，错误的观念；错觉，幻觉【记忆】词根记忆：il（进入）+lus（玩）+ion（表名词）→有被玩弄的幻觉→幻觉【同义】mirage n. 幻景，幻想

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: innate
trans: adj. 天赋的【记忆】词根记忆：in（进入）+nat（出生）+e→生来就带有→天赋的

sentences.english: Children have an innate ability to learn language.
sentences.chinese: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的
detailed_translations.english: an innate quality or ability is something you are born with

name: insane
trans: adj. 蠢极的，荒唐的；（患）精神病的，疯狂的【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+sane（健全的）→精神不健全的→精神病的【反义】sane adj. 神智健全的

sentences.english: That’s an insane risk.
sentences.chinese: 那是疯狂的冒险之举。

sentences.english: The whole idea sounds absolutely insane to me.
sentences.chinese: 整个主意在我看来荒谬至极。

sentences.english: Why did you do that? Have you gone insane?
sentences.chinese: 为什么这么做？你疯了吗？

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能，直觉；天性【记忆】词根记忆：in（内）+stinct（刺激）→内在的刺激→本能

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: mental
trans: adj. 心理的，精神的；智力的【记忆】词根记忆：ment（想，心智）+al（…的）→心理的，精神的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: multiple personality
trans: 多重人格

name: pathology
trans: n. 病理学【记忆】词根记忆：path（病）+ology（…学）→病理学

sentences.english: One person may show lots of pathology in their brain while another shows very little, yet both may have had dementia.
sentences.chinese: 即使两人都患有痴呆症，但一人的大脑可能在病理现象中呈现较多，而另一个人可能较少。

sentences.english: According to the scientific team, only one of these four categories of gamblers actually shows signs of a significant pathology.
sentences.chinese: 根据科学小组得知，事实上在这四种赌徒里只有一种显示出明显的病理学的迹象。

sentences.english: It makes sense to leave the ovaries if there is no risk factors or pathology at the time of surgery, especially in young women since those are the ones who seem to be most affected.
sentences.chinese: 斯科西亚说，“如果在手术时没有出现危险因素或病理原因，那么保留卵巢就是合理的，尤其是那些年轻妇女，因为她们似乎是受到影响最大的人群。”

detailed_translations.english: the study of the causes and effects of illnesses

name: phobia
trans: n. 恐惧（症）【记忆】词根记忆：phob（恐惧）+ia（某种病）→恐惧（症）

sentences.english: Some children suffer from school phobia .
sentences.chinese: 有些儿童对上学有恐惧症。

detailed_translations.english: a strong unreasonable fear of something

name: psychiatry
trans: n. 精神病学【记忆】词根记忆：psych（精神）+iatry→精神病学

sentences.english: In it, he argued that psychiatry was a branch of medical science and should be investigated by observation and experimentation like the other natural sciences.
sentences.chinese: 在书中，他主张精神病学是医学的一个分支，应当像其他自然科学一样以观察和实验为研究手段。

detailed_translations.english: the study and treatment of mental illnesses

name: psychic
trans: adj. 精神的【记忆】词根记忆：psych（精神）+ic（…的）→精神的

sentences.english: a spiritual healer with psychic powers
sentences.chinese: 有超自然力量的精神治疗师

sentences.english: a documentary on psychic phenomena
sentences.chinese: 关于超自然现象的纪录片

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的；心灵的；灵魂的；超自然的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the power of the human mind to do strange or surprising things that cannot be explained by reason

name: rational
trans: adj. 理性的；合理的【记忆】词根记忆：rat（计算）+ion+al（…的）→通过计算来定量→理性的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: retrospection
trans: n. 回顾，反省【记忆】词根记忆：retro（向后）+spect（看）+ ion→ 回顾

name: spiritual
trans: adj. 精神的；心灵的；宗教（上）的【记忆】词根记忆：spirit（精神）+ual（…的）→精神的【搭配】spiritual damage 精神伤害

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

name: sympathy
trans: n. 同情；（思想感情上的）赞同【记忆】词根记忆：sym（相同）+path（感情）+ y→怀有相同的感情→同情

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

name: symptom
trans: n. 症状【搭配】clinical symptom临床表现

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: trauma
trans: n. 创伤

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

name: abolish
trans: v. 废止，废除【记忆】词根记忆：abol（消除）+ish（使…）→废止

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: accomplice
trans: n. 同谋者，帮凶【记忆】词根记忆：ac（加强）+com（共同）+ plic（重叠）+e→共同聚集在一起（做事）→同谋者

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: acquittal
trans: n. 宣判无罪【记忆】词根记忆：ac（加强）+quit（使自由）+ tal→（疑犯）获得自由→宣判无罪

sentences.english: ...the acquittal of six police officers charged with beating up a suspect.
sentences.chinese: …对被控殴打一嫌疑犯的６名警官作出的无罪判决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赦免；无罪开释；履行；尽职；（债务等的）清偿

name: annul
trans: v. 废除，取消【记忆】词根记忆：an（加强）+nul（=null没有）→变没有→取消【同根】annulment n. 解除（婚约），废止（契约）

sentences.english: Their marriage was annulled last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻关系去年宣告解除。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a marriage or legal agreement no longer exists

name: arbitration
trans: n. （由争执双方挑选的人所做的）公断，仲裁【记忆】词根记忆：arbitr（判断）+ation（表名词）→仲裁

sentences.english: The dispute is going to arbitration (=  someone is being asked to arbitrate  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这场争议将提请仲裁。

sentences.english: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to binding arbitration .
sentences.chinese: 纠纷双方都接受了约束性仲裁。

detailed_translations.english: the process of judging officially how an argument should be settled

name: bill
trans: n. 法案

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: cancellation
trans: n. 取消【记忆】来自cancel（v. 取消，把…作废）

sentences.english: Rail passengers are fed up with cancellations and delays.
sentences.chinese: 火车乘客厌烦取消班次和误点的问题。

sentences.english: Bad weather led to the cancellation of the game.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好导致比赛取消了。

detailed_translations.english: a decision that an event that was planned will not happen

name: captivity
trans: n. 囚禁，拘留【记忆】词根记忆：capt（抓）+ivity（情况）→抓住→拘留

sentences.english: The hostages were released from captivity.
sentences.chinese: 人质被释放了。

detailed_translations.english: when a person or animal is kept in a prison,  cage  etc and not allowed to go where they want

name: codification
trans: n. 法典编纂【记忆】词根记忆：cod(e)（编码）+ification（形成…）→法典编纂

name: condone
trans: vt. 宽恕【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+don（给予）+ e→给出（大度）→宽恕

sentences.english: I cannot condone the use of violence under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我不能原谅在任何情况下使用暴力。

detailed_translations.english: to accept or forgive behaviour that most people think is morally wrong

name: confirmation
trans: n. 证实，确认；批准【搭配】confirmation message 确认信息

sentences.english: There has still been no official confirmation of the report.
sentences.chinese: 这则报道仍未得到官方证实。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, document etc that says that something is definitely true

name: constitution
trans: n. 宪法，章程；组成，设立【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+stitut（建立）+ ion（表物）→宪法

sentences.english: The right to speak freely is written into the Constitution of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由的权利被写入美国宪法。

sentences.english: She’s got a strong constitution – she’ll recover in no time.
sentences.chinese: 她体质强壮，很快就会恢复。

sentences.english: What’s the chemical constitution of the dye?
sentences.chinese: 这种染料的化学成分是什么？

detailed_translations.english: a set of basic laws and principles that a country or organization is governed by

name: court
trans: n. 法院

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: culprit
trans: n. 犯人【记忆】词根记忆：culp（罪）+rit→犯人

sentences.english: Police finally managed to catch the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 警察终于抓住了罪犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯人，罪犯；被控犯罪的人
detailed_translations.english: the person who is guilty of a crime or doing something wrong

name: decree
trans: n. 法令；判决【搭配】government decree政府法令to issue a decree颁布法令

sentences.english: We assembled here today are issuing a new decree to be heardin every city, in every foreign capital, and in every hall of power.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们聚集于此，是为了颁布新的命令，让它在每座城市、每个国家的首都、每座权力的殿堂回响。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official judgment or give an official order
an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country

name: defendant
trans: n. 被告【搭配】nominal defendant名义被告

sentences.english: We find the defendant not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 我们裁定被告无罪。

detailed_translations.english: the person in a court of law who has been  accused  of doing something illegal

name: denounce
trans: vt. 告发【记忆】词根记忆：de（毁）+nounc（说）+e→说毁人的话→告发

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: deposition
trans: n. 革职；废黜；证人陈述【记忆】词根记忆：de（去掉）+position（位置）→革职

sentences.english: the deposition of the King
sentences.chinese: 废黜国王

detailed_translations.english: the act of removing someone from a position of power

name: detain
trans: vt. 耽搁；拘留【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+tain（拿住）→反复被捉住→拘留

sentences.english: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
sentences.chinese: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。

sentences.english: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
sentences.chinese: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

detailed_translations.english: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

name: domineering
trans: adj. 专横的，霸道的

sentences.english: a domineering mother
sentences.chinese: 专横的母亲

detailed_translations.chinese: 跋扈的；专横的；盛气凌人的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is domineering tries to control other people without considering their feelings or ideas – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 实行暴政；高耸；流行（domineer的ing形式）

name: enforcement
trans: n. 执行，强制【搭配】strict enforcement of a new law 新法令的强制执行

name: exempt
trans: vt. 免除，豁免；adj. 被免除的【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+empt（获得）→获得出去（的权利）→豁免

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: extradition
trans: n. 引渡

name: eyewitness
trans: n. 目击者，见证人【搭配】eyewitness account目击人的叙述

sentences.english: One eyewitness said he saw her talking to a man in a blue car.
sentences.chinese: 一名目击者说他看见她在跟一个坐在蓝色汽车里的男子说话。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has seen something such as a crime happen, and is able to describe it afterwards

name: hearing
trans: n. 听证会

sentences.english: a child with a hearing disability
sentences.chinese: 有听力障碍的儿童

detailed_translations.english: the sense which you use to hear sounds

name: impeach
trans: vt. 弹劾【记忆】词根记忆：im（加以…）+peach（告发）→加以告发→弹劾

sentences.english: The governor was impeached for using state funds improperly.
sentences.chinese: 州长因违规使用州政府资金而受到弹劾。

detailed_translations.english: if a government official is impeached, they are formally charged with a serious crime in a special government court

name: imprison
trans: v. 监禁【搭配】imprison sb. in sth. 将某人禁锢于某处

sentences.english: The government imprisoned all opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 政府把反对派领导人全部监禁起来。

sentences.english: She was imprisoned within his strong arms.
sentences.chinese: 她被他强壮的手臂搂着。

sentences.english: Many elderly people feel imprisoned in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人感到待在自己家里跟坐牢一样。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving

name: imprisonment
trans: n. 监禁【搭配】sentenced to life imprisonment 被判终身监禁

sentences.english: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 她被判处7年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned

name: incriminate
trans: vt. 显示…有罪【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+crimin（罪）+ ate→显示…有罪

sentences.english: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
sentences.chinese: 他声称那些毒品是有人为了栽赃陷害他而放在那里的。

detailed_translations.english: If something incriminates you, it suggests that you are responsible for something bad, especially a crime

name: indemnity
trans: n. 赔款，补偿；（保证赔偿的）保障【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+demn（伤害）+ity（表性质）→使不受损害→保障【同根】indemnification n. 保障；补偿，补偿物

sentences.english: insurance providing indemnity against future liabilities
sentences.chinese: 对将来的债务提供保障的保险

detailed_translations.english: protection against loss or damage, especially in the form of a promise to pay for any losses or damage

name: interrogatory
trans: adj. 质问的，疑问的

name: jurisprudence
trans: n. 法学【记忆】词根记忆：juris（法律）+prud（小心）+ ence（表行为）→认真学法→法学

sentences.english: In jurisprudence it is a well-known principle that justice should not merely be done but should also be seen to be done.
sentences.chinese: 在法理学方面，人所共知的原则是：对受害者不仅应该公正对待，而且应当让人们看到他得到了公正的对待。

sentences.english: As a separate science of law, health jurisprudence should have its own theoretical system.
sentences.chinese: 作为独立的法学学科，卫生法学应形成公认的理论体系。

detailed_translations.english: the science or study of law

name: legality
trans: n. 合法性【记忆】词根记忆：legal（合法的）+ity（表性质） →合法性

name: legislation
trans: n. 法律，法规；立法

sentences.english: This is a very important piece of legislation (= law ).
sentences.chinese: 这是一条非常重要的法规。

detailed_translations.english: a law or set of laws

name: liability
trans: n. （法律上对还款、赔偿的）责任，义务；倾向；债务【搭配】limited liability有限责任

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

name: non-observance
trans: n. （对法律、习俗等的）不遵守，违反【记忆】词根记忆：non（不）+observance（遵守）→不遵守

name: notary
trans: n. 公证人

sentences.english: Want to be an assistant judge or notary.
sentences.chinese: 想成为一名助理法官或公证人。

sentences.english: The notary looked at the count with astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 那公证人惊异地望着伯爵。

sentences.english: "Very well; and where is this house that I purchase?" asked the count carelessly, addressing himself half to Bertuccio, half to the notary.
sentences.chinese: “好极了，我买的这座房子在什么地方？” 伯爵随意地问道，这句话一半是对贝尔图乔说的，一半是对公证人说的。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a lawyer, who has the legal power to make a signed statement or document official

name: observance
trans: n. 遵守

sentences.english: the Memorial Day observance
sentences.chinese: 纪念日的习俗

detailed_translations.chinese: (法律习俗等)遵守；奉行；礼仪，仪式
detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a law or does something because it is part of a religion, custom, or ceremony

name: patent
trans: n. 专利（权）；v. 申请专利【搭配】patent device 专利设备apply for a patent 申请专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: penalty
trans: n. 惩罚，罚金【搭配】death penalty 死刑

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: query
trans: n. 质问，疑问；v. 质疑【记忆】词根记忆：quer（寻求）+y（表行为）→寻求答案→疑问

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: ratification
trans: n. 批准【记忆】词根记忆：rat（计算）+ification（表抽象名词）→通过计算证实→批准

sentences.english: We welcome this development and we look forward to early ratification of the treaty by China.
sentences.chinese: 我们欢迎这一进展并期望中国早日批准本条约。

detailed_translations.english: The ratification of a treaty or written agreement is the process of ratifying it

name: recidivist
trans: n. 惯犯

name: remit
trans: vt. 免除（债务或处罚）

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状
detailed_translations.english: to free someone from a debt or punishment

name: revocation
trans: n. 撤回【记忆】词根记忆：re（回）+voc（声音）+ation →（原来的）话收回→撤回

sentences.english: The assignment, delegation or revocation shall be in writing and shall not take effect until copies have been received by both Parties.
sentences.chinese: 此类委托、授权或撤回应是书面的并且在合同双方接到副本之前不能生效。

detailed_translations.english: the act of revoking a law, decision, or agreement

name: substantiate
trans: vt. 证实【记忆】词根记忆：sub（下）+stant（站）+iate →（让理论）能站得住脚→证实

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: summons
trans: n. 传票

sentences.english: The judge must issue a summons .
sentences.chinese: 法官必须发出传票。

sentences.english: He had been accused of a drug offence but police had been unable to serve a summons on him (= officially order him to appear in court ) .
sentences.chinese: 他被指控贩卖毒品罪，但警方一直无法把传票送达给他。

detailed_translations.english: an official order to appear in a court of law

name: testify
trans: v. （尤指在法庭上）作证【记忆】词根记忆：testi（证据）+fy（使…）→用证据证明→作证

sentences.english: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

sentences.english: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
sentences.chinese: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

detailed_translations.english: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

name: accusation
trans: n. 控告，起诉，告发，谴责【搭配】bring an accusation against对…起诉

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: indictment
trans: n. 控告

name: lawsuit
trans: n. 诉讼

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

name: nonsuit
trans: n. 诉讼驳回

name: plaintiff
trans: n. 起诉人，原告【记忆】词根记忆：plaint（抱怨）+iff（表名词）→原告

sentences.english: The lead plaintiff of the lawsuit is the University of California.
sentences.chinese: 这次诉讼的第一原告是加利福尼亚大学。

detailed_translations.english: someone who brings a legal action against another person in a court of law

name: plea
trans: n. 恳求；（法庭中被告一方的）抗辩，答辩，辩护【搭配】plea bargain认罪求情

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: proceeding
trans: n. 诉讼

sentences.english: The proceedings of the inquiry will take place in private.
sentences.chinese: 调查行动将秘密进行。

detailed_translations.english: The proceedings are an organized series of events that take place in a particular place

name: prosecute
trans: v. 起诉，控告，检举【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+secut（跟随）+ e→跟随（法官）在他面前（告状）→控告

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

name: sue
trans: v. 控告，提起诉讼

sentences.english: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
sentences.chinese: 如果建筑商不履行合同，我们就要提出起诉。

sentences.english: The company is suing a former employee.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正在起诉一名前雇员。

sentences.english: The railway may sue for damages (= in order to get money ) because of loss of revenue.
sentences.chinese: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉，要求赔偿。

sentences.english: He is being sued for divorce (= in order to end a marriage ) by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子对他提出起诉，要求离婚。

detailed_translations.english: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sue)人名；(日)末(名)；(法)休；(英)休(女子教名Susan、Susanna的昵称)

name: display
trans: vt./n. 陈列，展览；显示，表现【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+play（播放，表演） →分列展示→陈列【搭配】on display 展示，陈列【同义】exhibition n. 展览show n. 展出

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: warning
trans: n. 警告【搭配】warning sign警告标志

sentences.english: a warning that grey squirrels are threatening the existence of red squirrels
sentences.chinese: 关于灰松鼠正威胁到红松鼠生存的警告

detailed_translations.english: something, especially a statement, that tells you that something bad, dangerous, or annoying might happen so that you can be ready or avoid it

name: critical
trans: adj. 批评的；评论的；危急的；紧要的；临界的；挑剔的【记忆】词根记忆：crit（判断）+ical（…的）→做出判断的→评论的【搭配】critical of 爱挑毛病的，批评的critical thoughts 挑剔的思想be of critical importance 至关重要critical point 临界点a critical period 危险期【同根】uncritical adj. 不加批判的critically adv. 危急地；用钻研目光地

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: emerge
trans: v. 现出；显露，（事实等）暴露【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+merg（沉，没）+e→水落石出→显露

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: spontaneous
trans: adj. 自发的，自然而然的【记忆】词根记忆：spont（=spond承诺）+aneous（有…特征的）→发自（内心）的承诺→自发的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

name: criticism
trans: n. 批评【搭配】take criticism 接受批评literary criticism 文学批评

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: suppress
trans: v. 压制，镇压；禁止发表；抑制（感情等）；阻止…的生长（或发展）【记忆】词根记忆：sup（下）+press（压）→压下去→镇压【同义】squash vt. 镇压，压制restrain vt. 抑制，压制【同根】suppressant n. 抑制物suppression n. 镇压，抑制

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: aesthetic
trans: adj. 审美的【搭配】aesthetic fatigue审美疲劳aesthetic feeling美感

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: ancient calligraphy and painting
trans: 古书画

name: art
trans: n. 艺术【搭配】art exhibition艺术展览fine art美术art director艺术总监；艺术指导modern art现代艺术

sentences.english: the Museum of Modern Art in New York
sentences.chinese: 纽约现代艺术博物馆

sentences.english: an example of early Indian art
sentences.chinese: 印度早期艺术的范例

sentences.english: Television is ruining the art of conversation.
sentences.chinese: 电视在糟蹋会话艺术。

detailed_translations.english: the use of painting, drawing,  sculpture  etc to represent things or express ideas

name: artistic
trans: adj. 艺术（家）的；有美感的【搭配】artistic value艺术价值artistic quality艺术品质artistic standards艺术水准artistic work 艺术作品

sentences.english: artistic work
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品

sentences.english: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值，人们褒贬不一。

detailed_translations.english: relating to art or culture

name: artware
trans: n. 工艺品

name: bronze ware
trans: 铜器

name: cradle
trans: n. 摇篮；发源地【搭配】in the cradle在婴儿时期

sentences.english: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.english: Athens is often regarded as the cradle of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 雅典常常被认为是民主的发源地。

detailed_translations.english: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

name: creative art
trans: 创造性艺术

name: decorative art
trans: 装饰艺术

name: display cabinet
trans: 展示柜

name: edify
trans: v. 熏陶；启发【搭配】edify sentiment陶冶情操【同根】edification n. 启迪；教诲

detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: emboss

detailed_translations.english: to mould or carve (a decoration or design) on (a surface) so that it is raised above the surface in low relief

trans: n. 胶体；凝胶

sentences.chinese: 在水泡上涂一些芦荟凝胶并用绷带包起来以帮助它恢复到健康状态。

sentences.chinese: “我们希望在这种凝胶中放入一种抗逆转录病毒制剂，从而起到另一层的保护作用。” 他说。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid gels, it becomes firmer or thicker
a thick wet substance that is used in beauty or cleaning products

name: harden
trans: v. （使）变硬

sentences.english: It will take about 24 hours for the glue to harden.
sentences.chinese: 胶水干透大约需要24小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变硬，变坚固；变坚强；变冷酷
detailed_translations.english: to become firm or stiff, or to make something firm or stiff

detailed_translations.chinese: (Harden)人名；(英、德、罗、瑞典)哈登；(法)阿尔当

name: lapping
trans: n. 研磨

name: lubricant
trans: n. 润滑剂

sentences.chinese: 它的喷嘴上涂了种润滑油。

trans: v. 使…润滑

sentences.chinese: 给所有活动部件加润滑油。

trans: v. （使）混合；融合；n. 融合；合并

sentences.english: She sang the first verse again, listening to the way the words melded with the music.
sentences.chinese: 她再次吟咏了第一节，倾听着歌词与音乐的交融。

sentences.english: ...a perfect meld of art and social comment.
sentences.chinese: ...一种艺术与社会评论的完美融合。

detailed_translations.english: if two things meld, or if you meld them, they combine into one thing
A meld of things is a mixture or combination of them that is useful or pleasant

name: mosaic
trans: n. 马赛克；镶嵌细工【搭配】mosaic tile 镶嵌地砖

sentences.chinese: 用壁画和马赛克装饰的房间

sentences.english: a 3rd-century Roman mosaic floor
sentences.chinese: 三世纪罗马镶嵌地面

detailed_translations.chinese: 摩西的；拼成的；嵌花式的

detailed_translations.english: a pattern or picture made by fitting together small pieces of coloured stone, glass etc

sentences.chinese: 天气潮湿时衣服会发霉。

sentences.english: Such oil can contain carcinogens and toxic mould.
sentences.chinese: 这种油可能包含致癌物和有毒的霉。

detailed_translations.english: to become or cause to become covered with this growth

name: nugget

trans: v. 打洞，穿孔

sentences.chinese: 一根肋骨骨折，刺穿了她的肺部。

sentences.chinese: 板岩采石场

detailed_translations.english: a place where large amounts of stone or sand are dug out of the ground

trans: vt. 净化，提纯【搭配】refine on 精于，改进

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

sentences.english: Join the shoulder seams together.

sentences.chinese: 由于鲑鱼和胡瓜鱼这些濒危物种受到威胁，国家当局已经要求消减从该三角洲往外输水的量。

sentences.chinese: 金属之间互相摩擦，迸出一串火星。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

sentences.chinese: 虽然奥术消除者被认可为是公民，但只要是一名经验丰富的修补匠，高喊出正确的指令，就可以命令它们。

detailed_translations.english: in the past, a tinker was someone who travelled from place to place selling things or repairing metal pots, pans etc

sentences.chinese: 新的把手得焊上去。

trans: vt. 集合；装配【同根】assembly n. 集会；组装

sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

name: behave

sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.

trans: vt. 保护；保存，储存【同根】conservative adj. 保守的

sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.chinese: 小野兔告诉他说：“你所寻找的那块红色的金子就在你身后的大洞穴里。

sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.chinese: 只有几套公寓仍然空着。

sentences.english: There was only a vacant lot (= empty unused area of land in a city ) where her house used to be.

sentences.english: a vacuous romantic novel

name: void

sentences.chinese: 重要经济学理论家

sentences.chinese: 如何达到理想体重的建议

sentences.chinese: 雨水这么多，天气情况很不理想。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be
a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

name: pride
trans: n. 骄傲

sentences.english: He wore his medals with pride.
sentences.chinese: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

sentences.english: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.chinese: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.english: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.chinese: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.english: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
sentences.chinese: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

name: collective
trans: adj. 集体的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: accomplishment
trans: n. 成就；完成；技艺

sentences.english: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说，这是很好的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

name: credit
trans: v. 信用，信任；记入贷方；把…归于；n. 赊欠；贷款；称赞，认可；学分【记忆】词根记忆：cred（相信）+it→信任【搭配】payment by credit 信用卡支付give...credit for... 因…而称赞…credit facility 信用透支credit limit 信贷限额on credit 赊账【同根】discredit v. 不信任，怀疑

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: accredit
trans: v. 信任；授权；归于【记忆】词根记忆：ac（加强）+cred（信任）+ it→信任

sentences.english: That should see you think his accredit what.
sentences.chinese: 那要看你想给他授权什么。

sentences.english: To this, use accredit statement is a very good processing means.
sentences.chinese: 对此，使用授权声明是一个很好的处理方式。

name: accreditation
trans: n. 信任；委派；鉴定合格【记忆】来自accredit（vt. 信任；授权）

detailed_translations.chinese: 证明合格， 鉴定合格

name: belief
trans: n. 信仰；相信

sentences.english: a strong belief in God
sentences.chinese: 笃信上帝

sentences.english: When you get something wrong, it can shake your belief in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什么事情没做好，就会动摇你对自己的信心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that something is definitely true or definitely exists

name: credibility
trans: n. 可信性，可靠性【记忆】词根记忆：cred（相信）+ibility（可…性）→可信性，可靠性

sentences.english: The police have lost their credibility.
sentences.chinese: 警察已经失去了他们的可信性。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of deserving to be believed and trusted

name: credible
trans: adj. 可信的，可靠的【反义】incredible adj. 难以置信的

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: faith
trans: n. 信任；信仰【搭配】have faith in... 信任，相信…lose faith in... 不信任…，不相信…religious faith 宗教信条

sentences.english: People have lost faith in the government.
sentences.chinese: 人们已失去了对政府的信心。

sentences.english: deep religious faith
sentences.chinese: 坚定的宗教信仰

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

name: persuade
trans: v. 说服；使相信【搭配】persuade sb. to do sth. 劝说某人做某事persuade sb. into/out of sth. 劝说某人做/不做某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: aesthetician
trans: n. 美学家【同根】aesthetics n. 美学

name: astrologist
trans: n. 占星家【同根】astrology n. 占星学

name: botanist
trans: n. 植物学家

sentences.english: A botanist can differentiate varieties of plants.
sentences.chinese: 植物学家能区分各种不同的植物。

sentences.english: Along with English botanist Joseph Hooker, Lyell was one of a small handful of people Darwin had shown early drafts of his own work on natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 同英国植物学家约瑟夫·胡克一样，莱尔是少数了解达尔文在自然选择学说方面研究的早期草稿的人之一。

sentences.english: Forty-five years on, the French botanist's gardens have grown massive in scale.
sentences.chinese: 四十五年过去，这法国植物学家的花园规模更大。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make scientific studies of wild plants

name: demographer
trans: n. 人口统计学家【同根】demography n. 人口统计学

sentences.english: Professor Antonio Golini is a demographer at the University of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 罗马大学安东尼奥教授是位人口统计学家。

sentences.english: "I'm shaking to be honest, " said Stuart Gietel-Basten, an University of Oxford demographer who has argued for the end of the one-child policy.
sentences.chinese: “我真的非常震惊，”牛津大学人口统计学家斯图尔特·让泰尔-巴斯顿评论计划生育政策。

sentences.english: Professor Li Jianmin, a demographer at Nankai University, warns of the outlook for childless males. "Elder care for these single men will be a social problem, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 南开大学人口统计学家李建民教授警告说，无子女单身男性的晚景堪忧。“这些单身男人上了年纪后，如何照顾他们将成为一个社会问题。”

name: ecologist
trans: n. 生态学者

sentences.english: Ecologists argue that the benefits of treating sewage with disinfectants are doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 生态学家们认为用消毒剂处理污水的好处是值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies ecology

name: entomologist
trans: n. 昆虫学家【同根】entomology n. 昆虫学

name: ethnologist
trans: n. 人种学家【同根】ethnology n. 人种学

name: geographer
trans: n. 地理学者

sentences.english: Another reason, says Peter Hopkins, a geographer at Newcastle University, is that Scotland’s cultural iconography is much more vivid and more popular than England’s.
sentences.chinese: 纽卡斯尔大学地理学者彼得•霍普金斯表示，另一个原因是苏格兰的文化意象相比英格兰更生动，更深入人心。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has studied geography to a high level

name: geologist
trans: n. 地质学家【同根】geology n. 地质学

sentences.english: He is also a geologist.
sentences.chinese: 他也是一位地质学家。

sentences.english: A senior Pakistani geologist says, however, that the trend could be due to large-scale irrigation schemes that began in the area at around the same time as the West's Industrial Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一位资深巴基斯坦地质学家说，这个趋势也可能是因为这个地区与西方工业革命同时开始的大规模的灌溉计划造成的。

sentences.english: Another geologist in the region, Yang Yong, also said he believes geological concerns likely played an important role in the decision.
sentences.chinese: 该地区另一位地质学家杨勇也说，他相信地质方面的考虑可能对推迟蓄水的决定起到了重要作用。

name: linguistician
trans: n. 语言学家【同根】linguistics n. 语言学

name: mathematician
trans: n. 数学家

sentences.english: The risks can be so complex that banks hire mathematicians to assess them.
sentences.chinese: 这类风险可以是如此复杂以至于银行雇佣数学家们去评估它们。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

name: meteorologist
trans: n. 气象学家【同根】meteorology n. 气象学

sentences.english: "This is probably one of the worst storms since 1990," a meteorologist in Seattle said.
sentences.chinese: 西雅图气象专家表示，这也许是自1990年以来最严重的暴风雪。

sentences.english: At the time, he noted that "One meteorologist remarked that if the theory were correct, one flap of a seagull's wings could change the course of weather forever".
sentences.chinese: 在文中，他写道：“一位气象学者注意到，如果这个理论是正确的，那就意味着一只海鸥扇动一下翅膀能够永久地改变天气的进程”。

sentences.english: By e-mail and earphone, he confers with Jack Parrish, chief meteorologist, and they order the NOAA technician to slip a dropsonde into the shoot.
sentences.chinese: 通过电子邮件和耳机，他与首席气象学家杰克·帕里什联络，指挥NOAA的技术人员发射下投式探空仪。

name: neurologist
trans: n. 神经学家【同根】neurology n. 神经学

name: oceanographer
trans: n. 海洋学家【同根】oceanography n. 海洋学

sentences.english: The oceanographer told delegates that the problem of ocean acidification was worse in high latitudes, in the Arctic and around Antarctica, than it was nearer the equator.
sentences.chinese: 这位海洋学家告诉与会代表，高纬度地区的海洋酸化问题更加严重，北极和南极周围比赤道附近糟糕得多。

sentences.english: Before the war, Munk had been studying oceanography, so he took his concerns to his mentor, Harald Sverdrup, then director of Scripps and widely regarded as the top oceanographer in the US.
sentences.chinese: 战前，芒克一直在研究海洋学，他很关注他的导师--哈拉尔斯维德鲁普，在他的指导下芒克很快成为美国顶尖海洋学家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海洋学者, 海洋研究者

name: ornithologist
trans: n. 鸟类学家【同根】ornithology n. 鸟类学

name: paleontologist
trans: n. 古生物学家【同根】paleontology n. 古生物学

sentences.english: As a result, the research has the potential to change the way a paleontologist views a fossil.
sentences.chinese: 现在，研究者们已经拥有了改变一个古生物学家观察化石方式的潜力。

sentences.english: Even the tracks alone say a lot about the feeding behavior of the ancient birds, commented paleontologist Martin Lockley of the University of Colorado in Denver.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛科罗拉多大学的古生物学家马丁•劳克雷评论说，即使只有这些足迹也很能说明这些古代鸟类的进食行为。

sentences.english: This study "provides conclusive genetic evidence for the simultaneous burial of a small nuclear family, " said Louise Humphrey, a paleontologist with the Natural History Museum in London.
sentences.chinese: 这一研究“用基因证明了这是个同期的小核心家庭，”路易斯·汉弗莱说到，他是伦敦自然历史博物馆的一名古生物学家。

name: pathologist
trans: n. 病理学家【同根】pathology n. 病理学

name: philosopher
trans: n. 哲学家【同根】philosophy n. 哲学

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: physiologist
trans: n. 生理学家【同根】physiology n. 生理学

name: seismologist
trans: n. 地震学家【同根】seismology n. 地震学

name: conceal
trans: v. 隐藏；隐瞒【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+ceal（藏）→隐藏

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: cryptic
trans: adj. 含意隐晦的【记忆】词根记忆：crypt（隐藏的）+ic（…的）→含意隐晦的

sentences.english: This thrilling story will keep you on the edge of your seat as you explore the house, collect items and unravel cryptic secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这惊心动魄的故事，将让你在你的座位边，为您探索的房子，收集物品和解开神秘的秘密。

sentences.english: It was the cryptic first sign of a cyberespionage and information-warfare campaign devised to disrupt the 2016 presidential election, the first such attempt by a foreign power in American history.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场网络间谍—信息战行动的第一个神秘迹象，该行动旨在干扰2016年的总统大选，在美国的历史上，这还是第一次有外国势力有这样的举动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神秘的； 含义模糊的
detailed_translations.english: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

name: dissemble
trans: v. 掩饰，掩藏【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+sembl（相像）+e →和本性不一样→掩饰

sentences.english: Henry was not slow to dissemble when it served his purposes.
sentences.chinese: 形势一对他有利，亨利就马上开始隐瞒。

detailed_translations.english: to hide your true feelings, thoughts etc

name: feign
trans: vt. 假装（有某种感情）；装（病、睡）

sentences.english: Feigning a headache, I went upstairs to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我假装头痛，上楼到自己房间去了。

detailed_translations.english: to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

name: hide
trans: v. 隐藏，掩藏

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: lurk
trans: vi. 潜伏，埋伏；暗藏

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

name: pretend
trans: v. 装作，假装

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: seclusion
trans: n. 隐居【记忆】词根记忆：se（分开）+clus（关闭）+ion →离开并关闭起来→隐居

sentences.english: They enjoyed ten days of peace and seclusion.
sentences.chinese: 他们享受了十天与世隔绝的宁静生活。

name: sneak
trans: v. 偷偷地做，偷带，偷拿

sentences.english: I snuck her a note.
sentences.chinese: 我偷偷塞给她一张纸条。

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard
to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

name: think of sb./sth. as sth.
trans: 认为是，觉得是

name: essentially
trans: adv. 本质上，基本上【同根】essential adj. 本质的，基本的

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: visual
trans: adj. 视觉的，用于视觉的【记忆】词根记忆：vis（看）+ual（…的）→视觉的【搭配】visual acuity 视觉灵敏度visual aid 直观教具visual arts 视觉艺术visual cell 视觉细胞visual fatigue 视觉疲劳

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: experience
trans: n. 经验；经历；体验【搭配】experience in... 有…的经验gain experience获得经验

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
sentences.chinese: 小册子中的建议反映了我们所获得的实践经验。

sentences.english: I had some experience in fashion design.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些时装设计方面的经验。

sentences.english: She was turned down on the grounds of lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 她因缺乏经验而被拒绝。

sentences.english: The book is based on personal experience .
sentences.chinese: 本书是根据个人经历写成的。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

name: afford
trans: vt. 担负得起【记忆】联想记忆：af+ford（看作Ford，美国福特家族）→财大气粗→担负得起【搭配】afford to do sth. 负担得起做某事afford to 买得起【同根】affordable adj. 能负担的，承担得起的

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: underestimate
trans: v./n. 低估【记忆】合成词：under（不足）+estimate（估计） →估计不足→低估

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

name: importance
trans: n. 重要性【搭配】utmost importance极其重要

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

name: action
trans: n. 拍摄

sentences.english: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

detailed_translations.english: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应，改编【同根】adaptable adj. 能适应的；可修改的adapter n. 改编者

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: board of censors
trans: 审查委员会

name: cast
trans: v. 投射（光、视线等）；n. 演员表，全体演员【同根】casting n. 选角

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

name: censor
trans: v. 审查 n. 检查员【同根】censorship n. 审查制度

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

name: cinematographer

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: decimalism
trans: n. 十进制【搭配】decimal adj. 十进位的

name: gunpowder
trans: n. 火药【搭配】black gunpowder黑火药

sentences.english: Damp gunpowder will not fire.
sentences.chinese: 潮湿的火药不会起火。

detailed_translations.english: an explosive substance used in bombs and  fireworks

name: hieroglyphic
trans: n. 象形文字

sentences.english: The Inca had no system of hieroglyphic writing, as the Maya did, and any portraits that Inca artists may have made of their rulers were lost.
sentences.chinese: 和玛雅人一样，印加人也没有象形文字书写系统，而且印加艺术家们所绘制的统治者肖像业已失传。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字；象形文字写的文章
detailed_translations.english: a picture or symbol representing an object, concept, or sound
of or relating to a form of writing using picture symbols, esp as used in ancient Egypt

name: paper-making
trans: n. 造纸术

name: printing
trans: n. 印刷术【搭配】printing plate印刷板

sentences.english: the invention of printing
sentences.chinese: 印刷术的发明

sentences.english: the printing industry
sentences.chinese: 印刷业

sentences.english: a printing error
sentences.chinese: 印刷错误

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of making a book, magazine etc using a machine that puts ink onto paper

name: seismograph
trans: n. 地震仪【记忆】词根记忆：seismo（地震）+graph（写；图）→能描绘地震情况的仪器→地震仪

sentences.english: On the right waist have a seismograph, it tender prior to the earthquake forecast the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 在右腰上有一个地震仪，它嫩在地震前预报地震。

sentences.english: People always make some misunderstanding for the sampling rate and dynamic range of shallow seismograph.
sentences.chinese: 人们对浅层地震仪的采样率及动态范围这两个指标往往产生某些误解。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that measures and records the movement of the earth during an  earthquake

name: waterwheel
trans: n. 水车

name: antiquarian
trans: adj. 古物的

sentences.english: ...an antiquarian bookseller.
sentences.chinese: ...一位古董书商。

sentences.english: ...antiquarian and secondhand books.
sentences.chinese: ...古旧和二手书。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古文物研究的；古文物的
detailed_translations.english: Antiquarian means concerned with old and rare objects

detailed_translations.chinese: 古文物研究者；[古] 古文物收藏家

name: Bronze Age
trans: 青铜器时代

name: Iron Age
trans: 铁器时代

name: material culture
trans: 物质文化

name: abiding
trans: adj. 永久的，永恒的

sentences.english: Phil has a deep and abiding love for his family.
sentences.chinese: 菲尔对家人怀有深厚不渝的爱。

detailed_translations.english: an abiding feeling or belief continues for a long time and is not likely to change

detailed_translations.chinese: 遵守；容忍；继续存在（abide的现在分词）

name: abrupt
trans: adj. 突然的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: chronic
trans: adj. 长期的；（疾病）慢性的【记忆】词根记忆：chron（时间）+ic（…的）→时间的→长期的，慢性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: concur
trans: vi. 同时发生；意见相同，一致【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+cur（跑）→一起跑→同意，一致

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: concurrent
trans: adj. 同时发生的

sentences.english: The exhibition reflected concurrent developments abroad.
sentences.chinese: 该展览反映了国外的同期发展情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并发的；一致的；同时发生的
detailed_translations.english: existing or happening at the same time

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 共点；同时发生的事件

name: contemporary
trans: adj. 当代的，同时代的【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+tempor（时间）+ ary（…的）→同时间的→同时代的

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: cursory
trans: adj. 仓促的【记忆】词根记忆：curs（跑）+ory（…的）→随便跑过去的→草率的

sentences.english: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.
sentences.chinese: 伯克粗略瞥了眼菜单，然后啪地合上了。

detailed_translations.english: done very quickly without much attention to details

name: dated
trans: adj. 有年头的，陈旧的

sentences.english: That dress looks a bit dated now.
sentences.chinese: 那件连衣裙现在看起来有点过时了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈旧的；过时的；有日期的
detailed_translations.english: old-fashioned

detailed_translations.chinese: 注有日期（date的过去式和过去分词）

name: duration
trans: n. 持续时间；期间【记忆】词根记忆：dur（持久）+ation→持久时间

sentences.english: The course is of three years’ duration.
sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that something continues

name: elapse
trans: vi. （时间）消逝【记忆】词根记忆：e（加强）+laps（滑，滑走）+ e→滑走→（时间）消逝

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: eternal
trans: adj. 永恒的

sentences.english: the Christian promise of eternal life
sentences.chinese: 基督教承诺的永生

sentences.english: She’s an eternal optimist (= she always expects that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever and having no end

name: everlasting
trans: adj. 永恒的，持久的

sentences.english: everlasting fame
sentences.chinese: 永久的名声

sentences.english: a symbol of God’s everlasting love
sentences.chinese: 上帝永恒之爱的象征

sentences.english: a belief in life everlasting
sentences.chinese: 对永生的信念

detailed_translations.english: continuing for ever, even after someone has died

name: extant
trans: adj. 现存的

sentences.english: Few of the manuscripts are still extant.
sentences.chinese: 手稿大都散佚无存。

detailed_translations.english: still existing in spite of being very old

name: extemporaneous
trans: adj. 即席的【记忆】词根记忆：ex（前面的）+tempor（时间）+ aneous（有…特征的）→（没有）前面的时间（准备）→即席的

sentences.english: an extemporaneous speech
sentences.chinese: 即席演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 即席的，临时的；无准备的；不用讲稿的；善于即席讲话的
detailed_translations.english: spoken or done without any preparation or practice

name: former
trans: adj. 以前的

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: formerly
trans: adv. 从前，原来

sentences.english: Kiribati, formerly known as the Gilbert Islands
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯，旧称吉尔伯特群岛

sentences.english: This elegant hotel was formerly a castle.
sentences.chinese: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

detailed_translations.english: in earlier times

name: hasty
trans: adj. 匆忙的

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: immediate
trans: adj. 立即的【记忆】词根记忆：im（无）+medi（中间）+ate（有…性质的）→无中间过程的→立即的【同根】immediately adv. 立即；直接地

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: impromptu
trans: adj. 临时的；即兴的

sentences.english: When do we make impromptu speeches?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候要做即席演讲？

sentences.english: When Marco was asked to give an impromptu speech on“Addictions,”he divided the topic /into/ several parts. Notice how he used the pattern of related subtopics in the outline that follows.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子，马可要做一个关于“嗜好”的即席演讲，他将这个主题分成了几部分，注意下面他在大纲中是如何运用有关联副主题模式的。

detailed_translations.english: done or said without any preparation or planning

name: improvise
trans: vt. 即席而作

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: instantaneous
trans: adj. 瞬间的，即刻的【记忆】词根记忆：instant（立即）+aneous（有…特征的）→马上发生的→即刻的

sentences.english: modern methods of instantaneous communication
sentences.chinese: 现代的即时通信方法

detailed_translations.english: happening immediately

name: interlude
trans: n. 间歇，插曲；幕间休息；幕间音乐【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+lud（玩，戏剧）+e→戏剧中间的暂停→幕间休息

sentences.english: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
sentences.chinese: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

detailed_translations.chinese: 插曲；穿插；幕间节目；[数] 插算
detailed_translations.english: a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens

name: juncture
trans: n. 特定时刻，重要关头

sentences.english: Atthis juncture, I suggest we take a short break.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，我建议大家稍事休息。

sentences.english: The talks are at a critical juncture(= very important point ).
sentences.chinese: 会谈正处于紧急关头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关键时刻， 危急关头； 结合处， 接合点
detailed_translations.english: a particular point in an activity or period of time

name: lasting
trans: adj. 持久的

sentences.english: The reforms will bring lasting benefits.
sentences.chinese: 改革将带来长久的利益。

sentences.english: Their generosity made a lasting impression on me.
sentences.chinese: 他们的慷慨给我留下了难忘的印象。

sentences.english: a solution that would bring lasting peace
sentences.chinese: 将带来持久和平的解决方案

detailed_translations.english: strong enough, well enough planned etc to continue for a very long time

name: lately
trans: adv. 最近

sentences.english: What have you been doing lately?
sentences.chinese: 你最近在干什么？

sentences.english: Lately, I’ve had trouble sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 最近我睡眠有问题。

detailed_translations.english: recently

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. 夜间的【记忆】词根记忆：noct（夜晚）+urnal（…的）→夜间的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: obsolete
trans: adj. 过时的【记忆】词根记忆：obsol（死）+ete→腐烂的→过时的

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: overdue
trans: adj. 逾期的

sentences.english: an overdue gas bill
sentences.chinese: 逾期未付的煤气账单

sentences.english: The library books are overdue.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的书过期未还。

sentences.english: The baby was a week overdue (= it was expected to be born a week ago ).
sentences.chinese: 宝宝超过预产期有一周了。

detailed_translations.english: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected

name: perennial
trans: adj. 长久的，永远的【记忆】词根记忆：per（贯穿，自始至终）+ enn（年）+ial（…的）→贯穿一年的→长久的

sentences.english: Lack of resources has been a perennial problem since the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的
detailed_translations.english: a plant that is perennial lives for more than two years
a plant that lives for more than two years

name: permanent
trans: adj. 永久的【记忆】词根记忆：per（贯穿，自始至终）+man （逗留）+ent（…的）→始终逗留的→持久的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: pressing
trans: adj. 紧迫的【记忆】词根记忆：press（挤压，逼迫）+ing（正…的）→紧迫的

sentences.english: The CD, released in October, sold out a first pressing of 1,500 in just four months.
sentences.chinese: 这张光盘发行于10月份，第一批压制的1,500张仅仅四个月就销售一空。

detailed_translations.english: a thing or group of things, especially records or CDs, that have been made by pressing plastic or metal into shape
needing to be discussed or dealt with very soon

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: previously
trans: adv. 先前，以前

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: schedule
trans: n. 时间表，计划表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: session
trans: n. 一段时间；一次

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: simultaneously
trans: adv. 同时发生地【记忆】词根记忆：simult（相类似）+aneous（有…特征的）+ly（…地）→（时间）相同地→同时发生地

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: synchronise
trans: vt. 同时发生【记忆】词根记忆：syn（共同）+chron（时间）+ ize（使…）→同时发生

detailed_translations.chinese: 同步发生， 同速进行

name: temporary
trans: adj. 临时的【记忆】词根记忆：tempor（时间）+ary（…的）→有时间性的→临时的

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: transient
trans: adj. 短暂的；过路的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: transitory
trans: adj. 短暂的【记忆】词根记忆：trans（变换）+it（走）+ory（…的） →走过就变的→短暂的

sentences.english: Most teenage romances are transitory.
sentences.chinese: 大多数少年时代的罗曼史都转瞬即逝。

detailed_translations.english: continuing or existing for only a short time

name: urgent
trans: adj. 紧急的，迫切的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: analysis
trans: n. 分析，分解【记忆】词根记忆：ana（类似）+lys（分解）+ is（表情况）→类似分解→分析【搭配】self analysis自我分析intelligence analysis 情报分析【同根】analyst n. 分析家；化验员analyse vt. 分析；分解

sentences.english: She’s been in analysis for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析， 分析报告； 分解， 解析
detailed_translations.english: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems

name: figure
trans: n. 数字；人物；v. 认为；想，估计【搭配】leading figures 主要人物，领导人物

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: meteorology
trans: n. 气象学【搭配】dynamic meteorology动力气象学

sentences.english: This is a book about meteorology.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲气象的。

sentences.english: It plays an increasingly important part in meteorology for cloud, precipitation, hail and thunderstorm detection as well as the navigation of aircraft and ships.
sentences.chinese: 它在对云层、降水、冰雹和雷暴的气象探测以及在船舰和飞机的导航中，起着日益重要的作用。

sentences.english: All of this depends on certain assumptions and the meteorology, the geology and the hydrology of the area plus the contours of the land around this particular power plant.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是根据某些假设,和气象状态，地质情况，还有，水文请跨国,在加上土地的等高线,在这个特定的核能电站的周围。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of weather conditions

name: ozone layer
trans: 臭氧层

name: tempest
trans: n. 暴风雨，暴风雪【记忆】词根记忆：temp（=temper时间）+est→时间引起天气骤变→暴风雨

sentences.english: I hadn't foreseen the tempest my request would cause.
sentences.chinese: 我没有想到我的请求会带来这么大一场风波。

name: tornado
trans: n. 龙卷风【记忆】词根记忆：torn（转）+ado→转着的风→龙卷风

sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: troposphere
trans: n. 对流层

sentences.english: The orange layer is known as the troposphere, where all of the weather and clouds are generated and contained.
sentences.chinese: 橘黄色的那一层被称为“对流层”，那里是所有的气候状况和云层形成和演变的地方。

sentences.english: The lowest layer of the atmosphere is known as the troposphere, which is constantly in motion, causing the weather.
sentences.chinese: 地球大气层的最底层是所谓的对流层，这一层的大气不断运动，引起了气象变化。

sentences.english: The reasons are as below, the Pacific jet stream or planetary waves in troposphere can directly affect the Pacific center of action of the AO.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为太平洋急流或准定常行星波在对流层中直接影响了位于该区域的北极涛动的活动中心。

detailed_translations.english: the lowest atmospheric layer, about 18 kilometres (11 miles) thick at the equator to about 6 km (4 miles) at the Poles, in which air temperature decreases normally with height at about 6.5°C per km

name: typhoon
trans: n. 台风【搭配】typhoon eye台风眼

sentences.chinese: 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。

sentences.english: We both are under stress and standing in the middle of a typhoon .
sentences.chinese: 你我都处在很紧张的环境中，站在台风的中心。

sentences.english: The football match have to stand over next week for the typhoon storm.
sentences.chinese: 由于台风风暴，这场足球赛延期到下个星期举行。

n. 内容；/kənˈtent/
 adj. 满足的，愿意的【搭配】be content with 对…感到满足，满足的

sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.chinese: 美国正在发生重大事件。

trans: adj. 极其重要的，必不可少的【搭配】vital to/for sth. 对…极重要的，对…必不可少的at the vital moment 在关键时刻a vital error 致命的错误a vital decision 重要决定

trans: adj. 比较的，相当的【同根】comparatively adv. 相当地；比较地

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: contrast
trans:
n. 对比；对照；/kənˈtrɑːst/
 v. 对比【搭配】by contrast 对比之下；（与…）相对照in contrast with/to 与…成反比contrast A with B 把A与B做对比

if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

vt. 使生效；实施，贯彻；/ˈɪmplɪmənt/
 n. 工具【记忆】词根记忆：im（使…）+ple（满）+ment →使圆满→实现→实施【同根】implementation n. 实施，执行【同义】perform vt. 做，履行execute vt. 执行utensil n. 用具instrument n. 仪器，工具

sentences.chinese: 然后他给小鼠服用了咖啡因和抗炎药，意图发现这些物质是否阻断醋酸的产生，进而缓解头痛。

 v. 私占；拨出（款项）【记忆】词根记忆：ap（加强）+propri（拥有）+ ate（使…）→把公款变为自己拥有→私占【反义】inappropriate adj. 不适合的

 vi. 冲突【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+flict（打）→互相打→冲突【搭配】come into conflict with sb. 与…有冲突
