sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: overcoat
trans: n. 大衣；厚外套

sentences.english: I sprang 400 pounds for  her overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 给她买那件大衣，我花了400镑。

sentences.english: He placed his cap and overcoat on a chair.
sentences.chinese: 他把帽子和大衣搁在一张椅子上。

sentences.english: She removed all the grease stains from her overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 她把她大衣上所有油渍都去掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a long thick warm coat

name: pajamas
trans: n. 睡衣裤

name: scarf
trans: n. 围巾；披巾；头巾

sentences.english: Hey, your scarf is slipping off.
sentences.chinese: 喂， 你的围巾快掉了。

sentences.english: The scarf flapped her face.
sentences.chinese: 围巾轻拂着她的脸。

sentences.english: She muffled her throat with a scarf.
sentences.chinese: 她用围巾围住脖子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders, especially to keep warm

name: shawl
trans: n. （女用）披巾，披肩

sentences.english: She wrapped her shawl closer about her.
sentences.chinese: 她把围巾围得紧一些。

sentences.english: I attempted to steal to the door with an intention of calling her husband; but I was summoned back by a piercing shriek--the shawl had dropped from the frame.
sentences.chinese: 我正想偷偷走到门口打算去叫她丈夫，可是一声刺耳的尖叫把我召唤回来——那围巾从镜框上掉下来了。

sentences.english: And is your shawl to keep you warm in heaven or hell?
sentences.chinese: 你的披肩会在哪儿为你保暖，天堂还是地狱？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth, in a square or  triangular  shape, that is worn around the shoulders or head, especially by women

name: suit
trans: n. 套装

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: waistcoat
trans: n. 背心

sentences.english: You will then have only a pair of trousers, a waistcoat, a hat and a coat.
sentences.chinese: 您只剩下一条长裤，一件背心，一顶帽子和一件短上衣了。

sentences.english: In the cartoon, John Bull appears as a short, stocky figure wearing a waistcoat with the British flag on.
sentences.chinese: 在漫画中，“约翰牛”常以矮小健壮的形象出现，身穿印有英国国旗的背心。

sentences.english: After sleeping in the sledge and dining in the kitchen, to sit in an arm-chair in clean linen, in thin boots, with a chain on one’s waistcoat, is such luxury!
sentences.chinese: 经过在雪撬上睡觉和在厨房吃饭后，穿着干净的亚麻布衣服，细薄的靴子坐在靠背椅里，某人的马甲上还挂着表链，这一切是多么的奢侈了啊！

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing without sleeves that has buttons down the front and is worn over a shirt, often under a jacket as part of a man’s suit

name: wool
trans: n. 毛料；毛织物

sentences.english: a wool overcoat
sentences.chinese: 羊毛大衣

sentences.english: a ball of wool
sentences.chinese: 一团毛线

detailed_translations.english: the soft thick hair that sheep and some goats have on their body

name: abortive
trans: adj. 不成功的；失败的

sentences.english: an abortive military coup
sentences.chinese: 一场未遂的军事政变

detailed_translations.english: an abortive action is not successful

name: blunder
trans: n. 愚蠢的错误；疏忽；失误；v. 犯愚蠢的错误；失误

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: defective
trans: adj. 有缺点的；不完全的

sentences.english: The disease is caused by a defective gene.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病是由缺陷基因引起的。

sentences.english: defective products
sentences.chinese: 残次品

detailed_translations.english: not made properly, or not working properly

detailed_translations.chinese: 有缺陷的人；不完全变化词

name: demerit
trans: n. 缺点

sentences.english: Demerits were given to students for late attendance at prayers.
sentences.chinese: 祷告会上迟到的学生被记过了。

detailed_translations.english: a bad quality or feature of something

name: drawback
trans: n. 缺点；障碍，不利条件；退还的关税【搭配】drawback of sth. 某事物的缺点【同义】disadvantage n. 缺点；不利条件

sentences.english: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
sentences.chinese: 这是座很不错的城市，唯一的不足就是天气。

detailed_translations.english: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

name: err
trans: v. 犯错误，做错事；出差错

sentences.english: It’s always best to err on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 过于谨慎永远比冒风险强。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯错；做错；犯罪；走上歧途
detailed_translations.english: to be more careful or safe than is necessary, in order to make sure that nothing bad happens

name: erroneous
trans: adj. 不正确的，错误的【记忆】联想记忆：erro（看作error，错误）+ neous→错误的，不正确的

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: erroneously
trans: adv. 错误地

name: failure
trans: n. 失败，不及格；失败者；故障，失灵；未能【搭配】failure rate 失败率；故障率power failure 停电

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

name: fallible
trans: adj. 会犯错误的

sentences.english: Humans are fallible.
sentences.chinese: 人孰无过。

sentences.english: These surveys are often a rather fallible guide to public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 这些调查往往会对舆论产生误导。

detailed_translations.english: able to make mistakes or be wrong

name: flaw
trans: n. 缺点；瑕疵

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: flop
trans: v. 笨拙地抛下；悬挂；失败；n. 失败【搭配】a complete flop 彻底失败flip flops人字拖

sentences.english: His head flopped back pathetically.
sentences.chinese: 他脑袋向后仰着，一副可怜相。

detailed_translations.chinese: 笨拙地抛下；扑通放下；拍（翅）
detailed_translations.english: to hang or fall loosely, in an uncontrolled way
a film, play, product etc that is not successful

name: heedless
trans: adj. 不加注意；掉以轻心

sentences.english: O’Hara rode on, heedless of danger.
sentences.chinese: 奥哈拉不理会危险，继续骑马前行。

detailed_translations.english: not paying attention to something

name: ignore
trans: v. 不顾，不理，忽视【搭配】ignore the fact 忽视事实

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: inaccurate
trans: adj. 错误的

sentences.english: This is a silly and inaccurate way to think about time, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这是一种愚蠢和错误的看待时间的方法。

sentences.english: It could also be an invalidation notice specifying that part of data should not be considered in the integration process because it is inaccurate.
sentences.chinese: 它经常是一个无效的通告，部分的数据集成过程中应该不会被考虑，因为他们是错误的。

name: incorrectly
trans: adv. 错误地；不适当地

name: misjudge
trans: v. 判断错误

sentences.english: The government misjudged the mood of the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 政府错误地判断了选民的情绪。

sentences.english: I think you’ve misjudged her.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是错看她了。

detailed_translations.english: to form a wrong or unfair opinion about a person or a situation

name: neglect
trans: vt./n. 忽视，疏忽【记忆】词根记忆：neg（否定）+lect（选择）→不去选它→忽视；疏忽【搭配】neglect one's duty 玩忽职守

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: negligence
trans: n. 疏忽；失职；失误，过失

sentences.english: negligence in carrying out safety procedures
sentences.chinese: 执行安全程序时的疏忽

sentences.english: The bridge’s architect was sued for criminal negligence.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥梁的建筑师被控犯有玩忽职守罪。

detailed_translations.english: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for

name: negligent
trans: adj. 疏忽的；造成过失的

sentences.english: Mr Brown was found guilty of negligent driving.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生被判疏忽驾驶罪。

detailed_translations.english: not taking enough care over something that you are responsible for, with the result that serious mistakes are made

name: offhand
trans: adv. 未经核实地；不加思索地

sentences.english: She said you were a bit offhand with her this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 她说你今天下午对她有点敷衍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 随便的；即时的；无准备的；即席的

name: omission
trans: n. 遗漏；疏忽

sentences.english: Copies of the lists were posted so that omissions could be corrected.
sentences.chinese: 多份名单被张贴出来，以便更正遗漏之处。

detailed_translations.english: when you do not include or do not do something

name: omit
trans: v. 忽略；漏掉，遗漏

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: regardless
trans: adj. 毫不顾及的；adv. 不顾后果地；无论如何【记忆】合成词：regard（关心）+less（少）→很少关心的→不顾后果地，毫不顾及地【搭配】regardless of 不管

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: slovenly
trans: adj. 凌乱的；马虎的【记忆】词根记忆：slov（松开）+en+ly（…的）→松松垮垮的→凌乱的

sentences.english: slovenly habits
sentences.chinese: 邋里邋遢的习惯

sentences.english: a large slovenly woman
sentences.chinese: 一个身材高大、不修边幅的女人

sentences.english: a slovenly way of speaking
sentences.chinese: 随便的说话方式

detailed_translations.chinese: 懒散的；不整洁的；马虎的
detailed_translations.english: lazy, untidy, and careless

detailed_translations.chinese: 邋遢地；马虎地；不整洁地

name: typo
trans: n. 打字错误；排印错误

name: impropriety
trans: n. 不合适举止；不正当行为

sentences.english: Accusations of impropriety were made against the company’s directors.
sentences.chinese: 对公司董事不正当的行为提出了指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不适当；不正确；用词错误；[审计] 不正当行为
detailed_translations.english: behaviour or an action that is wrong or unacceptable according to moral, social, or professional standards

name: incompetent
trans: adj. 无能力的；不胜任的；不称职的【记忆】词根记忆：in（无）+competent（有能力的） →无能力的

sentences.english: an incompetent manager
sentences.chinese: 不称职的经理

sentences.english: weak incompetent leadership
sentences.chinese: 软弱不称职的领导

sentences.english: The president turned furiously on his staff. "I'm surrounded by incompetents!"
sentences.chinese: 董事长愤怒地指责其职员，“我身边全是些没用的人！”

detailed_translations.chinese: 无能力的，不胜任的；不合适的；不适当的；无力的
detailed_translations.english: not having the ability or skill to do a job properly
An incompetent is someone who is incompetent

name: ineligible
trans: adj. 不合格的；不符合资格的

sentences.english: They were ineligible to remain in the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有资格继续留在美国了。

detailed_translations.english: not allowed to have or do something because of a law or rule

name: inept
trans: adj. 无能的；不擅长的；不适当的【搭配】be inept at不擅长

sentences.english: inept leadership
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的领导

sentences.english: He was criticized for his inept handling of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他因处理这个问题不力而遭到批评。

detailed_translations.english: not good at doing something

name: unbecoming
trans: adj. 不合适的，不恰当的；不相称的

sentences.english: Austin displayed conduct unbecoming of an officer and a gentleman.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯汀的行为不符合军官和绅士的身份。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不适当的，不相称的；不合身的，不得体的
detailed_translations.english: clothes that are unbecoming make you look unattractive

name: unseemly
trans: adj. 不适宜的，不得体的【搭配】unseemly manner不当的举止unseemly effect不当影响

sentences.english: Ann thought it unseemly to kiss her husband in public.
sentences.chinese: 安认为当众亲她丈夫不太得体。

detailed_translations.english: unseemly behaviour is not polite or not suitable for a particular occasion

name: bidding
trans: n. 请求；吩咐；命令

name: nominate
trans: v. 任命；指派【记忆】词根记忆：nomin（名称，名字）+ate（使…）→任命

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: command
trans: v. 命令，指挥；控制；n. 命令；司令部【记忆】词根记忆：com（加强）+mand（命令）→命令【搭配】have a command of... 掌握…at sb.'s command 听命于…

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: instruction
trans: n. 指令，命令

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

name: mandatory
trans: adj. 强制的，命令的；托管的

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: request
trans: v./n. 要求，请求

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

name: requisition
trans: n. 要求【记忆】词根记忆：re（一再）+quis（寻求）+ ition→要求

sentences.english: ...a requisition for a replacement photocopier.
sentences.chinese: ...一份更换复印机的授权书。

detailed_translations.chinese: 征用；要求；申请书；引渡要求
detailed_translations.english: A requisition is a written document which allows a person or organization to obtain goods
if someone in authority, especially the army, requisitions a building, vehicle, or food, they officially demand to have it during an  emergency  such as a war

name: participant
trans: n. 参加者，参与者【记忆】联想记忆：parti（看作party，晚会）+cip（抓，拿）+ant→抓去参与派对的人→参与者【搭配】participant in sth. 参与某事

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: beforehand
trans: adv. 预先，事先【记忆】合成词：before（在…以前）+hand（手）→抢在…之前下手→预先，事先【搭配】beforehand process预加工beforehand system 以前的制度【同义】before adv. 在先

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: tune
trans: n. 调子；和谐；vt. 调节，调整【记忆】联想记忆：转动（turn）旋钮调音（tune）【搭配】carry a tune唱得准

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

name: compose
trans: v. 组成，构成；写，创作（乐曲等）；使安定，调谐【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+pos（放）+e →放到一起→组成，构成【搭配】be composed of 由…组成【同根】composer n. 作曲家

sentences.english: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
sentences.chinese: 巴林顿为新版的《仲夏夜之梦》谱了曲。

sentences.english: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水由氢和氧组成。

detailed_translations.english: to write a piece of music

name: computer
trans: n. 电脑【搭配】computer software计算机软件

sentences.english: a huge global computer network
sentences.chinese: 巨大的全球计算机网络

sentences.english: the latest computer software
sentences.chinese: 最新的计算机软件

detailed_translations.english: an electronic machine that stores information and uses programs to help you find, organize, or change the information

name: guess
trans: n./v. 猜测【搭配】guess at猜测，估计【同义】speculate v. 推测；投机

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

name: rate
trans: n. 速率，比率；等级；价格，费用；v. 估价；评级，评价【搭配】at any rate 无论如何at the rate of 以…速度failure rate 失败率

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: alto
trans: n. 女低音

sentences.english: What are you, a soprano, an alto, or.
sentences.chinese: 你唱什么的， 女高音， 女低音，还是。

sentences.english: The four parts in singing are soprano , alto, tenor and bass.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌的四个声部是女高音、 女低音、 男高音和男低音。

sentences.english: It is a combination of the tenor and the alto.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女低音； 女低音歌手
detailed_translations.english: a singing voice that is lower than a  soprano  , or a singer with a voice like this

name: baritone
trans: n. 男中音

sentences.english: a famous baritone
sentences.chinese: 著名男中音

detailed_translations.english: a male singing voice that is lower than a  tenor  but higher than a  bass  , or a man with a voice like this
a baritone voice or instrument is lower than a  tenor  but higher than a  bass

name: cantata
trans: n. 清唱剧，大合唱

detailed_translations.chinese: 大合唱；（意）清唱剧；康塔塔（一种声乐套曲）
detailed_translations.english: a piece of religious music for singers and instruments

name: choir
trans: n. 唱诗班；合唱团

sentences.english: The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.english: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.english: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.chinese: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

name: chorus
trans: n. 合唱队；合唱；副歌，叠句；齐声；v. 齐声说【搭配】in chorus 异口同声chorus master 合唱队指挥

sentences.english: I sing with the university chorus.
sentences.chinese: 我在大学合唱队里唱歌。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who sing together
if people chorus something, they say it at the same time

name: conservatory
trans: n. 音乐学校

detailed_translations.english: a room with glass walls and a glass roof, where plants are grown, that is usually added on to a house

name: soprano
trans: n. 女高音

sentences.english: She sings soprano .
sentences.chinese: 她唱女高音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女高音；最高音部；女高音歌手
detailed_translations.english: a very high singing voice belonging to a woman or a boy, or a singer with a voice like this
a soprano voice or instrument has the highest range of notes

name: tenor
trans: n. 男高音

sentences.english: Arthur Davies sings the tenor solo.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟•戴维斯表演男高音独唱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 男高音；要旨，大意；票据的限期；稳定的进程
detailed_translations.english: a male singing voice that can reach the range of notes below the lowest woman’s voice, or a man with a voice like this
a tenor voice or instrument has a range of notes that is lower than an  alto  voice or instrument

name: accordion
trans: n. 手风琴【记忆】词根记忆：ac（加强）+cord（心）+ion （物）→抒发心声的（琴）→手风琴

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我别致的手风琴好像变成了纸板盒。

sentences.english: All at once I pictured my own father, patiently enduring my nightly accordion practice sessions though he must have yearned for peace and quiet after his long days at the pizza factory.
sentences.chinese: 突然，我想起了我的父亲。 虽然他在比萨厂呆了一整天后一定非常渴望清静，但还是耐心地忍受着我每天晚上练习手风琴的那段时间。

sentences.english: So you may be saying to yourself, I have to sign up right now for Swahili and calculus and accordion lessons before my brain withers away!
sentences.chinese: 你或许因此对自己说，趁着我的大脑还没退化，赶紧报名学习史瓦西里文和微积分，还有手风琴班吧！

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a large box that you hold in both hands. You play it by pressing the sides together and pulling them out again, while you push buttons and  key s  .

name: bagpipe
trans: n. 风笛

name: band
trans: n. 乐队【搭配】rock band 摇滚乐队

sentences.english: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.
sentences.chinese: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。

sentences.english: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
sentences.chinese: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。

sentences.english: interviews with band members
sentences.chinese: 对乐队成员的采访

detailed_translations.english: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music

name: banjo
trans: n. 班卓琴

sentences.english: The boy picked the banjo.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩弹着班卓琴。

sentences.english: This shamisen, originating in Okinawa, is a banjo-like three-stringed instrument that is played with a plectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这种三味弦起源于冲绳群岛，是一种像班卓琴那样的用琴拨弹奏的三弦乐器。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a guitar, with a round body and four or more strings, played especially in  country and western  music

name: bass
trans: n. 低音提琴，低音吉他

sentences.english: The band features Johnson on bass (=  playing the bass guitar  ) .
sentences.chinese: 这支乐队由约翰逊弹奏低音吉他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鲈鱼；男低音；低音部；椴树
detailed_translations.english: a very low male singing voice, or a man with a voice like this
a bass instrument or voice produces low notes

name: bassoon
trans: n. 低音管，大管

name: cello
trans: n. 大提琴【搭配】solo cello 独奏大提琴

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

sentences.english: Classical instruments like the violin or the cello are boring, you say, and definitely not cool.
sentences.chinese: 你觉得小提琴或大提琴这样的传统乐器非常枯燥，而且一点也不酷。

sentences.english: Many years ago, a young man learning cello went to Casals, the greatest cellist in the 20th century, for advice: how can I become an excellent cellist?
sentences.chinese: 很多年前，有一位学大提琴的年轻人去向20世纪最伟大的大提琴家卡萨尔斯讨教：我怎样才能成为一名优秀的大提琴家？

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a large  violin  that you hold between your knees and play by pulling a  bow (= special stick )  across the strings

name: clarinet
trans: n. 单簧管

name: flute
trans: n. 长笛

sentences.english: The boy trilled on a flute.
sentences.chinese: 男孩在长笛上吹颤音。

sentences.english: He played a nice tune on the flute.
sentences.chinese: 他吹奏了一首优美的笛子曲。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

name: guitar
trans: n. 吉他

sentences.english: Before singing, he noodled at his guitar.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌之前他先弹了几下吉他。

sentences.english: He strummed his guitar when he talked to me.
sentences.chinese: 他和我说话时把吉他拨弄响了。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument usually with six strings that you play by pulling the strings with your fingers or with a  plectrum (= small piece of plastic, metal etc )

name: harmonica
trans: n. 口琴

sentences.english: Usually Gus would bring his harmonica and, after talking for a little while, they’d play a few songs together.
sentences.chinese: 通常盖斯会带着他的口琴，在聊了一会儿以后，他们会一起演奏几首歌。

sentences.english: In 1995, when the ban went into effect, the only instrument allowed in the Cumberland prison was the harmonica, but inmates who already had a guitar or electronic keyboard were allowed to keep them.
sentences.chinese: 1995年该禁令实行后，坎伯兰监狱的囚犯们被允许拥有的乐器就只剩下口琴了，但在此之前已经有电吉他或键盘的囚犯被批准可以保留这些乐器。

sentences.english: He made a harmonica out of the corncob.
sentences.chinese: 他把玉米棒子弄得象口琴一样。

detailed_translations.english: a small musical instrument that you play by blowing or sucking and moving it from side to side near your mouth

name: harp
trans: n. 竖琴

sentences.english: She began to harp us to drink after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 用餐后，她开始弹奏起竖琴让我们饮酒消食。

sentences.english: She swept her fingers over the strings of the harp.
sentences.chinese: 她用手指划过竖琴的琴弦。

sentences.english: I never learned how to tune a harp, or play upon a lute; but I know how to raise a small and obscure city to glory and greatness...where to all kindreds of the earth will pilgrim.
sentences.chinese: 我从未学习过如何为竖琴调弦，也不知如何弹奏鲁特琴。 但我懂得如何使一座偏僻的无名小镇发展成辉煌而伟大的城市，使世界各国的子民前来朝圣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹奏竖琴；喋喋不休；不停地说

detailed_translations.english: a large musical instrument with strings that are stretched across a vertical frame with three corners, and that you play with your fingers

name: oboe
trans: n. 双簧管

sentences.english: Why does a trumpet--If I asked a trumpet to play this pitch, a trumpet played, and then I asked an oboe to play it, the sound would be very different.
sentences.chinese: 小号为什么...,如果我用小号演奏这个音高,小号演奏后,我又让双簧管来演奏,声音会很不一样

detailed_translations.english: a wooden musical instrument like a narrow tube, which you play by blowing air through a reed

name: orchestra
trans: n. 管弦乐队

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

name: organ
trans: n. 风琴，管风琴【搭配】organ pipe 管风琴

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: pan pipes
trans: n. 排箫

name: percussion
trans: n. 打击乐器

sentences.english: Tonight we have Paul Duke on percussion (= playing a percussion instrument ) .
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们请到保罗·杜克先生负责打击乐。

sentences.english: a range of percussion instruments
sentences.chinese: 一组打击乐器

detailed_translations.english: musical instruments such as drums, bells etc which you play by hitting them

name: piano
trans: n. 钢琴【搭配】play the piano 弹钢琴

sentences.english: Jean accompanied her on the piano .
sentences.chinese: 琼为她钢琴伴奏。

detailed_translations.english: a large musical instrument that has a long row of black and white  key s  . You play the piano by sitting in front of it and pressing the keys.

name: saxophone
trans: n. 萨克斯管

sentences.english: The pianist doubles on saxophone.
sentences.chinese: 那钢琴演奏者兼作萨克斯管吹奏员。

sentences.english: That evening, Bill and Hillary were getting ready for bed. Hillary turned to Bill and said, "Well, I found out who peed in your saxophone.
sentences.chinese: 当晚，比尔和希拉里正要睡觉，希拉里转过身来跟比尔说道：“哎呀，我知道是谁往你的萨克斯管里撒尿了。”

sentences.english: I wish I had his saxophone's soft leather traveling bag with me, so I could give it to this man in case he someday finds himself on the way to a non-street gig.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望我当时带着他那只装萨克斯的软皮旅行包，这样我就可以把包送给这个人，好让某天他结束街头艺人生涯，开始正式演出时可以用得上。

detailed_translations.english: a curved musical instrument made of metal that you play by blowing into it and pressing buttons, used especially in popular music and  jazz

name: string
trans: n. 线；弦【搭配】shoe string 鞋带

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: trombone
trans: n. 长号

detailed_translations.english: a large metal musical instrument that you play by blowing into it and sliding a long tube in and out to change the notes

name: trumpet
trans: n. 喇叭；小号

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way

name: viola
trans: n. 中提琴【搭配】solo viola 独奏中提琴

sentences.english: All these people happen to be playing the violin, viola,or what have you next to you.
sentences.chinese: 这些人不只是碰巧在你身边，演奏小提琴或中提琴。

detailed_translations.english: a wooden musical instrument that you play like a violin but that is larger and has a lower sound

name: violin
trans: n. 小提琴【搭配】violin concerto 小提琴协奏曲

sentences.english: He plays the violin in an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在管弦乐队中演奏小提琴。

sentences.english: She is first violin of an orchestra .
sentences.chinese: 她是管弦乐队的第一小提琴手。

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

detailed_translations.english: a small wooden musical instrument that you hold under your chin and play by pulling a bow(= special stick ) across the strings

name: wind
trans: n. 管乐器【搭配】the wind section 管乐部

sentences.english: The wind blew from the northeast.
sentences.chinese: 风从东北方向吹来。

detailed_translations.english: moving air, especially when it moves strongly or quickly in a current

name: concerto
trans: n. 协奏曲

sentences.english: ...Tchaikovsky's First Piano Concerto.
sentences.chinese: …柴可夫斯基的《第一钢琴协奏曲》。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of  classical  music, usually for one instrument and an  orchestra

name: duet
trans: n. 二重唱

sentences.english: Tonight she sings a duet with first husband Maurice Gibb.
sentences.chinese: 今晚她与第一任丈夫莫里斯∙吉布表演了二重唱。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music for two singers or players

name: episode
trans: n. 插曲

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: lullaby
trans: n. 催眠曲，摇篮曲

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对着婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: The lullaby had the baby into the land of Nod in no time.
sentences.chinese: 催眠曲一下子就把婴儿送入了睡乡。

detailed_translations.english: a slow quiet song sung to children to make them go to sleep

name: plainsong
trans: n. 单旋律圣歌

name: sonata
trans: n. 奏鸣曲【搭配】sonata form奏鸣曲

sentences.english: a piano sonata
sentences.chinese: 钢琴奏鸣曲

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music with three or four parts that is written for a piano, or for a piano and another instrument

name: symphony
trans: n. 交响乐【搭配】symphony orchestra 交响乐团

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

name: chord
trans: n. 弦，和音

sentences.english: the opening chords of 'Stairway to Heaven'
sentences.chinese: 《通往天堂的阶梯》的开篇和弦

detailed_translations.english: a combination of several musical notes that are played at the same time and sound pleasant together

name: euphonious
trans: adj. 悦耳的

sentences.english: The sound of whistle is euphonious , emotional, and melodic.
sentences.chinese: 口哨的音色悦耳动听，抒情性极强，极富歌唱性。

sentences.english: By accident, some sweet and euphonious proverbs made her obsessed with language learning.
sentences.chinese: 一个偶然的机会，一些美妙悦耳的谚语使她迷恋上了语言学习。

sentences.english: “The music wasn’t bad,” Kathy replied. “I thought the violin and the piano produced a euphonious combination.”
sentences.chinese: “音乐还不错，”凯西回答，“我觉得小提琴和钢琴演奏出了悦耳的合音。”

detailed_translations.english: denoting or relating to euphony; pleasing to the ear

name: harsh
trans: adj. 刺耳的

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: movement
trans: n. （尤指交响曲的）乐章

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: pitch
trans: n. 音高

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: prelude
trans: n. 前奏；序幕

sentences.english: Living together as a prelude to marriage is now considered acceptable in many countries.
