sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: immune
trans: adj. 免疫的；不受影响的；豁免的【同义】resistant adj. 有抵抗力的invulnerable adj. 无法伤害的【同根】immunity n. 免疫力

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: influential
trans: adj. 有很大影响的，有权势的

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: interact
trans: vi. 相互作用；相互影响【同根】interaction n. 相互作用

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: interplay
trans: v./n. 相互作用，相互影响【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+play（起作用）→相互作用

sentences.english: The law bring into effect is an organism concerned with the interplay among society, economic and culture.
sentences.chinese: 实际运作中的法律制度是一个社会、经济和文化互相作用的有机体。

sentences.english: The equipment design must grow by continual interplay between the technical specification and the packaging .
sentences.chinese: 仪器设计必须根据工艺指标和装配之间不断地交互影响而发展。

sentences.english: To date, most research into the interplay of exercise and anxiety has focused on the actions of various neurotransmitters or chemical messengers within the brain, like serotonin and dopamine.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，大多数有关锻炼和焦虑的相互影响的研究都集中在大脑内的各种神经递质或化学信使，如血清素、多巴胺上。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or things affect each other

name: interrelationship
trans: n. 相互关系，相互影响

sentences.english: ...the interrelationships between unemployment, crime, and imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: ...失业、犯罪和监禁之间的相互关系。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two things that makes them affect each other

name: pliable
trans: adj. （指人或思想）容易受影响的；顺从的；易弯的【记忆】词根记忆：pli（=ply，弯，折）+able（能…的）→能弯曲的→易弯的

sentences.english: a shoe made of soft pliable leather
sentences.chinese: 柔韧的皮革做成的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 易弯曲的， 柔软的； 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: able to bend without breaking or cracking

name: predispose
trans: v. 事先（在某方面）影响某人；（使）易受感染（患病）【同根】predisposition n. 倾向，癖性

sentences.english: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentences.chinese: 他们煞费苦心雇用那些具备把顾客服务好的个性的人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone more likely to suffer from a particular health problem

name: predominant
trans: adj. 支配的，突出的【记忆】词根记忆：pre（前）+dominant（统治的）→在前面统治的→支配的

sentences.english: the predominant group in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的主导群体

sentences.english: In this painting, the predominant colour is black.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画的主色调是黑色。

detailed_translations.english: more powerful, more common, or more easily noticed than others

name: susceptibility
trans: n. 易感性；易受影响（的状况）【记忆】词根记忆：sus（下）+cept（拿）+ibility（易…性）→易被拿下→易感性

sentences.english: I knew I would have to be careful not to offend their susceptibilities .
sentences.chinese: 我知道我得小心，不能伤害他们脆弱的感情。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s feelings, especially when they are easily offended or upset

name: susceptible
trans: adj. 易受感染的，易受影响的【记忆】词根记忆：sus（下）+cept（拿）+ible（能…的）→能被拿下的→易受影响的

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: curative
trans: adj. 有疗效的；医疗的【记忆】词根记忆：cura（=cure，治愈）+tive→有疗效的

sentences.english: the spring’s alleged curative properties
sentences.chinese: 这处泉水号称能治病的功效

detailed_translations.chinese: 有助于治疗的，有疗效的
detailed_translations.english: able to or intended to cure illness

name: heal
trans: v. 治愈；调停

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

name: healing
trans: n. 康复；adj. 有治疗作用的【记忆】来自heal（v. 治愈）

sentences.english: Many men and even women are very judgmental of the need to talk about problems because they have never experienced how healing it can be.
sentences.chinese: 许多男人，甚至女人，都把谈论问题的需要视为很严肃、正经的事，因为他们不知该怎么治疗这种需要。

sentences.english: Mare and most of all from the founder and director, Marie: I am praying like crazy for you that your graft took and all is healing 100% well.
sentences.chinese: 还有，最最重要的，来自创办人和董事，玛丽：我由衷企求你所接受的治疗，以及其他所有的都100%有疗效。祝你好运，我的灵魂与你同在。

detailed_translations.english: the process of becoming healthy and strong again

name: psychiatric
trans: adj. 精神病的；治疗精神病的

sentences.english: a psychiatric hospital
sentences.chinese: 精神病医院

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: Charles was suffering from a psychiatric disorder (= mental illness ) .
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯彼时精神错乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神病学的，精神病治疗的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the study and treatment of mental illness

name: recover
trans: v. 重新获得；使复原，使康复；收回【搭配】recover yourself 使自己振作recover from 恢复

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: remedy
trans: n. 药品；补救；治疗法；vt. 治疗；补救；纠正【搭配】remedy for 对…的治疗法或药物，补救

sentences.english: The problems in our schools do not have a simple remedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校的问题没有简单的解决办法。

sentences.english: To remedy the situation, the water must be chemically treated.
sentences.chinese: 为了改善这种情况，水必须进行化学处理。

detailed_translations.english: a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better
to deal with a problem or improve a bad situation

name: surgery
trans: n. 外科手术治疗；外科；手术室【同根】surgical adj. 外科的

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: therapist
trans: n. 临床医学家；治疗学家

sentences.english: a speech therapist
sentences.chinese: 言语治疗师

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been trained to give a particular form of treatment for physical or mental illness

name: therapy
trans: n. 治疗，疗法【搭配】radiation therapy 放射治疗interferon therapy 干扰素治疗法recreation therapy 娱乐疗法be in therapy 接受治疗

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: alcoholism
trans: n. 酒精中毒【搭配】chronic alcoholism 慢性酒精中毒

sentences.english: ...a physician who specialized in the problems of alcoholism.
sentences.chinese: …一位专攻酗酒问题的医生。

detailed_translations.chinese: 酗酒；[内科] 酒精中毒
detailed_translations.english: the medical condition of being an alcoholic

name: anemia
trans: n. 贫血【搭配】nutritional anemia 营养性贫血

sentences.english: Interference with the normal production of heme or globin leads to anemia.
sentences.chinese: 血红素或球蛋白的正常产生收到干扰会导致贫血。

sentences.english: Perhaps the present concern with the values of liberal arts education portends an intellectual anemia.
sentences.chinese: 现在关心大学文科教育的重要性也许意味着患了智力贫血症。

name: angina
trans: n. 心绞痛

name: appendicitis
trans: n. 阑尾炎；盲肠炎

sentences.english: Her doctor made a diagnosis of appendicitis.
sentences.chinese: 她的医生作出阑尾炎的诊断。

sentences.english: The doctor has cured numerous people of appendicitis .
sentences.chinese: 这个医生治愈了很多人的阑尾炎。

sentences.english: He and Farkash met when he had appendicitis and she was a nurse, and they were married in 1970 or 1971 and have seven children.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲与索菲亚的相识，是因为他得了阑尾炎，而那时，她是一名护士。 两人在1970或1971年结婚，膝下育有七名儿女。

detailed_translations.english: an illness in which your  appendix  swells and causes pain

name: arthritis
trans: n. 关节炎【搭配】rheumatoid arthritis 风湿性关节炎

sentences.english: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 我的手腕有轻微关节炎。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

name: asthma
trans: n. 哮喘症【搭配】bronchial asthma 支气管性哮喘

sentences.english: Any illness of the lungs or throat , such as asthma or a cough.
sentences.chinese: 消耗病，痨病肺部或喉咙的任何一种病变，如哮喘或咳嗽。

sentences.english: It scares me sometimes because I do have asthma and when I walk, I do gasp for air.
sentences.chinese: 她说：“我会担心体重，因为我有哮喘，我走路的时候总是气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: Another aspect of this problem is control of asthma among children in these populations.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一个方面是在这些群体的儿童中控制哮喘。

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition that causes difficulties in breathing

name: bronchitis
trans: n. 支气管炎

sentences.english: He was in bed with bronchitis.
sentences.chinese: 他身患支气管炎，卧病在床。

detailed_translations.english: an illness that affects your bronchial tubes and makes you cough

name: bunion
trans: n. 拇囊炎（拇指外翻）

name: cancer
trans: n. 癌【搭配】breast cancer 乳腺癌liver cancer 肝癌lung cancer 肺癌

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

name: chickenpox
trans: n. 水痘

name: coma
trans: n. 昏迷【搭配】in a coma 陷于昏迷

sentences.english: The sick man went into a coma.
sentences.chinese: 病人进入了昏迷状态。

sentences.english: In the absence of treatment, disease progression results in seizures, stupour and coma.
sentences.chinese: 在不治疗的情况下，病情的发展可导致癫痫发作和昏迷。

sentences.english: He has not ventured outside his tiny house for years because his wife is in a coma, and he does not want her to wake up and find him gone.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他都没有走出自己的小房子出去冒险，因为他的妻子一直昏迷着，他不希望妻子醒来的时候发现自己已经离开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （因严重疾病或重伤引起的）昏迷

name: concussion
trans: n. 震荡，冲击【搭配】brain concussion 脑震荡

name: cough
trans: n. 咳嗽【搭配】dry cough 干咳

sentences.english: Matthew coughed and cleared his throat.
sentences.chinese: 马修咳了一声清清喉咙。

sentences.english: I think I’m getting a cold or flu – I’ve been coughing and sneezing all day.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是着凉了，或者得了流感——我整天都在咳嗽和打喷嚏。

sentences.english: He’s got a bad cough.
sentences.chinese: 他咳嗽得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly push air out of your throat with a short sound, often repeatedly
a medical condition that makes you cough a lot

name: diabetes
trans: n. 糖尿病

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: dislocation
trans: n. 脱臼

sentences.english: Millions of refugees have suffered a total dislocation of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 几百万难民饱受生活颠沛流离之苦。

detailed_translations.english: Dislocation is a situation in which something such as a system, process, or way of life is greatly disturbed or prevented from continuing as normal

name: dysmenorrhoea
trans: n. 痛经

name: enteritis
trans: n. 肠炎【搭配】chronic enteritis 慢性肠炎

name: fracture
trans: n. 骨折

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: haemorrhage
trans: n. 脑出血【搭配】cerebral haemorrhage 脑出血intracerebral haemorrhage 脑内出血

name: hepatitis
trans: n. 肝炎

sentences.english: What is hepatitis?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肝炎？

sentences.english: WHO will work in close collaboration with all our partners to prevent and control viral hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织将与所有合作伙伴紧密合作，预防和控制病毒性肝炎。

sentences.english: If the nails are mostly white with darker rims, this can indicate liver problems, such as hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 如果指甲有大片的白色和深色的边缘，这可能预示着肝脏问题，例如肝炎。

detailed_translations.english: Hepatitis is a serious disease which affects the liver

name: hypertension
trans: n. 高血压

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which your  blood pressure  is too high

name: hypotension
trans: n. 低血压

name: leukemia
trans: n. （肿瘤）白血病

sentences.english: Children are children, whether they have leukemia or not.
sentences.chinese: 孩子就是孩子，不管他们是否有白血病。

sentences.english: Unlike the other three types of leukemia, some patients with CLL may have disease that does not progress for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 与其他三种类型的白血病不同，慢性淋巴细胞白血病患者可能会有一些持续时间不长的病症。

sentences.english: There are some we think may contribute, but as you know, we give a lot of different medications, particularly in children with leukemia.
sentences.chinese: 有一些我们认为可能有贡献，但如你所知，我们开了很多不同的药物，特别是给有白血病的儿童。

detailed_translations.english: a type of cancer of the blood, that causes weakness and sometimes death

name: malaria
trans: n. 疟疾【搭配】falciparum malaria 恶性疟；热带疟

sentences.english: We know how to prevent malaria.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道怎样去阻止疟疾。

sentences.english: The campaign to eradicate malaria did not.
sentences.chinese: 而根除疟疾运动则未做到这一点。

sentences.english: To reach our goal of near zero deaths from malaria by 2015, we need an extraordinary intensification of our actions in two key areas.
sentences.chinese: 我们要想在2015年以前达到疟疾死亡人数近于零的目标，必须格外加强我们在两个关键领域的行动。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that is common in hot countries and that you get when a type of  mosquito  bites you

name: pharyngitis
trans: n. 咽炎【搭配】chronic pharyngitis 慢性咽炎

name: pneumonia
trans: n. 肺炎【搭配】atypical pneumonia 非典型性肺炎bacterial pneumonia 细菌性肺炎

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital, suffering from pneumonia.
sentences.chinese: 她得了肺炎，被送往医院。

detailed_translations.english: a serious illness that affects your lungs and makes it difficult for you to breathe

name: rabies
trans: n. 狂犬病

sentences.english: More than 99% of all human deaths from rabies occur in Africa and Asia.
sentences.chinese: 狂犬病造成的所有人类死亡中，有99%以上发生在非洲和亚洲。

sentences.english: Therefore, prompt local treatment of all bite wounds and scratches that may be contaminated with rabies virus is important.
sentences.chinese: 因此，迅速对可能已感染狂犬病毒的所有咬伤处和抓伤处进行局部处理很重要。

sentences.english: Becky found a wolf in the oak stump near the wash.I think it has rabies.
sentences.chinese: 贝基在干河床附近的栎树墩发现一只狼。 我想它有狂犬病。

detailed_translations.english: a very dangerous disease that affects dogs and other animals, and that you can catch if you are bitten by an infected animal

name: smallpox
trans: n. 天花【搭配】smallpox vaccine天花疫苗

name: tetanus
trans: n. 破伤风

name: tracheitis
trans: n. 气管炎

name: tuberculosis
trans: n. 肺结核

sentences.english: She was infected with tuberculosis.
sentences.chinese: 她被传染上了肺结核。

sentences.english: With that, he handed me some papers and the address of a tuberculosis specialist; I was to go see him and report back.
sentences.chinese: 他边说边把几张纸和一个肺结核病专家的住址塞到我手里，要我去见那个专家并回报结果。

detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease that affects many parts of your body, especially your lungs

name: tumor
trans: n. 瘤【搭配】benign tumor 良性瘤

sentences.english: When do you think the patient can be operated on for the tumor?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这个病人什么时候可以做肿瘤手术？

sentences.english: Staging of prostatic adenocarcinoma is based upon how extensive the tumor is.
sentences.chinese: 前列腺腺癌的分级是根据肿瘤的浸润程度而定的。

sentences.english: The tumor in his prostate gland was caught at an early and very likely curable stage.
sentences.chinese: 由于他的前列腺肿瘤是在早期被发现的，处在很有可能治愈阶段。

name: similarly
trans: adv. 同样地，类似地

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

sentences.english: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
sentences.chinese: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地，燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

detailed_translations.english: in a similar way

name: collect
trans: v. 收集；接走；收（税等）；聚集【记忆】词根记忆：col（共同）+lect（选择）→选择后放在一起→收集【同根】collective adj. 共同的，集体的

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: beyond
trans: prep. 超出【记忆】联想记忆：红极一时的乐队“Beyond”就是这个词

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

name: enlarge
trans: vt. 扩大，放大【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+large（大的）→使…变大→扩大，放大

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

name: develop
trans: v. 发展；生长，形成【同根】development n. 发展undeveloped adj. 欠发达的developing adj. 发展中的

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣；利息；利益；vt. 使感兴趣

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: accumulate
trans: v. 积累；增加【同根】accumulation n. 积累

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: amass
trans: v. 积聚【记忆】词根记忆：a（加强）+mass（聚集）→积聚

sentences.english: For 25 years, Darwin amassed evidence to support his theories.
sentences.chinese: 25年间，达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune after the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后，他积累了大量财富。

detailed_translations.english: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

name: attend
trans: v. 出席；照料【搭配】attend school上学attend a meeting出席会议

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: collection
trans: n. 收集，积聚；收藏品

sentences.english: a stamp collection
sentences.chinese: 一批邮票收藏品

sentences.english: a computerized data collection system
sentences.chinese: 计算机化的数据收集系统

detailed_translations.english: a group of objects, often of the same sort, that have been collected

name: congregate
trans: v. 聚集【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+greg（组，群）+ ate→聚集

sentences.english: Crowds began to congregate to hear the President’s speech.
sentences.chinese: 人群开始聚拢，来聆听总统的演讲。

detailed_translations.english: to come together in a group

name: convene
trans: v. 召集【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+ven（来）+e →都来到一起→召集

sentences.english: a report by experts convened by the National Institutes of Health
sentences.chinese: 由全国健康协会召集的专家提出的一份报告

detailed_translations.english: if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting
if a group of people convene, or someone convenes them, they come together, especially for a formal meeting

name: gather
trans: v. 聚集；收集；逐渐增加；猜想【搭配】gather in 收割

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: party
trans: n. （共同做某事的）一组，一群

sentences.english: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚有个小聚会，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

sentences.english: the party spirit
sentences.chinese: 参加社交聚会的乐趣

sentences.english: I have always voted for the Labour Party.
sentences.chinese: 我一直投工党的票。

detailed_translations.english: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

name: amplify
trans: vt. 放大（声音等）；vi. 详述【反义】deflate vt. 放气；使缩小shrink vi. 缩小

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

name: augment
trans: v. 增大，增值；提高【同根】augmentation n. 增加

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: broaden
trans: v. 加宽【记忆】词根记忆：broad（宽的）+en（使…）→使宽的→加宽

sentences.english: Mark’s smile broadened.
sentences.chinese: 马克笑得更加灿烂了。

sentences.english: The council decided to broaden the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 地方议会决定拓宽人行道。

detailed_translations.english: to make something wider, or to become wider

name: dilate
trans: v. 膨胀【记忆】词根记忆：di（分开）+lat（放）+e→分开放（使变得更大）→膨胀

sentences.english: dilated pupils
sentences.chinese: 扩大的瞳孔

detailed_translations.english: if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider

name: escalate
trans: v. （使）逐步增长或发展，（使）逐步升级；扩大，上升【记忆】来自Escalator，原来是自动电梯的商标，后来才出现了动词escalate

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: expand
trans: v. （使）膨胀，（使）扩张；展开；详述【同根】expanding adj. 扩大的expansion n. 扩张，膨胀expanse n. 宽广空间

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: extend
trans: v. 延长；扩大【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+tend（伸展）→伸展出去→延长【同根】extension n. 延长

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

name: magnify
trans: vt. 放大；扩大【记忆】词根记忆：magn（大）+ify（使…）→使…大→放大

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: outstretch
trans: v. 拉长【记忆】词根记忆：out（出）+stretch（拉长）→拉长

sentences.english: A beautiful girl, by the name of Clytle, was so fond of his beauty and glory that she knelt on the ground from dawn to dusk, with her hands outstretch towards the sun.
sentences.chinese: 一位名叫克里提的美丽少女迷恋于他的英俊潇洒，每日都跪在地上，双手伸向太阳。

sentences.english: A beautiful girl, by the name of Clytle, was so fond of his beauty and glory that she knelt on the ground from dawn to dusk, with her hands outstretch towards the sun.
sentences.chinese: 以为名叫克里提的美丽少女迷恋于他的英俊潇洒，每日都跪在地上，双手伸向太阳。

detailed_translations.english: to extend or expand; stretch out

name: sprawl
trans: v. 摊开手脚躺（坐）着；散乱地延伸；n. 四肢伸开的姿势或动作；散乱杂乱的大片地方（尤指建筑物）【记忆】联想记忆：伸展手脚趴在地上（sprawl）潦草地写（scrawl）

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: swell
trans: vi. 膨胀；增长【记忆】联想记忆：那种气味（smell）在增长（swell），越来越难闻

sentences.english: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
sentences.chinese: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。

sentences.english: The window frame was swollen shut.
sentences.chinese: 窗框膨胀变形，关得死死的。

detailed_translations.english: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body
the roundness or curved shape of something
very good

name: compass
trans: n. 罗盘；[pl.] 圆规；指南针；界限，范围【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+pass（通过）→共同通过的地方→界限

sentences.english: a map and compass
sentences.chinese: 地图和指南针

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that shows directions and has a needle that always points north

name: realm
trans: n. 界，领域；王国【记忆】联想记忆：real（真正的）+m→真正的好东西（如音乐，艺术）无国界→领域；王国

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: region
trans: n. 地区；范围【记忆】词根记忆：reg（统治）+ion→统治的区域→地区；范围

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: regional
trans: adj. 局部范围的；地方（性）的；全地区的【搭配】regional accent 地方口音

sentences.english: local and regional government
sentences.chinese: 地方及区域治理

sentences.english: regional variations in farming practice
sentences.chinese: 农耕方式的地区性差异

sentences.english: a slight regional accent
sentences.chinese: 轻微的地方口音

detailed_translations.chinese: 地区的；局部的；整个地区的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular region or area

name: scope
trans: n. （活动、影响等的）范围；（发挥能力等的）余地【记忆】联想记忆：s+cope（对付，处理）→人处理的事情多了，眼界自然就会开阔→范围

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱，频谱；范围，幅度【记忆】词根记忆：spect（看）+rum→能看到的颜色→光谱

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: sphere
trans: n. 球（体）；范围，领域【记忆】本身为词根：球

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

detailed_translations.english: a ball shape

detailed_translations.chinese: 包围；放入球内；使…成球形

name: territory
trans: n. 领土；领域，范围【同根】territorial adj. 领土的

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: zone
trans: n. 地区；范围【同根】horizontal adj. 水平的horizontally adv. 水平地

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

name: appeal
trans: vi. 呼吁；吸引；起诉；n. 感染力，吸引力【同义】accuse（vt. 起诉）

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: appetite
trans: n. 食欲；欲望【搭配】appetite for 对…的食欲；对…的兴趣

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: captivate
trans: vt. 迷住，吸引【记忆】词根记忆：cap（抓）+tiv+ate（使…）→使抓住→迷住，吸引

sentences.english: I was captivated by her brilliant mind.
sentences.chinese: 我为她的聪慧所迷。

detailed_translations.english: to attract someone very much, and hold their attention

name: intrigue
trans: v. 密谋；引起极大兴趣；n. 密谋【同根】intriguing adj. 迷人的，吸引人的

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

detailed_translations.english: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

name: orient
trans: vt. 使朝向；使适应；把…兴趣引向【记忆】词根记忆：ori（升起）+ent→朝向太阳升起的地方→使朝向

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: contingency
trans: n. 偶然，可能性；意外事件；紧急事件【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+ting（接触）+ ency（表行为）→事情都碰一起→偶然

sentences.english: a contingency plan
sentences.chinese: 应变计划

sentences.english: Add up your outgoings, putting on a bit more for contingencies.
sentences.chinese: 把你的经常性开支加起来，再增加些钱用于意外开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶然性， 可能性； 意外事件； 附带事件
detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that might happen in the future, especially one that could cause problems

name: feasible
trans: adj. 可行的，可能的；可做的，可实行的【记忆】联想记忆：f+easi（看作easy，容易的）+ ble→容易做到的→可能的【搭配】feasible plan 可行的计划feasible suggestion 可行的建议

sentences.english: a feasible solution
sentences.chinese: 可行的解决方法

detailed_translations.english: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

name: imaginable
trans: adj. 可想象的，可能的【记忆】词根记忆：imagin(e)（想象）+able（可…的）→可想象的

sentences.english: The travel brochure is full of the most wonderful resorts imaginable.
sentences.chinese: 这本旅游小册子里全是人们梦寐以求的最好的旅游胜地。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is the best, worst etc that can be imagined

name: likelihood
trans: n. 可能；可能性【记忆】联想记忆：likeli（看作likely，很可能）+ hood（表性质）→可能性

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

name: presumably
trans: adv. 推测起来，大概【记忆】来自presumable（adj. 可能的）【同根】presume v. 料想，认为presumable adj. 可能的，可假定的

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: probability
trans: n. 可能性；概率【记忆】来自probable（adj. 可能的）

sentences.english: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
sentences.chinese: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性，然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

name: probable
trans: adj. 很可能的，大概的【同义】likely adj. 可能发生的

sentences.english: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
sentences.chinese: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。

sentences.english: Success is highly probable .
sentences.chinese: 成功的希望相当大。

detailed_translations.english: likely to exist, happen, or be true

detailed_translations.chinese: 很可能的事；大有希望的候选者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc

name: suspense
trans: n. 悬念；悬疑；焦虑【记忆】词根记忆：sus（下）+pens（悬挂）+e →挂着（一颗心）→悬念【同根】suspend v. 悬挂；暂停suspended adj. 暂停的suspender n. [常pl.]吊裤带suspensive adj. 可疑的；悬而未定的

sentences.english: Come on then, tell me what happened; the suspense is killing me (= I feel very excited or anxious because I do not know what will happen next ) .
sentences.chinese: 快来，告诉我发生了什么事。急死我了。

sentences.english: She couldn’t bear the suspense a moment longer.
sentences.chinese: 这样提心吊胆，她再也受不了了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 悬念；悬疑；焦虑；悬而不决
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of excitement or anxiety when you do not know what will happen next

name: distance
trans: n. 距离；远离；远方；一长段时间【记忆】联想记忆：distan（看作distant，在远处的）+ce→远方，距离【搭配】cover a distance of 跨过某个距离long-distance flight 长途飞行【同义】far n. 远方

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

name: as a whole
trans: 整个来看

sentences.english: Life as a whole is better if you go slowly, and take the time to savor it, appreciate every moment. That’s the simplest reason to slow down.
sentences.chinese: 如果你行进的慢一些，生活就是完整的，会让你感觉更好，花时间去欣赏它，欣赏每一个时刻，这就是为什么要慢下来的最简单的原因。

sentences.english: In other words, when parts of the community go away for a while, which is inevitable on any long-lived project, the community as a whole has to be strong and diverse enough to survive.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，当社区的一部分人离开一段时间时（这在任何长期项目中都是必不可避免的），社区作为一个整体必须足够强壮和多样化才能生存。

name: abut
trans: vt. 毗连【搭配】abut on与…毗连

sentences.english: The castles abut a natural forest.
sentences.chinese: 与城堡毗邻的是一片天然森林。

sentences.english: Today people think of it as a "frontier province", which lie just below the Tibetan plateau and abut Vietnam, Laos and Burma.
sentences.chinese: 今天，人们认为它是一个“边省”，这是在青藏高原及毗邻的越南、老挝和缅甸。

sentences.english: Frontier trade is not only the special form of the economic and trade among the abut countries' frontier regions, but also the important component part of the country's foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 边境贸易是毗邻国家边境地区之间经济、贸易活动的特殊形式，是国家对外经贸活动的重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: if one piece of land or a building abuts another, it is next to it or touches one side of it

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的，毗连的【同义】detached adj. 分开的separate adj. 个别的

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: adjoin
trans: vt. 紧挨，临近【同根】adjoining adj. 邻接的

sentences.english: A vacant plot of land adjoins his house.
sentences.chinese: 有一块空地紧挨着他家。

detailed_translations.english: to be next to or joined to sth

name: afield
trans: adv. 在野外；在战场上；到远方【记忆】词根记忆：a（在…）+field（原野）→在野外

sentences.english: They were exporting as far afield as Alexandria.
sentences.chinese: 他们出口货物远至亚历山德里亚。

sentences.english: students who come from further afield
sentences.chinese: 远方来的学生

detailed_translations.chinese: 在战场上；去野外；在远处；远离著
detailed_translations.english: far away, especially from home

name: alienate
trans: v. 使疏远，使不友好；转让，让渡（财产等）【同根】alienated adj. 疏远的，被隔开的

sentences.english: The latest tax proposals will alienate many voters.
sentences.chinese: 最新的纳税提案将失去远许多选民的支持。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that makes someone unfriendly or unwilling to support you

name: alienation
trans: n. 疏远；离间【搭配】alienation from 与…疏远alienation of... …间的疏远sense of alienation 疏离感

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of not being part of society or a group

name: border
trans: n. 边界；v. 接壤，接近【记忆】联想记忆：b+order（命令）→听从命令，不许出边界→边界

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: contiguous
trans: adj. 接近的【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+tig（接触）+ uous（…的）→都接触的→接近的

sentences.english: America’s 48 contiguous states
sentences.chinese: 美国的48个互相毗连的州

detailed_translations.english: next to something, or next to each other

name: distant
trans: adj. 遥远的【记忆】词根记忆：di（s）（分开）+stant（站）→分开站→有距离的→遥远的

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: estrange
trans: v. 使疏远【记忆】词根记忆：e（加强）+strange（陌生）→使…陌生→使疏远

sentences.english: The more the physical causes incline mankind to inaction, the more the moral causes should estrange them from it.
sentences.chinese: 所以，物质的因素越使他们趋于懈怠时，精神的因素就越使他们远离物质的因素。

sentences.english: Their specific treatment of volume, apertures, and overall geometry interested us as tools to estrange conventional ideas of residential housing.
sentences.chinese: 该建筑在体量、孔径和整体几何形状上的处理手法都激发我们有了远离传统住宅的想法。

name: faraway
trans: adj. 遥远的【记忆】合成词：far（远）+away（离开）→远离→遥远的

sentences.english: She dreamed of flying away to exotic faraway places.
sentences.chinese: 她梦想着飞到遥远的异国。

sentences.english: faraway noises
sentences.chinese: 远处的喧嚣声

detailed_translations.english: a long distance away

name: nearness
trans: n. 接近【同义】closeness n. 接近

sentences.english: God is nearer to me than I am to myself; my existence depends on the nearness and the presence of God.
sentences.chinese: 上帝比我更靠近我自己；我的存在取决于上帝的存在以及上帝离我有多近。

name: neighbouring
trans: adj. 临近的，附近的

sentences.english: The fair attracted hundreds of people from the neighbouring towns and villages.
sentences.chinese: 集市吸引了邻近城镇及村庄的好几百人前来。

detailed_translations.english: near the place where you are or the place you are talking about

name: proximity
trans: n. 接近，邻近；亲近【记忆】词根记忆：proxim（近处）+ity→接近

sentences.english: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity (= very near to each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 在这里，富人和穷人比邻而居。

detailed_translations.english: nearness in distance or time

name: ulterior
trans: adj. 较远的；不可告人的【记忆】词根记忆：ult（高，远）+erior→较远的

sentences.english: He’s just being nice. I don’t think he has any ulterior motives.
sentences.chinese: 他就是好心，我不认为他别有用心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 将来的，较远的；在那边的；隐秘不明的

name: vicinity
trans: n. 邻近，附近【搭配】in the vicinity of sth. 在某物附近

sentences.english: The stolen car was found in the vicinity of the station.
sentences.chinese: 被盗汽车在车站附近被发现。

sentences.english: There used to be a mill in the vicinity.
sentences.chinese: 附近曾有一座磨坊。

detailed_translations.english: in the area around a particular place

name: daze
trans: n. 迷惑【搭配】in a daze 茫然地

sentences.english: She wandered round in a daze, not quite sure what to do.
sentences.chinese: 她恍恍惚惚地四处徘徊，不知该干什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使茫然；使眼花缭乱；使晕眩

detailed_translations.english: feeling confused and not able to think clearly

name: downhearted
trans: adj. 无精打采的，垂头丧气的【记忆】词根记忆：down（下）+heart（心）+ed（…的）→心情低落的→无精打采的

sentences.english: When no replies came, I began to feel downhearted.
sentences.chinese: 一点回应都没有，我开始感到灰心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无精打采的；垂头丧气的
detailed_translations.english: feeling sad and disappointed, especially because you have tried to achieve something but have failed

name: exhaust
trans: v. （使）非常疲倦；用尽；n. （机器排出的）废气【同根】exhaustion n. 精疲力竭；耗尽exhaustible adj. 被竭尽的

sentences.english: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
sentences.chinese: 讲一整天课令我精疲力竭。

sentences.english: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
sentences.chinese: 我们面临世界石油储备耗尽的危险。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel extremely tired

name: faint
trans: adj. 虚弱眩晕的；vi. 晕倒

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

name: indefatigable
trans: adj. 不知疲倦的【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+de（否定）+fatig（疲倦）+able（…的）→不知疲倦的

sentences.english: His indefatigable spirit helped him to cope with his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他不屈不挠的精神帮助他对抗病魔。

detailed_translations.english: You use indefatigable to describe someone who never gets tired of doing something

name: intuition
trans: n. 直觉【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+tuit（教育）+ion →不用教导就有的（感觉）→直觉

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

name: listless
trans: adj. 无精打采的

sentences.english: The heat was making me listless.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气使我懒洋洋的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling tired and not interested in things

name: ravenous
trans: adj. 狼吞虎咽的【记忆】词根记忆：rav（捕）+en+ous（…的）→不断捕食的→狼吞虎咽的

sentences.english: I’m absolutely ravenous.
sentences.chinese: 我饿极了。

sentences.english: a ravenous appetite
sentences.chinese: 极大的胃口

detailed_translations.english: very hungry

name: sensation
trans: n. （感官的）感觉能力；感觉；轰动【记忆】词根记忆：sens（感觉）+ation（表名词）→感觉【同根】sensational adj. 感觉的

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

name: sensitive
trans: adj. 敏感的，灵敏的【同根】sensitivity n. 敏感，灵敏性

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: sensory
trans: adj. 感觉的，感官的【搭配】a sensory organ 感觉器官

sentences.english: sensory stimuli such as music
sentences.chinese: 音乐等的感官刺激

sentences.english: sensory deprivation
sentences.chinese: 感觉丧失

detailed_translations.english: relating to or using your senses of sight, hearing, smell, taste, or touch

name: sensuous
trans: adj. 愉悦感官的【记忆】词根记忆：sens（感觉）+uous（有…性质的）→愉悦感官的

sentences.english: full sensuous lips
sentences.chinese: 饱满性感的嘴唇

sentences.english: a beautiful and sensuous young woman
sentences.chinese: 一个漂亮又性感的年轻女人

detailed_translations.chinese: 感觉上的，依感观的；诉诸美感的
detailed_translations.english: attractive in a sexual way

name: sentient
trans: adj. 有感觉能力的，有感觉的；知悉的【记忆】词根记忆：senti（=sent感觉）+ent（…的） →有感觉的

sentences.english: Man is a sentient being.
sentences.chinese: 人是有感知力的生命。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有感情的；有感觉力的；意识到的
detailed_translations.english: able to experience things through your senses

name: blueprint
trans: n. 蓝图，方案【记忆】合成词：blue（蓝）+print（印刷的图）→蓝图

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: centre around
trans: 以…为中心，围绕着

name: concept
trans: n. 概念；观念；设想

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: construct
trans:
vt. 建造；构思，构筑；创立；/ˈkɒnstrʌkt/
 n. 构想，观念；结构【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+struct（建立）→建造，构筑【搭配】construct a model 制作模型construct an argument 建立论点

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: context
trans: n. 上下文；背景；环境【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+text（编织）→共同编织在一起的→上下文

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: district
trans: n. 区【搭配】agricultural district 农业区

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

name: entertainment
trans: n. 娱乐，招待【搭配】entertain v. （使）欢乐，（使）娱乐；招待

sentences.english: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: There will be live entertainment (= performed then, not recorded ) throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 现场表演将持续一整天。

sentences.english: The dolphins give good entertainment value (= a lot of amusement and interest ).
sentences.chinese: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

detailed_translations.chinese: 娱乐， 文娱节目， 表演会； 招待， 款待， 请客
detailed_translations.english: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people

name: entrance
trans: n. 入口；进入【搭配】entrance fee 入场费main entrance 大门

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: make use of
trans: 使用，利用

sentences.english: You can make use of the building materials that have been lying by.
sentences.chinese: 你们可以利用那些被搁置不用的建筑材料。

sentences.english: This article provided some descriptions of the API, along with some sample code to illustrate how to make use of them.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章提供了应用程序编程接口的一些描述以及一些样本代码来阐明如何使用他们。

sentences.english: The generality of SOAP means that not all systems that make use of SOAP can communicate easily.
sentences.chinese: SOAP 的一般性意味着并非所有使用 SOAP 的系统都可以很容易地进行通信。

name: pedestrian
trans: adj. 徒步的；n. 行人【记忆】词根记忆：ped（脚）+estrian→用脚走的人→行人

sentences.english: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.chinese: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars

name: project
trans:
n. 计划，方案；课题，项目；工程；/prəˈdʒekt/
 v. （使）伸出；放映，投射，发射；（使）凸出，使伸出；设计，规划【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+ject（扔）→向前扔→放映【搭配】draw up a project 制定方案carry out a project 执行方案

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.

sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: opinion
trans: n. 主张，判断【搭配】in one's opinion在某人看来

sentences.english: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
sentences.chinese: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

detailed_translations.english: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

name: proposal

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐；劝告；使受欢迎【搭配】recommend sb. sth. 向某人推荐某物we recommend that... 我们建议…

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

trans: n. 推荐，推荐信；建议【搭配】letter of recommendation 推荐信on sb.'s recommendation 在某人的推荐下

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: remark
trans: n. 评语，意见；v. 评论；注意到【同根】remarkable adj. 显著的，非凡的

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: submit
trans: v. 屈从；提交【搭配】submit to 递交；屈服

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: utterance
trans: n. 用言语表达；话语

sentences.english: These two utterances communicate the same message.
sentences.chinese: 这两句话传递同样的信息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意见, 说话, 发表
detailed_translations.english: the action of saying something

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

trans: n. （餐馆中的）卡座

detailed_translations.english: A booth is a small area separated from a larger public area by screens or thin walls where, for example, people can make a telephone call or vote in private

detailed_translations.chinese: 自助餐；小卖部；打击；猛烈冲击

if something, especially wind, rain, or the sea, buffets something, it hits it with a lot of force

name: change the reservation
trans: 更改预约

name: chef
trans: n. 厨师长，厨师【搭配】sous chef 副主厨，副厨师长

sentences.english: a master chef
sentences.chinese: 手艺高超的厨师长

sentences.english: a pastry chef
sentences.chinese: 糕饼师傅

detailed_translations.english: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

name: dinner jacket
trans: 晚礼服

name: dress code
trans: 着装要求

trans: 享有盛誉

name: entree
trans: n. 主菜【搭配】entree chaude热盘

trans: 提前

sentences.english: If there is any change about the time of the meeting, please notify us in advance.
sentences.chinese: 开会时间如有变， 请提前告诉我们。

trans: 在角落里

trans: 在休息厅（等候）

trans: 留位

name: name
trans: n. 名字；v. 命名【搭配】in the name of以…的名义name after按…命名

sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

name: nonsmoking
trans: adj. 严禁吸烟的【搭配】nonsmoking area 禁烟区

trans: 包间

name: reserve ahead of time
trans: 提前预约

sentences.chinese: 他带她到一家豪华餐厅吃了一顿有五道菜的晚餐。

sentences.english: The company runs a chain of restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 公司经营连锁饭店。

sentences.english: A new restaurant has just opened across the road.
sentences.chinese: 马路对面刚开了一家新饭馆。

detailed_translations.english: a place where you can buy and eat a meal

trans: 吸烟区

trans: 双人桌

sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦改变了我们的时空概念。

sentences.english: close relationships established over a long period of time
sentences.chinese: 长期建立起来的亲密关系

sentences.english: Customers have only a limited amount of time to examine the goods.
sentences.chinese: 顾客只有有限的时间可以检查商品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数

detailed_translations.english: to arrange that something should happen at a particular time

name: under the name of
trans: 以…的名义

sentences.english: He made a few records under the name of Joe Ritchie.
sentences.chinese: 他用乔∙里奇的名字录制了几张唱片。

sentences.chinese: 他们从窗户爬出来。

sentences.english: Boost me up so I can look in the window.
sentences.chinese: 把我向上抬起，这样我能朝窗户里面看。

sentences.chinese: 他们从他的津贴中扣除损坏窗户的费用。

trans: v. 代人临时照看小孩

sentences.chinese: 在服务台托运行李。

sentences.chinese: 他们住在森林里。

sentences.english: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.

sentences.chinese: 我帮他挑选房子里用的家具。

sentences.chinese: 一堆笔记、考卷和课本乱七八糟地摊在桌子上。

sentences.english: The floor was littered with papers.
sentences.chinese: 地板上乱七八糟扔了许多报纸。

trans: n. 食物，营养；维持，支持【记忆】词根记忆：sus（下）+ten（拿住）+ance →拿住下面使稳固→支持

sentences.chinese: 没有食物，动物很快就会死亡。

sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是他们唯一的食物。

sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: ancestral

sentences.chinese: …这一家在德国南部的祖宅。

detailed_translations.english: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land that they have had for a long time

name: tortoise
trans: n. 乌龟；行动迟缓的人【搭配】tortoise shell龟甲

sentences.english: I saw a big sea tortoise .
sentences.chinese: 我看见过一个大海龟。

sentences.english: Run like a tortoise.
sentences.chinese: 像乌龟一样慢慢跑。

sentences.english: Either way, both the hare and tortoise get what they deserve based on how they behave.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，野兔和乌龟得到什么都是基于它们的行为举止的。

name: settle
trans: v. 定居；调停；安放；结算；安置于；（鸟等）飞落；决定【记忆】词根记忆：sett（=set，安置）+le（表动词）→放好→安放【搭配】settle down 定居，过安定的生活【同根】settler n. 定居者settlement n. 居住；住宅区

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定

name: adapt
trans: v. （使）适合，适应；改编【记忆】词根记忆：ad（加强）+apt（适应）→适应【搭配】adapt to 适应…adapt from 根据…改编【同根】adaptable adj. 能适应的；可修改的

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: unique
trans: adj. 唯一的；极不寻常的，极好的【记忆】词根记忆：uni（单一）+que（…的）→唯一的【搭配】a unique style 独特的风格unique copy 珍本，孤本【同根】uniqueness n. 独特，独一无二

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: subspecies
trans: n. （动植物的）亚种【记忆】词根记忆：sub（次，亚）+species（物种，种）→亚种

sentences.english: Several other subspecies of gull are found in the region.
sentences.chinese: 几个海鸥的其他亚种在此地区被找到。

detailed_translations.english: a group of similar plants or animals that is smaller than a  species

name: alligator
trans: n. 短吻鳄

sentences.english: alligator shoes
sentences.chinese: 短吻鳄皮皮鞋

detailed_translations.chinese: 短吻鳄（产于美国及中国）；短吻鳄皮革；鳄口式工具
detailed_translations.english: a large animal with a long mouth and tail and sharp teeth that lives in the hot wet parts of the US and China

detailed_translations.chinese: 鳄鱼般的；鳄鱼皮革的；鳄鱼皮纹的

name: amphibian
trans: n. 两栖动物【搭配】amphibian jeep 水陆两用吉普车

sentences.english: At first this amphibian deals with the cooler days by burying itself in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.english: "Almost all of them were abandoned somewhere in the city, " said Wu Weichun, the director of the zoo's amphibian department, to the Shanghai Dailynewspaper.
sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

name: amphibiology
trans: n. 两栖动物学

name: bullfrog
trans: n. 牛蛙

name: camouflage
trans: n. 伪装【记忆】联想记忆：cam（看作came，来）+ou（看作out）+flag（旗帜）+e→扛着旗帜出来→伪装成革命战士

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: chameleon
trans: n. 变色龙

detailed_translations.chinese: 变色龙， 蜥蜴； 善变之人
detailed_translations.english: a  lizard  that can change its colour to match the colours around it

name: cobra
trans: n. 眼镜蛇

sentences.english: A set of changes in the mongoose’s receptor makes it resemble the cobra’s own resistant receptor.
sentences.chinese: 猫鼬受体的一系列变化使得它们类似于眼镜蛇自己的抗毒液性受体。

sentences.english: Sometimes an attacking mongoose is bitten, but it has another line of defense against the venom — its acetylcholine receptor has also evolved so that the cobra neurotoxin cannot bind to it.
sentences.chinese: 有时猫鼬也会被咬到，但它还有除了反应之外的第二种防御毒液的方式——它的乙酰胆碱受体同样进化到了不怕眼镜蛇神经毒素的地步。

sentences.english: However, when cornered, these snakes will raise their heads, sometimes with a third of their body off the ground, spread their cobra-like neck-flap, open their black mouths and hiss.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当被逼到角落时，这些蛇就会抬起头部，有时会有三分之一脱离地面，舒展开它们眼镜蛇般的脖颈，打开黑色的嘴发出嘶嘶的声音。

detailed_translations.english: a poisonous African or Asian snake that can spread the skin of its neck to make itself look bigger

trans: n./v. 爬行；匍匐前进【搭配】move at a crawl缓慢行进

name: iodine

sentences.english: The cut burns from the iodine.
sentences.chinese: 伤口因涂了碘酒而疼痛。

sentences.english: Apply some iodine before you bandage.
sentences.chinese: 用绷带包扎伤口之前先敷点碘酒。

sentences.english: The tincture of iodine smarted when applied it to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 往伤口上擦碘酒时，能引起剧痛。

detailed_translations.english: a dark blue chemical substance that is used on wounds to prevent infection. It is a chemical  element  :symbol I

name: ion
trans: n. 离子

sentences.english: These vibrations turn the ion into a sort of superfast metronome.
sentences.chinese: 铝离子因为这些振动成为一种超高速节拍器。

sentences.english: The ion channel was the missing circuit element I was looking for, and it already existed in nature.
sentences.chinese: 这种离子通道是我正在寻找的缺失的电路元件，而且它的确在自然界中存在。

detailed_translations.english: an atom which has been given a positive or negative force by adding or taking away an  electron

name: isotope
trans: n. 同位素

sentences.english: ...tritium, a radioactive isotope of hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: ...氚，氢的一种放射性同位素。

detailed_translations.english: one of the possible different forms of an atom of a particular  element

name: limestone
trans: n. 石灰石，石灰岩

sentences.english: ...high limestone cliffs.
sentences.chinese: …高耸的石灰岩峭壁。

detailed_translations.english: a type of rock that contains calcium

name: metal
trans: n. 金属

sentences.english: The gate is made of metal.
sentences.chinese: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。

sentences.english: a small black metal box
sentences.chinese: 一个黑色的金属小盒子

sentences.english: They traded in gold and other precious metals (= valuable metals used especially for making jewellery ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。

sentences.english: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal (= old metal that is melted and used again ) .
sentences.chinese: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel

name: metalloid
trans: n. 非金属

name: methane
trans: n. 甲烷，沼气【搭配】methane emission 沼气泄出methane content 沼气含量

sentences.english: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
sentences.chinese: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 甲烷；[能源] 沼气
detailed_translations.english: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat

name: nitrogen
trans: n. 氮

sentences.english: Well, we know nitrogen has what?
sentences.chinese: 对于氮气我们知道什么？

sentences.english: The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质。

sentences.english: All of these from the group one and two through the group five and six elements, but what about elements, what about molecules like hydrogen, or nitrogen, or maybe oxygen?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是来自于第一主族和第二组主族,到第五主族和第六组主族的悬殊，那么元素呢，比如氢气，氮气或氧气那样的分子呢？

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N

name: oxygen
trans: n. 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: particle
trans: n. 极少量，微粒

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

name: plastic
trans: adj. 塑料（制）的

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

name: silica
trans: n. 硅石

sentences.english: While her team is confident that coal burning is causing the high rates of cancer, they are not certain it is due to silica.
sentences.chinese: 她的团队相信，煤的燃烧导致了肺癌的高发病率，但是他们不能确定这是二氧化硅引起的。

sentences.english: The basic ingredients in glass, including silica sand and soda ash, are found almost everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃的基本原料，包括硅砂和纯碱，几乎可以在任何地方找到。

sentences.english: The silica in cucumber is an essential component of healthy connective tissue, which includes muscles, tendons, ligaments, cartilage, and bone.
sentences.chinese: 黄瓜中的硅是健康的结缔组织的重要组成部分，结缔组织包括肌肉、肌腱、韧带、软骨和骨。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical  compound  that exists naturally as sand,  quartz  , and  flint  , used in making glass

name: silicon
trans: n. 硅，硅元素

sentences.english: But the brittleness of silicon limits its uses.
sentences.chinese: 但是，硅的脆性也限制了其应用范围。

sentences.english: The company pioneered the use of the silicon chip.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司首先使用硅片。

sentences.english: They consist of silicon, sand and metal so there’s no any connection to dinosaurs … Besides, we may see corrosion on some of them.
sentences.chinese: 它们是由硅砂和金属构成的，和恐龙蛋没有任何关系……除此之外，我们还能看到它们上面的腐蚀的部分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that exists as a solid or as a powder and is used to make glass, bricks, and parts for computers. It is a chemical element: symbol Si

name: silver
trans: n. 银

sentences.english: The silver spoon tarnished.
sentences.chinese: 银匙失去光泽了。

sentences.english: Her teeth were capped with silver.
sentences.chinese: 她的牙齿是包了银的。

sentences.english: The workers parted gold from silver in the workshop.
sentences.chinese: 在车间里工人们把金子从银子中提炼出来。

name: sodium
trans: n. 钠

sentences.english: ...one level teaspoon of sodium bicarbonate powder.
sentences.chinese: 一平茶匙碳酸氢钠粉末

detailed_translations.english: a common silver-white metal that usually exists in combination with other substances, for example in salt. It is a chemical element: symbol Na

name: sulfur
trans: n. 硫磺

sentences.english: But no one knew where the sulfur came from.
sentences.chinese: 但是，没有人知道硫来自何处。

sentences.english: Well, this chlorine has taken one electron from the sulfur.
sentences.chinese: 对了，这个氯从硫那里得到了一个电子。

sentences.english: These pollutants are called aerosols and they include soot as well as compounds of nitrogen and sulfur and other stuff into the air.
sentences.chinese: 通常，我们称这些污染物为悬浮微粒，它们包含烟尘以及氮硫与进入大气的其他物质的混合物。

name: action
trans: n. 作用

sentences.english: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

detailed_translations.english: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

name: biochemistry
trans: n. 生物化学【记忆】词根记忆：bio（生物）+chemistry（化学）→生物化学

sentences.english: ...the effects of air pollutants on the biochemistry of plants or animals.
sentences.chinese: …大气污染物对植物或动物生化过程的影响。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the chemistry of living things

name: bleach
trans: vt. 漂白；n. 漂白剂【搭配】bleach out漂白

sentences.english: She bleached her hair blonde.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发漂成了金黄色。

sentences.english: The wood had been bleached by the sun .
sentences.chinese: 木头已被太阳晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to make something pale or white, especially by using chemicals or the sun
a chemical used to make things pale or white, or to kill  germ s

name: catalysis
trans: n. 催化作用

name: caustic
trans: n. 腐蚀剂；adj. 腐蚀性的；（指评论）讽刺的，挖苦的【搭配】caustic remarks 讽刺挖苦的言论

sentences.english: caustic soda (= a chemical used for cleaning things )
sentences.chinese: 苛性钠，烧碱

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 腐蚀性的；[化学] 苛性的；刻薄的；焦散的
detailed_translations.english: a caustic substance can burn through things by chemical action

detailed_translations.chinese: [助剂] 腐蚀剂；苛性钠；焦散曲线

name: corrode
trans: v. 腐蚀；侵蚀【记忆】词根记忆：cor（加强）+rod（咬）+e→不断侵咬使腐坏→腐蚀

sentences.english: Acidic water will corrode the pipes.
sentences.chinese: 酸性水会腐蚀管子。

detailed_translations.english: if metal corrodes, or if something corrodes it, it is slowly destroyed by the effect of water, chemicals etc

name: decay
trans: v. 腐烂；衰退；n. 腐败【搭配】decayed tooth 龋齿a decaying culture 日渐衰落的文化

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: decomposition
trans: n. 分解【搭配】biological decomposition生物分解

sentences.english: So no one decomposition is sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 因此一种分解是不够的。

sentences.english: This is an important difference, because it means that the additional transaction decomposition can be turned on only when required.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个很重要的不同点，因为这意味着仅仅在需要时才进行附加的事务分解。

sentences.english: Unlike other decomposition solutions, due to this algorithm, there are no constraints that allow only sibling or child elements/attributes to be mapped to the same table.
sentences.chinese: 由于有了此算法，与其他的分解解决方案不同，没有只允许将兄弟或孩子元素/属性映射到同一个表的约束。

name: dye
trans: v. 给…染色；n. 染料【搭配】hair dye 染发剂

sentences.english: The women prepared, spun, and dyed the wool.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们将羊毛预备、纺线并染色。

sentences.english: hair dye
sentences.chinese: 染发剂

detailed_translations.english: to give something a different colour using a dye
a substance you use to change the colour of your clothes, hair etc

name: erode
trans: v. 侵蚀，腐蚀【搭配】erode away 侵蚀【同义】erosion n. 侵蚀

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: explode
trans: v. （使）爆炸；激增；破除【搭配】explode a superstition 破除迷信explode with rage 勃然大怒

sentences.english: The device was thrown at an army patrol but failed to explode.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.english: Far sooner than anyone thought possible, the Russians exploded an atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

detailed_translations.english: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

name: explosive
trans: n. 爆炸物；adj. 爆炸的；使人冲动的【搭配】explosive device 引爆装置

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

name: hydronic
trans: adj. 液体循环加热的

name: ignite
trans: v. 点燃，燃烧【记忆】词根记忆：ign（点火）+ite（使…）→点燃

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

name: polymerization
trans: n. 聚合

name: reagent
trans: n. 反应力；反应物；试剂

sentences.english: This is another organic chemistry reagent, it's also used extensively in the pharmaceutical industry.
sentences.chinese: 这也是一个有机化学试剂，而且还在制药业中广泛应用。

sentences.english: Mag is the limiting reagent.
sentences.chinese: 镁是极限反应物。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that shows that another substance in a  compound  exists, by causing a chemical  reaction

name: rot
trans: n. 腐烂；v. （使）腐烂【同根】rotten adj. 腐烂的

sentences.english: the smell of rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的气味

sentences.english: wood that is soft with rot
sentences.chinese: 腐烂变软的木头

detailed_translations.english: the natural process of decaying, or the part of something that has decayed
to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: （表示厌恶、蔑视、烦恼等）胡说；糟了

name: scorch
trans: v. 烧焦；使枯萎；n. 烧焦

sentences.english: The walls had been blackened and scorched by fire.
sentences.chinese: 这些墙被大火熏黑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you scorch something, or if it scorches, its surface burns slightly and changes colour
a mark made on something where its surface has been burnt

name: sear
trans: v. 烙，烧灼

sentences.chinese: 草地野火烧焦了巴斯克亥农庄附近的土地。

a mark caused by searing

name: solubility
trans: n. 溶度，溶性；可解决性，可解释性

name: solvent
trans: adj. 溶解的；有溶解性的；有偿付能力的；n. 溶媒，溶剂【记忆】词根记忆：solv（e）溶解+ent（…剂）→溶剂

sentences.english: They're going to have to show that the company is now solvent.
sentences.chinese: 他们将不得不证明公司现在是具备偿债能力的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有偿付能力的；有溶解力的
detailed_translations.english: having enough money to pay your debts
a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance

name: stale
trans: adj. 不新鲜的；陈腐的

sentences.english: stale jokes
sentences.chinese: 老掉牙的笑话

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting any more

name: tint
trans: vt. 上色，染色；n. 上色；色彩

sentences.english: paper with a yellowish tint
sentences.chinese: 泛黄的纸张

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of a particular colour
to slightly change the colour of something, especially hair

name: laughter
trans: n. 笑，笑声

sentences.english: Foster joined in the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 福斯特也跟着笑了起来。

sentences.english: He looked shocked, then burst into laughter (= started laughing ).
sentences.chinese: 他一脸的震惊，接着便放声大笑起来。

detailed_translations.english: when people laugh, or the sound of people laughing

name: tap
trans: v. 轻拍；利用，开发

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: expressive
trans: adj. 表现的；有表现力的【搭配】expressive force表现力

sentences.english: You can train people to be more expressive.
sentences.chinese: 你可以培训人们使其更富于表现力。

sentences.english: ...the present fashion for intuitive, expressive painting.
sentences.chinese: …当前凭直觉的、富于表现力的绘画风尚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions

name: machinery
trans: n. 机械；机构【记忆】词根记忆：machine（机械）+ry（集合名词）→机械

sentences.english: ...quality tools and machinery.
sentences.chinese: …优质工具和机械。

detailed_translations.english: You can use machinery to refer to machines in general, or machines that are used in a factory or on a farm

name: emotion
