sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: motor
trans: n. 马达【搭配】motor system马达系统

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: circuit
trans: n. 环行；电路【记忆】词根记忆：circu（=circ环）+it（走）→环行

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: vocalisation
trans: n. 声音

name: amused
trans: adj. 愉快的【搭配】be amused by对…觉得有趣

name: amusing
trans: adj. 风趣的

sentences.english: I don’t find his jokes at all amusing .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他的笑话一点都不好笑。

sentences.english: a highly amusing (=  very amusing  ) film
sentences.chinese: 非常有趣的电影

detailed_translations.english: funny and entertaining

name: beaming
trans: adj. 喜气洋洋的，愉快的

name: blessed
trans: adj. 愉快的

sentences.english: the Blessed Virgin
sentences.chinese: 圣母马利亚

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸福的；受祝福的；神圣的
detailed_translations.english: holy

name: bliss
trans: n. 狂喜

sentences.english: I didn’t have to get up till 11 – it was sheer bliss.
sentences.chinese: 我可以睡到11点才起来，真幸福啊。

detailed_translations.english: perfect happiness or enjoyment

name: blithe
trans: adj. 无忧无虑的，快乐的【同根】blithesome adj. 欢乐的，愉快的

sentences.english: a blithe disregard for the facts
sentences.chinese: 对事实的漠视

detailed_translations.english: happy and having no worries

name: brighten
trans: vt. 使快活，使高兴

sentences.english: Use blonde highlights to brighten your hair.
sentences.chinese: 用点金色的挑染，让你的发色明亮起来。

sentences.english: The morning sunshine brightened up the room.
sentences.chinese: 清晨的阳光照亮了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明亮；变亮；活跃；快乐高兴
detailed_translations.english: to make something lighter or brighter

name: delight
trans: n. 快乐，喜悦；v. （使）高兴，（使）欣喜【同根】delightful adj. 令人愉快的

sentences.english: The kids were screaming with delight.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

sentences.english: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
sentences.chinese: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction
to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment

name: ecstasy
trans: n. 狂喜【同根】ecstatic adj. 狂喜的

sentences.english: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: …一种近乎宗教极乐的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme happiness

name: elation
trans: n. 兴高采烈

name: enrapture
trans: vt. 使狂喜

sentences.english: The place at once enraptured me.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方立刻把我迷住了。

sentences.english: The 20,000-strong audience listened, enraptured.
sentences.chinese: 两万多名观众听得入了迷。

sentences.english: ...an enraptured audience.
sentences.chinese: ...一场观众如痴如醉。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone enraptures you, you think they are wonderful or fascinating

name: exaltation
trans: n. 欣喜【同根】exalt vt. 提拔；提升exalted adj. 兴奋的

sentences.english: The city was swept up in the mood of exaltation.
sentences.chinese: 该城被兴奋的情绪给席卷了。

detailed_translations.english: a very strong feeling of happiness

name: excitement
trans: n. 激动，兴奋；刺激

sentences.english: We were both new to the excitements of life in the big city.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都是初次感受大城市多姿多彩的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being excited

name: exhilaration
trans: n. 高兴，活跃，愉快【同根】exhilarate vt. 使高兴

sentences.english: It might be the exhilaration of that potent cordial, which is distilled only in the furnace-glow of earnest and long-continued thought.
sentences.chinese: 那力量可能是潜在热情的兴奋表现，是从长期不断的诚挚思想的熔炉中蒸馏出来的。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being happy, excited, and full of energy

name: exult
trans: v. 欢腾【记忆】词根记忆：ex（加强）+ult（=sult跳）→（高兴地）跳起来→欢腾【同根】exultant adj. 欢腾的，狂欢的

sentences.english: ‘We made the front page!’ Jos exulted.
sentences.chinese: “我们上了头版！”乔斯欣喜若狂道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂喜，欢欣鼓舞；非常高兴
detailed_translations.english: to show that you are very happy and proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something

name: gleeful
trans: adj. 极高兴的，兴奋的

name: grin
trans: n./v. 咧着嘴笑【搭配】grin and bear it 默默忍受

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

name: hilarious
trans: adj. 高兴的

sentences.english: The focus is solely on the shirts and the hilarious design.
sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.english: But I love my awful life so much right now, that I find it hilarious when I am unable to convince anyone else of it.
sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

name: intoxicate
trans: vt. （使）沉醉，（使）欣喜若狂【同根】intoxication n. 陶醉

detailed_translations.english: (of an alcoholic drink) to produce in (a person) a state ranging from euphoria to stupor, usually accompanied by loss of inhibitions and control; make drunk; inebriate

name: joyous
trans: adj. 快乐的，高兴的

sentences.english: a joyous occasion
sentences.chinese: 欢乐的场合

sentences.english: Our music is a joyous celebration of life.
sentences.chinese: 我们的音乐是对生活的欢乐颂扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人高兴的；充满欢乐的（等于joyful）
detailed_translations.english: very happy, or likely to make people very happy

name: jubilant
trans: adj. 欢欣的

sentences.english: Radicals were jubilant at getting rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 激进分子因为除掉了他而欣喜若狂。

sentences.english: The fans were in jubilant mood as they left the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们离开体育场时兴高采烈。

detailed_translations.english: extremely happy and pleased because of a success

name: merry
trans: adj. 欢快的【同根】merrily adv. 高兴地，愉快地

sentences.english: He marched off, whistling a merry tune.
sentences.chinese: 他吹着一首欢快的曲子大步走了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas

name: mirth
trans: n. 欢乐，欢笑【搭配】abandoned mirth 尽情的快乐

sentences.english: Her body began to shake with mirth.
sentences.chinese: 她笑得浑身直颤。

detailed_translations.english: happiness and laughter

name: overjoyed
trans: adj. 极度高兴的【搭配】overjoyed at sth. 因…欣喜若狂

sentences.english: Shelley was overjoyed to see me.
sentences.chinese: 谢莉看见我高兴极了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely pleased or happy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…万分高兴；使…狂喜（overjoy的过去分词）

name: pleasing
trans: adj. 愉快的

sentences.english: a pleasing sound
sentences.chinese: 悦耳的声音

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人愉快的；讨人喜欢的；合意的
detailed_translations.english: giving pleasure, enjoyment, or satisfaction

name: rapture
trans: n. 狂喜

sentences.english: The boys gazed up at him in rapture.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们欣喜若狂地抬头注视着他。

detailed_translations.english: great excitement and happiness

name: ravish
trans: vt. 使陶醉，使狂喜；强奸

sentences.english: She'll never know how close she came to being dragged off and ravished.
sentences.chinese: 她永远都不会知道她差一点就被人拖走强暴了。

detailed_translations.english: to force a woman to have sex

name: rejoice
trans: v. 高兴，欣喜【搭配】rejoice in因…感到欣喜

sentences.english: Today you may rejoice because of contacts, news or visits from friends who live in another city or country.
sentences.chinese: 今天您可能因为得到来自另一个城市或国家的朋友的联系、消息或拜访而感到高兴。

sentences.english: Why is it that we rejoice at a birth and grieve at a funeral? Is it because we are not the person concerned?
sentences.chinese: 我们为何在（人家）出生之时高兴而在殡殓之时又悲伤呢？是否因为我们不属于关人士才这样的？

name: amorous
trans: adj. 色情的；恋爱的【记忆】词根记忆：amor（爱）+ous（…的）→恋爱的

sentences.english: She resisted his amorous advances .
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝了他的挑逗。

sentences.english: He was always boasting about his amorous adventures .
sentences.chinese: 他老是吹嘘自己的风流韵事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多情的；恋爱的；热情的；色情的
detailed_translations.english: showing or concerning sexual love

name: compunction
trans: n. 懊悔【搭配】without compunction 毫无愧疚地

sentences.english: They used their tanks against the leftists without compunction .
sentences.chinese: 他们肆无忌惮地使用坦克来对付左派人士。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you should not do something because it is bad or wrong

name: contrite
trans: adj. 痛悔的

sentences.english: a contrite apology
sentences.chinese: 深感悔悟的道歉

detailed_translations.english: feeling guilty and sorry for something bad that you have done

name: penitential
trans: adj. 赎罪的；后悔的

name: repentance
trans: n. 悔恨，懊悔【搭配】in repentance 悔过

sentences.english: They showed no repentance during their trial.
sentences.chinese: 他们在受审期间没有表现出任何悔悟。

detailed_translations.english: when you are sorry for something you have done

name: sentimental
trans: adj. 感伤的

sentences.english: She said a sentimental goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 她依依不舍地道别。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伤感的；多愁善感的；感情用事的；寓有情感的

name: commiserate
trans: v. 同情，怜悯

sentences.english: When I lost, he commiserated with me.
sentences.chinese: 我失败时，他同情我。

detailed_translations.english: to express your sympathy for someone who is unhappy about something

name: consolation
trans: n. 安慰；慰问【搭配】consolation prize 安慰奖

sentences.chinese: 聊可安慰的是，随着这孩子慢慢长大，境况也好起来了。

sentences.chinese: 他知道自己已经尽了最大努力，心中便有了安慰。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes you feel better when you are sad or disappointed

name: empathetic
trans: adj. 移情作用的，能产生共鸣的

sentences.chinese: ...克林顿作为一位感同身受倾听者的本领。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移情作用的；同感的（等于empathic）
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is empathetic has the ability to share another person's feelings or emotions as if they were their own

name: effusive
trans: adj. 热情洋溢的；溢出的【记忆】词根记忆：ef（出）+fus（流）+ive（…的）→（感情）流出的→热情洋溢的

sentences.english: Our host gave us an effusive welcome.
sentences.chinese: 主人热情地欢迎我们。

detailed_translations.english: showing your good feelings in a very excited way

name: endearment
trans: n. 表示爱意的词或短语

name: enviable
trans: adj. 值得羡慕的【搭配】an enviable position令人羡慕的地位

sentences.english: Now he was in the enviable position of not having to work for a living.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已不必为生计而工作，着实令人羡慕。

detailed_translations.english: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it

name: fondness
trans: n. 爱好，溺爱【搭配】fondness for喜欢，喜爱

name: inclination
trans: n. 爱好；趋势；倾斜【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+clin（倾斜）+ ation→倾斜

sentences.chinese: 我生性爱说“不”。

trans: n. 思乡情（病）【记忆】词根记忆：nost（家）+alg（痛）+ia（某种病）→想家想得心痛的病→思乡病

sentences.chinese: 他也许被他对快乐青年时代的环境的怀念影响了。

name: fraternize
trans: v. （尤指与不该亲善者）亲善

name: impassive
trans: adj. 无动于衷的，冷漠的【搭配】impassive fervid 无动于衷的

sentences.english: Her impassive face showed no reaction at all.
sentences.chinese: 她表情冷淡，毫无反应。

detailed_translations.english: not showing any emotion

name: profane
trans: v. 亵渎【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+fan（庙）+e→在庙前做坏事→亵渎

sentences.english: profane language
sentences.chinese: 亵渎的语言

detailed_translations.english: showing a lack of respect for God or holy things
to treat something holy with a lack of respect

name: adjust oneself
trans: 自我调整，学会适应环境

name: attractive personality
trans: 吸引人的个性

name: be adept in
trans: 擅长…

name: convincing
trans: adj. 令人信服的【同根】convince vt. 使信服

sentences.english: convincing evidence of his guilt
sentences.chinese: 证明他有罪的有力证据

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that something is true or right

name: cooperative
trans: adj. 合作的【反义】incooperative adj. 不愿合作的

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: generous
trans: adj. 慷慨的【同根】generosity n. 慷慨

sentences.chinese: 迪特勒在他的时间和金钱方面慷慨大方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

name: greeting
trans: n. 问候【搭配】exchange greetings互相问候

sentences.english: I smiled a polite greeting, but the woman hardly acknowledged me.
sentences.chinese: 我客气地笑着打了个招呼，可是那女人没有答理我。

sentences.english: The two cousins exchanged greetings (= greeted each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 表兄妹俩互相问候。

name: informal
trans: adj. 非正式的【搭配】informal occasion 非正式场合

sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour

name: intelligent
trans: adj. 聪明的【同根】intelligence n. 智力

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: interpersonal relationship
trans: 人际关系

name: keep promise
trans: 信守承诺

name: moderate
trans:
adj. 温和的；/ˈmɒdəreɪt/
 v. （使）和缓；节制【搭配】moderate character 性情温和

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc

to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: networking skill
trans: 人际技巧，社交技巧

name: punctual
trans: adj. 准时的【同根】punctuality n. 准时

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: relationship network
trans: 关系网

name: reliable
trans: adj. 可靠的【同义】trustworthy adj. 可靠的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: sociable
trans: adj. 社交的【搭配】sociable personality好交际的性格【反义】unsociable adj. 不合群的

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: tolerant
trans: adj. 宽容的【同根】tolerance n. 忍耐

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: poll
trans: n. 民意测验；政治选举；v. 对…进行民意测验；获得…选票【记忆】联想记忆：大选（poll）费用（toll）上涨幅度惊人【搭配】public opinion poll 民意调查conduct a poll on 对…进行调查，投票【同根】polling n. 投票

sentences.english: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。

sentences.english: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.
sentences.chinese: 民意调查显示，教育是选民心中的头等大事。

sentences.english: Labour is ahead in the polls.
sentences.chinese: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。

sentences.english: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
sentences.chinese: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民意测验；政治选举，大选
detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…进行民意测验； 获得
detailed_translations.english: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

name: nurture
trans: vt. 培养；滋养；n. 营养品【记忆】联想记忆：大自然（nature）滋养（nurture）着人类

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: decline
trans: v./n. 下降，衰退；谢绝【记忆】词根记忆：de（向下）+clin（倾斜）+e →向下倾斜→下降，衰退【搭配】on the decline 在衰退中in decline下降rapid decline 飞速减少phase of decline 衰退期【参考】recline v. 放置incline v. 倾斜

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: factor
trans: n. 因素，要素【搭配】the key factor 关键因素internal/external factors 内在/外在因素

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: cause
trans: vt. 引起，导致

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: disjunction
trans: n. 分离；折断【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分离）+junct（连接）+ ion→分离

sentences.english: Like society , it builds its unity on the disjunction.
sentences.chinese: 每次统一都以剧烈的分裂为基础。

detailed_translations.english: the act of disconnecting or the state of being disconnected; separation

name: perception
trans: n. 感觉；洞察力【记忆】来自perceive（v. 感知，觉察）【同根】perceptible adj. 可察觉的perceptive adj. 有感知的，有洞察力的

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

name: reality
trans: n. 现实

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

name: breed
trans: n. 种，品种；v. 饲养；养育，培育；酿成，产生【记忆】联想记忆：这一窝（brood）小鸡是同一个品种（breed）【搭配】breed fish 养鱼

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: cultivate
trans: vt. 种植；培养【记忆】词根记忆：cult（培养，耕种）+iv+ate（使…）→培养；种植

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: cultivation
trans: n. 耕种；培养

sentences.english: soil cultivation
sentences.chinese: 土壤耕作

detailed_translations.chinese: 培养；耕作；耕种；教化；文雅
detailed_translations.english: the preparation and use of land for growing crops

name: cultural
trans: adj. 文化的，人文的；修养的

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

name: foster
trans: v. 培养，培育（某物）；促进；领养；adj. 收养的【记忆】联想记忆：fost（看作fast，快速的）+er →促进【同根】fosterling n. 养子，养女fosterer n. 养育者

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: nourish
trans: vt. 养育，滋养；怀有（希望等）【同根】nourishing adj. 有营养的

sentences.english: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。

sentences.english: a well nourished baby
sentences.chinese: 营养良好的婴儿

detailed_translations.english: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

name: conduce
trans: v. 有助于；导致【搭配】conduce to 导致，有助于

detailed_translations.chinese: 有益于， 有助于； 导致
detailed_translations.english: to lead or contribute (to a result)

name: generate
trans: vt. 产生（光、热、电等）；引起【记忆】词根记忆：gener（产生）+ate（做）→引起【同根】generation n. 产生；一代generator n. 发电机

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: induce
trans: v. 引诱，诱使；引起；感应【记忆】词根记忆：in（加以）+duc（引导）+e →引诱，引起【同根】inducement n. 引诱；劝诱inducible adj. 可诱导的，可诱发的

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机；v. 引发，导致【同义】stimulus n. 刺激物initiate vt. 发起，开始cause vt. 引起，导致

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: factual
trans: adj. 事实的；真实的【记忆】词根记忆：fact（事实）+ual（…的）→事实的

sentences.english: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts or relating to facts

name: literally
trans: adv. 逐字地；实际上

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: practically
trans: adv. 几乎，简直；实际上【记忆】来自practice（n. 实践，实际）

sentences.english: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.english: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.english: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.english: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.chinese: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: virtually
trans: adv. 实际上；几乎

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: affiliate
trans: v. 隶属；加入，加盟【记忆】词根记忆：af（加强）+fili（子女）+ ate→成为子女→加入

sentences.english: He wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed expert advice in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为一家美国公司的会员，因为他需要法律事务方面的专家意见。

detailed_translations.english: if a group or organization affiliates to or with another larger one, it forms a close connection with it
a company, organization etc that is connected with or controlled by a larger one

name: anarchism
trans: n. 无政府主义【记忆】词根记忆：an（无）+arch（统治者）+ ism （表主义）→无政府主义

name: authoritative
trans: adj. 有权威性的；命令式的【同根】authority n. 权威

sentences.english: the most authoritative work on English surnames
sentences.chinese: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

detailed_translations.english: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

name: autonomy
trans: n. 自治，自治权【记忆】词根记忆：auto（自己）+nomy→自治

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

name: ballot
trans: n. 投票

sentences.english: The party leader is elected by secret ballot .
sentences.chinese: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。

sentences.english: Workers at the plant held a ballot and rejected strike action.
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人举行投票，否决了罢工行动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投票；投票用纸；投票总数
detailed_translations.english: a system of voting, usually in secret, or an occasion when you vote in this way
to ask someone to vote for something

name: centralize
trans: vt. 集中于中央（或中心）【记忆】词根记忆：central（中心）+ize（使…）→集中于中央（或中心）

sentences.english: plans to centralize the company’s U.S. activities
sentences.chinese: 公司对在美国的业务活动进行统一管理的计划

detailed_translations.english: to organize the control of a country, organization, or system so that everything is done or decided in one place

detailed_translations.chinese: 集聚，集中；施行中央集权
detailed_translations.english: to organize the control of a country, organization, or system so that everything is done or decided in one place

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；委任，委托（书），代办；佣金，手续费【搭配】in commission 可使用，服现役中out of commission 不能使用

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会，全体委员

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: confederacy
trans: n. 联盟，邦联【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+feder（联盟）+ acy （表性质）→联盟

sentences.english: They've entered this new confederacy because the central government's been unable to control the collapsing economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经参加了这个新同盟，因为中央政府已经不能控制摇摇欲坠的经济了。

detailed_translations.english: a confederation

name: confederate
trans: v. （使）联盟；adj. 联合的【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+feder（联盟）+ ate →共结联盟→（使）联盟

sentences.english: The young woman was his confederate, of course.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻女子当然是他的同谋。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a confederacy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使联盟；使联合；同伙；帮凶

name: congress
trans: n. （代表）大会；（美国等国的）国会，议会

sentences.english: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
sentences.chinese: 执政党工党的代表大会

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc

name: dictatorial
trans: adj. 独裁的，专断的【搭配】dictatorship n. 专政

sentences.english: dictatorial regimes
sentences.chinese: 独裁政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 独裁的，专政的；专横傲慢的
detailed_translations.english: a dictatorial government or ruler has complete power over a country

name: diplomatic
trans: adj. 外交的；讲究手腕的【同根】diplomatic relations外交关系

sentences.english: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
sentences.chinese: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

name: dispensation
trans: n. 特许，赦免

sentences.english: They were promised dispensation from military service.
sentences.chinese: 他们被许诺将被特免不用服兵役。

detailed_translations.english: A dispensation is special permission to do something that is normally not allowed

name: domain
trans: n. 领地；领域【同义】area n. 领域field n. 领域

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: election
trans: n. 选举

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: embargo
trans: n./v. 禁止贸易，禁运

sentences.english: The United Nations imposed an arms embargo against the country.
sentences.chinese: 联合国对该国施行了武器贸易禁运。

sentences.english: The fruit was embargoed.
sentences.chinese: 水果被禁运了。

sentences.english: They embargoed oil shipments to the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们禁止了对美国石油船运。

detailed_translations.english: an official order to stop trade with another country

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止， 禁止出入港口
detailed_translations.english: If goods of a particular kind are embargoed, people are not allowed to import them from a particular country or export them to a particular country

name: factious
trans: adj. 内讧的，闹派别的

detailed_translations.chinese: 好捣乱的；好搞派系的；源于派别的
detailed_translations.english: given to, producing, or characterized by faction

name: ideology
trans: n. 意识形态【记忆】词根记忆：ideo（思想）+logy（…学）→思想体系，意识形态

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: ignominy
trans: n. 耻辱

sentences.english: ...the ignominy of being fired.
sentences.chinese: ...被开除的羞辱。

detailed_translations.english: an event or situation that makes you feel ashamed or embarrassed, especially in public

name: indignity
trans: n. 轻蔑，侮辱【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+dignity（尊严）→侮辱

sentences.english: The prisoners were subjected to all sorts of indignities.
sentences.chinese: 犯人遭受各种侮辱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动
detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes you feel very ashamed and not respected

name: kingdom
trans: n. 王国

sentences.english: the United Kingdom
sentences.chinese: 联合王国

sentences.english: the animal/plant/mineral kingdom
sentences.chinese: 动物界/植物界/矿物界〔大自然三界〕

detailed_translations.english: a country ruled by a king or queen

name: league
trans: n. 同盟，联盟

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

name: parade
trans: n. 游行【搭配】parade party 游行晚会

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

name: partisan
trans: adj. 党派的【记忆】来自party（n. 党派）

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；vt. 向…请愿【记忆】词根记忆：pet（寻求）+ition→力争实现要求→请愿

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: privilege
trans: n. 特权【记忆】词根记忆：privi（=priv单个）+leg（法律）+e→有个人法律→特权

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: procession
trans: n. 队伍，行列【记忆】词根记忆：process（队列行进）+ion（表名词）→向前走的→队伍

sentences.english: They marched in procession to the Capitol building.
sentences.chinese: 他们列队向国会大厦行进。

detailed_translations.chinese: 队伍，行列；一列，一排；列队行进
detailed_translations.english: a line of people or vehicles moving slowly as part of a ceremony

name: regime
trans: n. 政权【搭配】political regime 政治体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: regimen
trans: n. 政权【记忆】词根记忆：regi（=reg统治）+men（抽象名词）→统治方式/制度→政权

sentences.english: Patients maintain a strict dietary regimen.
sentences.chinese: 病人严格遵守饮食规律。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配
detailed_translations.english: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

name: rejection
trans: n. 拒绝

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

name: sanction
trans: v. 批准；n. 批准，认可；约束力；[常作pl.] 国际制裁【同根】sanctionist n. 制裁者

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: scandal
trans: n. 丑事，丑闻；恶意诽谤；流言蜚语；反感，愤慨【搭配】financial scandal 财政丑闻

sentences.english: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。

sentences.english: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
sentences.chinese: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。

sentences.english: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
sentences.chinese: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。

sentences.english: a major scandal involving the government
sentences.chinese: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻

sentences.english: a series of financial scandals
sentences.chinese: 一连串金融丑闻

sentences.english: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
sentences.chinese: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻

sentences.english: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
sentences.chinese: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑事， 丑闻； 流言蜚语； 反感， 愤慨
detailed_translations.english: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

name: self-government
trans: n. 自治

name: senate
trans: n. 参议院【搭配】Senate President 参议长

sentences.english: The Senate approved the bill.
sentences.chinese: 参议院批准了这项议案。

detailed_translations.english: the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France

name: sovereign
trans: n. 君主；adj. 主权独立的

sentences.english: In March 1889, she became the first British sovereign to set foot on Spanish soil.
sentences.chinese: 1889年3月，她成为首位踏上西班牙国土的英国君主。

sentences.english: a sovereign ruler
sentences.chinese: 最高统治者

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen
having the highest power in a country

name: unconventional
trans: adj. 不因循守旧的，不落俗套的

sentences.english: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.chinese: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个奇才。

sentences.english: He was known for his unconventional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因另类行为而出名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非传统的, 不合惯例的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society

name: veto
trans: n./v. 否决（权）【搭配】veto right/the power of veto 否决权

sentences.english: The Senate had a sufficient majority to override the presidential veto (= not accept his refusal ).
sentences.chinese: 参议院有足够的多数票可以推翻总统的否决。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission
if someone in authority vetoes something, they refuse to allow it to happen, especially something that other people or organizations have agreed

name: vote
trans: n. 投票，选票

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

name: soil
trans: n. 土壤【搭配】soil erosion 水土流失

sentences.english: She moistenend  the soil round the plant.
sentences.chinese: 她把植物周围的土壤弄湿。

detailed_translations.english: to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body
to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body

name: fertility
trans: n. 富饶；丰产

detailed_translations.english: the ability of the land or soil to produce good crops

name: fertilizer
trans: n. 肥料【搭配】organic fertilizer有机肥

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: pesticide
trans: n. 杀虫剂【记忆】词根记忆：pesti（=pest害虫）+cid（杀） +e→杀虫剂

sentences.english: They sprinkled pesticide to bug the potatoes .
sentences.chinese: 他们喷撒杀虫剂给马铃薯除虫。

sentences.english: This resulted in the contamination of the bags used in that facility's fluid bed dryers with pesticide contamination.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了由于工厂的流体床干燥器被杀虫剂污染而把使用的包装袋污染。

sentences.english: Investigators in Japan have found punctures on the outside of at least one of the bags tied to the poisonings as well as traces of the pesticide.
sentences.chinese: 日本调查人员在其中至少一袋涉及中毒案的饺子的外包装袋上发现了刺孔以及杀虫剂的痕迹。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance used to kill insects and small animals that destroy crops

name: growth
trans: n. 增长；发展【搭配】personal growth 个人成长

sentences.english: measures to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 刺激经济增长的措施

detailed_translations.english: an increase in amount, number, or size

name: algae
trans: n. 藻类

sentences.english: ...an effort to control toxic algae in Green Lake.
sentences.chinese: …控制绿湖里有毒水藻的努力。

detailed_translations.english: a very simple plant without stems or leaves that grows in or near water

name: increase
trans:
vt. 增加，增长，增强；/ˈɪŋkriːs/
 n. 增加，增长，增强【搭配】on the increase 正在增加，不断增长

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: run-off
trans: n. （雨、水或其他液体的）地表径流

name: anopheles
trans: n. 疟蚊

name: beetle
trans: n. 甲虫

sentences.english: He studied the Namib beetle, an ingenious species that lives in one of the driest places on earth.
sentences.chinese: 他研究了纳米布甲虫，这是一种机灵的物种，生活在世界上最干燥的地方之一。

sentences.english: With half an inch of rain per year, the beetle can only survive by consuming the dew it collects on the hydrophilic skin of its back in the early mornings.
sentences.chinese: 它的生活地每年只有半英尺的降雨量，这种甲虫可以通过使用它背部具吸水性的皮肤在早晨收集的水露存活下来。

sentences.english: While other bugs may change color due to external circumstances like temperature, the Panamanian tortoise beetle is one of the few creatures known to control its own color changing.
sentences.chinese: 据了解，其他小虫可能是随着外部环境（如：气温）的变化而变色的，但巴拿马龟甲虫是可以控制自身颜色变化的少数动物之一。

detailed_translations.english: to overhang; jut
an insect with a round hard back that is usually black

name: biocenosis
trans: n. 生物群落

name: bug
trans: n. 虫子；臭虫【搭配】bug repellent 防虫液；驱虫剂

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: cabbage worm
trans: 菜青虫

name: cockroach
trans: n. 蟑螂

sentences.english: He stumbled to the door and found a six-foot cockroach standing there.
sentences.chinese: 他跌跌撞撞地去打开门，见到一只六英尺高的蟑螂站在那儿！

sentences.english: He saw the cockroach scurry under it with the gecko far behind struggling to go under.
sentences.chinese: 蟑螂急匆匆的从冰箱底下跑过去，壁虎在后面也努力的想要钻过去。

sentences.english: Competitions include Skating Around Poverty and Welfare Hurdles. Mascots include a cockroach and a rat.
sentences.chinese: 比赛项目包括贫穷和福利绕障碍滑冰，吉祥物是蟑螂和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: a large black or brown insect that lives in dirty houses, especially if they are warm and there is food to eat

name: cricket
trans: n. 蟋蟀

sentences.english: The boy traded his knife for a cricket bat.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩用他的刀子换了一个板球棒。

sentences.english: He angrily stomped his cricket after failing the fight.
sentences.chinese: 比赛失败后，他生气地踏死了他的蟋蟀。

sentences.english: He was pressganged into playing in the charity cricket match.
sentences.chinese: 他是被强拉去参加这场板球义赛的。

detailed_translations.english: a game between two teams of 11 players in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running between two sets of three sticks

name: flea
trans: n. 跳蚤

sentences.english: Are you sure the dog has fleas ?
sentences.chinese: 你确定那只狗身上有跳蚤吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 跳蚤；低廉的旅馆；生蚤的动物
detailed_translations.english: a very small insect without wings that jumps and bites animals and people to eat their blood

name: grasshopper
trans: n. 蚂蚱，蝗虫【同义】locust n. 蝗虫

sentences.english: One day a grasshopper came upon an ant at work in a garden.
sentences.chinese: 一天， 蚱蜢碰到了一只正在花园里干活的蚂蚁。

sentences.english: I remember that it was summer. I had just come inside from catching grasshoppers and I was sorting them on my sister's bed because I didn't want to get grasshopper guts on mine.
sentences.chinese: 我记得那是夏天，我抓了些蝗虫放到妹妹的床上，根据它们还剩下几只脚来归类，有些蝗虫的内脏都冒出来了，我当然不想弄到自己的床上。

detailed_translations.english: an insect that has long back legs for jumping and that makes short loud noises

name: hazardous
trans: adj. 有害的

sentences.english: the disposal of hazardous waste
sentences.chinese: 有害废弃物的处理

detailed_translations.english: dangerous, especially to people’s health or safety

name: horsefly
trans: n. 牛虻

sentences.english: That horsefly is the only thing keeping this old horse moving.
sentences.chinese: 那只马蝇是唯一能让这匹老马活动的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a large fly that bites horses and cattle

name: insect
trans: n. 昆虫【搭配】insect bite 昆虫咬伤beneficial insect 益虫injurious insect 害虫

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: insecticide
trans: n. 杀虫剂

sentences.english: Spray the plants with insecticide.
sentences.chinese: 给植物喷洒杀虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance used for killing insects

name: integrated pest management
trans: 害虫综合治理

name: larva
trans: n. 幼虫

sentences.english: The eggs quickly hatch into larvae.
sentences.chinese: 这些卵很快孵化成幼虫。

detailed_translations.english: a young insect with a soft tube-shaped body, which will later become an insect with wings

name: louse
trans: n. 虱子

detailed_translations.chinese: 虱子；寄生虫；卑鄙的家伙
detailed_translations.english: a small insect that lives on the hair or skin of people or animals

name: mosquito
trans: n. 蚊子【搭配】mosquito net 蚊帐

sentences.english: The male mosquito never stings.
sentences.chinese: 雄蚊不叮。

sentences.english: Are your mosquito bites still itching?
sentences.chinese: 你被蚊子咬的地方还痒吗?

sentences.english: The frog darted out its tongue to catch a mosquito.
sentences.chinese: 这只青蛙突然伸出舌头捕捉蚊子。

detailed_translations.english: a small flying insect that sucks the blood of people and animals, sometimes spreading the disease  malaria

name: moth
trans: n. 蛾【搭配】silk moth 蚕蛾

sentences.english: What do a hummingbird, a moth, and a maple tree have in common?
sentences.chinese: 蜂鸟、蛾子和枫树之间有什么共同之处呢？

sentences.english: Around streetlights in leafy suburbs what often seems like a moth at first glance may in fact be a small bat.
sentences.chinese: 在绿树成荫的郊区，街灯周围经常有乍一看象蛾子的飞行物，而事实上可能是一只微蝠。

sentences.english: Authorities say the mob of 'roos is endangering a species of local lizard and the threatened gold sun moth through overgrazing.
sentences.chinese: 有关部门表示，由于过度放牧，这些袋鼠已经对一种当地蜥蜴和金日蛾的生存构成了威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an insect related to the  butterfly  that flies mainly at night and is attracted to lights. Some moths eat holes in cloth.

name: pest
trans: n. 害虫，有害物【记忆】联想记忆：“拍死它”→见到害虫就拍死它→害虫

sentences.english: a chemical used in pest control
sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

detailed_translations.chinese: 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

name: rootworm
trans: n. 食根虫

name: silkworm
trans: n. 蚕

sentences.english: The first silkworm diseases began to appear in 1845, creating an epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 1845年，首批桑蚕疾病开始出现，并引起了一次流行。

sentences.english: An epidemic of several silkworm diseases caused production to fall, especially in France, where the industry never recovered.
sentences.chinese: 而几种桑蚕疾病的流行导致了丝绸产品下滑，特别在法国，丝绸工业再也没有恢复。

detailed_translations.english: a type of  caterpillar  which produces silk thread

name: spider
trans: n. 蜘蛛【搭配】spider web 蜘蛛网

sentences.english: Do you think that the spider can web anything?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这蜘蛛能用网捕住什么吗?

sentences.english: Why not hold spider of the week contests in your home throughout this season?
sentences.chinese: 在这整个蜘蛛出没的季节里，为什么不在你家里举行蜘蛛周竞赛？

sentences.english: Likewise, by these investigators’ logic, male arachnophobes should get a mild tickle down there whenever they spy a spider scurrying across their desk.
sentences.chinese: 同样的，按这些研究者的逻辑，男性蜘蛛恐惧者每次看到蜘蛛爬过桌子都应该下身瘙痒咯？

detailed_translations.english: a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads

name: termite
trans: n. 白蚁

sentences.english: A German man and woman, their faces in close-up, talked about the good and essential symbiotic nature of termite mounds, with subtitles.
sentences.chinese: 一个德国男人和女人的脸部特写镜头，他们在谈论白蚁堆美好而必要的共栖性特质，带字幕。

sentences.english: Office blocks modeled on termite nests and buildings that can resist climate change have been the focus at a conference by some of Australia's most influential designers in Melbourne.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚一些最有影响的设计师在墨尔本的一个会议上着重讨论了以白蚁巢穴为模型的办公楼群，以及能够抵御气候变化的建筑物。

sentences.english: The hills recede into the distance and now we are in vast grasslands dotted with termite mounds, skyscraper sandcastles of the insect world.
sentences.chinese: 山丘已经远去，我们现在行进在宽广的草原上，草地上有白蚁堆，那是昆虫世界的摩天大楼。

detailed_translations.english: an insect that eats and destroys wood from trees and buildings

name: vermin
trans: n. 害虫

sentences.english: The beds were filthy and full of vermin.
sentences.chinese: 那些床铺肮脏不堪，而且爬满了虫子。

sentences.english: Foxes are considered vermin.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸被认为是害兽。

detailed_translations.english: small animals, birds, and insects that are harmful because they destroy crops, spoil food, and spread disease

name: wasp
trans: n. 黄蜂，胡蜂【搭配】wasp waist 蜂腰，细腰

sentences.english: A wasp stung me on the arm.
sentences.chinese: 黄蜂蜇了我的手臂。

sentences.english: Years of dealing with plasters and wasp stings on the beach mean handbags and subsequently backpacks are stuffed with remedies.
sentences.chinese: 和药膏和沙滩上黄蜂叮咬打了多年交道，结果是我的手提包和背包里塞满了药物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 黄蜂；[昆] 胡蜂；易怒的人
detailed_translations.english: a thin black and yellow flying insect that can sting you

name: additive
trans: n. 添加剂【搭配】free from additive 不含添加剂

sentences.english: One of these was laced with a bitter additive that could be detected only on contact .
sentences.chinese: 其中一种含有一些只有接触才能发现的苦味的添加剂。

sentences.english: Introducing the uniquely Boolean concept of complementation into an additive identity, we find an interesting effect.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了独特的逻辑概念的互补成添加剂的特性，我们发现一个有趣的结果。

sentences.english: As mentioned above, it was a very iterative process where all of the element were slowly built up together through additive and subtraction means.
sentences.chinese: 正如以上所提到的，将不同的元素通过加法和减法的方式，慢慢地组合到一起是一个需要不断反复的过程。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is added to food to improve its taste, appearance etc

name: cancer-causing chemical
trans: 致癌化学物

name: communicable
trans: adj. 可传染的

detailed_translations.chinese: 可传达的；会传染的；爱说话的
detailed_translations.english: a communicable disease can be passed on to other people

name: concoction
trans: n. 混合物

sentences.english: He sipped the concoction cautiously.
sentences.chinese: 他小心翼翼地啜着调配出来的酒。

name: contaminant
trans: n. 污染物【记忆】词根记忆：contamin（污染）+ant（…物）→污染物【搭配】air contaminant 空气污染物

sentences.english: environmental contaminants
sentences.chinese: 环境污染物

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes something dirty

name: cyanide
trans: n. 氰化物

sentences.english: His death has all the signs of cyanide poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 他的死亡具有氰化物中毒的所有迹象。

detailed_translations.english: a very strong poison

name: exacerbation
trans: n. 恶化，加重【记忆】词根记忆：ex（使…）+acerb（酸）+ation （表名词）→使变酸→恶化【同根】exacerbate vt. 使加剧

name: fertilize
trans: vt. 使…受精；施肥【同根】fertilization n. 施肥；受精

sentences.english: The faeces contain nitrogen which fertilizes the soil.
sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

detailed_translations.english: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it

name: herbicide
trans: n. 除草剂【参考】herb n. 药草

sentences.english: But water containing the herbicide cannot be released back into the river and it is known that low water levels can harm river ecosystems accustomed to higher levels.
sentences.chinese: 但含有除草剂的水不能再排向河流，而且我们知道低水位将会对习惯于高水位的河流生态系统造成危害。

sentences.english: Genetically altered soybeans and cotton require less herbicide to control weeds. These varieties now make up more than 70 percent of all soybean and cotton acreage planted in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 转基因的大豆和棉花不需要那么多除草剂来控制杂草，这些品种现在占美国大豆和棉花种植面积的70%以上。

sentences.english: Virtually all commercial GMOs are bred to withstand direct application of herbicide and/or to produce an insecticide.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，所有的商业性的转基因生物都可以抵抗直接作用的除草剂和/或者制造一种杀虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance used to kill unwanted plants

name: nitrogen
trans: n. 氮

sentences.english: Well, we know nitrogen has what?
sentences.chinese: 对于氮气我们知道什么？

sentences.english: The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质。

sentences.english: All of these from the group one and two through the group five and six elements, but what about elements, what about molecules like hydrogen, or nitrogen, or maybe oxygen?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是来自于第一主族和第二组主族,到第五主族和第六组主族的悬殊，那么元素呢，比如氢气，氮气或氧气那样的分子呢？

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N

name: pesticide residues
trans: 农药残留

name: phosphate fertilizer
trans: 磷肥

name: resistant
trans: adj. 抵抗的；抗…的

sentences.english: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.
sentences.chinese: 一些人对锻炼的主意非常抵制。

detailed_translations.english: not damaged or affected by something

name: sprayer
trans: n. 喷雾器

name: weed
trans: v. 除草【记忆】联想记忆：种子（seed）在杂草（weed）中顽强生长

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

name: algae pollution
trans: 藻类污染

name: aquatic plant
trans: 水生植物

name: brown algae
trans: 褐藻

name: exuberant
trans: adj. 繁茂的【记忆】词根记忆：ex（加强）+uber（果实）+ant （…的）→全都是果实的→繁茂的

sentences.english: exube-rant carvings
sentences.chinese: 充满生气的雕刻品

detailed_translations.chinese: 繁茂的；生气勃勃的，充溢的
detailed_translations.english: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful

name: green algae
trans: 绿藻

name: red algae
trans: 红藻

name: sargassum
trans: n. 马尾藻类海藻

name: seaweed
trans: n. 海藻

sentences.english: So the next time you see a chunk of seaweed ... notice the beauty of it, yes.
sentences.chinese: 所以下次你碰见一大片海藻时，要毫不犹豫的欣赏它的美。

sentences.english: The crabs come closer to shore at this time of year, Child said, where they feed on the seaweed.
sentences.chinese: 这些螃蟹每年这个时间，要来到这里海岸的边上，恰尔特说，它们以吃海藻为生。

sentences.english: In many places, like Japan, people get iodine from seafood, seaweed, vegetables grown in iodine-rich soil or animals that eat grass grown in that soil.
sentences.chinese: 像日本等许多地方，人们通过食用海鲜、海藻得到碘，还可以从生长在高碘土壤里的蔬菜或食草动物那里得到碘。

detailed_translations.english: a plant that grows in the sea

name: symbiosis
trans: n. 共生关系【记忆】词根记忆：sym（共同）+bi（生命，生物）+osis（表现象）→共同维持生命→共生关系

sentences.english: ...the link between bacteria, symbiosis, and the evolution of plants and animals.
sentences.chinese: ...细菌、共生和动植物进化间的联系。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship between different living things that depend on each other

name: underwater
trans: adj. 水下的

sentences.english: an underwater camera
sentences.chinese: 水下摄影机

sentences.english: ...giant submarines able to travel at high speeds underwater.
sentences.chinese: …能在水下高速行驶的巨型潜艇。

sentences.english: Some stretches of beach are completely underwater at high tide.
sentences.chinese: 有些沙滩在涨潮时会完全被水淹没。

detailed_translations.english: below the surface of an area of water, or able to be used there
Something that exists or happens underwater exists or happens below the surface of the ocean, a river, or a lake

name: span
trans: n. 跨距；一段时间；v. 持续；横跨

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

name: century
trans: n. 世纪【搭配】half a century 半个世纪

sentences.english: the story of life on a small farm at the turn of the century
sentences.chinese: 讲述世纪初一个小农场生活的故事

detailed_translations.english: one of the 100-year periods measured from before or after the year of Christ’s birth

name: stretch
trans: v. 延伸，绵延；伸展；拉长；n. 一段（时间、路程）；伸展【搭配】at a stretch 一口气地，连续at full stretch 全力以赴，竭尽所能stretch out 伸展，伸手【同义】extend v. 延伸

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: boundary
trans: n. 分界线；边界【记忆】词根记忆：bound（界限）+ary（表地点）→分界线，边界

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: jungle-clad
trans: adj. 丛林密布的

name: clad
trans: adj. 被…覆盖的，被…笼罩的

sentences.english: an armour-clad ship
sentences.chinese: 装甲舰

detailed_translations.english: wearing a particular kind of clothing

detailed_translations.chinese: 在金属外覆以另一种金属
穿衣（clothe的过去式和过去分词）

name: volcano
trans: n. 火山【记忆】联想记忆：vol（意愿）+can（会）+(n)o →火山爆发不以人的意志为转移→火山【同根】volcanic adj. 火山的

sentences.english: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.chinese: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava is sometimes forced out

name: coral
trans: n. 珊瑚，珊瑚虫；adj. 珊瑚色的，珊瑚红的

sentences.english: It is like the bow of the King of the Persians that is painted with vermilion and is tipped with coral.
sentences.chinese: 你的嘴唇就像是波斯王国的弯弓，那是一张涂上朱砂的弯弓，那是一张头上镶嵌珊瑚的弯弓。

sentences.english: I believe they are doing a good job with that. How about the coral? Is it really as beautiful as they say?
sentences.chinese: 我相信他们是在做好事。对了，珊瑚怎么样？它们真的就像人们说的那么漂亮吗？

detailed_translations.english: pink or reddish-orange in colour
a hard red, white, or pink substance formed from the bones of very small sea creatures, which is often used to make jewellery

name: outlier
trans: n. [地质学]老围层，外露层

name: calendar
trans: n. 日历，历法【搭配】academic calendar 校历；学年日历

sentences.english: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

name: decade
trans: n. 十年【搭配】over the past decade 在过去的十年里

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

name: epoch
trans: n. 纪元【同根】epochal adj. 划时代的

sentences.english: the Victorian epoch
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

detailed_translations.english: a period of history

name: era
trans: n. 年代，时代【搭配】the Christian era 公元

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: fortnight
trans: n. 两星期【搭配】in a fortnight 两星期后

sentences.english: a fortnight’s holiday
sentences.chinese: 十四天的假期

sentences.english: in a fortnight’s time
sentences.chinese: 两周后

sentences.english: a fortnight ago
sentences.chinese: 两周前

detailed_translations.english: two weeks

trans: 闰年

name: lunar calendar
trans: 阴历

name: solar calendar
trans: 阳历

trans: n. 酸化【搭配】oceanic acidification 海洋酸化

name: atoll
trans: n. 环状珊瑚岛；环礁

name: blast fishing
trans: 爆破捕鱼

name: calcium carbonate
trans: 碳酸钙

name: cluster
trans: vi. 丛生；群集；n. 串，束，群【搭配】a cluster of... 一束…

sentences.english: Do this for all nodes in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.english: This can be done on any server of the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: colony
trans: n. （同地生长的植物或动物）群；群体【同义】community n. 群落

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: continental shelf
trans: 大陆架

name: crustacean
trans: n. 甲壳类动物；adj. 甲壳类的【记忆】词根记忆：crust（外壳）+acean→甲壳类动物

sentences.english: Researchers found the 70-millimeter crustacean in the dark shale of an Oklahoma quarry.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在俄克拉荷马采石场的页岩层发现这些70毫米的甲壳纲动物。

sentences.english: This is the world's largest crustacean and the seven king crabs introduced here from the North Pacific by Russian scientists in 1961 have multiplied at an astonishing rate.
sentences.chinese: 这是世界上最大的甲壳类动物。 俄罗斯科学家在1961年从北太平洋引进这里的七只帝王蟹已以惊人的速度成倍增长。

sentences.english: Daphnia has a large number of never-before seen genes, as well as a big chunk of the same genes found in humans, the most of any insects or crustacean so far known to scientists.
sentences.chinese: 水蚤有大量之前从未见过的基因，也有一大堆在人类身上就发现的相同基因，其数量是至今科学家所知的昆虫或甲壳类生物中最多的。

name: exoskeleton
trans: n. 外骨骼【记忆】词根记忆：exo（外部）+skeleton（骨骼） →外骨骼

sentences.english: An advanced onboard micro-computer ensures the exoskeleton moves in concert with the operator.
sentences.chinese: 一种最先进的机载微型电脑确保了外骨骼与操作器一致移动。

sentences.english: For example, scientists at Raytheon (RTN) have been working on an exoskeleton to give its user super strength like that of the Hulk.
sentences.chinese: 举个例子来说吧，雷声公司的研究人员开发一件外骨骼，可以使用户拥有绿巨人一样的强大力量。

sentences.english: He plans to add regenerative capabilities to the exoskeleton, so that it will require little or no power when moving on level ground.
sentences.chinese: 他计划要为外骨骼添加再生能源的能力，使得平地的运行能耗损很少能源或甚至不耗损能源。

detailed_translations.english: the hard parts on the outside of the body of creatures such as insects and crabs

name: fishery
trans: n. 渔业；水产业【搭配】fishery resource 渔业资源

sentences.english: ...the fisheries off Newfoundland.
sentences.chinese: …纽芬兰附近的那些渔场。

detailed_translations.english: a part of the sea where fish are caught in large numbers

name: fore reef
trans: 前礁

trans: 岸礁；边礁

trans: 海洋物种

sentences.english: Atype of mollusk, the lined chiton has colorful lines on its valves andwhite or yellow spots or bands on its girdle.
sentences.chinese: 条纹石鳖是一种软体动物，瓣膜上有彩色条纹，条带上有白色或黄色斑点或环状物。

sentences.english: "To my eye, it's pretty clearly modified by human hands, though it may originally have originated as a fossil cavity of some ancient mollusk, " Rundkvist wrote.
sentences.chinese: 伦德奎斯特写道，“ 按我的观点，这东西很清楚是用人手修改过的。 尽管它原来可能只是某些古代软体动物化石中空的型腔。”

sentences.english: Measuring more than 16 inches (407 millimeters), this giant mollusk is the biggest ever found in its subclass--Caudofoveata.
sentences.chinese: 超过16英寸（407毫米）的长度，使这种大型的软体动物成为尾腔亚纲中迄今为止发现的最大的物种。

trans: n. （水螅型）珊瑚虫

name: rainforests of the sea
trans: 海洋热带雨林

name: reef crest
trans: 礁顶

name: sea anemone
trans: 海葵

name: secrete

sentences.english: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
sentences.chinese: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it

name: shoreline protection
trans: 海岸线保护

trans: n. 海绵动物【同根】spongy adj. 海绵似的

sentences.english: Clean the rug by sponging it gently.
sentences.chinese: 用湿布轻轻擦洗以清洁小地毯。

detailed_translations.english: to put paint on a surface using a sponge
a piece of a soft natural or artificial substance full of small holes, which can suck up liquid and is used for washing

name: stony coral
trans: 石珊瑚

name: active volcano
trans: 活火山

name: caldera
trans: n. 破火山口（开口较大的火山口）

sentences.english: Roast the peppers until the skin begins to char and blister.
sentences.chinese: 把这些辣椒烤到表皮发黑起泡为止。

name: cone volcano
trans: 锥状火山

name: crater
trans: n. 火山口【搭配】bowl-shaped crater 碗型的火山口crater lake 火山湖

sentences.english: craters on the moon’s surface
sentences.chinese: 月球表面的坑

detailed_translations.english: a round hole in the ground made by something that has fallen on it or by an explosion

name: crust
trans: n. 地壳

sentences.english: sandwiches with the crusts cut off
sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

detailed_translations.chinese: 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮
detailed_translations.english: the hard brown outer surface of bread

trans: n. 洼地；盆地

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: dormant
trans: adj. 静止的；休眠的【搭配】dormant volcano 休眠火山

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

trans: n. 地震

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

sentences.chinese: 示威者被赶出大厅。

sentences.english: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
sentences.chinese: 两个发动机突然熄火，飞机在下降的同时开始喷出燃料。

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

name: fault
trans: n. 断层

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

sentences.english: Mexico's Mount Colima began spewing lava and ash last night.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥科利马山昨晚开始喷发熔岩和火山灰。

sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

sentences.english: The parks and squares looked grim under a mantle of soot and ash.
sentences.chinese: 在一层烟尘的笼罩下，这些公园和广场显得阴沉沉的。

name: outburst

sentences.english: ...a spontaneous outburst of cheers and applause.
sentences.chinese: …由衷爆发出的欢呼声和掌声。

detailed_translations.english: An outburst of an emotion, especially anger, is a sudden strong expression of that emotion

name: plate

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: seismic
trans: adj. 地震的，地震引起的【记忆】词根记忆：seism（地震）+ic（…的）→地震的

sentences.english: increased seismic activity
sentences.chinese: 越来越频繁的地震活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 地震的；因地震而引起的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by  earthquakes

name: seismology
trans: n. 地震学【记忆】词根记忆：seism（地震）+ology（…学）→地震学

sentences.english: He is a famous seismology expert.
sentences.chinese: 他是有名的地震学专家。

sentences.english: The last system also corresponds to the real time seismology.
sentences.chinese: 其中，最后一个体系即相当于实时地震学。

sentences.english: He had just received a doctorate in recognition of his contributions to seismology .
sentences.chinese: 他刚被授予了博士头衔以表彰他对地震学作出的贡献。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of  earthquakes

name: shield volcano
trans: 盾状火山

name: squirt

sentences.english: Some kids squirted a water pistol in her face.
sentences.chinese: 有几个小孩用水枪朝她脸上喷水。

sentences.english: It just needs a little squirt of oil.
sentences.chinese: 它只需喷点油。

detailed_translations.english: Squirt is also a noun

detailed_translations.english: a layer of rock or earth

name: tectonic plate
