detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: enable
trans: v. 使能够，使成为可能【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+able（能够的）→使能够，使成为可能【搭配】enable sb. to do sth. 使某人能够做某事

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: climb
trans: n./v. 上升，增长

sentences.english: Harry climbed the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 哈里爬上楼梯。

sentences.english: Boys were climbing trees along the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在河边爬树。

detailed_translations.english: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do
to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do

name: vertically
trans: adv. 垂直地；直立地

sentences.english: Well, we cut it into vertically simple pieces.
sentences.chinese: 我们把它分割为垂直简单的部分。

sentences.english: For instance, say your application requires a container that vertically stacks display objects but without any gap in between.
sentences.chinese: 比方说，您的应用程序要求一个容器能够垂直堆叠显示对象而不在其间留空隙。

sentences.english: This will ensure that all of the areas you add to this UI are arranged vertically in one column.
sentences.chinese: 这将确保向这个 UI 添加的所有区域都将被垂直地组织到一个列内。

name: forwards
trans: adv. 向前方

sentences.english: The paging UI allows you to navigate backwards and forwards through displayed data, displaying a fixed number of records at a time.
sentences.chinese: 该分页 UI 使您能够在所显示的数据之间向前和向后导航，并且一次显示固定数量的记录。

sentences.english: Together they illustrate the importance of understanding the lifecycle -- backwards, forwards, and inside out -- so that you can manipulate it when you need to.
sentences.chinese: 将这些问题汇总在一起，就能体现充分理解生命周期的重要性 —— 向后、向前或由内向外，这样您就可以在需要的时候操纵它。

sentences.english: The single door hinges forwards and upwards, so such cars can be parked facing the pavement and close together—indeed, three of them can sit abreast in a standard parking place.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的门可以向前和向上开启，所以这样的车可以面向着道路紧密停靠在一起，当然，三辆这样的车可以并排停在一个标准停车位里。

name: backwards
trans: adv. 向后的

sentences.english: Hannah took a step backward.
sentences.chinese: 汉娜往后退了一步。

sentences.english: She pushed me and I fell backwards into the chair.
sentences.chinese: 她推了我一下，我便往后倒在椅子上。

detailed_translations.english: in the direction that is behind you

name: crazy
trans: adj. 热衷的；狂热的

sentences.english: The neighbours must think we’re crazy.
sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.english: It’s an absolutely crazy idea .
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是个荒唐的想法。

sentences.english: I know this idea sounds crazy , but it may be worth a try.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.english: He often works 12 hours a day – it’s crazy .
sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

detailed_translations.english: very strange or not sensible

name: devoted
trans: adj. 爱好的；热衷的；致力（于…）的

sentences.english: a devoted father
sentences.chinese: 尽职的父亲

sentences.english: Beckham’s devoted fans
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆的忠实球迷

detailed_translations.english: giving someone or something a lot of love and attention

name: fanatic
trans: n. （对某一活动、运动、生活方式）入迷者，痴狂者

sentences.english: fanatics who represent a real danger to democracy
sentences.chinese: 对民主构成很大威胁的狂热分子

sentences.english: a religious fanatic
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热入迷者；盲信者；盲信
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extreme political or religious ideas and is often dangerous
Fanatic means the same as

name: fanaticism
trans: n. 狂热；着迷【搭配】religious fanaticism 宗教狂热

name: frenetic
trans: adj. 发狂似的；狂热的

sentences.english: She rushes from job to job at a frenetic pace.
sentences.chinese: 她发疯似的不停地跳槽。

detailed_translations.english: frenetic activity is fast and not very organized

name: frenzy
trans: n. 狂热；狂乱；疯狂

sentences.english: Doreen had worked herself into a frenzy .
sentences.chinese: 多琳一阵狂怒。

detailed_translations.english: a state of great anxiety or excitement, in which you cannot control your behaviour

name: furor
trans: n. 喧闹；狂热；狂怒；抗议

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹， 轰动； 盛怒

name: mania
trans: n. 强烈的欲望，狂热，极大的热情

sentences.english: The mania for dinosaurs began in the late 1800s.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙热兴起于19世纪晚期。

detailed_translations.chinese: [医]颠狂, 狂躁, 癖好, 狂热
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

name: zealotry
trans: n. 狂热分子的态度（或行为）

sentences.english: Even so, there is some fear of zealotry.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，还是担心狂热分子。

sentences.english: But at a time when the western world is battling to defend free speech against religious zealotry, they look particularly indefensible.
sentences.chinese: 但每次当西方社会奋起身来为他们的言论自由辩护以反抗宗教狂热时，他们看起来却是那么的无言以辩。

sentences.english: Tory distrust of Europe has injected zealotry into what was once a pro-business party famed for its pragmatism.
sentences.chinese: 保守派不相信欧洲已经注入了狂热到曾经因它们的实用主义而闻名于世的亲企党中。

detailed_translations.english: extreme or excessive zeal or devotion

name: ardent
trans: adj. 热情的【搭配】ardent passion 热情

sentences.english: an ardent supporter of free trade
sentences.chinese: 自由贸易的热心支持者

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情的；热心的；激烈的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: showing strong positive feelings about an activity and determination to succeed at it

name: ardor
trans: n. 激情；狂热；热情，热忱

sentences.english: The difficulty and failure both didn't cool his ardor.
sentences.chinese: 困难和失败都没有降低他的热情。

sentences.english: "Here's fresh meat for your axe, Kreis, " he said; "a rose-white youth with the ardor of a lover for Herbert Spencer.
sentences.chinese: “克瑞斯，你那板斧有了新对象了，”他说，“一个纯洁得像白玫瑰的青年，对斯宾塞怀着恋人一样的热情。

sentences.english: Cathy Whitaker: That was the day I stopped believing in the wild ardor of things.
sentences.chinese: 凯西。惠特克：那一天，让我开始不再相信狂野的热情这样的事情。

name: cordial
trans: adj. 热诚的【搭配】cordial hospitality 盛情接待

sentences.english: The talks were conducted in a cordial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

detailed_translations.english: friendly but quite polite and formal

name: enthusiasm
trans: n. 热情【搭配】an outburst of enthusiasm 热情奔放

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 热情的；热心的【搭配】enthusiastic applause 热烈的掌声enthusiastic reception 热诚的接待

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: fervent
trans: adj. 热情的，热诚的，热烈的

sentences.english: a fervent appeal for peace
sentences.chinese: 对和平的强烈呼吁

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的；强烈的；炽热的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

name: fervor
trans: n. 热情，热烈【搭配】patriotic fervor 爱国热情

sentences.english: He took up the cause with evangelical fervor .
sentences.chinese: 他以传道者般的热情投身于这一事业。

sentences.english: The cathedral at Chartres is an expression of the religious fervor of the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在查特雷斯的大教堂是中世纪时期宗教热情的表现之一。

sentences.english: As social conflicts continue tosharpen, the party needs to divert attention, and of course a parade is a goodway to do that by whipping up nationalist fervor.
sentences.chinese: 随着社会冲突继续深化，中共需要转移人们的注意力，而阅兵就是实现这一点的好办法，可以激起人们的民族主义热情。

name: passionate
trans: adj. 充满激情的，热切的，强烈的【记忆】词根记忆：passion（激情）+ate（具有…的）→充满激情的

sentences.english: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。

sentences.english: a very passionate young man
sentences.chinese: 一位感情热烈的年轻人

sentences.english: a passionate lover
sentences.chinese: 富有激情的爱人

sentences.english: a passionate kiss
sentences.chinese: 激情的一吻

detailed_translations.english: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

name: verve
trans: n. 热忱；（人的）生机，精力

sentences.english: He looked for the dramatic, like the sunset in this painting, and painted it with great verve.
sentences.chinese: 他追求画面的表现力—就像这幅画里的落日—而且创作时充满激情。

detailed_translations.english: energy, excitement, or great pleasure

name: zeal
trans: n. 热情【搭配】zeal for 对…的热情

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

name: zealous
trans: adj. 热情的，积极的；狂热的【搭配】be zealous in... 热心于…

sentences.english: a zealous preacher
sentences.chinese: 热心的讲道者

sentences.english: zealous political activists
sentences.chinese: 积极的政治活动家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is zealous does or supports something with great energy

name: zest
trans: n. 热情；狂热

sentences.english: The danger of being caught added a certain zest to the affair.
sentences.chinese: 被捉奸的危险为这件风流韵事增添了一些刺激性。

detailed_translations.english: eager interest and enjoyment

name: ache for
trans: 渴望

name: aspire
trans: v. 渴望，有志于【记忆】加强记忆：a（加强）+spir（呼吸）+e →看到渴望的东西就呼吸急促→渴望

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: court
trans: v. 试图获得；博得

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: crave
trans: v. 渴望【搭配】crave for 渴望

sentences.english: an insecure child who craves attention
sentences.chinese: 缺乏安全感、渴望被关注的孩子

detailed_translations.english: to have an extremely strong desire for something

name: desirable
trans: adj. 令人向往的；可取的；值得拥有的；值得做的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

detailed_translations.english: something that is desirable is worth having or doing

name: desire
trans: n. 愿望；欲望；渴望；v. 渴望；期望；想望

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

name: desirous
trans: adj. 渴望；想望；希望

sentences.english: The enemy is so desirous of peace that he will agree to any terms.
sentences.chinese: 敌人如此渴望和平，他会同意任何条件。

detailed_translations.english: wanting something very much

name: desperate for
trans: 极度渴望…

name: hunger
trans: n. （对某事物的）渴望，渴求；饥饿【搭配】hunger for 渴望

sentences.english: Try to satisfy your hunger by eating some fruit.
sentences.chinese: 吃些水果充充饥吧。

sentences.english: her hunger for knowledge
sentences.chinese: 她的求知欲

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you need to eat

name: long
trans: vi. 渴望【搭配】long for 渴望

sentences.english: He longed to see her again.
sentences.chinese: 到那里去要多长时间？

sentences.english: She longed for the chance to speak to him in private.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望有机会和他私下交谈。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much, especially when it seems unlikely to happen soon

name: reverie
trans: n. 幻想；白日梦

sentences.english: She was startled out of her reverie by a loud crash.
sentences.chinese: 哗啦一声巨响把她从幻想中惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: a state of imagining or thinking about pleasant things, that is like dreaming

name: yearn
trans: vi. 渴望；怀念【搭配】yearn for 渴望

sentences.english: He yearned for freedom.
sentences.chinese: 他曾渴望自由。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

name: yen
trans: vi. 渴望

sentences.english: The dollar fell by 24 percent against the yen (= decreased in value in relation to the yen ) between 1970 and 1973.
sentences.chinese: 在1970年至1973年间，美元对日元的汇率下跌了24%。

detailed_translations.chinese: 日元（日本货币单位）；渴望
detailed_translations.english: the standard unit of money in Japan: symbol ¥

name: clockwise
trans: adj. 顺时针方向的；adv. 顺时针方向地

sentences.english: Screw the lid on clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 按顺时针方向拧紧盖子。

sentences.english: Gently swing your right arm in a clockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 按顺时针方向轻轻摆动你的右臂。

detailed_translations.english: in the same direction as the  hands  of a clock move
Clockwise is also an adjective

name: decline
trans: n. 斜面，倾斜

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: disorientate
trans: v. 使失去方向感；使（某人）神智迷乱

sentences.english: An overnight stay at a friend's house disorientates me.
sentences.chinese: 在朋友家睡了一觉，醒来我不知自己身在何处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失去方向感； 使迷茫， 使不知所措
detailed_translations.english: If something disorientates you, you lose your sense of direction, or you generally feel lost and uncertain, for example, because you are in an unfamiliar environment

name: incline
trans:
v. （使）倾斜；（使）倾向于；易于；/ˈɪnklaɪn/
 n. 倾斜；斜面，斜坡

sentences.english: a steep incline
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

name: orientate
trans: v. （使）适应；给…定位；使朝向，转至特定方向

sentences.english: The reason for this was that he decided to orientate the map in the direction of the Pole Star since Polaris was the immovable guiding light in which the voyagers of that era placed their trust.
sentences.chinese: 他之所以要这样做就是因为他决定以北极星的方向来确定地图的方位。 因为北极星是一盏不动的导航灯，那个时代的航海家们主要依靠北极星来导航。

name: slope
trans: n. 斜坡；倾斜；v. （使）倾斜

sentences.english: a steep slope
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

sentences.english: a gentle
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: She looked back up the grassy slope.
sentences.chinese: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

sentences.english: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
sentences.chinese: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

detailed_translations.english: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

name: uphill
trans: adv. 向上，往上；艰难地

sentences.english: The road twists uphill.
sentences.chinese: 这条路弯弯曲曲通向山上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向上， 往上； 上坡； 艰难地
detailed_translations.english: towards the top of a hill

name: typical
trans: adj. 典型的【记忆】词根记忆：typ（模式）+ical（…的）→成为模式的→典型的【同根】typically adv. 典型地

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: high-pitched
trans: adj. 声调高的【记忆】词根记忆：high（高）+pitch（音高）+ ed（…的）→声调高的

name: exaggerated
trans: adj. 夸张的【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+agger（堆积）+ ate（使…）+(e)d（…的）→使越堆越高的→夸张的【同根】exaggerate v. 夸大，夸张exaggeration n. 夸张

name: repetitious
trans: adj. 重复的【记忆】来自repeat（vt. 重说；重做）【同根】repetition n. 重复；副本

sentences.english: repetitious work
sentences.chinese: 重复的工作

detailed_translations.english: involving the same actions or using the same words many times, in a way that is boring

name: source
trans: n. 根源；来源【搭配】at source 在源头

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: fascination
trans: n. 着迷；令人着迷的事物【记忆】联想记忆：fasc（看作fast，牢固的）+ in（里面的）+ation→牢牢地陷在里边→使着迷【同根】fascinate v. 强烈地吸引，使着迷

sentences.english: The fascination lay in the mystery of what was inside the box.
sentences.chinese: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

detailed_translations.english: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting

name: linguist
trans: n. 语言学家【记忆】词根记忆：lingu（语言）+ist（从事某项研究的人）→语言学家【同根】linguistic adj. 语言的，语言学的

sentences.english: He had a scholarly air and was an accomplished linguist.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种学者的风度，而且是个熟练掌握多国语言的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches linguistics

name: boast
trans: v./n. 自夸；夸耀【记忆】联想记忆：烤鸭（roast duck）值得夸耀（boast）

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: boastful
trans: adj. 好自夸的

name: bombastic
trans: adj. 辞藻华丽而空洞的

sentences.english: He was vain and bombastic.
sentences.chinese: 他既虚荣又浮夸。

sentences.english: ...the bombastic style adopted by his predecessor.
sentences.chinese: …他的前任采取的浮夸方式。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as bombastic, you are criticizing them for trying to impress other people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning

name: brag
trans: v. 自夸，吹嘘

sentences.english: Do not brag or bluff.
sentences.chinese: 不要自夸和虚张声势。

sentences.english: It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.english: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.chinese: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

name: magniloquent
trans: adj. 言语夸张的【记忆】词根记忆：magni（大）+loqu（说话）+ ent（关于…的）→说大话的→言语夸张的

sentences.english: News of the death of forests appears to have been greatly magniloquent.
sentences.chinese: 森林在灭亡的消息似乎被很大程度上夸大其词了。

detailed_translations.english: (of speech) lofty in style; grandiloquent

name: overstate
trans: v. 夸大的叙述，夸张【记忆】合成词：over（过分）+state（说）→夸张

sentences.english: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
sentences.chinese: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。

sentences.english: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated (= is very important ).
sentences.chinese: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

name: pretentious
trans: adj. 自命不凡的，自负的【记忆】词根记忆：pre（预先）+tent（伸展）+ ious（…的）→将优势伸展的→自命不凡的

sentences.english: a pretentious film
sentences.chinese: 矫饰的电影

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is pretentious, they try to seem more important, intelligent, or high class than they really are in order to be impressive

name: acquaint
trans: v. （使）认识；（使）熟悉【同根】acquaintance n. 认识；了解

sentences.english: Have steps been taken to acquaint breeders with their right to apply for licenses?
sentences.chinese: 已经采取措施让饲养动物者了解他们申请执照的权利了吗？

detailed_translations.english: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself with something, you learn about it.

name: ambiguous
trans: adj. 含糊其辞的；意向不明的【搭配】an ambiguous smile 用意含糊的微笑

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: apprehend
trans: vt. 了解，明白【记忆】词根记忆：ap（加强）+prehend（抓）→（被）抓住→逮捕；抓住（意思）→了解，明白

sentences.english: The police have failed to apprehend the culprits.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能拘捕罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: if the police apprehend a criminal, they catch him or her

name: comprehend
trans: v. 理解；包含【记忆】词根记忆：com（加强）+prehend（抓住）→牢牢抓住→理解【同根】comprehensible adj. 能充分理解的comprehension n. 理解

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: comprehension
trans: n. 理解；理解力

sentences.english: Why you let her talk you into doing such a foolish thing is beyond my comprehension (= impossible for me to understand ) .
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会被她说服去做这种蠢事，我实在是无法理解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解， 理解力， 领悟； 理解力测验
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand something

name: evident
trans: adj. 明显的【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+vid（看）+ent（…的）→看出来的→明显的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: explicit
trans: adj. 明确的；清楚的；详述的【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+plic（重叠）+it→（说话）不啰嗦的→清楚的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: grasp
trans: vt. 抓紧；掌握；n. 抓【记忆】联想记忆：他见到她宛如抓住（grasp）一根救命稻草（grass）

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: ignorance
trans: n. 无知；不知道【搭配】ignorance about 不知…

sentences.english: Excuse my ignorance, but how does it actually work?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的无知，它究竟是如何运作的？

detailed_translations.english: lack of knowledge or information about something

name: ignorant
trans: adj. 无知的【搭配】ignorant of the law不懂法律

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: intelligible
trans: adj. 容易理解的；清楚的【搭配】unintelligible adj. 难解的，无法了解的incomprehensible adj. 不能理解的，难于领悟的

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

name: tangibly
trans: adv. 可触摸地；明白地【同根】tangible adj. 有形的；可触摸的intangible adj. 无形的；难以理解的

detailed_translations.chinese: 可触摸地； 可感知地； 有形地

name: understandable
trans: adj. 可以理解的；可同情的

sentences.english: It is understandable that parents are angry, and looking for someone to blame.
sentences.chinese: 父母生气了想找个人出气，这是可以理解的。

sentences.english: He just can’t face anyone at the moment, which is perfectly understandable.
sentences.chinese: 他现在就是无法面对任何人，这完全可以理解。

sentences.english: an understandable mistake
sentences.chinese: 情有可原的失误

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以理解的；可以了解的
detailed_translations.english: understandable behaviour, reactions etc seem normal and reasonable because of the situation you are in

name: understanding
trans: n. 理解；谅解；adj. 体谅的；宽容的

sentences.english: Luckily, I have a very under­standing boss.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，我有一个非常通情达理的上司。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体谅的， 宽容的， 通情达理的
detailed_translations.english: sympathetic and kind about other people’s problems

detailed_translations.chinese: 理解，理解力；谅解；协议；相互理解，融洽
detailed_translations.english: an unofficial or informal agreement

name: acquisition
trans: n. 取得；获得物【同根】acquire vt. 取得，获得

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

name: alphabet
trans: n. 字母表【同根】alphabetical adj. 按字母表顺序的；字母的

sentences.english: The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters.
sentences.chinese: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing

name: first-language acquisition
trans: 母语习得

name: language acquisition
trans: 语言习得

name: language study
trans: 语言学习

name: mother tongue
trans: 母语

sentences.english: children for whom English is not their mother tongue
sentences.chinese: 母语不是英语的儿童

detailed_translations.english: your mother tongue is the first and main language that you learnt when you were a child

name: native language
trans: 本国语言

name: oral
trans: adj. 口头的，口述的【搭配】oral communication 口头交流

sentences.english: oral history
sentences.chinese: 口述的历史

sentences.english: an oral agreement
sentences.chinese: 口头协议

detailed_translations.english: spoken, not written
a spoken test, especially in a foreign language

name: phonetic
trans: adj. 语音的【记忆】词根记忆：phon（声音）+et+ic（…的）→语音的

sentences.english: a phonetic alphabet
sentences.chinese: 音标

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sounds of human speech

name: pronounce
trans: v. 发音；宣称【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+nounc（说）+e →在前面说→宣布【搭配】pronounce sentence 宣判

sentences.english: The scheme was pronounced a failure.
sentences.chinese: 该方案宣告失败。

detailed_translations.english: to give a judgment or opinion
to officially state that something is true

name: pronounceable
trans: adj. （指声音）发得出的；（指词）可发音的【记忆】词根记忆：pronounce（发音）+able（可…的）→（指词）可发音的

detailed_translations.chinese: 发得出的； 可发音的
detailed_translations.english: a word, name etc that is pronounceable is easy to say

name: spoken language
trans: 口语

name: accost
trans: vt. （以不怀好意的态度）上前和（陌生人）说话

sentences.english: He was accosted by four youths and forced to give them all his money.
sentences.chinese: 四个少年走上前来和他搭讪，逼迫他交出身上所有的钱。

name: chat
trans: v./n. 闲谈，聊天【搭配】chat with... 和…聊天

sentences.english: John and I sat up until the early hours chatting.
sentences.chinese: 我和约翰聊到凌晨才睡。

detailed_translations.english: to talk in a friendly informal way, especially about things that are not important

name: coax
trans: vt. 劝诱，哄【搭配】coax sb. to do sth. 哄某人做某事

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: colloquial
trans: adj. 白话的；通俗的；口语体的【记忆】词根记忆：col（共同）+loqu（说话）+ ial（…的）→两人一起说→口语体的

sentences.english: ...a colloquial expression.
sentences.chinese: …一个口语表达法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白话的；通俗的；口语体的
detailed_translations.english: language or words that are colloquial are used mainly in informal conversations rather than in writing or formal speech

name: confide
trans: vt. 吐露【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+fid（相信）+e →值得相信→吐露

sentences.english: I knew she had some fundamental problems in her marriage because she had confided in me a year earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我知道她的婚姻存在一些根本问题，因为她一年前曾向我吐露过。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone you trust about personal things that you do not want other people to know

name: declaim
trans: v. 慷慨陈词【记忆】词根记忆：de（使…加强）+claim（呼喊）→大声呼喊→慷慨陈词

sentences.english: He raised his right fist and declaimed: "Liar and cheat!"
sentences.chinese: 他举起右拳慷慨陈词:"骗子！"

detailed_translations.english: to speak loudly, sometimes with actions, so that people notice you

name: dumb
trans: adj. 哑的，无说话能力的；不说话的，无声音的【搭配】be struck dumb with 因…说不出话来【同义】mute adj. 哑的speechless adj. 无言的voiceless adj. 无声的

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: effuse
trans: v. 流出；吐露【记忆】词根记忆：ef（出）+fus（流）+e→流出→吐露

detailed_translations.english: to pour or flow out

name: equivocate
trans: vi. 含糊其辞【记忆】词根记忆：equi（相等）+voc（声音）+ate →大家都说一样的话，无人表态→含糊其辞

sentences.english: He is equivocating a lot about what is going to happen if and when there are elections.
sentences.chinese: 他含含糊糊地说着很多如果进行选举会发生的状况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说模棱两可的话；支吾， 躲闪；推诿；含糊其词
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question

name: excuse
trans:
n. 借口；/ɪkˈskjuːz/
 vt. 原谅【搭配】excuse for …的借口

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: gabble
trans: v. 急促不清的说话

sentences.english: Just calm down, stop gabbling, and tell me what has happened.
sentences.chinese: 冷静一下，说话别太急，告诉我发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to say something so quickly that people cannot hear you clearly or understand you properly

name: gossip
trans: n. 小道传闻；闲话；爱说长道短的人；v. 闲聊；传播流言蜚语【搭配】gossip with sb. about sth. 和某人说长道短

sentences.english: Who knows how much of the gossip was true.
sentences.chinese: 有谁知道这些流言蜚语有多少是真的呢？

sentences.english: You must avoid gossip and focus on what you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流言蜚语；爱说长道短的人
detailed_translations.english: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

name: grumble
trans: n./v. 抱怨，牢骚【搭配】grumble at 对…表示不满grumble over 埋怨

sentences.english: ‘This is boring,’ Kathleen grumbled.
sentences.chinese: “这真无聊。”凯瑟琳抱怨道。

sentences.english: My only grumble is that there isn't a non-smoking section.
sentences.chinese: 我惟一的抱怨是这儿没有无烟区。

sentences.english: They grumble about how hard they have to work.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨自己工作得很辛苦。

sentences.english: Taft grumbled that the law so favoured the criminal that trials seemed like a game of chance.
sentences.chinese: 塔夫脱抱怨法律如此有利于罪犯，使得审判看来像是一场运气的游戏。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining in an unhappy way
Grumble is also a noun
If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way

name: hearsay
trans: n. 传闻，谣言【搭配】hearsay evidence 传闻证据；非直接证据

sentences.english: I wouldn’t take any notice of it – it’s just hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 我不会在意，这只不过是传闻而已。

detailed_translations.english: something that you have heard about from other people but do not know to be definitely true or correct

name: hoarse
trans: adj. （声音）嘶哑的【搭配】hoarse voice沙哑的声音

sentences.english: He was hoarse from laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他笑得嗓子都沙哑了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are hoarse, or if your voice is hoarse, you speak in a low rough voice, for example because your throat is sore

name: hubbub
trans: n. （人群的）喧闹声

sentences.english: the hubbub from the market
sentences.chinese: 市场的嘈杂声

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of loud noises, especially the noise of a lot of people talking at the same time

name: nonsense
trans: n. 废话【搭配】cut the nonsense 不要胡说

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: oration
trans: n. （正式的）演说【记忆】词根记忆：ora（说）+tion→演说

sentences.english: ...a brief funeral oration.
sentences.chinese: ...一篇简短的葬礼悼词。

detailed_translations.english: a formal public speech

name: outwit
trans: vt. （智力上）超过；智胜【记忆】词根记忆：out（超过）+wit（机智）→以机智取胜→智胜

sentences.english: a wolf that had outwitted hunters for years
sentences.chinese: 一头多年来智胜猎人的狼

detailed_translations.english: to gain an advantage over someone using tricks or clever plans

name: rumble
trans: vi. 发出持续而低沉的声音；n. 低沉的声音

sentences.english: The sky, swollen like a black bladder, rumbled and crackled.
sentences.chinese: 天空胀得像个黑色的气囊，发出隆隆声和劈啪声。

detailed_translations.english: If something rumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise
a series of long low sounds

name: solicit
trans: v. 请求，恳求【搭配】solicit sth. from sb. 向某人恳求某事

sentences.english: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
sentences.chinese: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for money, help, or information

name: psychologist
trans: n. 心理医生，心理学家【搭配】an educational psychologist一位教育心理学家

sentences.english: a clinical psychologist
sentences.chinese: 临床心理学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained in psychology

name: character
trans: n. 性格；特性；人物；（书写或印刷）符号，（汉）字【记忆】联想记忆：char+acter（看作actor，演员）→演员刻画人物性格，惟妙惟肖→性格【搭配】character traits 性格特征character flaws 性格缺陷cartoon characters 卡通人物in character 适合out of character 不适合；不相称

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: undergo
trans: v. 经历，经受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: transformation
trans: n. （彻底的）变化，改观

sentences.english: In recent years, the movie industry has undergone a dramatic transformation .
sentences.chinese: 近些年，电影业经历了巨大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: a complete change in someone or something

name: meaningful
trans: adj. 有目的的；有意义的【记忆】词根记忆：meaning（意义）+ful（有…的） →有意义的

sentences.english: Sam and Barbara exchanged meaningful glances.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆和芭芭拉交换了会意的眼神。

detailed_translations.english: a look that clearly expresses the way someone feels, even though nothing is said

name: trait
trans: n. 特性【同义】attribute n. 特性

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: personality
trans: n. 人格，个性；名人【搭配】multiple personality 多重人格

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

name: adorable
trans: adj. 可爱的【同根】adore vt. 喜爱

name: ambitious
trans: adj. 雄心壮志的【同根】ambition n. 雄心

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: aspiring
trans: adj. 有志气的，有抱负的【搭配】aspire v. 有志于

sentences.english: aspiring young writers
sentences.chinese: 胸怀壮志的年轻作家

sentences.english: the aspiring middle classes
sentences.chinese: 有抱负的中产阶级

detailed_translations.chinese: 有抱负的， 有理想的
detailed_translations.english: hoping to be successful in a particular job, activity, or way of life

name: bravery
trans: n. 勇敢；勇气【同根】brave adj. 勇敢的

sentences.english: an act of great bravery
sentences.chinese: 非常勇敢的行为

detailed_translations.english: actions, behaviour, or an attitude that shows courage and confidence

name: brilliant
trans: adj. 有才气的【搭配】brilliant mind 聪明头脑

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: courageous
trans: adj. 勇敢的，有胆量的【同根】courage n. 勇气

sentences.english: He was wrong, and courageous enough to admit it.
sentences.chinese: 他是错了，而且有勇气承认自己错了。

sentences.english: a courageous decision
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的决定

detailed_translations.english: brave

name: daring
trans: adj. 大胆的

sentences.english: a daring rescue attempt
sentences.chinese: 大胆的营救行动

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things
courage that makes you willing to take risks

name: fearless
trans: adj. 勇敢的，无畏的

sentences.english: These dogs are absolutely fearless.
sentences.chinese: 这些狗什么都不怕。

sentences.english: a fearless explorer
sentences.chinese: 一个无畏的探险者

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of anything

name: forgiving
trans: adj. 宽大的，宽容的【搭配】forgiving heart 宽容的心

name: genial
trans: adj. 亲切的，和蔼的【同义】amiable adj. 和蔼可亲的

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

name: humorous
trans: adj. 幽默的【同根】humor n. 幽默

sentences.english: humorous stories
sentences.chinese: 诙谐的故事

sentences.english: The film has some mildly humorous moments.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影中有些略显幽默的片段。

detailed_translations.english: funny and enjoyable

name: independent
trans: adj. 独立的【搭配】independent thinking独立思考

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: ingenuous
trans: adj. 纯朴的，单纯的【同义】naive adj. 天真的

sentences.english: He seemed too ingenuous for a reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他好像太天真诚实，不适合做记者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 天真的；坦白的；正直的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: an ingenuous person is simple, trusting, and honest, especially because they have not had much experience of life

name: intrepid
trans: adj. 勇敢的，无畏的【同根】intrepidity n. 无畏

sentences.english: intrepid explorers
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的探险家

detailed_translations.english: willing to do dangerous things or go to dangerous places – often used humorously

name: perfect
trans: adj. 完美的【同根】perfection n. 完美

sentences.english: His English was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: quick wit
trans: 机敏，急智

name: romantic
trans: adj. 浪漫的【同根】romanticism n. 浪漫主义

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

name: spunky
trans: adj. 活力四射的

name: arbitrary
trans: adj. 专断的，武断的

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: arrogant
trans: adj. 傲慢的，自大的【同义】haughty adj. 傲慢的

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

name: bad-tempered
trans: adj. 坏脾气的

sentences.english: When his headaches developed, Nick became bad-tempered and even violent.
sentences.chinese: 尼克的头疼起来时，他变得焦躁易怒，甚至暴躁。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is bad-tempered becomes easily annoyed and talks in an angry way to people

name: barbaric
trans: adj. 野蛮的【同义】savage adj. 野蛮的

sentences.english: The way the whales are killed is nothing short of barbaric.
sentences.chinese: 对鲸的捕杀方式简直就是野蛮。

detailed_translations.english: very cruel and violent

name: bossy
trans: adj. 专横的；爱指挥他人的

sentences.english: her loud bossy sister
sentences.chinese: 她那个爱管人的大嗓门姐姐

detailed_translations.chinese: 专横的；浮雕装饰的；爱指挥他人的
detailed_translations.english: always telling other people what to do, in a way that is annoying

name: conceited
trans: adj. 自负的【同根】conceit n. 自负

sentences.english: You’re the most conceited, selfish person I’ve ever known.
sentences.chinese: 你是我认识的人当中最自负、最自私的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is conceited thinks they are very clever, skilful, beautiful etc – used to show disapproval

name: dishonest
trans: adj. 不诚实的【反义】honest adj. 诚实的

sentences.english: dishonest traders
sentences.chinese: 奸商

sentences.english: People on welfare are wrongly seen as lazy or dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 靠福利救济的人被误以为懒惰或不老实。

detailed_translations.english: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people

name: foxy
trans: adj. 狡猾的【同义】crafty adj. 狡诈的

name: hasty
trans: adj. 草率的【同根】haste n. 草率hasten v. 使加快

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: hypocritical
trans: adj. 虚伪的【同根】hypocrisy n. 虚伪

sentences.english: It would be hypocritical to say I travel at 70 mph simply because that is the law.
sentences.chinese: 如果仅仅因为法律规定的时速是70英里我就说自己的行驶时速是70英里，那就太虚伪了。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is different from what you claim to believe – used to show disapproval

name: impatient
trans: adj. 不耐烦的，急躁的【搭配】be impatient with 对…感到不耐烦

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: irresponsible
trans: adj. 不负责任的【反义】responsible adj. 负责的

sentences.english: It was highly irresponsible of him to leave the children on their own in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 他把孩子们独自留在游泳池里，真是太不负责任了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不对更高一级负责的；不承担责任的；无责任感的；无负责能力的
detailed_translations.english: doing careless things without thinking or worrying about the possible bad results

detailed_translations.chinese: 不负责任的人， 无责任感的人

name: irritable
trans: adj. 急躁的，易怒的【同根】irritation n. 刺激

sentences.english: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: getting annoyed quickly or easily

name: passive
trans: adj. 消极的【同义】inactive adj. 消极的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: quarrelsome
trans: adj. 爱争吵的

sentences.english: He became quarrelsome after drinking too much.
sentences.chinese: 他喝多了就爱找人吵架。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is quarrelsome quarrels a lot with people

name: rude
trans: adj. 粗鲁的

sentences.english: a rude remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的话

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

detailed_translations.english: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

name: selfish
trans: adj. 自私的【搭配】selfish behavior 自私行为

sentences.english: How can you be so selfish?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能这样自私？

sentences.english: selfish behaviour
sentences.chinese: 自私的行为

detailed_translations.english: caring only about yourself and not about other people – used to show disapproval

name: vulgar
trans: adj. 粗俗的【同根】vulgarity n. 粗俗

sentences.english: vulgar behaviour
sentences.chinese: 粗俗的行为

detailed_translations.english: remarks, jokes etc that are vulgar deal with sex in a very rude and offensive way

name: weird
trans: adj. 怪异的【同义】odd adj. 古怪的

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: hull
trans: n. 船体；（种子的）外壳

sentences.english: The hull had suffered extensive damage to the starboard side.
sentences.chinese: 船体右舷遭到大面积损坏。

detailed_translations.english: the main part of a ship that goes in the water
to take off the outer part of vegetables, rice, grain etc

name: hang
trans: v. 悬挂；绞死；垂下【搭配】hang out with 跟…闲逛

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: lift
trans: vt. 提，举【搭配】lift up拿起

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: frame
trans: n. 框架；vt. 给…镶框

sentences.english: Newman played a central role in framing the new law.
sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

name: clear of sth.
trans: 不碰到某物，没有某物阻碍

name: seabed
trans: n. 海底，海床【记忆】合成词：sea（海）+bed（床）→海床

sentences.english: The wreck was raised from the seabed in June 2000.
sentences.chinese: 沉船于2000年6月从海底打捞上来。

detailed_translations.english: the land at the bottom of the sea

name: suction
trans: n. （对空气或液体）吸，抽吸

sentences.english: My vacuum cleaner has very good suction.
sentences.chinese: 我的真空吸尘器吸力很强。

sentences.english: a suction pump
sentences.chinese: 抽吸泵

detailed_translations.english: the process of removing air or liquid from an enclosed space so that another substance is sucked in, or so that two surfaces stick together

name: surrounding
trans: adj. 周围附近的【搭配】surrounding ground 周围土地【同根】surround v. 包围，环绕surroundings n. 周围的事物，环境

sentences.english: Troops sealed off the surrounding area .
sentences.chinese: 军队封锁了周围地区。

sentences.english: We decided to explore the surrounding countryside .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定去附近的乡间走走看看。

detailed_translations.english: near or around a particular place

name: mud
trans: n. 泥，泥浆【搭配】in the mud在泥里

sentences.english: They daubed mud all over themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他们用泥涂满全身。

sentences.english: I dirty my trousers when I step on the mud.

 v. 进步；进展；前进【同根】progressive adj. 进步的progression n. 前进；连续

sentences.english: Because of this, researchers have experimented with other techniques, such as this one, to turn adult cells into beta-islet cells.

name: archaeological
trans: adj. 考古学的，考古有关的【搭配】archaeological site 考古遗址

sentences.english: Just who made the tools is unclear from the archaeological evidence alone, though our relative Homo erectus is identified as the likely creator of at least the Acheulian tools.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经确定我们的近亲直立人至少是阿舍利工具可能的创造者，但仅凭考古学证据还无法确定是谁制造了这些工具。

sentences.english: So there are two other models, then, models different from the immigration model, two other models for understanding the formation of Israel, that build on this archaeological evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么还有两个其他的模型，与移民模型不同的两个模型，这两个模型也是为了说明以色列的形成，它们是依据考古学证据。

sentences.english: The work fills (in) a gap which has hitherto existed in our archaeological literature.
sentences.chinese: 这部著作填补了我国考古学文献中的一个空白。

name: archaeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

sentences.english: In fact, she was an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

trans: n. 考古学

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Paleolithic man could only make the most basic stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 旧石器时代的人类只能制造最简单的石器。

sentences.english: A group of caverns of northern Spain west-southwest of Santander. The caves contain magnificent specimens of Paleolithic art discovered in 1879.
sentences.chinese: 奥尔塔米拉岩窟：西班牙北部的一组岩窟，位于桑坦德西南偏西，洞穴里有1879年发现的旧石器时期艺术的宏伟的标本。

sentences.english: Hilazon Tachtit was occupied by the Natufians, hunter-gatherers who began to build permanent dwellings during the transition between the prefarming Paleolithic and the agricultural Neolithic periods.
sentences.chinese: 希拉松塔奇提特洞穴一直被纳图夫人所占据，并且在旧石器时代到新石器时代的过度阶段开始在那里建造永久性的住房。

sentences.english: Rinse off any soap residue.

sentences.english: Her husband was later treated for a fractured skull.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫后来因颅骨碎裂而接受治疗。

detailed_translations.english: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

name: trace
trans: v. 查出；追溯；n. 痕迹【记忆】联想记忆：追溯（trace）车轮的痕迹（track）

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

name: unearth

sentences.english: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
sentences.chinese: 农民们有时仍然能在这里挖到人骨。

sentences.english: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
sentences.chinese: 在一家商店，我发现了一套非常好玩的 20 世纪 20 年代的玩具。

sentences.english: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation great – hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表了曾经使这个国家伟大的仅存的品质–勤奋。

trans: n. 人口【记忆】词根记忆：popul（人）+ation（表名词）→人口【搭配】population control 人口控制

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

sentences.english: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly and in a very short time

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: more or less
trans: 或多或少；大约

name: the arrival of…
trans: …的到来

name: deadly
trans: adj. 致命的；极度的；adv. 非常【同义】deathful adj. 致命的fatal adj. 致命的

sentences.english: a deadly poison
sentences.chinese: 致命的毒药

sentences.english: a deadly weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命武器

sentences.english: His face had a deadly paleness.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸死一般的苍白。

name: islander

sentences.chinese: 岛民们忍受了几个世纪的剥削。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives on an island

name: immunity
trans: n. 免疫力；免除，豁免权【同根】immune adj. 免疫的；不受影响的immunology n. 免疫学

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: assassination
trans: n. 刺杀，暗杀【搭配】assassination plot 暗杀阴谋

sentences.english: He narrowly escaped an assassination attempt (=  when someone tries but fails to kill someone else  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他在一次暗杀行动中死里逃生。

detailed_translations.english: the act of murdering an important person

trans: v. 窒息

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly

trans: adj. 死亡的；不再存在的【记忆】词根记忆：de（否定）+funct（活动）→不活动→死亡的

sentences.english: the now-defunct nuclear reactor
sentences.chinese: 现已废弃的核反应堆

detailed_translations.english: not existing any more, or not useful any more

name: demise
trans: n. 消亡；死亡

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

trans: v. （期限）终止；呼气；断气【同根】expiry n. 满期；终结

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

trans: v. 焚化，毁弃【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+ciner（灰）+ate →使成灰→焚化

detailed_translations.english: to burn something completely in order to destroy it

sentences.chinese: 扩散性膀胱癌

detailed_translations.english: an invasive disease spreads quickly and is difficult to stop

name: lethal
trans: adj. 致命的，破坏性的，毁灭性的；有害的【记忆】词根记忆：leth（遗忘）+al→致命的伤害就是被彻底遗忘→致命的

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: mischievous
trans: adj. 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的【同义】naughty adj. 调皮的harmful adj. 有害的

sentences.english: Their sons are noisy and mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的几个儿子又吵又淘气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them

name: mortal
trans: adj. 致死的；凡人的；n. 凡人【同根】mortality n. 死亡率immortal adj. 不朽的；不死的；n. 不朽的人物immortality n. 不朽；永存

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: noxious
trans: adj. 有害的，有毒的【搭配】noxious fumes 有毒的烟雾

sentences.english: noxious fumes
sentences.chinese: 有毒烟雾

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的

trans: adj. 有毒的【搭配】poisonous atmosphere 有毒的大气

sentences.english: Some mushrooms are extremely poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 一些蘑菇有剧毒。

sentences.english: She was bitten on the ankle by a poisonous snake .
sentences.chinese: 她被毒蛇咬了脚踝。

trans: v. 厚厚地覆盖；（使）窒息；把（火）闷熄【记忆】联想记忆：s（看作she）+mother（母亲）→她快被母亲的溺爱窒息了→窒息

sentences.english: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住
detailed_translations.english: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

detailed_translations.chinese: 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

trans: n. 毒素，毒质【同义】poison n. 毒物

sentences.english: Tests showed increased levels of toxin in shellfish.
sentences.chinese: 测试表明贝类中的毒素级别上升了。

detailed_translations.english: a poisonous substance, especially one that is produced by  bacteria  and causes a particular disease

trans: n. 毒液

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: venomous
trans: adj. 分泌毒液的；狠毒的【搭配】venomous snake 毒蛇

sentences.english: Lisa shot him a venomous glance.
sentences.chinese: 莉萨恶狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.chinese: 里德攻击铁路当局还有最厉害的一招没使出来。

trans: v. 断言，声称；坚持【同根】assertive adj. 言语果断的assertiveness n. 坚定而自信assertion n. 坚决断言

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

trans: v. 认为，想

sentences.english: You shouldn’t believe everything you read.

sentences.english: I believed him, even though his story sounded unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 我相信了他，尽管他的话听上去难以置信。

sentences.english: I don’t believe a word of it (=  I think it is completely untrue  ) .

sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

trans: vt. 断言，宣称【搭配】declare oneself 显露身份；发表意见declare for 赞成declare bankruptcy 宣告破产

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

trans: v. 假设；假定【同根】presumably adv. 推测起来，大概presumable adj. 可能的，可假定的

sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定

name: protest
trans:
n. （公开的）抗议活动；/prəˈtest/
 v. 抗议；断言【搭配】storm of protest 抗议风暴firestorm of protest 抗议大爆发

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

trans: v. 猜想；假定，以为【搭配】be supposed to do sth. 应该做某事

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal

sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

trans: adj. 知道的；意识到的【搭配】be aware of 意识到…【同根】unaware adj. 不知道的，没意识到的

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .

name: pollutant

sentences.chinese: 有毒污染物堆放场

name: polluter

name: pollution
