sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: renewal
trans: n. 更新；重新开始；重建；复兴；续借

sentences.english: Mark’s contract comes up for renewal at the end of this year.
sentences.chinese: 马克的合同将在今年年末到期，需要续签。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更新，恢复；复兴；补充；革新；续借；重申
detailed_translations.english: when an activity, situation, or process begins again after a period when it had stopped

name: resume
trans: vt. （中断后）重新开始；恢复【记忆】词根记忆：re（重新）+sum（拿起）+e →重新拿起→重新开始

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: threshold
trans: n. 入门；极限；开端；门槛【同义】doorway n. 门口outset n. 开端，开始

sentences.english: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
sentences.chinese: 她打开门，跨过门槛。

sentences.english: The creature is on the threshold of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这种生物已濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance

name: general
trans: adj. 一般的，普通的；大体的，概括的【记忆】词根记忆：gener（产生）+al（…的）→产生一切的→普遍的【搭配】in general 通常，大体上general science 大众科学【同根】generalization n. 归纳，概括

sentences.english: There has been a general decline in standards.
sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.english: ways to improve your general health
sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.english: There is one exception to this general principle.
sentences.chinese: 这个一般性原则有一例外

sentences.english: a four-star general
sentences.chinese: 四星上将

detailed_translations.english: affecting all or most people, places or things
an officer of very high rank in the army or air force

name: sense
trans: n. 意义；含义；理解…的方式；看待…的角度

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: prescriptivism
trans: n. 规定主义

name: view
trans: n. 看法，意见，见解；态度

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: variety
trans: n. 种类；变化，多样化【记忆】词根记忆：vari（变化）+ety（表性质）→变化【搭配】a variety of 许多

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

name: language
trans: n. 语言

sentences.english: How many languages do you speak?
sentences.chinese: 你能说几种语言？

sentences.english: one of the best-known poems in the English language
sentences.chinese: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

detailed_translations.english: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area

name: inherently
trans: adv. 天性地，固有地【记忆】词根记忆：in（向内）+her（粘附）+ent+ ly（…地）→骨子里带来地→固有地

name: ought to
trans: 应当，应该

sentences.english: You really ought to quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 你真的应该把烟戒了。

sentences.english: The company ought to be making changes in its marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 公司应该在营销策略上作出改变了。

sentences.english: What sort of crimes ought the police to concentrate on?
sentences.chinese: 警方应当集中打击哪一类罪案？

sentences.english: You were out enjoying yourself when you ought to have been studying.
sentences.chinese: 应该学习的时候你却在外面玩。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone should do something because it is the best or most sensible thing to do

name: impose
trans: vi. 把…强加于；征（税等），处以（罚款、监禁等）【记忆】词根记忆：im（使…）+pos（放）+e→强行放置→把…强加于

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: adaptable
trans: adj. 能适应的；可修改的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: adaption
trans: n. 适应，改编

name: advisable
trans: adj. 可取的，适当的；明智的【记忆】词根记忆：advis(e)（建议，劝告）+ able（能…的）→能够听取别人的劝告是明智的→明智的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

name: becoming
trans: adj. 合适的；与…相称的

name: coincide
trans: vi. 同时发生；一致【记忆】词根记忆：co（共同）+in+cid（落下）+ e→突然降临→一致【同义】concur vi. 同时发生agree vi. 与…一致

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: conformity
trans: n. 符合，一致

sentences.english: We must act in conformity with local regulations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须按当地的法规行事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that obeys rules, customs etc

name: fit
trans: v. 符合【搭配】fit with... 符合…

sentences.english: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.
sentences.chinese: 这些腰带、和服和其他衣服都做得适合孩子穿。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it

name: fitting
trans: adj. 适合的

sentences.english: I thought the memorial was a fitting tribute to the President.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这座纪念碑恰如其分地表达了对总统的敬意。

sentences.english: new light fittings
sentences.chinese: 新款灯具配件

detailed_translations.english: right for a particular situation or occasion
an outside part of a piece of equipment that makes it possible to use or handle it

name: pertinent
trans: adj. 有关的；恰当的；相宜的【记忆】词根记忆：per（自始至终）+tin（拿住）+ ent（…的）→始终抓住→有关的

sentences.english: He asked me a lot of very pertinent questions .
sentences.chinese: 他问了我许多直接相关的问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相关的，相干的；中肯的；切题的
detailed_translations.english: directly relating to something that is being considered

name: plausible
trans: adj. 似有道理的，似乎正确的【记忆】词根记忆：plaus（鼓掌）+ible（可…的） →可给予鼓掌的→似有道理的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: properly
trans: adv. 适当地，恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: suit
trans: v. 适合；适宜

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: suitable
trans: adj. 适当的，相配的

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

name: abridge
trans: vt. 缩短，删节【记忆】词根记忆：a（加强）+bridg（短，缩短）+ e →缩短

sentences.english: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.chinese: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.english: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

name: clause
trans: n. 子句；条款

sentences.english: A confidentiality clause was added to the contract.
sentences.chinese: 合同中加上了一项保密条款。

detailed_translations.english: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

name: concise
trans: adj. 简明的，简练的，简洁的【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+cis（切）+e→切掉（多余的）→简洁的

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

name: genre
trans: n. 类型

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

name: glossary
trans: n. 词汇表，术语表【记忆】词根记忆：gloss（词语，语言）+ary（场所）→放（难词）的地方→词汇表

sentences.english: A glossary of terms is included for the reader's convenience.
sentences.chinese: 为了方便读者，还收录了术语汇编。

detailed_translations.english: a list of special words and explanations of their meanings, often at the end of a book

name: grammar
trans: n. 语法

sentences.english: Check your spelling and grammar.
sentences.chinese: 检查你的拼写和语法。

sentences.english: the rules of English grammar
sentences.chinese: 英语的语法规则

sentences.english: A dictionary lists the words, a grammar states the rules.
sentences.chinese: 词典收列单词，语法书讲解语法规则。

detailed_translations.english: the rules by which words change their forms and are combined into sentences, or the study or use of these rules

name: implicit
trans: adj. 含蓄的；不直接言明的【记忆】词根记忆：im（加以）+plic（重叠，折叠） +it→重叠表达→含蓄的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: lexical
trans: adj. 词汇的

sentences.english: We chose a few of the commonest lexical items in the languages.
sentences.chinese: 我们选取了各语言中最常见的几个词汇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词汇的；[语] 词典的；词典编纂的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with words, or related to words

name: lingual
trans: adj. 语言的

sentences.english: Her dentist advised that the problem might be coming from her thicker-than-average lingual frenulum.
sentences.chinese: 她的牙医说口语水平上不去的原因可能是她的舌系带比一般人的要厚。

detailed_translations.english: of or relating to the tongue or a part or structure resembling a tongue

name: parlance
trans: n. 说法；术语；用语【记忆】词根记忆：parl（说）+ance（表状态）→术语

name: phonemics
trans: n. 音位学

name: sentence
trans: n. 句子

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

name: sound
trans: n. 音

sentences.english: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
sentences.chinese: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解

sentences.english: a sound knowledge of English
sentences.chinese: 扎实的英语知识

sentences.english: He has sound grasp of European history.
sentences.chinese: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

detailed_translations.english: complete and thorough

name: syllable
trans: n. 音节

sentences.english: The accent falls on the third syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音落在第三个音节上。

sentences.english: The stress falls on the second syllable.
sentences.chinese: 重音在第二个音节上。

sentences.english: Accentuate the word “accent”on the first syllable.
sentences.chinese: 在“accent”一词的第一个音节上加重音符号。

detailed_translations.english: a word or part of a word which contains a single vowel sound

name: symbol
trans: n. 符号；代号；记号；象征【同根】symbolic adj. 象征的；符号的

sentences.english: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

sentences.english: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
sentences.chinese: Fe是铁的化学符号。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea

name: tense
trans: n. 时态

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: decide
trans: vt. 决定；裁决vi. 决定；判决【搭配】decide on/upon 决定，选定

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

name: species
trans: n. 种类，类群【记忆】联想记忆：科学家从一些生物种类（species）中选取好的制成标本（specimen）

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: indication
trans: n. 表明；指示【记忆】词根记忆：in（加以…）+dic（说）+ation（行为）→说出→指示

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: rural
trans: adj. 农村的，乡村的【记忆】词根记忆：rur（乡村）+al（…的）→农村的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: urban
trans: adj. 都市的；住在都市的【记忆】发音记忆：“饿奔”→初到大都市闯荡，饿得狂奔→都市的【搭配】urban areas 城市地区urban residents 城市居民【同根】urbanization n. 都市化

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: setting
trans: n. 环境；背景；安置【记忆】来自set（v. 布置）

sentences.english: I’ve worked with children in various settings, mainly in secondary school.
sentences.chinese: 我在许多地方教过孩子，主要是在中学。

sentences.english: The heating system was already on its highest setting.
sentences.chinese: 取暖系统已经调到了最高挡。

detailed_translations.english: the place where something is or where something happens, and the general environment

name: demonstration
trans: n. 论证，证明；示范；显示；示威游行【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+monstr（显示）+ ation→显示；示威游行

sentences.english: Supporters staged a demonstration outside the US embassy.
sentences.chinese: 支持者在美国大使馆外举行了示威游行。

sentences.english: Police opened fire on a peaceful demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝和平示威的人群开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public

name: denote
trans: v. 表示，指示【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+not（标记）+ e→做标记→指示【同义】signify vt. 表示，意味

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: disclose
trans: vt. 揭露；透露；公开【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+close（关闭）→不关闭→透露【反义】conceal v. 隐藏，隐瞒hide v. 隐藏，掩藏

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: exhibit
trans: vt. 陈列，展览；显示【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+hibit（拿）→拿出来→显示；展览【同根】exhibition n. 展览

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: expose
trans: vt. 使暴露，揭露【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+pos（放）+e→放出来→使暴露【搭配】expose oneself 暴露expose to... 使易受…

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露，曝光【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+pos（放）+ure（行为） →放出来→暴露

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: manifest
trans: adj. 明显的；v. 表明，证明；n. 旅客名单；载货清单【记忆】词根记忆：mani（手）+fest（仇恨）→用手打人，仇恨很明显→明显的

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: point
trans: n. 尖；小数点；目的；得分；要点，观点；v. 指向；表明；瞄准【搭配】come to the point 说到要点，扼要地说on the point of... 即将…的时候point out 指出

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: presentation
trans: n. 赠送；礼物；授予；提供；显示；介绍，报告；上演【记忆】词根记忆：present（展示）+ation（行为）→介绍【搭配】make/give a presentation 做报告on presentation of sth. 展示某物

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: proclaim
trans: v. 宣告，声明；显示；赞美【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+claim（呼喊）→在前面大叫→宣告，声明【同义】declare vt. 正式宣布；宣称announce vt. 宣布

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: proclamation
trans: n. 公告，布告，声明【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+claim（呼喊）+ ation（行为）→在前面大叫→声明

sentences.english: The authorities issued a proclamation forbidding public meetings.
sentences.chinese: 当局发布了公告，禁止公开集会。

detailed_translations.english: an official public statement about something that is important, or when someone makes such a statement

name: revelation
trans: n. 被揭示的真相；出乎意料的好事；揭露，披露【同义】disclosure n. 揭发，败露【反义】concealment n. 隐藏

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: uncover
trans: vt. 揭开，揭露【记忆】词根记忆：un（打开）+cover（盖子）→揭开

sentences.english: When the seedlings sprout, uncover the tray.
sentences.chinese: 幼苗发芽后，揭开盘上的遮盖物。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something

name: unveil
trans: v. 揭去面纱或覆盖物；揭幕；首次公开、揭露或展示（某事物）【记忆】词根记忆：un（解开）+veil（面纱）→揭去面纱

sentences.english: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

name: backward
trans: adj. 落后的；进步缓慢的【记忆】词根记忆：back（后）+ward（向…）→落后的

sentences.english: She went without a backward glance.
sentences.chinese: 她头也不回地走了。

sentences.english: He works backward, building a house from the top downward.
sentences.chinese: 他倒着干活，从上往下盖房子。

detailed_translations.english: looking or facing in the direction that is behind you
If you do something backward, you do it in the opposite way to the usual way

name: cheap living expenses
trans: 低生活成本

name: economic gap
trans: 经济差距

name: extension
trans: n. 伸出；延长部分【搭配】one month extension 延期一个月the extension of vocabulary 词汇的扩展extension to... …的延伸部分

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: hamlet
trans: n. 小村

detailed_translations.english: a very small village

name: idyllic
trans: adj. 田园的【搭配】idyllic poem 田园诗

sentences.english: This idyllic pastoral scene is only part of the picture.
sentences.chinese: 但这种田园诗般的乡村风光仅仅是一个侧面。

sentences.english: Some believe that lemurians were much more like early humans living in a sort of idyllic paradise largely agrarian with lush forests and an abundance of flowers and fruit trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些就相信利莫里亚更加像早期的人类，生活在一种田园诗般的天堂里，主要地与繁荣的森林，盛开的花朵和结果的树在一起。

sentences.english: I don't mind a bit of idiosyncrasy, but that strange ideology you believe in , coupled with your idyllic ideas on life, suggest to me that all you're doing is looking for some idol to follow.
sentences.chinese: 你有一点特殊的癖性我不在乎，但你相信的那种奇怪的意识形态，加上你向往田园诗般生活的想法，给我的印象是你在做的就是要找到一个偶像来效仿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 田园诗般的， 田园风光的， 牧歌的

name: imbalance
trans: n. 不平衡【记忆】词根记忆：im（不）+balance（平衡）→不平衡

sentences.english: a hormonal imbalance
sentences.chinese: 内分泌失调

detailed_translations.english: a lack of a fair or correct balance between two things, which results in problems or unfairness

name: in the long run
trans: 从长远角度而言

sentences.english: But these methods would not be enough in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 但是，从长远来看，光有这些方法还是远远不够。

sentences.english: It has been rather costly to install the machinery, but it should pay off in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 安装这套机械代价很高，但从长远来看它会赚钱的。

sentences.english: They might be annoying or frustrating at times, but in the long run, the lessons learned from them can help you become better at what you do.
sentences.chinese: 有时候这些问题可能会让您烦心或感到挫败，但就长远来看，从中得到的经验教训可帮助您更好地进行自己的工作。

trans: n. 基础结构，基础设施【记忆】词根记忆：infra（下）+structure（结构）→下面的结构→基础结构

sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: locality
trans: n. 位置；地区【记忆】来自local（adj. 地方的）

sentences.chinese: 来自几个不同地区的天气报告

detailed_translations.english: a small area of a country, city etc

name: low crime rate
trans: 低犯罪率

name: monotonous
trans: adj. 单调的，无聊的；无变化的【记忆】词根记忆：mono（单个）+ton（声音）+ ous（…的）→一个声音的→单调的【搭配】a monotonous diet 乏味的食物

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

trans: 处于…边缘

trans: n. 郊区【记忆】词根记忆：out（出）+skirts（位于…的边缘）→城市周边→郊区

sentences.english: The rubble was then dumped in a municipal landfill site on the outskirts of Florence.
sentences.chinese: 这堆碎石后来被倾倒在佛罗伦萨市郊的一处垃圾填埋场。

sentences.english: On the outskirts of every city I saw, there was a veritable forest of apartment blocks under construction.
sentences.chinese: 在我造访的每个城市的郊区，一栋栋在建公寓楼确实是鳞次栉比。

sentences.english: After abandoning his devastated home on the outskirts of Damascus, Mustafa, his wife, children and aging parents spent months seeking safety in one town after another.
sentences.chinese: 在抛弃大马士革郊区破坏殆尽的家后，穆斯塔法和他的妻子，孩子几年迈的父母花了几个月的时间在一个又一个小镇躲避战祸。

name: pastoral
trans: adj. 田园的

sentences.english: his pastoral work among the congregation
sentences.chinese: 他在教堂会众中的牧灵工作

detailed_translations.chinese: 牧师的；牧人的；田园生活的；乡村的

name: quietness
trans: n. 安静

trans: n. 郊区

sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

trans: adj. 冗长乏味的，单调的【搭配】a tedious story 乏味冗长的故事

sentences.english: The audience coughed down the tedious speaker.
sentences.chinese: 听众用咳嗽声阻挠演讲人的沉闷发言。

sentences.english: There's no point in labouring at a tedious task.

sentences.chinese: 我们都喜欢乡村生活的宁静。

sentences.english: For this brings not only the tranquility which comes from doing well, but also that which comes from doing few things.
sentences.chinese: 因为这不仅带来由于做事适当而产生的宁静，而且带来由于做很少的事而产生的宁静。

sentences.english: And while I love my family to death, this time of tranquility is one of absolute bliss for me.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我对我的家庭爱得要死，但这片刻的宁静绝对是我的幸福之一。

trans: adj. 消息闭塞的【记忆】词根记忆：un（不）+informed（消息灵通的）→消息闭塞的

sentences.english: Parents were left anxious, uninformed, and isolated.
sentences.chinese: 家长们忧心忡忡，不知道情况到底如何，感到孤立无援。

sentences.english: uninformed criticism from uninformed journalists
sentences.chinese: 来自不了解情况的新闻记者的毫无根据的批评

detailed_translations.english: not having enough knowledge or information

name: booming

detailed_translations.chinese: 发展迅速的； 激增的

name: centralisation
trans: n. 集中化【记忆】词根记忆：central（中心的）+isation（…化）→集中化

trans: 市中心

trans: 城市规划者

name: commercialisation
trans: n. 商业化【记忆】词根记忆：commercial（商业的）+isation （…化）→商业化

trans: n. 大都市【记忆】词根记忆：metro（母亲）+polis（城市）→母亲城→大都市

sentences.chinese: 这座城市已变成繁忙的大都市。

detailed_translations.english: a very large city that is the most important city in a country or area

name: municipal
trans: adj. 市的，市政的；地区的；内政的【记忆】词根记忆：muni（公共的）+cip（头）+ al（…的）→公众之头→市政的【同根】municipality n. 市政当局

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

trans: 居民区，住宅区

name: residential quarter
trans: 居住区

name: shopping centre
trans: 商业区

name: slum
trans: n. 贫民窟，贫民区

sentences.chinese: 贫民窟一定是在你内心.

sentences.english: But, she added, even after she had a classroom, she had no idea what might come of her effort to teach kids from the slum.
sentences.chinese: 但她补充说，即使她有了教室后，她并不知道她对贫民窟的孩子施教会得出什么样的结果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫民窟；陋巷；脏乱的地方
detailed_translations.english: a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live

name: traffic congestion

name: urban construction
trans: 城市建设

name: urban sprawl
trans: 城市扩张

name: result
trans: n. 结果，效果【搭配】research result 研究结果

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；郑重地说；广播通知【记忆】词根记忆：an（加强）+nounc（说）+ e→反复说→郑重地说【同根】announcement n. 宣告；发表announcer n. 播报员

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: reveal

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

name: disease

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: associate
trans:
v. 把…联系在一起；使有联系；/əˈsəʊʃiət/
 n. 伙伴；同事；adj. 副的【记忆】词根记忆：as（加强）+soci（社会）+ ate（使…）→成为一个社会→把…联系在一起【搭配】associate with 和…相关，联合business associate商业伙伴associate professor 副教授【同义】combine vt. 使结合join vi. 加入，结合

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: afflict
trans: vt. 使苦恼；折磨【记忆】词根记忆：af（加强）+flict（打击）→一再打击→使苦恼；折磨【搭配】be afflicted with/by... 被…折磨【同义】torment vt. 折磨torture vt. 拷问，折磨

detailed_translations.english: to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

name: adequate for
trans: 胜任…的

name: assessment
trans: n. 评定，估价【搭配】assessment of 评估…

sentences.english: a reading assessment test
sentences.chinese: 阅读评估测试

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you make a judgment about a person or situation, or the judgment you make

name: bear through
trans: 完成，做完

name: concentrate on
trans: 集中精力于

sentences.english: Filter out the noise and nonsense. Only concentrate on what you deeply desire.
sentences.chinese: 过滤掉噪音和胡言乱语，只全神贯注于你内心深处的向往。

name: describe as
trans: 描述为

name: effort
trans: n. 努力【搭配】make an effort 努力

sentences.english: Lou lifted the box easily, without using much effort.
sentences.chinese: 卢没费多大力气就把箱子搬了起来。

sentences.english: Frank put a lot of effort into the party.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克办这次聚会花了不少精力。

sentences.english: Learning to speak another language takes effort.
sentences.chinese: 学说外语要下功夫。

sentences.english: I'm afraid this essay is a poor effort.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，这篇文章写得不好。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental energy that you need to do sth; sth that takes a lot of energy

name: environmental aspect
trans: 环境因素

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈【搭配】feedback on... 的反馈

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: financial strain
trans: 资金紧张

name: fulfill duty
trans: 完成任务

name: go to great lengths to
trans: 尽最大的努力，竭尽全力

name: goal-oriented
trans: adj. 目标导向的

name: goal-setting
trans: n. 目标确立

name: high-efficiency
trans: n. 高效

name: in-depth interview
trans: 深度访谈

name: merit
trans: v. （正式）应获得；值得；n. 优点；价值；功绩【搭配】merit pay 绩效工资merit rating 绩效评定

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: outward
trans: adj./adv. 公开的（地）；向外的（地）

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

name: profitability analysis
trans: 可能性分析

name: questionnaire
trans: n. 问卷，调查表【搭配】questionnaire survey 问卷调查

sentences.english: Teachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.
sentences.chinese: 教师们将被要求填写一份调查问卷。

detailed_translations.english: a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information

name: risk analysis
trans: 风险分析

name: sampling survey
trans: 抽样调查

name: statistic analysis
trans: 统计分析

name: SWOT analysis
trans: SWOT分析（分析企业自身的竞争优势、竞争劣势、机会和威胁）

name: target
trans: n. 目标【搭配】sales target 销售目标

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time
to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

name: task-oriented
trans: adj. 以任务为导向的

name: under investigation
trans: 在调查中

name: ache
trans: n. 疼痛

sentences.english: His feet were aching from standing so long.
sentences.chinese: 他站了那么久，双脚隐隐作痛。

detailed_translations.english: if part of your body aches, you feel a continuous, but not very sharp pain there
a continuous pain that is not sharp or very strong

name: Alzheimer's
trans: n. 阿兹海默症【搭配】Alzheimer's disease 阿兹海默症

name: amnesia
trans: n. 健忘症【搭配】retrograde amnesia 逆行性遗忘

sentences.english: It is sad that many people have got amnesia when they come out from disasters.
sentences.chinese: 许多人渡过灾难以后都得了健忘症，这是可悲的。

sentences.english: So one explanation is that infant amnesia is simply a result of the natural process of forgetting the things we experience throughout our lives.
sentences.chinese: 因此，就有解释称，婴儿健忘症仅仅是我们一生当中忘记我们所经历过的事情这一自然过程的一个结果。

sentences.english: Postcrash amnesia has robbed him of the vital three or four minutes that preceded the crash in the Pont d'Alma tunnel and its aftermath, when he lay suspended between life and death.
sentences.chinese: 撞车造成的健忘症已抹掉了关于阿尔玛桥隧道里撞车前至关紧要的三四分钟以及事后情况的记忆．那时他正悬命于生死之间。

name: atrophy
trans: n. 萎缩【搭配】muscular atrophy 肌肉萎缩

sentences.english: If you don't exercise your muscles, they weaken and atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果不锻炼你的肌肉，肌力就削弱和萎缩了。

sentences.english: If compassion can only be activated by sustained attention, which is prevented by fast-cut editing, then the ability to be genuinely moved by another’s story could atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 如果只能通过持续的关注激活同情心，而这种关注又受到快速切断编辑的阻碍，那么，被他人的故事真正打动的能力就会萎缩。

sentences.english: The compounds "likely have an effecton motor neurons"—responsible for controlling movements—"but that isa hunch at present, based on the type of atrophy we saw, " Hughes said inan email.
sentences.chinese: 这些化合物“可能对运动神经元（负责控制运动）产生作用”----“根据我们观察到的萎缩症类型，目前这只是个预测，”休斯在一封电子邮件中说。

name: backache
trans: n. 背痛

sentences.english: Many workers go home from their first day on the job with either a bad headache or a backache—undoubtedly the result of nervous tension.
sentences.chinese: 许多员工在第一天上班的时候会带着头痛或背痛回家，这无疑就是紧张情绪造成的结果。

sentences.english: This may cause stomach upset, ulcers, headache, backache, high blood pressure and in severe cases can lead to panic attacks or a panic disorder.
sentences.chinese: 这可能会引起胃部不适，溃疡，头痛，背痛，高血压，甚至在严重的情况下可能导致惊恐发作或惊恐障碍等疾病。

detailed_translations.english: a pain in your back

name: central paralysis
trans: 中枢性瘫痪

name: dehydrate
trans: v. 脱水

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: dementia
trans: n. 痴呆【搭配】vascular dementia 血管性痴呆

name: diagnosable
trans: adj. 可诊断的

name: disturbance
trans: n. 干扰

sentences.english: There were disturbances in the crowd as fans left the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷离开体育场时，人群中发生了骚乱。

sentences.english: When a helicopter lands, it can cause a disturbance to local residents.
sentences.chinese: 直升机降落会惊扰当地居民。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people behave violently in public

name: dreaminess
trans: n. 多梦

name: dry eyes
trans: 双眼干涩

name: emotional instability
trans: 情绪不稳定

name: endocrine
trans: n. 内分泌

sentences.english: Located near the base of the neck, the thyroid is a large endocrine gland that produces hormones that help control growth and metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 甲状腺位于颈部的底部附近，是一个很大的内分泌腺体，它产生激素，协助控制生长和新陈代谢。

sentences.english: Some of the chemicals that are all around us have the ability to interfere with our endocrine systems, which regulate the hormones that control our weight, our biorhythms and our reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 我们周围的某些化学物质会影响人体的内分泌系统——其作用是通过调节激素分泌从而控制体重、生理周期以及生殖能力。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the system in your body that produces hormones

name: enfeeble
trans: v. 使…衰弱

detailed_translations.english: to make weak; deprive of strength

name: epilepsy
trans: n. 癫痫【搭配】focal epilepsy 局部性癫痫

name: fatigue
trans: n. 疲劳【搭配】mental fatigue 心理疲劳chronic fatigue 慢性疲劳

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，人人都有类比疲劳。

detailed_translations.english: very great tiredness

name: get numb
trans: 变麻

name: hemiplegia
trans: n. 偏瘫，半身麻痹

name: insomnia
trans: n. 失眠【搭配】intermittent insomnia 间歇失眠

sentences.english: If you have insomnia, try my simple cure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.english: In my insomnia, you have to hold me to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.english: I know someone with insomnia who only gets two hours of sleep each night.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一个患有失眠症的人，他每天晚上只能睡上两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep

name: language barrier
trans: 语言障碍

name: lose consciousness
trans: 失去知觉

name: memory deterioration
trans: 记忆力下降

name: migraine
trans: n. 偏头痛【记忆】词根记忆：migr（迁移）+aine→移来移去的（头痛）→偏头痛【搭配】migraine headache 偏头痛

sentences.english: Her mother suffered from migraines.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲患了偏头痛。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely bad headache, during which you feel sick and have pain behind your eyes

name: nerve system
trans: 神经系统【搭配】peripheral nervous system 周围神经系统central nervous system 中枢神经系统

name: nervousness
trans: n. 神经过敏，紧张不安

detailed_translations.chinese: 神经质；[心理] 神经过敏；紧张不安

name: neuralgia
trans: n. 神经痛【搭配】sciatic neuralgia 坐骨神经痛

name: neurological
trans: adj. 神经学的【搭配】neurological disorder 神经障碍

sentences.english: ...neurological disorders such as Parkinson's disease.
sentences.chinese: ...诸如帕金森综合症的神经系统混乱症状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神经病学的，神经学上的
detailed_translations.english: Neurological means related to the nervous system

name: paralysis
trans: n. 麻痹【记忆】词根记忆：para（旁边）+lys（裂开，分解）+is（表情况）→旁边分开了→麻痹【搭配】paralysis agitans 震颤性麻痹

sentences.english: paralysis of the lower body
sentences.chinese: 下半身瘫痪

sentences.english: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it

name: paralytic
trans: adj. 瘫痪的；麻痹的【搭配】paralytic squint 麻痹性斜视

sentences.english: ...paralytic disease.
sentences.chinese: ...致瘫疾病。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from paralysis
someone who is  paralysed

name: paralyse
trans: v. 使瘫痪【记忆】词根记忆：para（旁边）+lys（分开）+e →身体（不听大脑支配）像与自己分开了一样→使瘫痪

sentences.english: Her legs were partly paralysed in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 在撞车事故中她的双腿部分瘫痪。

detailed_translations.english: if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it

name: Parkinson's disease
trans: 帕金森病

name: sleep disorder
trans: 睡眠紊乱

name: tinnitus
trans: n. 耳鸣

name: consolidation
trans: n. 合并，巩固【同根】consolidate v. 巩固

sentences.english: Enable users to submit consolidation nodes, even if not all leaf nodes have been opened.
sentences.chinese: 允许用户提交合并结点，即使并非所有的叶子节点都已打开。

sentences.english: This allows the user greater flexibility in planning for server consolidation or expansion by having the option of adding more users or additional applications.
sentences.chinese: 通过增加更多用户或附加的应用程序，允许用户在服务器合并或扩展的规划中具有更大的灵活性。

sentences.english: NAS is a consolidation of storage over a network for access by heterogeneous clients at the file level.
sentences.chinese: NAS 是通过网络的存储合并，以便不同类型客户端在文件级别进行访问。

detailed_translations.english: the act of consolidating or state of being consolidated

name: episodic
trans: adj. 偶然发生的，分散性的【记忆】来自episode（n. 片段）【搭配】episodic memory 情节记忆

sentences.english: These are usually episodic in nature and for the most part are a reflection of the immature central nervous system.
sentences.chinese: 这些通常在本质中表现为插曲式的，大多数情况下是未成熟的中枢神经系统的反射。

sentences.english: Examples of this would be a half-hour sitcom, a one-hour drama, an episodic documentary, a how-to program such as cooking or home repair or a reality show.
sentences.chinese: 包括半小时的情景喜剧，一小时的剧情片，一部插话式的纪录片，一个诸如烹饪或家居修补或真人秀的指引类节目。

name: process
trans: n. 过程；制作法；vt. 加工；办理【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+cess（行走）→向前走的（历程）→过程【搭配】a peaceful process 一个平静的流程in the process of doing 在做某事的过程中【同义】course n. 过程procedure n. 方法

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: encode
trans: v. 编码【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+code（电码，密码）→编码【反义】decode v. 解码

sentences.english: As previously mentioned, the main thing this renderer does is decode input and encode output.
sentences.chinese: 正如前面提到的，渲染器做的主要工作就是解码输入和编码输出。

sentences.english: Decoder - This feature can be used to decode data to get back the original form, or to encode and encrypt data.
sentences.chinese: 这个特性用来解码数据，从而得到数据的原始形式。或者用来编码和加密数据。

sentences.english: Obviously, if you wanted to encode and decode in some other format, I would suggest extending the input and output stream.
sentences.chinese: 如果您希望以其他格式进行编码和解码，我建议您继承输入和输出流，这是很自然的事情。

detailed_translations.english: to put a message or other information into code

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料【搭配】additional information 详情information desk 咨询处

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: strengthen
trans: vt. 加强，巩固【记忆】词根记忆：strength（力量）+en（使…）→（使）有力量→加强

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: stabilise
trans: v. （使）稳定；（使）安定【同根】stabilisation n. 稳定装置stability n. 稳定性

sentences.english: However, after three weeks of cold exposure, body weight began to stabilise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，暴露在寒冷中三周后，体重就开始稳定下来。

sentences.english: But these will not stabilise levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide — only slow the rate of increase.
sentences.chinese: 但是这无法稳定大气中的二氧化碳水平——而只能降低增加的速率。

name: store
trans: v. 储藏；储存

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 使便利，使容易，推动，帮助【记忆】词根记忆：facil（e）（容易做的）+ it+ate（使…）→使容易，使便利

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: retrieval
trans: n. 检索；找回【同根】retrieve v. 重新得到

sentences.english: a new system that should speed up information retrieval
sentences.chinese: 能加速信息检索的新系统

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting back information stored on a computer system

name: arouse
trans: v. 引起；鼓励；激发；醒来【同义】cause v. 引起

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: elicit
trans: v. 抽出；引起【同根】elicitation n. 引出，诱出

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: foment
trans: vt. 助长，煽动【搭配】foment dissension 挑拨离间

sentences.english: They were accused of fomenting rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动叛乱。

detailed_translations.english: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government

name: fortify
trans: vt. 激励；加强【记忆】词根记忆：fort（要塞）+ify（使…）→使成为要塞→加强

sentences.english: Her position was fortified by election successes and economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 她的地位因为选举获胜及经济复苏而得到巩固。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger
to build towers, walls etc around an area or city in order to defend it

name: hasten
trans: v. 加速，加紧【参考】haste n. 匆忙

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: impel
trans: vt. 驱使，推进【同根】compel v. 强迫dispel v. 驱散

sentences.english: ...the courage and competitiveness which impels him to take risks.
sentences.chinese: ...驱策他冒险的勇气和竞争精神。

detailed_translations.english: if something impels you to do something, it makes you feel very strongly that you must do it

name: impetus
trans: n. 促进；推动力【记忆】词根记忆：im（向内）+pet（寻求）+us →内在的追求→推动力

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: incite
trans: vt. 煽动，鼓动，激起【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+cit（唤起，激起）+ e →唤起情绪→激起【搭配】incite sb. to do sth. 鼓动某人做某事

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

name: instigate
trans: vt. 煽动，鼓动【搭配】instigate sb. to do sth. 教唆某人做某事

sentences.english: Abettors, who instigate others to commit crimes, are not only the instigators but also the disseminator of criminal intent.
sentences.chinese: 教唆犯作为教唆他人犯罪的人，不仅是犯意的挑起者，也是犯意的传播者。

sentences.english: This paper can be divided into four parts. The first part briefly outlines the previous achievements on"instigate the lawsuits".
sentences.chinese: 本文分为四部分，第一部分对有关“教唆词讼”的先行研究作了一个简要的概述。

name: intensify
trans: v. （使）增强，（使）加剧【同义】rise v. 增强

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

trans: v. 点燃；激起

sentences.english: We watched as the fire slowly kindled.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着火慢慢地燃烧起来。

detailed_translations.english: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

name: promote
trans: v. 促进；提升；宣传【同根】promotion n. 提升；促进；宣传

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: prompt
trans: v. 激励；引起【同根】promptly adv. 迅速地；立即地

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: propel
trans: vt. 推进，推动；激励【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+pel（推）→推进

sentences.english: a boat propelled by a small motor
sentences.chinese: 由小马达驱动的小船

sentences.english: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

detailed_translations.english: to move, drive, or push something forward

name: stimulate
trans: v. 刺激；激励【同根】stimulus n. 刺激物

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: urge
trans: vt. 鼓励；竭力主张；推进

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: balance
trans: n./vt. 平衡【记忆】联想记忆：bal（看作ball，球）+ance→球操选手需要很好的平衡能力→平衡

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: erratic
trans: adj. 不稳定的；不规则的

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

name: immobile
trans: adj. 固定的【反义】mobile adj. 移动的

sentences.english: She could see a figure sitting immobile, facing the sea.
sentences.chinese: 她看到一个人影面朝大海坐着，一动不动。

detailed_translations.english: not moving at all

name: immobility
trans: n. 不动；固定【记忆】词根记忆：immobil（e）（固定的）+ity（性质）→不动；固定

sentences.chinese: 其原因是由于长时间不动，造成静脉血液停滞，促使静脉中血凝块形成。

sentences.english: If sleep paralysis is an example of too much immobility, so-called REMbehavior disorder is an example of too little.
sentences.chinese: 如果睡眠瘫痪症是过于静止的例子，那么所谓快速眼动行为障碍就是一个太不安静的例子。

name: immutable
trans: adj. 不变的；不可变的【搭配】immutable truth永远不变的真理

sentences.english: This decision should not be seen as immutable.
sentences.chinese: 不该把这个决定看成是不可改变的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不变的；不可变的；不能变的
detailed_translations.english: never changing or impossible to change

name: inactive
trans: adj. 不活动的，停止的【同根】active adj. 积极的，活动的

sentences.english: The brain cells are inactive during sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在睡觉时脑细胞不活跃。

sentences.english: Young people are becoming politically inactive.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人变得不热衷政治了。

detailed_translations.english: not doing anything, not working, or not moving

name: poise
trans: n. 镇定；vt. 使平稳

sentences.english: What amazed him even more than her appearance was her poise.
sentences.chinese: 比她的长相更让他惊讶的是她的沉着镇定。

detailed_translations.english: If someone has poise, they are calm, dignified, and self-controlled

name: stable
trans: adj. 稳定的；镇静的，稳重的【反义】unstable adj. （情绪）不稳定的，反复无常的

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: static
trans: adj. 静态的，静力的【反义】dynamic adj. 动力的，活跃的

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

name: stationary
trans: adj. 静止的，不动的；固定的【记忆】联想记忆：station（位置）+ary→总在一个地方的→静止的

sentences.english: How did you manage to drive into a stationary vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么开车的，竟会撞上一辆停着的车子？

detailed_translations.chinese: 固定的， 静止不动的
detailed_translations.english: standing still instead of moving

name: steady
trans: adj. 稳的；稳定的；v. （使）稳定【同根】steadily adv. 稳定地

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking

name: variable
trans: adj. 易变的；n. 变量【同根】variability n. 可变性，易变性

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: deal
trans: v. 处理【搭配】deal with 处理

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

name: dispose
trans: v. 处理；安排；n. 处置；性情【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+pos（放）+e→分开（排好）→安排

sentences.chinese: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

name: handle
trans: v. 处理

sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

trans: v. 处理，对付【记忆】词根记忆：tack（钉）+le→除去眼中钉→处理，对付

sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.chinese: 渔具

the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: treat
trans: v. 对待；处理；治疗【搭配】treat unequally 不平等地对待

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

name: in the course of

name: conduct
trans:
n. 举止；指导；管理；/kənˈdʌkt/
 vt. 指导；管理，实施【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+duct（引导）→指导【搭配】conduct oneself 控制自己

sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: a number of
trans: 很多，许多

sentences.english: The speaker can extemporize on any of a number of subjects.
sentences.chinese: 该演讲人对若干题目中的任一个都能即席发言。

sentences.english: They cannibalized three aircraft carriers and a number of warships to form a task force.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽调了三艘航空母舰和一些战舰组成一支特遣部队。

trans: v. 发现，找到；发觉【记忆】词根记忆：dis（除去）+cover（盖）→除去覆盖物→发现【同根】discovery n. 发现

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: fail to
trans: 未能

trans: adj. 明显的，显而易见的【记忆】词根记忆：ob（加强）+vi（道路）+ous（…的）→就在路上的→明显的【搭配】obvious choice 明显的选择

sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

name: profound
trans: adj. 深切的，深远的；知识渊博的，见解深刻的；深奥的【记忆】词根记忆：pro（前面）+found（基础）→有基础在前面→深远的【搭配】a profound sleep 酣睡a profound idea 深刻的思想【同义】abstruse adj. 深奥的esoteric adj. 深奥的，难以理解的

sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

trans: n. 倾向；趋势；流行，时尚；v. 伸向，倾向【记忆】联想记忆：tend（倾向）加r还是倾向（trend）【搭配】a downward trend 向下的趋势an upward trend 向上的趋势economic trend 经济趋势recent trend 最近的趋势sweeping trends 席卷一切的潮流

sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。
