name: influence
trans: n. 影响力；产生影响力的人；vt. 影响【搭配】have an influence on/upon sth. 对某事产生影响【同义】impact n. 影响effect n. 影响；效果 v. 招致

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: consumer
trans: n. 消费者；用户【搭配】consumer price index 消费者物价指数consumer psychology 消费心理【同根】consumerism n. 消费，消费主义

sentences.english: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
sentences.chinese: 不久消费者就要支付更高的机票价了。

sentences.english: It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (= consumers in general ).
sentences.chinese: 它将为消费者提供更多的商品选择。

sentences.english: Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
sentences.chinese: 消费者需求促使制造商品的进口量增加了。

sentences.english: Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月消费支出下降了0.1%。

sentences.english: sources of consumer advice
sentences.chinese: 给予消费者建议的信息来源

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and uses products and services

name: aspiration
trans: n. 强烈的愿望；志向；渴望达到的目的【记忆】词根记忆：a（加强）+spir（呼吸）+ ation→看到渴望的东西就呼吸急促→强烈的愿望【同根】aspire v. 向往，有志于

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: attitude
trans: n. 态度，看法；姿势；意见【记忆】发音记忆：“爱踢球的”→尽管人们对国足态度不一，但青少年踢球的热情无法阻挡→态度【搭配】attitude to/towards... 对…的态度the attitude to smoking 对待吸烟的态度

sentences.english: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
sentences.chinese: 他们一听说我是医生，态度就完全改变了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 态度， 看法； 姿势
detailed_translations.english: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour

name: behaviour
trans: n. 行为，表现；（机器等）运转情况【同义】manner n. 行为conduct n. 行为

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: abundant
trans: adj. 丰富的；充裕的；盛产【记忆】词根记忆：ab（加强）+und（溢出）+ ant（…的）→（多得）溢出来→丰富的【同根】abundance n. 大量，丰富

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: ample
trans: adj. 足够的；充足的【搭配】ample time 足够的时间

sentences.english: an ample bosom
sentences.chinese: 丰满的胸部

detailed_translations.english: more than enough

name: copious
trans: adj. 丰富的，大量的【记忆】词根记忆：cop（丰富）+ious（…的）→丰富的

sentences.english: He could drink copious amounts of beer without ill effect.
sentences.chinese: 他可以豪饮啤酒而无不适。

sentences.english: She listened to me and took copious notes .
sentences.chinese: 她边听我说话边记下大量笔记。

detailed_translations.english: existing or being produced in large quantities

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的，过分的【同根】excess n. 超越；过量 adj. 过量的，额外的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: lavish
trans: adj. 过分慷慨的，浪费的；v. 滥花，浪费【记忆】词根记忆：lav（洗，冲洗）+ish（使…）→冲洗掉→浪费【同义】extravagant adj. 奢侈的；过分的

sentences.english: a royal palace on a lavish scale
sentences.chinese: 庞大的皇宫

detailed_translations.english: very generous
to give someone or something a lot of love, praise, money etc

name: mass
trans: n. 团，众多；adj. 大量的【搭配】mass production 大规模生产

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

name: miscellaneous
trans: adj. 各种各样的，不同种类的；多才多艺的【记忆】词根记忆：misc（混淆）+ellan+eous（…的） →混淆的→各种各样的【搭配】miscellaneous costs 杂费

sentences.english: a miscellaneous assortment of books
sentences.chinese: 各种各样的书籍

sentences.english: They receive a grant of £1,094 to cover the cost of miscellaneous expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他们获得1,094英镑的津贴用于支付各种开支。

detailed_translations.chinese: 混杂的，各种各样的；多方面的，多才多艺的
detailed_translations.english: a miscellaneous set of things or people includes many different things or people that do not seem to be connected with each other

name: multitude
trans: n. 众多，大量；民众

sentences.english: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。

sentences.english: a multitude of possible interpretations
sentences.chinese: 种种可能的解释

detailed_translations.english: a very large number of people or things

name: numerous
trans: adj. 众多的【记忆】词根记忆：numer（数）+ous（…的）→数目很多的→众多的

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: plenteous
trans: adj. 丰富的，充足的

sentences.english: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
sentences.chinese: 主阿，你本为良善，乐意饶恕人，有丰盛的慈爱，赐给凡求告你的人。

detailed_translations.english: plentiful

name: plentiful
trans: adj. 丰富的【搭配】plentiful supply 大量供应

sentences.english: a plentiful supply of food
sentences.chinese: 食物的大量供应

detailed_translations.english: more than enough in quantity

name: plethora
trans: n. 过剩，过多

sentences.english: a plethora of suggestions
sentences.chinese: 一大堆建议

detailed_translations.chinese: 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of something, usually more than you need

name: profuse
trans: adj. 丰富的；大量的【同根】profusion n. 丰富

sentences.english: He made profuse apologies .
sentences.chinese: 他不住地道歉。

sentences.english: Profuse sweating is one of the symptoms of heat exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 大量出汗是中暑虚脱的症状之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的；很多的；慷慨的；浪费的
detailed_translations.english: produced or existing in large quantities

name: prolific
trans: adj. 多产的【搭配】prolific author 多产作家【同义】productive adj. 多产的

sentences.english: Handel’s prolific output of opera
sentences.chinese: 韩德尔丰富的歌剧作品

detailed_translations.english: a prolific artist, writer etc produces many works of art, books etc

name: substantial
trans: adj. 大量的；价值巨大的；结实的；实质的【同义】plentiful adj. 丰富的【同根】substantially adv. 可观地；实质上substance n. 物质；实质

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: sufficient
trans: adj. 足够的，充分的【反义】insufficient adj. 不足的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: swarm
trans: v. 挤满；云集；n. 一大群【搭配】swarm with 挤满，充满的

sentences.english: Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

detailed_translations.english: If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way
a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

name: wealth
trans: n. 大量

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: bundling
trans: n. 捆绑销售【同根】bundle vt. 捆；束

name: client
trans: n. 顾客【搭配】client service 客户服务

sentences.english: a meeting with an important client
sentences.chinese: 与一位重要客户的会面

detailed_translations.english: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

name: gender
trans: n. 性别【搭配】gender discrimination性别歧视

sentences.english: people of the same gender
sentences.chinese: 同性别的人

sentences.english: Discrimination on grounds of race or gender is forbidden.
sentences.chinese: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。

sentences.english: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.
sentences.chinese: 对待有偿劳动的态度可能存在着性别差异。

sentences.english: traditional gender roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的性别角色

sentences.english: toys that do not reinforce gender stereotypes
sentences.chinese: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具

sentences.english: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
sentences.chinese: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being male or female

name: low-income
trans: adj. 低收入的【记忆】合成词：low（低）+income（收入）→低收入的

name: passivity
trans: n. 被动性【同根】passive adj. 被动的

sentences.english: Such superiority or inferiority is the objective basis of initiative or passivity.
sentences.chinese: 这种优势或劣势，是主动或被动的客观基矗。

sentences.english: These local successes will add up to strategic superiority and initiative for us and strategic inferiority and passivity for the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 把这些局部的东西集合起来，就成了我们的战略优势和战略主动，敌人的战略劣势和战略被动。

sentences.english: If we assume that our efforts are unrelated to the outcomes in our lives we develop an outlook of pessimism and passivity.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们假设自己的付出与成果无关，那么我们就衍生出悲观和被动的观念。

name: propensity
trans: n. 倾向，癖好【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+pens（称重量）+ ity→重量偏向一边→倾向【搭配】consumption propensity 消费倾向

sentences.english: Mr. Bint has a propensity to put off decisions to the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 宾特先生有一种将决定拖到最后一分钟的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way

name: purchasing power
trans: 购买力

name: target audience
trans: 目标受众

name: targeted
trans: adj. 定向的【同根】target n. 目标；对象 vt. 把…作为目标

name: temptation
trans: n. 诱惑【搭配】resist temptation 抵制诱惑

sentences.english: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you’re certain you need it.
sentences.chinese: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑，除非你确有需要。

sentences.english: I finally gave in to the temptation and had a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我最终还是屈从诱惑，抽了一支烟。

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

name: upscale
trans: adj. 高消费阶层的【搭配】upscale clientele 高层次的顾客

sentences.english: an affluent upscale audience
sentences.chinese: 富裕的高消费观众

detailed_translations.chinese: 迎合高层次消费者的；质优价高的
detailed_translations.english: relating to people from a high social class who have a lot of money

name: conviction
trans: n. 判罪；坚信，确信

sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: historical
trans: adj. 历史的；史学的【搭配】historical data 史料，历史资料historical change 历史变迁

sentences.english: places of historical interest
sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.english: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the past

name: relic
trans: n. 遗物；遗迹【搭配】cultural relic 文物；文化遗产grade-one cultural relic 一级文物

sentences.english: Roman relics found in a field
sentences.chinese: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

name: infallible
trans: adj. 绝对可靠的；万无一失的【记忆】词根记忆：in（无）+fall（错误）+ible（…的） →无错误的→万无一失的

sentences.english: He had an infallible cure for a hangover.
sentences.chinese: 他有对付宿醉绝对灵验的良方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对可靠的；绝无错误的
detailed_translations.english: something that is infallible always works or has the intended effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 永远正确的人；绝无谬误的事物

name: testimony
trans: n. 证据；证明

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

name: regard
trans: v. 把…看作，把…认为；注视；n. 敬意，问候【搭配】as regards 关于，至于with/in regard to 对于；就…而论

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: objective
trans: n. 目标，目的；adj. 客观的；真实的【搭配】strategic objective 战略目标be objective about sth. 客观看待某事【同义】goal n. 目标aim n. 目的，目标

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: value
trans: n. 价值；价值观

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: bequest
trans: n. 遗产；遗赠

sentences.english: a bequest of $5,000
sentences.chinese: 五千美元的遗产

detailed_translations.english: money or property that you arrange to give to someone after your death

name: heritage
trans: n. 遗产；传统【记忆】词根记忆：herit（继承）+age（集合名词） →继承的东西→遗产【同义】inheritance n. 遗产，遗赠

sentences.english: the importance of preserving the national heritage
sentences.chinese: 保护民族遗产的重要性

sentences.english: beautiful old buildings which are part of our heritage
sentences.chinese: 属于我们遗产一部分的漂亮古建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产；传统；继承物；继承权
detailed_translations.english: the traditional beliefs, values, customs etc of a family, country, or society

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗产；遗赠

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: begrudge
trans: v. 对…不满；嫉妒

sentences.english: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定不会妒忌他得了获诺贝尔奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羡慕，嫉妒；吝惜，舍不得给
detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset with someone because they have something that you think they do not deserve

name: desperate
trans: adj. 拼命的，极度渴望的，绝望的【记忆】词根记忆：de（否定）+sper（希望）+ ate（具有…的）→没有希望→拼命的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: flatter
trans: v. 奉承；使高兴【搭配】flatter oneself that... 自以为…【同根】flatterer n. 谄媚者flattery n. 恭维的话

sentences.english: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
sentences.chinese: 佩里常常奉承米切尔太太，称赞她的烹调手艺。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

name: hesitate
trans: vi. 犹豫；不情愿【记忆】词根记忆：hes（粘附）+itate→脚像粘住了一样→犹豫【同根】hesitation n. 犹豫

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: indecision
trans: n. 无决断力；优柔寡断

sentences.english: There were weeks of indecision about who would go and when.
sentences.chinese: 关于谁去和什么时候去的问题几个星期以来一直悬而未决。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to decide what to do

name: indifferent
trans: adj. 漠不关心的；质量差的【搭配】an indifferent book 质量低劣的书

sentences.english: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.chinese: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

detailed_translations.english: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it

name: jealous
trans: adj. 妒忌的；猜疑的

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

name: scruple
trans: n. 踌躇；有顾忌

sentences.english: a man with no moral scruples
sentences.chinese: 一个道德上无所顾忌的男人

detailed_translations.english: a belief about what is right and wrong that prevents you from doing bad things

name: vacillate
trans: v. 观点（或立场等）摇摆；动摇

sentences.english: She vacillates between men twice her age and men younger than she.
sentences.chinese: 她在两个男人之间摇摆不定，一个年龄比她大一倍，一个比她小。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to change your opinions, decisions, ideas etc

name: ascertain
trans: v. 弄清，查明；确定【记忆】词根记忆：as（加强）+certain（确定）→一再区别→确定【同义】clarify vt. 澄清【反义】conceal vt. 隐瞒cover vt. 掩盖

sentences.english: A postmortem was ordered to try to ascertain the cause of death.
sentences.chinese: 下令验尸以查明死因。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄清， 查明； 确定
detailed_translations.english: to find out something

name: confident
trans: adj. 肯定的；确信的【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+fid（相信）+ ent（…的）→加强相信的→确信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: definite
trans: adj. 明确的，肯定的【记忆】词根记忆：de+fin（范围）+ite→划定范围的→明确的

sentences.english: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能给你明确的答复。

sentences.english: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要记录足够的数据，才能得出明确的结论。

sentences.english: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

sentences.english: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
sentences.chinese: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

detailed_translations.english: clearly known, seen, or stated

name: undoubtedly
trans: adv. 毋庸置疑地，确凿地

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: doctrine
trans: n. 教义；主义；学说【记忆】词根记忆：doctr（=doct教导）+ine（表抽象名词）→教义

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: exact
trans: adj. 精确的；准确的【同根】exactly adv. 正确地；完全地

sentences.english: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

sentences.english: What were his exact words?
sentences.chinese: 他的原话是什么？

sentences.english: The timing had to be exact.
sentences.chinese: 对时机的把握必须精确。

sentences.english: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
sentences.chinese: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

detailed_translations.english: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: institute
trans: n. 研究所，学院；vt. 建立，设立【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+stitut（建立）+e →建立，设立

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；[pl.] 天平；刻度；等级；比例（尺）；v. 攀登【搭配】on a large scale 大规模地in scale 成比例，相称out of scale 不成比例，不相称scale down 按比例缩小，按比例缩减

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

sentences.chinese: 这个包有一些独立的隔层。

sentences.chinese: 她把钱藏在公文包的暗层里。

detailed_translations.english: a smaller enclosed space inside something larger

trans: n. 目的地

sentences.chinese: 埃利斯岛已经成为美国最受欢迎的游览地之一。

name: escalator
trans: n. 电动扶梯【记忆】词根记忆：escal（梯子）+ator（表名词，器物）→电动扶梯【搭配】subway escalator 地铁扶梯

sentences.english: Take the escalator to the third floor and it's the last office on the left.
sentences.chinese: 乘电梯到4楼，左边最后的那个办公室就是。

trans: n. 渡船，渡轮

sentences.english: Your brother left his bag of film on the ferryboat.I found it.
sentences.chinese: 你哥哥把这个装胶卷的提包忘在渡船上。 我看到了。

sentences.chinese: 他们来到一条很宽的河边，发现渡船在河的另一头，所有人都不知怎么办好。

sentences.english: "Introduction to Buddhism" is composed of two seminar sessions recorded aboard Alan Watts's ferryboat home.
sentences.chinese: “佛教概论”这个讲座是艾伦.瓦茨乘海船回国时于船上所录制课程，包括两个讲座。

detailed_translations.english: a ferry

name: light rail
trans: 轻轨

name: platform
trans: n. 站台，月台【搭配】platform ticket 站台票service platform 工作台；操作平台

sentences.english: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: subway station
trans: 地铁站

name: terminus
trans: n. 终点站【记忆】词根记忆：termin（界限）+us→界限点→终点站【搭配】terminus station 终点站

sentences.english: What time does the train reach the terminus?
sentences.chinese: 火车什么时间到达终点站?。

sentences.english: Trains vomit out crowds of passengers at a terminus.
sentences.chinese: 成群的旅客在终点站从列车中挤出来。

sentences.english: Casablanca was the terminus of a long rickety railway line .
sentences.chinese: 卡莎布兰卡是一长而软弱的铁路线的终点。

detailed_translations.english: the station or stop at the end of a railway or bus line

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输工具【搭配】transportation expense 交通费用

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: vessel
trans: n. 大船；轮船【搭配】ocean-going vessel 远洋轮船

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: yacht
trans: n. 快艇，游艇；v. 驾游艇

sentences.english: His 36 ft yacht sank suddenly last summer.
sentences.chinese: 他的36英尺游艇去年夏天突然沉没了。

detailed_translations.english: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep

name: amenity
trans: n. 舒适；便利设施

sentences.english: The hotel is in the city centre, close to shops and local amenities.
sentences.chinese: 该酒店位于市中心，紧邻商店和当地的便利设施。

sentences.english: houses that lack basic amenities
sentences.chinese: 缺乏基本生活设施的房屋

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
detailed_translations.english: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

name: apparatus
trans: n. 仪器；设备【记忆】词根记忆：ap（加强）+par（准备）+ atus→准备好用的东西→设备

sentences.english: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

sentences.english: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械，器具，仪器；机构，组织
detailed_translations.english: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

name: appliance
trans: n. 器具；装置

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: axis
trans: n. 轴

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: device
trans: n. 装置，设备，仪表；方法，设计；手段，策略【记忆】词根记忆：de+vice（代替）→代替人力的（东西）→装置

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: fixture
trans: n. （房间等建筑物内的）固定装置，固定设施【记忆】词根记忆：fix（固定）+ture→固定装置

sentences.english: light fixtures
sentences.chinese: 照明设备

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

name: gadget
trans: n. 小巧的器械，精巧的装置；小玩意儿

sentences.english: ...sales of kitchen gadgets including toasters, kettles, and percolators.
sentences.chinese: …厨房小用品的销售，包括烤面包机、水壶和咖啡渗滤壶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 小玩意；小器具；小配件；诡计
detailed_translations.english: A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary.

name: gear
trans: n. 齿轮，传动装置，（排）档；（从事某项活动所需的）用具、设备、衣服等；vt. 调节，调整，使适应【搭配】gear change 变速杆，变速装置gear to/towards调整，使合适gear the plan 调整计划

sentences.english: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.english: Andy drove cautiously along in third gear.
sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.english: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
sentences.chinese: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？

sentences.english: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.english: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
sentences.chinese: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。

sentences.english: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
sentences.chinese: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

sentences.english: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.
sentences.chinese: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

sentences.english: My training was geared toward winning gold.
sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 齿轮，传动装置，排挡；用具，设备；衣服
detailed_translations.english: the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds
If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

name: handle
trans: vt. 操作，操纵

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；手段；工具；乐器【搭配】strategic instrument 战略工具measuring instrument 测量工具musical instrument 乐器【同根】instrumental adj. 起作用的；用乐器演奏的

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器

name: maneuver

sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

trans: n. 用具，全套装备；vt. 配备；供应

sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

trans: n. 支点；枢轴；v. （使）在枢轴上旋转（或转动）

sentences.chinese: 构成这个展览核心的是一大批水彩画。

detailed_translations.english: to turn or balance on a central point, or to make something do this

sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: rig
trans: v. 操纵，垄断；n. 船桅（或船帆等）的装置；成套器械

sentences.english: The ship was fully rigged and ready to sail.
sentences.chinese: 船已装备就绪，等待起航。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给船装帆;为提供必要装备
detailed_translations.english: to put ropes, sails etc on a ship

sentences.english: Overcrowding and poor sanitation are common problems in prisons.
sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤和卫生状况差是监狱里的普遍问题。

detailed_translations.english: the protection of public health by removing and treating waste, dirty water etc

name: industrial
trans: adj. 工业的，产业的【记忆】来自industry（n. 工业）【搭配】industrial base 工业基地

sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: output
trans: n. 产量；输出【搭配】industrial output 工业产出

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率【记忆】来自product（n. 产品）【同义】capacity n. 容量；生产力output n. 产量；输出量

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: soar
trans: n. 猛增；急升

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: withdraw
trans: v. 收回；撤退；缩回，退出；提取（钱）【记忆】词根记忆：with（向后）+draw（拉）→向后拉扯→撤退【搭配】withdraw one's promise 收回诺言a withdrawn letter 撤回的信函withdraw money from the bank 从银行取钱

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: aquifer
trans: n. 含水层

sentences.english: A long-term maintenance regime relies solely on natural methods to protect the watershed and aquifer.
sentences.chinese: 而对于流域及蓄水层的长期性维护制度将仅依靠自然实现。

sentences.english: The Ogallala aquifer is a major source of drinking and irrigation water for America's central plains.
sentences.chinese: 奥加拉拉蓄水层是美国中部平原饮用和灌溉用水的主要来源。

sentences.english: However, decline or rise of water level anomaly depends on the tectonic position where the well aquifer lies in the process of stress regulation and re accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 而水位异常图像出现的上升或下降形态，取决于井孔含水层系统在大震孕育过程的应力调整再积累阶段所处的构造部位。

detailed_translations.english: In geology, an aquifer is an area of rock underneath the surface of the earth which absorbs and holds water

name: distilled water
trans: 蒸馏水

name: drain
trans: n. 排水道

sentences.english: He flushed the drain.
sentences.chinese: 他用水冲排水沟。

sentences.english: The boat drifted helplessly along the drain until some people saw him.
sentences.chinese: 船儿无助地顺着排水沟漂流直到有人看见他。

detailed_translations.english: something that continuously uses a lot of time, money etc

name: drainage
trans: n. 排水；污水【搭配】drainage ditch 排水沟drainage hole 排水孔drainage system 排水系统

sentences.english: A handful of pebbles in the bottom of a flowerpot will help drainage.
sentences.chinese: 在花盆底下放一把鹅卵石能够帮助排水。

sentences.english: a plan to improve the town’s drainage system
sentences.chinese: 改善城里排水系统的计划

detailed_translations.english: the process or system by which water or waste liquid flows away

name: drinking water
trans: 饮用水

name: fresh water
trans: 淡水

name: groundwater
trans: n. 地下水【搭配】groundwater exploration 地下水勘探confined groundwater 承压地下水

sentences.english: There are fears that groundwater might become contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心地下水可能会遭污染。

detailed_translations.english: water that is below the ground

name: hard water
trans: 硬质水

name: running water
trans: 流水

name: salt water
trans: 盐水

name: sea water
trans: 海水

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道【搭配】sewage disposal 污水处理sewage engineering 污水排放工程

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: surface water
trans: 地表水

name: tap water
trans: 自来水

name: waste water
trans: 污水

name: ascend
trans: v. 攀登；升高【同根】ascending adj. 上升的，向上的

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

name: boost
trans: vt. 促进，增加【搭配】boost the economy 促进经济发展

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: burgeon
trans: vi. （正式）急速增长（发展）

sentences.english: When spring is coming all trees begin to burgeon .
sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.english: The brain-drain effect of studying abroad has started to burgeon due to flaws in the domestic academic environment.
sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.english: The seed of friendship and cooperation we sow today will burgeon and harvest in the future and China-US partnership of cooperation will definitely enjoy a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天播下的友好合作种子一定能够生根发芽、开花结果，中美合作伙伴关系一定能够迎来更加美好的明天。

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；增强【同根】enhancement n. 增加enhanced adj. 增强的；提高的

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: hoist
trans: n. 起重机；升起；v. （使）升起，吊起

sentences.english: The crew hurried to hoist the flag.
sentences.chinese: 船员们急忙把旗子升起来。

detailed_translations.english: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重器械； 举起， 升起， 吊起
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

name: raise
trans: v. 举起；增加；n. 提升；加薪

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

sentences.chinese: 他们仔细地检查了商品。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: attention
trans: n. 注意（力），留心；立正【记忆】词根记忆：at（加强）+tent（伸展）+ion（表名词）→伸展出去（听别人讲）→专心【搭配】attract/draw (sb's) attention to 吸引注意力divert attention from 转移注意力pay attention to 注意catch the attention of 引起注意

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: interactive
trans: adj. 互动的；交互式的【搭配】interactive media交互式媒体

sentences.english: interactive computer systems
sentences.chinese: 交互式电脑系统

sentences.english: the museum’s interactive exhibits
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的互动展品

detailed_translations.chinese: 互相作用的，互相影响的
detailed_translations.english: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions

name: blockbuster
trans: n. 轰动；巨型炸弹；电影大片

sentences.english: the latest Hollywood blockbuster
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞最新大片

detailed_translations.chinese: 轰动；巨型炸弹；一鸣惊人者
detailed_translations.english: a book or film that is very good or successful

name: stunning
trans: adj. 极好的；令人震惊的【同根】stun vt. 使震惊；打昏 n. 昏倒

sentences.english: She was 55 and still a stunning woman.
sentences.chinese: 她55岁，仍是个极美的女人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极好的；使人晕倒的；震耳欲聋的
detailed_translations.english: A stunning person or thing is extremely beautiful or impressive

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…打昏；使震耳欲聋；使大吃一惊（stun的ing形式）

name: scenery
trans: n. 风景，景色；舞台布景【记忆】词根记忆：scen(e)（景色）+ery（场所）→景色；舞台布景【搭配】natural scenery 自然风景magnificent scenery 壮丽的风景impressive scenery 令人难忘的风景

sentences.english: The best part of the trip was the fantastic scenery.
sentences.chinese: 此次旅行最精彩之处就是那美妙绝伦的风景。

sentences.english: Instead of stagehands, the actors will move the scenery right in front of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 演员们将替代舞台工作人员，当着观众的面置换布景。

detailed_translations.english: the natural features of a particular part of a country that you can see, such as mountains, forests, deserts etc

name: backdrop
trans: n. 背景幕布【记忆】合成词：back（后）+drop（垂下）→舞台后面垂下的→背景幕布

sentences.english: ...the rugged cliffs that formed a backdrop to the village.
sentences.chinese: ...构成村庄天然屏障的崎岖峭壁。

detailed_translations.english: the  scenery  behind something that you are looking at

name: commentator
trans: n. 评论员【同根】comment n./v. 注释，评论

sentences.english: political commentators
sentences.chinese: 政治评论员

detailed_translations.chinese: 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

name: copyright
trans: n. 版权

sentences.english: Who owns the copyright of this book?
sentences.chinese: 谁拥有这本书的版权？

sentences.english: The database will be protected by copyright .
sentences.chinese: 这个数据库将受到版权保护。

detailed_translations.english: the legal right to be the only producer or seller of a book, play, film, or record for a specific length of time

name: correspondent
trans: n. 记者

sentences.english: The result was correspondent with my wishes.
sentences.chinese: 结果与我的愿望是一致的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通讯员，记者；异地代理商；代理银行
detailed_translations.english: someone who is employed by a newspaper or a television station etc to report news from a particular area or on a particular subject

name: edition
trans: n. 版本【搭配】the first edition 初版the second edition 再版

sentences.english: a paperback edition
sentences.chinese: 平装本

sentences.english: the US edition of Marie Claire magazine
sentences.chinese: 《嘉人》杂志的美国版

sentences.english: Martin was reading the early edition of the Evening News.
sentences.chinese: 马丁在看《新闻晚报》的早间版

sentences.english: The textbook was first published in 1858 and is now in its 39th edition.
sentences.chinese: 该课本初版于1858年，现在已经是第39版了。

detailed_translations.english: the form that a book, newspaper, magazine etc is produced in

name: editorial
trans: n. 社论

sentences.english: an editorial assistant
sentences.chinese: 编辑助理

detailed_translations.english: relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

name: montage
trans: n. 蒙太奇，文学音乐或美术的组合体

sentences.english: a photo montage
sentences.chinese: 剪辑组合的摄影作品

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒙太奇（电影的基本结构手段和叙事方式）；混合画，拼集的照片
detailed_translations.english: the process of making a whole picture, film, or piece of music or writing by combining parts of different pictures, films etc in an interesting and unusual way

name: post-synchronization
trans: n. 后期录音合成

name: premiere
trans: n. 首演，首映

sentences.english: The 23-year-old actor was greeted by screaming fans as he arrived for the Leicester Square premiere of his new film Remember Me.
sentences.chinese: 这位23岁的年轻演员，在粉丝们的热情欢呼声中到达了莱斯雷特广场，今晚是他最新电影《记住我》的首映式。

sentences.english: The documentary premiered at the Jerusalem Film Festival.
sentences.chinese: 那部记录片在耶路撒冷电影节上首映。

sentences.english: Four astronauts visited for last week's premiere of the movie Space Station.
sentences.chinese: 四位宇航员到场参加了上个星期举行的电影《空间站》的首映式。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首位的；初次的；女主角的

detailed_translations.english: When a movie or show premieres or is premiered, it is shown to an audience for the first time
The premiere of a new play or movie is the first public performance of it

name: romance
trans: n. 爱情电影；浪漫【记忆】发音记忆：“罗曼史”→浪漫爱情

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

name: subtitle
trans: n. 字幕

sentences.english: a French film with English subtitles
sentences.chinese: 附有英语字幕的法国电影

sentences.english: "Lorna Doone" is subtitled "a Romance of Exmoor."
sentences.chinese: 《洛娜·杜恩》的副标题是《埃克斯穆尔的一个浪漫故事》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副标题；说明或对白的字幕
detailed_translations.english: the words printed over a film in a foreign language to translate what is being said by the actors

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上印字幕；给…加副标题
detailed_translations.english: If you say how a book or play is subtitled, you say what its subtitle is

name: title
trans: n. 片名

sentences.english: "Patience and Sarah" was first published in 1969 under the title "A Place for Us."
sentences.chinese: 《耐心与萨拉》于1969年以《我们的地方》为书名首次出版。

sentences.english: Pirandello titled his play "Six Characters in Search of an Author."
sentences.chinese: 皮兰德娄将其戏剧命名为《六个寻找作者的剧中人》。

sentences.english: The single is titled "White Love."
sentences.chinese: 这支单曲名为《白色之恋》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冠军；标题；头衔；权利；字幕
detailed_translations.english: the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 加标题于；赋予头衔；把…称为
detailed_translations.english: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a name

name: trailer
trans: n. 预告片

sentences.english: ...a misleadingly violent trailer for the film.
sentences.chinese: …一个让人误以为充斥暴力的电影预告片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖车；[电视] 预告片；追踪者
detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that can be pulled behind another vehicle, used for carrying something heavy

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘拖车式活动房屋旅行

name: canyon
trans: n. 峡谷【搭配】The Grand Canyon 科罗拉多大峡谷

sentences.english: The canyon is famous for producing echoes.
sentences.chinese: 这个峡谷以回声而闻名。

sentences.english: The grand canyon was not dug by the hand of man, but riven by nature.
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷并非人力所开而是受大自然之力而成的。

sentences.english: We made our way up the fixed rope and then down into a deeper third canyon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着固定的绳索前进，然后到达了一个更深的峡谷，这已经是第三个了。

name: creek
trans: n. 小溪

sentences.english: Follow Austin Creek for a few miles.
sentences.chinese: 沿着奥斯汀河走上几英里。

detailed_translations.english: a small narrow stream or river

name: crystal
trans: n. 结晶；水晶；晶体【搭配】crystal ball 水晶球crystal clear 完全透明的

sentences.english: ice/salt crystals
sentences.chinese: 冰 / 盐的结晶体

sentences.english: a pair of crystal earrings
sentences.chinese: 一对水晶耳环

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of a substance with many even sides, that is formed naturally when the substance becomes solid

name: estuary
trans: n. （江河入海的）河口湾【搭配】estuary deposit 河口沉积，港湾沉积

sentences.english: the Thames estuary
sentences.chinese: 泰晤士河河口

detailed_translations.english: the wide part of a river where it goes into the sea

name: gorge
trans: n. 咽喉；山峡，峡谷；v. 狼吞虎咽，贪婪地吃

sentences.english: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 我可以将每一天都花在狂吃巧克力上。

detailed_translations.english: If you gorge on something or gorge yourself on it, you eat lots of it in a very greedy way
a deep narrow valley with steep sides

name: jungle
trans: n. 丛林

sentences.english: the Amazon jungle
sentences.chinese: 亚马孙丛林

detailed_translations.english: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

name: landscape
trans: n. （陆上）风景，风景画；地形；v. 美化【搭配】Landscape Architecture 园林建筑学；景观建筑学

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: lawn
trans: n. 草坪，草地

sentences.english: I spent all morning mowing the lawn (= cutting the grass ).
sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.english: a carefully tended lawn
sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

name: limpid
trans: adj. 清澈的

name: meadow
trans: n. 草地

sentences.english: The meadow has been ploughed up.
sentences.chinese: 那片草地已用犁翻过。

sentences.english: The colt bounded through the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马驹跳着跑过牧场。

sentences.english: There are many lambs capering in the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 很多小羊在草地上蹦蹦跳跳。

detailed_translations.english: a field with wild grass and flowers

trans: n. 海市蜃楼【记忆】词根记忆：mir（惊奇）+age（场所）→让人惊奇的场所→海市蜃楼

sentences.english: Perhaps we are just chasing a mirage.
sentences.chinese: 也许我们只是在追逐一个梦。

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的【搭配】natural landscape 自然景观

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

trans: n. 全景【记忆】词根记忆：pan（全）+oram（观看）+a →全部看得到→全景

sentences.english: Horton looked out over a panorama of fertile valleys and gentle hills.
sentences.chinese: 霍顿眺望着那一片肥沃山谷和平缓山脉的景象。

sentences.english: a panorama of life in England 400 years ago
sentences.chinese: 400年前英格兰生活的全景图

detailed_translations.english: an impressive view of a wide area of land

name: picturesque
trans: adj. 美丽如画的；（语言）生动的【搭配】a picturesque village 风景如画的村庄

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: plain
trans: n. 平原

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

name: plateau
trans: n. 高原【搭配】plateau phenomenon 高原现象【同义】highland n. 高地tableland n. 高原

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: puddle
trans: n. 小水坑

sentences.english: Children splashed through the puddles.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们噼噼啪啪地踩过一个个小水坑。

detailed_translations.english: a small pool of liquid, especially rainwater

name: scenic
trans: adj. 风景优美的【搭配】scenic spot 旅游景点

sentences.english: a region of scenic beauty
sentences.chinese: 景色优美的地区

detailed_translations.chinese: 风景优美的；舞台的；戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: surrounded by views of beautiful countryside

name: shade
trans: n. 阴凉处；遮光物；阴暗部；色度；细微差别；v. 遮蔽，遮光

sentences.english: a delicate/pale/rich/soft shade of red
sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

name: spectacle
trans: n. 奇观【记忆】词根记忆：spect（看）+acle（物）→让你看到幻觉→奇观

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: spring
trans: n. 泉，泉水【搭配】hot spring温泉

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: summit
trans: n. （山等的）最高点，峰顶；峰会【同义】peak n. 顶点

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: trickle
trans: vi. 滴，淌，涓涓地流；n. 涓涓细流【搭配】trickle down 向下流

sentences.english: A tear trickled down the old man's cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一滴泪水顺着老人的面颊流了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滴；细细地流；慢慢地移动
detailed_translations.english: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
a thin slow flow of liquid

name: tundra
trans: n. 冻原，苔原

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

name: glorious
trans: adj. 光荣的；壮丽的；令人愉快的【记忆】词根记忆：glor(y)i（荣誉）→+ous→光荣的

sentences.english: a truly glorious future
sentences.chinese: 无比美好的将来

sentences.english: a glorious victory
sentences.chinese: 光荣的胜利

sentences.english: glorious views of the coast
sentences.chinese: 沿海的迷人景色

detailed_translations.english: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour

name: gorgeous
trans: adj. 华丽的；极好的【记忆】联想记忆：gorge（峡谷）+ous→峡谷很美丽→华丽的

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful or attractive

name: grand
trans: adj. 宏伟的；全部的

sentences.english: a grand country house
sentences.chinese: 豪华的乡间大宅

sentences.english: The party was a grand affair.
sentences.chinese: 这个聚会场面隆重。

sentences.english: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

detailed_translations.english: big and very impressive

name: magnificent
trans: adj. 壮丽的，宏伟的，华丽的；高尚的【同根】magnificently adv. 壮观地，宏伟地magnificence n. 壮丽，宏伟

adj. 详尽的；复杂的；精心制作的；/ɪˈlæbəreɪt/
 v. 详述，详细制定【记忆】词根记忆：e（加强）+labor（劳动）+ate（做）→精细化工作→精心制作的

sentences.chinese: 报告中说，因为工人们的虚弱，通过中断了业务会议而失去生产效率，并且破坏了社交聚会的范围。

trans: n. 细胞；基层组织【搭配】blood cell 血细胞【同根】cellular adj. 细胞的

sentences.chinese: 学习是一生的事。

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you.
sentences.chinese: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

sentences.chinese: 我从小就认识约翰了。

sentences.chinese: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: take care of
trans: 照顾

sentences.english: I always used to laugh to myself when I heard people say that we need to take care of ourselves in order to be able to take care of others.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一些人说要照顾好我们自己，这样我们才有能力去照顾好别人。 不知道为什么，当我听到这句话的时候，我经常笑我自己。

sentences.english: Because the office refrigerator is unowned by any individual, no one feels responsibility to take care of it, and certainly no one wants to take time out of his or her busy workday to do so.
sentences.chinese: 办公室里的冰箱因为不属于任何一个个人，没有人觉得自己有责任去管理或者照顾它，当然也没人在繁忙的工作时间抽出时间去做那些事情。

name: wrinkle
trans: n. 皱纹；v. （使）起皱纹【记忆】联想记忆：眨眼（twinkle）容易起皱纹（wrinkle）

sentences.english: Her face was a mass of wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸上布满皱纹。

sentences.english: Alex wrinkled up her nose at the smell.
sentences.chinese: 闻到那股味道，亚历克丝皱起了鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: wrinkles are lines on your face and skin that you get when you are old
if you wrinkle a part of your face, or if it wrinkles, small lines appear on it

name: tend
trans: vi. 倾向于…；vt. 照料

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: humanity
trans: n. 人类，人；人性；人道，仁慈；[pl.] 人文学科【记忆】词根记忆：human（人，人类）+ity（具备某种性质）→人类，人【同义】humankind n. 人类（总称）

sentences.english: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。

sentences.english: crimes against humanity
sentences.chinese: 反人类罪

sentences.english: We must never forget our common humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

detailed_translations.english: people in general

name: mercy
trans: n. 仁慈，善行【搭配】beg for mercy 乞求怜悯without mercy 残忍地

sentences.english: He showed no mercy to his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他对敌人毫不仁慈。

sentences.english: God have mercy on his soul.
sentences.chinese: 愿上帝宽恕他的灵魂。

detailed_translations.english: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

name: glacial
trans: adj. 冰期的，冰川期的；寒冷的，冰冷的；冷若冰霜的【记忆】词根记忆：glaci（冰）+al（…的）→冰期的【搭配】glacial period 冰川期，冰河时代

sentences.english: a glacial valley
sentences.chinese: 冰川谷

sentences.english: glacial deposits
sentences.chinese: 冰川沉积

detailed_translations.chinese: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
detailed_translations.english: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

name: episode
trans: n. 一段情节；一集【搭配】episode analysis 事例分析【同根】episodic adj. 偶然发生的

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: anticyclone
trans: n. 反气旋；高（气）压【记忆】词根记忆：anti（反）+cyclone（气旋）→反气旋

sentences.english: The anticyclone weather situations are more favorable than the cyclonic ones.
sentences.chinese: 反气旋天气情况比气旋天气情况更有利些。

sentences.english: Second is anticyclone this happens when winds form a wind system around a high.
sentences.chinese: 第二种是反气旋，当围绕高压中心形成风系统时出现反气旋。

sentences.english: When the air pressure in a region is higher than its surrounding it is called an anticyclone or an area of high pressure .
sentences.chinese: 当地区的大气压力比其周边高时，便称之为反气旋或高气压。

detailed_translations.english: an area of high air pressure that causes calm weather in the place it is moving over

name: atmospheric
trans: adj. 大气的，大气层的【搭配】atmospheric temperature 大气温度

sentences.english: atmospheric pressure

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Earth’s atmosphere

name: density
trans: n. 密度【搭配】atmospheric density 大气密度

sentences.english: areas of high population density
sentences.chinese: 人口密度高的地区

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

name: direct sunlight

name: element
trans: n. [pl.] 天气等（尤指风雨）；元素；组成【同根】elemental adj. 基本的；元素的

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: evaporated
trans: adj. 脱水的；蒸发干燥的【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+vapor（蒸汽）+ate（使…）+(e)d（…的）→使蒸汽出来的→蒸发干燥的【同根】evaporation n. 蒸发

name: hectopascal
trans: n. 百帕斯卡

name: moist
trans: adj. 潮湿的【同根】moisture n. 潮湿

sentences.english: Make sure the soil is moist before planting the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 播种之前要确保土壤湿润。

sentences.english: a rich, moist chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 香浓软润的巧克力蛋糕

sentences.english: warm moist air
sentences.chinese: 温暖湿润的空气

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist (= she was almost crying ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛湿润了。

detailed_translations.english: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

trans: adj. 神秘的【搭配】the mysterious universe 神秘的宇宙

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: seasonal demand

name: subtropical
trans: adj. 亚热带的【搭配】subtropical climate 亚热带气候

sentences.english: subtropical vegetation
sentences.chinese: 亚热带植被

detailed_translations.english: related to or typical of an area that is near a tropical area

name: sunrise
trans: n. 日出【搭配】at sunrise 日出时

sentences.english: a picture of sunrise over Mount Fuji
sentences.chinese: 富士山日出的照片

detailed_translations.english: the time when the sun first appears in the morning

name: sunset
trans: n. 日落【搭配】at sunset 日落时

sentences.english: a glorious sunset
sentences.chinese: 壮丽的日落景象

detailed_translations.english: the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

name: tropical cyclone
trans: 热带气旋

name: uncontaminated
trans: adj. 未被污染的【搭配】uncontaminated soil 未污染土壤

name: balmy
trans: adj. 温和的，宜人的

sentences.english: a balmy summer night
sentences.chinese: 一个宜人的夏夜

detailed_translations.english: balmy air, weather etc is warm and pleasant

name: breeze
trans: n. 微风，和风【搭配】icy breeze 寒风

sentences.english: flowers waving in the breeze
sentences.chinese: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

detailed_translations.chinese: 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波
detailed_translations.english: a gentle wind

name: brisk
trans: adj. 凛冽的；敏捷的，活泼的【记忆】联想记忆：b+risk（冒险）→喜欢冒险的人→敏捷的，活泼的

sentences.english: a brisk walk
sentences.chinese: 轻快的行走

sentences.english: They set off at a brisk pace .
sentences.chinese: 他们踏着轻快的步伐上路了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的， 生气勃勃的； 兴隆的， 繁忙活跃的； 寒冷而清新的
detailed_translations.english: quick and full of energy

name: centigrade
trans: n./adj. 摄氏度（的）；百分度（的）【记忆】词根记忆：centi（百）+grad（度）+e→百分度的【搭配】centigrade thermometer 摄氏温度计

sentences.english: ...daytime temperatures of up to forty degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: …高达40摄氏度的日间气温。

sentences.english: The number at the bottom is the recommended water temperature in centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 底部的数字为建议性摄氏度水温。

detailed_translations.english: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

name: chilly
trans: adj. 寒冷的【同根】chill n. 寒冷

sentences.chinese: 天冷了，是不是？

sentences.english: The bathroom’s a bit chilly.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里有点冷。

detailed_translations.english: chilly weather or places are cold enough to make you feel uncomfortable

trans: adj. 有湿气的，潮湿的【搭配】damp course 防水层；防湿层【同义】moist adj. 潮湿的

sentences.chinese: 墙上留下了潮湿的痕迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使潮湿；使阻尼；使沮丧，抑制

water in walls or in the air that causes things to be slightly wet
slightly wet, often in an unpleasant way

name: dank
trans: adj. 湿冷的，阴冷的

sentences.chinese: 阴冷的牢房

detailed_translations.english: unpleasantly wet and cold

sentences.chinese: 露水在叶片上聚集。

detailed_translations.english: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night

sentences.chinese: …躲避一场突如其来的瓢泼大雨。

weather that is a combination of light rain and mist

trans: n. 华氏温度计；adj. 华氏温度计的，华氏的

sentences.chinese: 有人问他华氏温标下水的沸点。

detailed_translations.english: Fahrenheit is also a noun

trans: adj. 有雾的【搭配】foggy morning 雾蒙蒙的早晨

sentences.english: driving in foggy conditions

trans: adj. 冰冷的【同根】freeze v. 冰冻

sentences.chinese: 房子里冷极了，我不可以开暖气吗？

sentences.english: We were freezing cold in the tent last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我们在帐篷里都冻僵了。

sentences.english: freezing fog
sentences.chinese: 冰雾

detailed_translations.english: extremely cold

name: frigid
trans: adj. 寒冷的，严寒的【同根】frigidity n. 冷淡

sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: frost
trans: n. 霜【同根】frosty adj. 结霜的

sentences.english: the risk of frost damage to crops
sentences.chinese: 庄稼遭受霜冻灾害的危险

detailed_translations.english: very cold weather, when water freezes

name: hail
trans: n. 冰雹【搭配】hail storm 冰雹风暴

sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

trans: n. 阴霾【同根】hazy adj. 朦胧的；模糊的

sentences.chinese: 太阳被一片金色烟霞笼罩。

detailed_translations.english: smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through
to make or become hazy

trans: adj. 湿的，潮湿的，湿润的【搭配】humid air 潮湿的空气humid climate 湿润的气候

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: light air
trans: 一级风，软风

name: mist
trans: n. 薄雾【搭配】in mist 在薄雾之中

sentences.english: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。

sentences.english: He vanished into the mist.
sentences.chinese: 他消失在雾中。

sentences.english: The hills were shrouded in mist (= covered in mist, so that you could not see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。

sentences.english: The mist came down off the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 雾从山上飘下来。

sentences.english: The mists rolled in off the sea (= came on to the land from the sea ) .
sentences.chinese: 雾气从海上涌来。

detailed_translations.english: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

name: misty
trans: adj. 充满雾气的，薄雾笼罩的【搭配】misty morning 薄雾弥漫的早晨

sentences.english: a cold, misty morning
sentences.chinese: 一个雾蒙蒙的寒冷早晨

detailed_translations.english: misty weather is weather with a lot of mist

detailed_translations.chinese: (Misty)人名；(英)米斯蒂，米丝蒂(女名)；(法)米斯蒂

name: moderate rain
trans: 中雨

name: nippy
trans: adj. 刺骨的；凛冽的

name: overcast
trans: adj. （被云、雾等）遮蔽的；阴天的；n. 阴天【搭配】overcast sky 阴天

sentences.english: Tomorrow will be overcast.
sentences.chinese: 明天是阴天。

sentences.english: The sky is overcast.
sentences.chinese: 天阴了。

sentences.english: During the daytime, it will be overcast, turning clear later.
sentences.chinese: 今天白天，阴转晴。

name: rain cats and dogs
trans: 下倾盆大雨

name: serene
trans: adj. 宁静的；晴朗的，无云的

sentences.english: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。

sentences.english: a serene mountain lake
sentences.chinese: 静谧的山间湖泊

detailed_translations.chinese: 平静的；安详的；清澈的；晴朗的
detailed_translations.english: very calm or peaceful

name: shower
trans: n. 阵雨【搭配】heavy shower 一阵大雨

sentences.english: Why does the phone always ring when I’m in the shower?
sentences.chinese: 为什么电话铃总是在我洗澡的时候响？

sentences.english: I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，我想用一下这里的淋浴。

sentences.english: The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle (= a shower in a separate part of the room ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫生间里有一个独立的淋浴间。

sentences.english: I need a shower.
sentences.chinese: 我需要洗个淋浴。

sentences.english: Mike shaved and showered.
sentences.chinese: 迈克刮了脸，冲了个淋浴。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body

name: sleet
trans: n. 雨夹雪；vi. 下雨夹雪

sentences.english: Photo Tip: When shooting in cold weather, or extreme conditions such as snow and sleet, it's important not to change your lenses outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 拍照小技巧：在寒冷的天气里，或者遇到极端天气的时候，如下雪或者雨夹雪，想要拍照，最重要的是注意不要在户外更换镜头。

sentences.english: The three boys threw their hockey gear to the top of the hill and tried crawling up the path, but the sleet had created a smooth glacier with nothing to hold on to.
sentences.chinese: 三个男孩儿把他们的冰球装备扔到山顶上，然后试着沿小路往上爬，但雨夹雪已经令山坡变得更加的滑，而且没有任何可以抓住的东西。

detailed_translations.english: half-frozen rain that falls when it is very cold

name: smog
trans: n. 烟雾【同根】smoggy adj. 烟雾弥漫的

sentences.english: Cars cause pollution, both smog and acid rain.
sentences.chinese: 汽车引起污染，既有烟雾又有酸雨。

detailed_translations.english: dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and  fog  , caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities

name: snowflake
trans: n. 雪花，雪片【记忆】词根记忆：snow（雪）+flake（小片）→雪花

sentences.english: The gift, the snowflake, the starry sky, the moonlight all give you.
sentences.chinese: 礼物，雪花，满天星斗的天空，在月光下的所有给你。

sentences.english: Bell is my greetings, singing is my blessing, snowflake is my card, wine is my kiss, the breeze is I embrace, happiness is my gift!
sentences.chinese: 钟声是我的问候，歌声是我的祝福，雪花是我的贺卡，美酒是我的飞吻，清风是我的拥抱，快乐是我的礼物！

sentences.english: Moonlight Christmas and snowflake bless my speech as you, I give you with blessings, are you happy?
sentences.chinese: 圣诞的月光和雪花都不如你祝福我的话语，我把同的祝福给你，你快乐吗？

name: storm

sentences.english: The governor found himself at the center of a political storm .
sentences.chinese: 州长发现自己处于一场政治风暴的中心。

sentences.english: An angry crowd stormed the embassy.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的人群突然袭击大使馆。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people suddenly express very strong feelings about something that someone has said or done
