name: stuffy
trans: adj. 不透气的；闷热的【搭配】hot and stuffy 闷热

sentences.english: It’s getting stuffy in here – do you mind if I open the window?
sentences.chinese: 这里越来越闷了，我开开窗行吗？

detailed_translations.english: (of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air

name: swelter
trans: vi. 热得难受；n. 闷热【同根】sweltering adj. 酷热的

name: tepid
trans: adj. 微温的

sentences.english: a tepid response from the audience
sentences.chinese: 观众冷淡的反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 微温的，温热的；不太热烈的；不热情的
detailed_translations.english: a feeling, reaction etc that is tepid shows a lack of excitement or interest

name: averse
trans: v. 不赞成，反对

sentences.english: Some banks are risk averse (=  do not like taking a risk  ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些银行不喜欢冒风险。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to do something or not liking something

name: disapprove
trans: v. 不赞成，反对；不批准，不同意【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+approve（赞成）→不赞成

sentences.english: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道父母会反对，但我还是去了。

sentences.english: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人极不赞同她的行为。

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong

name: frown
trans: v. 皱眉；反对【记忆】联想记忆：f（音似：翻）+row（看作brow眉毛，额头）+n→翻眉毛→皱眉

sentences.english: She frowned as she read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她看着信皱起了眉头。

detailed_translations.english: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

name: hostility
trans: n. 敌意，敌对，对抗；抵制，反对，否决；[pl.] 交战，战争【记忆】词根记忆：host（敌人）+ility→敌意，敌对

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

name: object
trans:
n. 物体；对象；目标；宾语；/əbˈdʒekt/
 v. 反对，不赞成【记忆】词根记忆：ob（反）+ject（扔）→反向扔→反对

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: objection
trans: n. 反对；反对的理由

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: opponent
trans: n. 敌手，对手；反对者；adj. 对立的；对抗的【记忆】词根记忆：op（相反）+pon（放置）+ ent（人）→反着站的人→对手，敌手

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: agonize
trans: vi. 苦苦思索【记忆】词根记忆：agon（挣扎）+ize→苦苦挣扎→苦苦思索

sentences.english: As a mother, I agonize over what my children will inherit.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个母亲，我对我的孩子们将要继承的东西感到极度痛苦。

name: chew
trans: v. 咀嚼；思量【搭配】chew over 深思熟虑；详细讨论

sentences.english: This meat’s so tough I can hardly chew it!
sentences.chinese: 这肉太老了，我几乎嚼不动！

detailed_translations.english: the act of biting something many times with your teeth
to bite food several times before swallowing it

name: considerate
trans: adj. 考虑周到的【同根】inconsiderate adj. 不体贴的；轻率的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: contemplate
trans: v. 盘算；沉思【同根】contemplation n. 沉思，思考contemplative adj. 爱思考的

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: haunt
trans: vt. （思想，回忆等）萦绕在心头

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: recall
trans: v. 回忆起【记忆】词根记忆：re（向后）+call（想）→回忆起

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: meditate
trans: v. 沉思，冥想【同根】meditation n. 冥想，沉思

sentences.english: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
sentences.chinese: 她静静地坐着，思考着这一天发生的事。

sentences.english: I try to meditate for half an hour every evening.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想,考虑；(尤指宗教上的)沉思,冥想
detailed_translations.english: to think seriously and deeply about something

name: muse
trans: vi./n. 沉思，冥想【记忆】Muse（希腊神话中的缪斯女神）

sentences.english: The sloth-like times come when we lose touch with our inner muse.
sentences.chinese: 当我们与内心沉思失去联系的时候，懒惰就会出现。

sentences.english: I want to be a better writer and maybe my muse will provide the motivation.
sentences.chinese: 我希望成为一名更好的作者，也许我的沉思将为我提供动力。

sentences.english: Initially it will be really hard to ignore the mind that wants to plan for the future and muse about the past, but with time you will see through its insanity.
sentences.chinese: 开始时，忽视想要计划将来沉思过去的思想是很困难的，但是随着时间的推移，你将看穿它的荒谬。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a way that shows you are thinking about it carefully

name: nostalgic
trans: adj. 思乡的；怀旧的【同根】nostalgia n. 乡愁；怀旧之情

sentences.english: Seeing those old school photographs has made me feel quite nostalgic.
sentences.chinese: 看到那些学生时代的旧照片，我不禁产生了怀旧之情。

sentences.english: a nostalgic look back at the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 对20世纪50年代的怀念

detailed_translations.english: if you feel nostalgic about a time in the past, you feel happy when you remember it, and in some ways you wish that things had not changed

name: pensive
trans: adj. 沉思的【记忆】词根记忆：pens（悬挂）+ive→悬挂于心的→沉思的

sentences.english: Jan looked pensive.
sentences.chinese: 简神情忧伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的
detailed_translations.english: thinking a lot about something, especially because you are worried or sad

name: ponder
trans: v. 思索，考虑【记忆】词根记忆：pond（重量）+er→掂重量→仔细考虑→沉思

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: preoccupation
trans: n. 主要考虑因素；全神贯注【搭配】take one's preoccupation with 全神贯注，专心致志于

sentences.english: Karouzos's poetry shows a profound preoccupation with the Orthodox Church.
sentences.chinese: 卡鲁佐斯的诗歌表现出对东正教的深切关注。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见
detailed_translations.english: when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

name: recollect
trans: vt. 回忆【记忆】词根记忆：re（重新）+collect（收集）→重新收集（记忆）→回忆【同根】recollection n. 回忆

sentences.english: All I recollect is a grey sky.
sentences.chinese: 我只记得一片灰色的天空。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回忆,想起,记起,忆起,记得
detailed_translations.english: to be able to remember something

name: speculate
trans: v. 推测；深思【同根】speculation n. 推测speculative adj. 推测的；投机的

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: common
trans: adj. 普通的；平常的【搭配】in common with 与…一样

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

name: mammal
trans: n. 哺乳动物【记忆】词根记忆：mamm（乳房）+al（表物）→哺乳动物【搭配】marine mammal 海洋哺乳动物【同根】mammalian adj. 哺乳动物的，哺乳纲的

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: reptile
trans: n. 爬行动物；卑鄙的人【记忆】词根记忆：rept（爬）+ile→爬行动物【同根】reptilian adj. 爬虫类的

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: remote
trans: adj. 长久的；遥远的，偏僻的；远程的；关系疏远的，脱离的；绝少的，微乎其微的；孤高的，冷淡的【记忆】词根记忆：re（反）+mot（移动）+e →向后移动→疏远的【搭配】remote control 遥控器remote chance/possibility 机会很小remote sensing technology 遥感技术a remote village 偏僻的村庄

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: ancestor
trans: n. 祖先【记忆】词根记忆：an（加强）+cest（=cess行走）+ or（表人）→走了很久的人→祖先【搭配】ancestor worship 祖先崇拜，敬奉祖先

sentences.english: My ancestors were French.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

name: marine
trans: adj. 海的；海生的，海中的【搭配】marine radar 航海雷达

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: various
trans: adj. 各种各样的；不同的；多方面的【记忆】词根记忆：vari（变化）+ous（…的）→变化的→各种各样的

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: worm-like
trans: adj. 蠕虫状

name: creature
trans: n. 生物，动物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: primeval
trans: adj. 远古的；原始的【记忆】词根记忆：prim（最初）+ev（时代）+ al（…的）→最早时间的→原始的

sentences.english: Primeval clouds of gas formed themselves into stars.
sentences.chinese: 原生气团形成了恒星。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the earliest time in the existence of the universe or the Earth

name: bacteria
trans: n. 细菌

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

name: clam
trans: n. 蛤

sentences.english: clam chowder (= a type of soup )
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊杂烩汤

detailed_translations.chinese: 捞蛤；保持沉默，闭嘴不言

detailed_translations.english: a  shellfish  you can eat that has a shell in two parts that open up

name: crab
trans: n. 螃蟹，类似螃蟹的动物【搭配】crab claw蟹钳

sentences.english: crab meat
sentences.chinese: 蟹肉

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large claws
to hunt or catch crabs

name: cuttlefish
trans: n. 墨鱼，乌贼

name: dolphin
trans: n. 海豚

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: Daniel: Yes, like a dolphin.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔: 嗯，像海豚一样。

detailed_translations.english: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

name: jellyfish
trans: n. 水母【记忆】合成词：jelly（果冻）+fish（鱼）→果冻一样透明的鱼→水母

sentences.english: But many marine experts have been saying for several years that we need to start loving jellyfish – because in the not too distant future, they may be the most plentiful marine species around.
sentences.chinese: 但是，多年来，许多海洋专家一直在说，我们需要开始热爱水母——因为在不远的将来，它们也许是我们周围最丰富的海洋物种。

sentences.english: Mr. Loughlin and others at the beach said it took a while for everyone to realize what was happening, because jellyfish stings are so rare at the beach.
sentences.chinese: 洛夫林先生和其他在海滩上的人说，过了好一会儿，大家才意识到发生了什么，因为水母蜇人在这片海滩上实属罕见。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal that has a round transparent body and can sting you

name: lobster
trans: n. 龙虾

sentences.english: She sold me a couple of live lobsters.
sentences.chinese: 她卖给了我几只活龙虾。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal with eight legs, a shell, and two large claws

name: octopus
trans: n. 章鱼

sentences.english: ...plates of octopus.
sentences.chinese: …一盘盘章鱼肉。

detailed_translations.english: a sea creature with eight tentacles (= arms )

name: oyster
trans: n. 牡蛎，耗

sentences.english: How can I pull the pearl from the burning oyster?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

detailed_translations.english: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl

name: plankton
trans: n. 浮游生物

sentences.english: ...its usual diet of plankton and other small organisms.
sentences.chinese: ...它通常赖以为食的浮游生物和其他微生物。

detailed_translations.english: the very small forms of plant and animal life that live in water, especially the sea, and are eaten by fish

name: porpoise
trans: n. 钝吻海豚

sentences.english: The rays are often seen gathering in groups near the surface, “flying” through the water by flapping their pectoral fins and sometimes even leaping porpoise-like into the air.
sentences.chinese: 魟鱼经常会成群的聚集在水面以下，通过拍动胸鳍在水中“飞行”，有时候甚至会像海豚一样跃出海面。

sentences.english: The Baiji Conservation Aquarium has already scored small successes with a similar breeding scheme aimed at averting the extinction of the endangered Yangtze finless porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 为防止这种无鳍海豚的灭绝，白鳍豚保护水族馆采用相同的培育方法已经取得了一些成就。

sentences.english: Still, she cautions that it's possible that the Dall's porpoise hunt in Japan may harm subpopulations of that animal, which numbers more than a million worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他警告在日本的捕猎可能危害白腰鼠海豚的亚种的安全，尽管白腰鼠海豚全种在地球上有一百多万只。

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal that looks similar to a  dolphin  and breathes air

name: prawn
trans: n. 对虾，明虾，大虾

sentences.english: a prawn sandwich
sentences.chinese: 明虾三明治

sentences.english: prawn cocktail (= a small dish of prawns in a sauce with some salad )
sentences.chinese: 大虾冷盘

detailed_translations.english: a small pink  shellfish  that can be eaten

name: salmon
trans: n. 鲑鱼，大马哈鱼

sentences.english: The salmon was brought to the table whole, garnished with parsley and slices of tomato and cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

sentences.english: State authorities have ordered cutbacks in deliveries of water from the delta because of the threat to endangered species of salmon and smelt.
sentences.chinese: 由于鲑鱼和胡瓜鱼这些濒危物种受到威胁，国家当局已经要求消减从该三角洲往外输水的量。

detailed_translations.english: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs

name: sardine
trans: n. 沙丁鱼

sentences.english: commuters packed like sardines on the evening train
sentences.chinese: 晚班火车上挤得像沙丁鱼一样的通勤乘客

detailed_translations.english: a small young fish that is often packed in flat metal boxes when it is sold as food

name: scale
trans: n. 鳞片；碍眼物

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: seagull
trans: n. 海鸥

sentences.english: Before he learned this, however, he found that moving more than one feather at that speed will spin you like a rifle ball... and Jonathan had flown the first aerobatics of any seagull on earth.
sentences.chinese: 他在学到这一点之前，还发现在那样的速度下，只要转动一两根羽毛就可以像陀螺似地旋转……于是乔纳森成了世界上第一只做特技动作的海鸥。

detailed_translations.english: a large common grey or white bird that lives near the sea

name: shrimp
trans: n. 小虾

sentences.english: I also got a microscope set and watched shrimp grow and things like that.
sentences.chinese: 我还得到过一个显微镜，观察小虾的成长和这些类似的事情。

sentences.english: The host generally pays, and no one needs to hear you gripe about appetizer prices or shrimp count.
sentences.chinese: 主人通常都会支付账单，没人想要听到你抱怨关于开胃菜的价格或者小虾的个数。

sentences.english: In summer midnight snack time, if you come across the Baisha street intersection, a big line of persons sitting by the avenue for taste the spicy shrimp .
sentences.chinese: 夏天里消夜时间你如果经过白沙路口就可以看到这儿林荫道上坐了一大排人，没错，他们就是冲着口味虾来的。

detailed_translations.english: a small sea creature that you can eat, which has ten legs and a soft shell

name: starfish
trans: n. 海星

sentences.english: She lays a kindly hand like a tiny starfish on my knee.
sentences.chinese: 她和善地伸出手，像小海星一样放在我的膝盖上。

sentences.english: In the oceans, you can find starfish and sea horses. They are interesting and beautiful sea animals.
sentences.chinese: 在海洋中，你能看到海星以及海马，它们都是很有趣并且美丽的海洋动物。

sentences.english: One reason is their diet: They eat only starfish (and sometimes sea urchins), and they reportedly prefer to eat them alive.
sentences.chinese: 原因之一是它们的饮食：它们只能吃到海星（有时是海胆），据报道它们喜欢吃活的。

detailed_translations.english: a flat sea animal that has five arms forming the shape of a star

name: walrus
trans: n. 海象

sentences.english: Morse was yet another name that appeared before walrus and seems to have spread to other languages only to drop out of use in English.
sentences.chinese: 莫尔斯是另一个在海象流传以前就存在的名称，并且似乎已经传播到其他语言而唯独在英语中退出了。

detailed_translations.english: a large sea animal with two long tusks(= things like teeth ) coming down from the sides of its mouth

name: beak
trans: n. 鸟嘴，喙

sentences.english: ...a black bird with a yellow beak.
sentences.chinese: …一只有着黄喙的黑鸟。

detailed_translations.english: the hard pointed mouth of a bird

name: bill
trans: n. 鸟嘴

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: canary
trans: n. 金丝雀

sentences.english: Tommy: I cleaned the bird cage and the canary disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 汤米：我刚才打扫鸟笼来着，金丝雀不见了。

sentences.english: Your software project might have its own kind of pit canary.
sentences.chinese: 您的软件项目也可以有自己的矿井金丝雀。

sentences.english: Look for some petal earth tones like canary yellow and light natural shades like aqua! There will be soon a dramatic transformation in your wedding that soon forms a fab.
sentences.chinese: 不妨寻找一些如金丝雀黄或如水流动的天然亮色作为裙摆的颜色，这将会使你的婚礼有一个充满戏剧性的出人意料的改变！

detailed_translations.english: a small yellow bird that people often keep as a pet

name: eagle
trans: n. 鹰

sentences.english: The eagle drooped its wings.
sentences.chinese: 那只鹰收拢双翅做俯冲。

sentences.english: Maybe they could not hold on to the arrival of the spring, but the female eagle thought what if their father could bring back the food?
sentences.chinese: 它们或许已经挨不到春天的到来了。 雌鹰这样想，但如果它们的爸爸会把食物带来呢？

sentences.english: She lacks the skill to accomplish this, but recognizes that an eagle can help her.
sentences.chinese: 她缺乏完成这项任务的能力，不过她认识到老鹰可以帮助她。

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

name: falcon
trans: n. 隼，猎鹰

sentences.english: Animals representing mythical powers and military might surrounded him—pumas, a wolf, eagles, a falcon, an owl, and rattlesnakes—some buried alive in cages.
sentences.chinese: 一些动物作为神和军事的力量的象征置放在他的周围——美洲狮、狼、鹰、隼、猫头鹰、响尾蛇——装在笼子里一起活埋。

detailed_translations.english: a bird that kills and eats other animals and can be trained to hunt

name: finch
trans: n. 鸣禽

sentences.english: We wake every morning to the sound of a finch singing.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨醒来时还能听到燕雀的歌唱。

sentences.english: One species of finch learned to pick up a cactus needle to poke for insects.
sentences.chinese: 有一种雀科小鸟学会捡起仙人掌针去戳得昆虫猎物。

detailed_translations.english: a small bird with a short beak

name: fowl
trans: n. 家禽，禽；禽肉

sentences.english: Carve the fowl into 8 pieces.
sentences.chinese: 将这只家禽切成8块。

detailed_translations.english: a bird, such as a chicken, that is kept for its meat and eggs, or the meat of this type of bird

name: ostrich
trans: n. 鸵鸟，回避现实的人

sentences.english: Some Italians eat donkeys; South Africans eat ostrich.
sentences.chinese: 有些意大利人吃驴；南非人吃鸵鸟。

sentences.english: He could not say what a parrot or even the unmistakable ostrich was.
sentences.chinese: 他说不清楚鹦鹉是什么或者连不会认错的鸵鸟也不知道。

sentences.english: Although reporters know that the ostrich policy is aimed at appeasing the authorities, they still don’t like it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管记者们清楚知道鸵鸟政策是为了迎合当局者，他们还是不喜欢这样。

detailed_translations.english: a large African bird with long legs, that runs very quickly but cannot fly

name: peacock
trans: n. 孔雀

sentences.english: Each pea and peach on the beach can be reached by the peacock.
sentences.chinese: 海滩上的每一颗豌豆和桃子孔雀都能触及.

sentences.english: In the evening breeze her pet peacock sat drowsing on its perch, and the pigeons were silent in their corner.
sentences.chinese: 在黄昏的微风中，她宠爱的孔雀蹬在栖木上打睡瞌，她的鸽子沉默地站在它们的角落里。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird, the male of which has long blue and green tail feathers that it can lift up and spread out

name: turkey
trans: n. 火鸡

sentences.english: roast turkey
sentences.chinese: 烤火鸡

detailed_translations.english: a bird that looks like a large chicken and is often eaten at Christmas and at Thanksgiving

name: vulture
trans: n. 秃鹫；贪婪的人

sentences.english: He hadn’t been dead five minutes before those vultures from the media were after his widow.
sentences.chinese: 他尸骨未寒，媒体那帮家伙就对他的遗孀进行了围追堵截。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird that eats dead animals

name: aerobic
trans: adj. 需氧的；增氧健身法的【搭配】aerobic bacteria 需氧细菌

sentences.english: running, swimming, and other forms of aerobic exercise
sentences.chinese: 跑步、游泳及其他有氧健身运动

detailed_translations.english: using oxygen

name: anaerobic
trans: adj. 厌氧的【搭配】anaerobic bacteria 厌氧菌

sentences.english: anaerobic bacteria
sentences.chinese: 厌氧菌

detailed_translations.chinese: [微] 厌氧的，[微] 厌气的；没有气而能生活的
detailed_translations.english: not needing oxygen in order to live

name: antibody
trans: n. 抗体【记忆】词根记忆：anti（反）+body（身体）→抗体

sentences.english: Such women carry antibodies which make their blood more likely to clot during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 这样的女性携带在孕期使她们的血液更可能凝结的抗体。

detailed_translations.english: a substance produced by your body to fight disease

name: bacillus
trans: n. 杆菌【记忆】复数形式写作bacilli

name: bacteriological
trans: adj. 细菌学的【搭配】bacteriological weapon 细菌武器

name: colony
trans: n. 菌落；殖民地【同根】colonial adj. 殖民地的

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: decline phase
trans: 衰亡期

name: decompose
trans: v. 分解，（使）腐烂【搭配】decompose into 分解为

sentences.english: a partially decomposed body
sentences.chinese: 部分腐烂的尸体

detailed_translations.english: to decay or make something decay

name: degradation
trans: n. 降解【同根】degrade v. 贬低；降级；降解

sentences.english: ...air pollution, traffic congestion, and the steady degradation of our quality of life.
sentences.chinese: …空气污染、交通阻塞以及我们生活质量的持续恶化。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: disinfection
trans: n. 消毒【同根】disinfect vt. 给…消毒

name: exponential growth
trans: 指数生长

name: fermentation
trans: n. 发酵【同根】ferment v./n. 发酵；动乱

sentences.english: But thrumming underneath it is a deep layer of culinary funkreminiscent of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 但敲打底部是深一层的使人想起的厨房的恐怖的发酵。

sentences.english: At that time, any fish caught had to be preserved. The only method possible was by fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代，所有捕来的鱼都要被贮存起来，唯一可能的贮存方法就是发酵。

sentences.english: They baited others with CO2 produced by fermentation when yeast is mixed with a sugar solution.
sentences.chinese: 他们用酵母与糖溶液混合后发酵产生的CO2作为另一些陷阱的饵。

name: fission
trans: n. 分裂生殖（法）；裂变【同根】fissionable adj. 可引起核分裂的fissility n. 易裂性

sentences.english: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentences.chinese: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制。

sentences.english: Essentially, all the neutrons and part of the gamma rays are emitted in the actual fission process .
sentences.chinese: 从根本上说，所有的中子和一部分射线都是在裂变实际的过程中放射出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion

name: fungus
trans: n. 真菌【记忆】复数形式写作fungi

sentences.english: The roses have fungus.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花长了真菌。

sentences.english: So how do you kill a fungus without harming its host?
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，我们如何才能做到不伤害宿主只杀死真菌呢?。

sentences.english: Monokaryons of this fungus will grow readily as saprophytes in plate or liquid culture .
sentences.chinese: 这种真菌的单核体在平板或液体培养时能像腐生菌那样容易生长。

detailed_translations.english: a simple type of plant that has no leaves or flowers and that grows on plants or other surfaces.  mushrooms  and  mould  are both fungi.

name: germ
trans: n. 微生物，细菌【搭配】carry germs 携带病菌

sentences.english: Put disinfectant down the toilet to kill any germs.
sentences.chinese: 在抽水马桶里投放消毒剂杀菌。

sentences.english: germ cells containing DNA
sentences.chinese: 含DNA的生殖细胞

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that can make you ill

name: germiculture
trans: n. 细菌培养【记忆】词根记忆：germ（细菌）+i+culture（培养） →细菌培养

name: inconspicuous
trans: adj. 不显眼的【搭配】inconspicuous consumption 隐性消费

sentences.english: an inconspicuous little restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家不起眼的小饭店

sentences.english: She stood by the wall, trying to look inconspicuous.
sentences.chinese: 她贴墙站着，尽量不引人注目。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不显眼的,不引人注意的
detailed_translations.english: not easily seen or noticed

name: infection
trans: n. 感染【搭配】bacterial infection 细菌感染

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: invisible
trans: adj. 肉眼看不见的【搭配】invisible to the naked eye 肉眼看不见的

sentences.english: The house was surrounded by trees, and invisible from the road.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子树木环绕，从路上是看不见的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is invisible cannot be seen

name: involution form
trans: 衰老型

name: log phase
trans: 对数期

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物【记忆】词根记忆：micro（微小）+be（=bio生命）→微生物【同根】microbial adj. 微生物的

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: microbiology
trans: n. 微生物学【同根】microbiologist n. 微生物学家

sentences.english: ...a professor of microbiology and immunology.
sentences.chinese: ...一位微生物学和免疫学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of very small living things such as  bacteria

name: microorganism
trans: n. 微生物，细菌【搭配】pathogenic microorganism 病原微生物

sentences.english: This is actually just a microorganism. But it has roughly 500 genes.
sentences.chinese: 这其实只不过是一个微生物，却拥有约500个基因。

sentences.english: Spread the contents of the amber onto a petri dish containing a microorganism food like starch or soy.
sentences.chinese: 把琥珀内嵌标本放在皮氏培养皿中，并加入微生物食品，比如淀粉或大豆。

sentences.english: Slight mutations that allow a microorganism to resist the full killing power of a medicine are an evolutionary advantage that greatly expedites the development of drug resistance.
sentences.chinese: 略微的突变即可使微生物具有抵抗力，使药物完全失去杀伤力，这种突变是一个进化优势，大大加快了耐药性的产生。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a  microscope

name: microscope
trans: n. 显微镜【搭配】electron microscope 电子显微镜

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

name: multiply
trans: v. 繁殖【搭配】multiply ceaselessly 不停地增加

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: pathogen
trans: n. 病原体【同根】pathogenic adj. 病原的；致病的

sentences.english: This would introduce only a small number of GM plants into the environment, so farmers could choose not to harvest them while still benefiting from their pathogen-detecting ability.
sentences.chinese: 这只需要把少量转基因作物引入到环境中，因此农民可以选择不收获它们，同时仍然享受它们的病原体探测能力的益处。

sentences.english: Scientists talk about the 'virulence' of a pathogen, but what does that mean to laypeople?
sentences.chinese: 科学家谈论一种病原体的“毒力”，但是这对于普通人的意义是什么？

detailed_translations.english: something that causes disease in your body

name: rot away
trans: 腐烂

name: stationary phase
trans: 稳定期

name: sterilisation
trans: n. 灭菌【同根】sterilise vt. 杀菌；消毒

name: vaccine
trans: n. 疫苗【同根】vaccinate vt. 预防接种vaccination n. 接种疫苗

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: virus
trans: n. 病毒【同根】viral adj. 病毒的，病毒引起的

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: finished
trans: adj. 完成的【记忆】词根记忆：finish（完成）+ed（…的）→完成的

sentences.english: I’m almost finished.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多完成了。

detailed_translations.english: no longer doing, dealing with, or using something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完成；结束；毁掉（finish的过去分词形式）

name: product
trans: n. 产物，产品【搭配】product development产品开发

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: dominate
trans: v. 支配，统治；耸立于【记忆】词根记忆：domin（=dom控制）+ate（表动词）→紧紧控制→支配，统治【同根】domination n. 支配，控制dominance n. 统治

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: flow
trans: v./n. 流；流动

sentences.english: a new road system to improve traffic flow through the city centre
sentences.chinese: 疏导市中心车流的新道路系统

sentences.english: These gates regulate the amount of water flowing into the canal.
sentences.chinese: 这些闸门调节流入运河的水量。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity
when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

name: thanks to
trans: 由于；多亏

name: technological
trans: adj. 科技的；技术的【搭配】technological advances 技术进步

sentences.english: The steam engine was the greatest technological advance of the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

detailed_translations.english: related to technology

name: advance
trans: adj. 预先的；先行的；v. 前进；取得进展；预付；n. 前进；求爱；预付（款等）【搭配】in advance 预先，提前book in advance 提前预订advanced progress 最新进展

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen

sentences.english: a hotel lobby
sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: lounge
trans: n. 休息室

sentences.english: the television lounge
sentences.chinese: 电视放映室

detailed_translations.english: a public room in a hotel or other building, that is used by many people as a place to relax

name: porch
trans: n. 门廊，走廊

sentences.english: He was standing on the porch, waving as we drove away.
sentences.chinese: 我们开车离开的时候，他站在走廊上向我们挥手。

detailed_translations.english: an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church

name: sanctum
trans: n. 私室，密所

sentences.english: Occasionally she would be allowed into the inner sanctum of his office.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔她也获准进入他那私密的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: a private place or room that only a few important people are allowed to enter – often used humorously

name: schoolroom
trans: n. 书房

sentences.english: They seemed like so many little flags dotted about the schoolroom.
sentences.chinese: 这些卡片就像无数面小旗点缀着教室。

sentences.english: One day, all of a sudden, he proposed that each one in turn should jump off the bench in our schoolroom.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他突然提议大家都轮流从教室的椅子上跳下去。

sentences.english: A clear example of this nationalism was displayed in the schoolroom, where one whole corner was given over to pictures and the pronouncements of Atatürk, the founder of the Turkish republic.
sentences.chinese: 关于这种民族主义的一个明显是例证就在学校的教室里，有一整个角落给了阿塔托克（Atatürk）的肖像和宣言，他是土耳其共和国的创始人。

detailed_translations.english: a room used for teaching in a small school

name: sewer
trans: n. 下水道；阴沟

sentences.english: ...the city's sewer system.
sentences.chinese: …该城市的下水道系统。

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or passage under the ground that carries away waste material and used water from houses, factories etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…铺设污水管道；用下水道排除…的污水
detailed_translations.english: to provide with sewers
to provide with sewers

name: single room
trans: 单人间

name: skyscraper
trans: n. 摩天大楼【记忆】联想记忆：sky（天）+scrape（摩擦）+r →可以擦到天→摩天大楼

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

detailed_translations.english: a very tall modern city building

name: to lay the foundation
trans: 打地基

name: storehouse
trans: n. 储藏室【记忆】合成词：store（仓库）+house（房子）→储藏室

name: spacious
trans: adj. 宽广的，广阔的，宽敞的【记忆】词根记忆：spac（看作space，空间）+ ious（多…的）→空间很多的→广阔的，宽敞的

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: evidence
trans: n. 根据，证据；形迹，迹象【记忆】词根记忆：e+vid（看见）+ence→证实所看见的人或物→根据，证据【搭配】a piece of evidence 一项证据in evidence 明显的

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: fascinating
trans: adj. 迷人的【搭配】find sth. fascinating 发现某物吸引人

sentences.english: a fascinating book
sentences.chinese: 一本引人入胜的书

sentences.english: That sounds absolutely fascinating .
sentences.chinese: 那听起来极具吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 有极大吸引力的
detailed_translations.english: extremely interesting

name: anecdote
trans: n. 短故事；轶事【记忆】联想记忆：a+nec（看作neck，脖子）+ dote（溺爱）→一个人伸着脖子爱听的轶事、奇闻【同根】anecdotal adj. 轶事的，趣闻的

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: similarity
trans: n. 相似【记忆】词根记忆：similar（类似的）+ity（情况，性质）→相似

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

name: exception
trans: n. 例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: norm-referenced
trans: n. 常模参照测验

name: analogy
trans: n. 推理；类比【记忆】词根记忆：ana（并列）+log（说话）+ y→放在一起说→类比【同根】analogous adj. 类似的【同义】likeness n. 相似

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: comparable
trans: adj. 可比较的，类似的；比得上的【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+par（平等）+ able →都是平等的→可比较的【同义】similar adj. 相似的，类似的like adj. 相似的，同样的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: homogeneous
trans: adj. 同种族（种类）的【记忆】词根记忆：homo（同类）+gene（基因）+ ous（有…性质的）→基因相同的→同种族（种类）的【搭配】homogeneous light 单色光，均匀光a homogeneous mixture 均匀混合物【同义】kindred adj. 同类的，类似的【反义】heterogeneous adj. 异类的，不同的dissimilar adj. 不同的，相异的

sentences.english: a homogeneous society
sentences.chinese: 同种族人组成的社会

detailed_translations.english: consisting of people or things that are all of the same type

name: uniform
trans: n. 制服；adj. 相同的，一致的【记忆】词根记忆：uni（单一）+form（形式）→形式统一的→相同的【搭配】in uniform 穿着制服的【同根】uniformity n. 同样，一致

sentences.english: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

detailed_translations.chinese: 统一的；一致的；相同的；均衡的；始终如一的
detailed_translations.english: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

name: differ
trans: v. 不同，相异；（在意见方面）发生分歧

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: differentiate
trans: v. （使）不同，区分，区别【记忆】词根记忆：different（不同）+iate（使…）→（使）不同【同根】differentiation n. 区别，差别【同义】discriminate v. 歧视，区别

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: discrepancy
trans: n. 不同；矛盾【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+crep（破裂）+ ancy →裂开→矛盾【同义】difference n. 差别，分歧【反义】accord n. 一致，符合

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

name: distinct
trans: adj. 清楚的，明显的；有区别的，不同的【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+tinct（=stinct刺）→把刺分开后显得清楚的→清楚的，明显的【搭配】be distinct from... 与…截然不同a distinct minority 明显的少数

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 独特的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: distinction
trans: n. 差别，不同

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: diverge
trans: v. （指道路，线条等）分开；分歧，偏离【记忆】词根记忆：di（分开）+verg（转）+e→转开→分开【同根】divergent adj. 分叉的；分歧的

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

name: diverse
trans: adj. 不同的，多样的【记忆】词根记忆：di（分开）+vers（转）+e→转开→不同的【搭配】diverse culture 多元文化【同根】diversity n. 多样，千变万化

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: separate
trans:
adj. 分离的，分开的；不同的，个别的；/ˈsepəreɪt/
 v. 隔开，分开

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

name: vary
trans: v. 改变；（使）多样化；变化；不同【同根】variable adj. 易变的 n. 变量various adj. 各种各样的

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: noticeably
trans: adv. 显而易见地；明显地

name: prominence
trans: n. 突出，显著，卓越，重要；突出物，明显【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+min（突出）+ ence→向前突出→突出物

sentences.english: He came to prominence during the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 他在该世界杯期间一举成名。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being important and well known

name: significantly
trans: adv. 重大地；明显地

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

name: transparent
trans: adj. 透明的；明显的；直率的【记忆】词根记忆：trans（横过，越过）+par（看见）+ent（…的）→可以看见的→透明的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: absorbing
trans: adj. 十分吸引人的

name: addict
trans: n. 对…入迷的人【同根】addictive adj. 使人上瘾的addiction n. 上瘾

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Walt's meth-business partner, the addict Jesse, is still recovering from the drug-related death of his girlfriend Jane at the end of last season.
sentences.chinese: 而沃特的制毒搭档——瘾君子杰西还未从女朋友之死的痛苦中恢复过来。 他的女朋友简在上一季结尾时死于毒品。

name: allure
trans: n./vi. 诱惑，吸引【记忆】词根记忆：al（向）+lur（吸引）+e→诱惑

sentences.english: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到此游玩的人。

sentences.english: The allure and charm of Paris captivate all who visit there.
sentences.chinese: 它的诱惑与魅力吸引了所有到那游玩的人。

name: appealing
trans: adj. 吸引人的【搭配】appealing look 吸引人的外表

sentences.english: The city offers an appealing combination of sporting and cultural events.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市集体育活动和文化活动于一身，颇具吸引力。

sentences.english: It creates an atmosphere which visitors find so appealing .
sentences.chinese: 它创造了一种吸引游客的氛围。

detailed_translations.english: attractive or interesting

name: bait
trans: n. 鱼饵，诱饵【记忆】联想记忆：等（wait）鱼吃饵（bait）

sentences.english: We used worms as bait.
sentences.chinese: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。

sentences.english: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
sentences.chinese: 鱼儿不上钩。

sentences.english: He baited his hook with pie.
sentences.chinese: 他把馅饼放在钓钩上作饵。

sentences.english: The boys dug pits and baited them so that they could spear their prey.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们挖了陷阱，在里面放上诱饵，以便用矛刺杀猎物。

detailed_translations.english: food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them
If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it

name: charisma
trans: n. 个人魅力【记忆】词根记忆：char（可爱的）+isma→可爱的东西→个人魅力【同根】charismatic adj. 有超凡魅力的

sentences.english: He lacks charisma.
sentences.chinese: 他缺乏个人魅力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 魅力；神授的能力；非凡的领导力
detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to attract and interest other people and make them admire you

name: draw
trans: vt. 吸引

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: engrossed
trans: adj. 全神贯注的

sentences.english: Tony didn't notice because he was too engrossed in his work.
sentences.chinese: 托尼因过于全神贯注于工作而没有注意到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注的；专心致志的
detailed_translations.english: If you are engrossed in something, it holds your attention completely

name: entice
trans: vt. 诱惑，怂恿

sentences.english: To influence or lead by means of wiles; entice.
sentences.chinese: 引诱，诱骗通过使用诡计来影响或怂恿；诱使。

sentences.english: To entice all the people looking for a loo-break to stay a bit longer, locals bought the antebellum houses and turned them into restaurants and inns.
sentences.chinese: 为了诱使那些原本只想小憩一会的过客待的更久一些，当地人买下内战前的房子，改装成餐馆和旅店。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

name: fascinate
trans: v. 深深吸引，迷住【记忆】词根记忆：fascin（迷住）+ate（做）→迷住【同根】fascination n. 迷恋fascinating adj. 吸引人的

sentences.english: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.
sentences.chinese: 政治让富兰克林的父亲着迷。

detailed_translations.english: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it

name: glamorous
trans: adj. 富有魅力的，迷人的【记忆】来自glamor（n. 魅力）

sentences.english: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
sentences.chinese: 她生活奢华，充满刺激。

sentences.english: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里最繁华的街区

sentences.english: On television, she looks so glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有魅力的, 迷人的
detailed_translations.english: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

name: grip
trans: n. 紧握，抓牢；掌握，控制；v. 握紧，抓牢；吸引…的注意力（或想象力等）【搭配】be in the grip of 在…的掌控下

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: intriguing
trans: adj. 引起兴趣（或好奇心）的，吸引人的

sentences.english: The magazine carries an intriguing mixture of high fashion, gossip and racing.
sentences.chinese: 这本杂志内容丰富有趣，有关时尚、花边新闻和赛马的内容都有。

detailed_translations.english: something that is intriguing is very interesting because it is strange, mysterious, or unexpected

name: inviting
trans: adj. 动人的，诱人的

sentences.english: The log fire looked warm and inviting.
sentences.chinese: 篝火看上去温暖诱人。

detailed_translations.english: something that is inviting is very attractive and makes you want to be near it, try it, taste it etc

name: magnet

sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

trans: vt. 施催眠术；使入迷

sentences.chinese: 我第一次见到戴安娜就被她的美貌迷住了。

trans: vt. 诱使；引起…的兴趣【同根】temptation adj. 诱惑物tempting adj. 吸引人的

sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

trans: n. 人种志，人种学【记忆】词根记忆：ethno（民族）+graph（写，画）+y→人种论

trans: v. （主动）提供；n. 出价；提议【搭配】offer help提供帮助on offer出售中

sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力，深刻的了解；顿悟【记忆】联想记忆：in+sight（眼光）→眼光深入→深刻的见解【搭配】gain an insight into 看透，识破

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: present
trans:
adj. 出席的；目前的；n. 现在；礼物；/prɪˈzent/
 v. 赠送；介绍；提出【搭配】present situation 当下的状况present a problem 提出问题【同义】current adj. 现在的【同根】presentation n. 介绍会

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: valuable
trans: adj. 贵重的，有价值的；n. 贵重物品【搭配】valuable belongings 贵重的财产【同根】invaluable adj. 无价的

name: existing
trans: adj. 现存的，正在使用的【同根】exist v. 存在existence n. 存在

trans: adj. 土著的【搭配】aboriginal tribe土著部落

sentences.english: ...Aboriginal art.
sentences.chinese: …土著艺术。

an aborigine

trans: n. 成年人；adj. 成年的

sentences.chinese: 一头成年的狮子

trans: n. 先辈【记忆】词根记忆：ante（在前）+ced（走）+ent（表人）→走在前面的人→先辈

sentences.chinese: 一些患者指出，病灶出现在先前的创伤部位。

sentences.chinese: 用户然后可以使用指定的条件（比如支持和置信界限），或在先前的序列上设置限制来分析该格子。

trans: n. 类人猿；adj. 像人类的【记忆】词根记忆：anthrop（人）+oid（像…的）→像人类的

sentences.english: From the point of view of evolution, men originated millions of years ago from the anthropoid, a species commonly referred to as the ape man.
sentences.chinese: 从进化的观点来看，人类起源于几百万年前的类人猿，通常又称作猿人。

any primate of the suborder Anthropoidea, including monkeys, apes, and man

sentences.chinese: “在人类学中，你不能将同性恋和第三性别混同，”他说。

sentences.chinese: 当我还在剑桥读书的时候，我记得有一位人类学的教授拿出一张照片，上面是一根有28个切口的骨头。

sentences.english: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想成为派对上的讨厌鬼，但我认为很重要的是，要问清楚神经科学是否揭示出我们已知之外的东西，比如人类学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of people, their societies,  culture s  etc

trans: n. 宗族；部落

sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔家族

sentences.english: warring clans

detailed_translations.english: a large group of families who often share the same name

trans: n. 世系，血统【搭配】be of good descent出身好common descent共同起源，共同祖先

sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

trans: adj. 种族的；人种的【搭配】ethnic group 族群ethnic line人种

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia

trans: n. 人种学；人类文化学【记忆】词根记忆：ethn（民族）+ology（…学）→人种学

sentences.chinese: 西西伯利亚的养鹿业类型学研究是俄罗斯民族学的一个重要课题。

sentences.chinese: 从民族学的角度及当时的历史背景分析，五帝之间并非直系血缘的父子、子孙关系，而是氏族、部落发展过程中的分裂与分化。

sentences.chinese: 种族歧视的受害者

a taboo subject, word, activity etc is one that people avoid because it is extremely offensive or embarrassing

name: tribal

sentences.english: a tribal dance

sentences.english: tribal cultures
sentences.chinese: 部落文化

name: tribalism
trans: n. 部落制【记忆】词根记忆：tribal（部落的）+ism（…制度）→部落制

name: tribe
trans: n. 部落【搭配】nomadic tribe游牧部落

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

something that is needed for a particular purpose

name: hiring
trans: adj. 雇用的

sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

name: employment
trans: n. 雇用；使用；工作，职业

sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用

name: human resources

name: document

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: attain

to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

trans: vt. 认出；承认，认可【记忆】词根记忆：re+cognis（知道）+e→认出；承认【搭配】be recognised as sth. 被认成为某物【同义】identify v. 识别realise v. 认识到

name: acquire
trans: vt. 取得，获得【记忆】词根记忆：ac+quire（追求）→不断追求才能够获得→获得

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: acquisitive
trans: adj. 渴望得到的；迫切求取的；贪婪的

sentences.english: We live in an acquisitive society.
sentences.chinese: 我们活在一个贪婪的社会里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 渴望得到的， 贪婪的
detailed_translations.english: wanting to have and keep a lot of possessions

name: attainable
trans: adj. 可得到的；可达到的

sentences.english: It is unrealistic to believe perfection is an attainable goal.
sentences.chinese: 相信可以达到完美是不现实的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可获得的， 可达到的， 可实现的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is attainable can be achieved

name: attainment
trans: n. 获得

sentences.english: a low level of educational attainment
sentences.chinese: 教育程度低

detailed_translations.english: success in achieving something or reaching a particular level

name: gain
trans: v. 获得，赚到

sentences.english: After gaining independence in 1957, it was renamed ‘Ghana’.
sentences.chinese: 1957年获得独立后，该国改名为“加纳”。

sentences.english: Carrie’s gained a lot of weight recently.
sentences.chinese: 卡丽的体重最近增加了很多。

sentences.english: The Democratic Party needed a net gain of only 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 民主党只需要增20张选票。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain or achieve something you want or need
an increase in the amount or level of something

name: get
trans: v. 获得

sentences.english: We need to get help quickly!
sentences.chinese: 我们需要马上得到帮助！

sentences.english: It would be a good idea to get professional advice.
sentences.chinese: 征求专业人士的意见，这个主意很好。

sentences.english: You may be able to get a grant from the local authority.
sentences.chinese: 你也许可以从当地政府获得拨款。

sentences.english: He cleared his throat to get our attention.
sentences.chinese: 他清清嗓子来引起我们的注意。

sentences.english: What time will we get there?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候可以到那里？

sentences.english: We got to Paris that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我们到了巴黎。

sentences.english: She soon got bored with the job.
sentences.chinese: 她不久就厌倦了这份工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 获得，得到；到达；变成，成为
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by finding it, asking for it, or paying for it

name: obtain
trans: v. 获得，得到；通用，流行；存在【记忆】词根记忆：ob（附近）+tain（拿住）→就在附近，触手可及→获得，得到

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: procure
trans: v. （设法）获得，取得，得到

sentences.english: It remained very difficult to procure food, fuel, and other daily necessities.
sentences.chinese: 当时仍然很难获得食品、燃料和其他日用必需品。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

name: procurement
trans: n. 获得

sentences.english: Russia was cutting procurement of new weapons "by about 80 percent," he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说俄罗斯正“以大约百分之八十的幅度”削减新武器的补给。

detailed_translations.english: Procurement is the act of obtaining something such as supplies for an army or other organization

name: profit
trans: v. 得益，获益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: redeem
trans: v. 赎回

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: retrieve
trans: v. 重新得到

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: secure
trans: v. 得到某物，获得；防护，保卫

sentences.english: There are no secure jobs these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。

sentences.english: We want a secure future for our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。

sentences.english: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

name: seize
trans: v. 抓住，捉住；夺取，攻占；起获，没收

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: accredited
trans: adj. 认可的

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认，确认；感谢【记忆】联想记忆：ac+know（知道）+ledge→大家都知道了，所以不得不承认→承认

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；准许进入；准许加入

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: admit
trans: v. 承认；准许…进入；准许…加入【记忆】词根记忆：ad+mit（送）→能送进去→准许…进入

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: approve
trans: vt. 赞成；批准，同意【记忆】词根记忆：ap（加强）+prov（证明）+ e→证明可行→赞成【搭配】approve of... 同意…

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: authorize
trans: v. 批准，认可；授权

sentences.english: an authorized biography
sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

name: avow
trans: vt. 承认；公开宣称【记忆】词根记忆：a（加强）+vow（发誓；许愿）→公开宣称

sentences.english: He avowed his commitment to Marxist ideals.
sentences.chinese: 他宣称对马克思主义理想矢志不渝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；公开宣称；坦率承认
detailed_translations.english: to make a public statement about something you believe in

name: comply
trans: vi. 遵从；服从【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+ply（重叠）→观点共同叠在一起→服从【搭配】comply with the law 守法

sentences.english: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官说过部队会遵从停火协议。

sentences.english: Some beaches had failed to comply with environmental regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一些海滩没能遵守环保规定。

detailed_translations.english: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

name: concede
trans: v. （不情愿地）承认；让步【记忆】词根记忆：con+cede（割让）→让出去→让步

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: concession
trans: n. 让步，迁就；特许权；承认，认可【记忆】联想记忆：con（共同）+cess（行走，前进）+ion→要想大家共同进步，必须都做出让步→让步

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: connivance
trans: n. 共谋；纵容；默许

name: connive
trans: v. 默许；纵容

sentences.english: He accused them of conniving with foreign companies to weaken employment rights.
sentences.chinese: 他指控他们与外国公司共谋来削弱雇用权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 默许； 纵容； 共谋
detailed_translations.english: to not try to stop something wrong from happening

name: grant
trans: v. 同意，准予；给予，授予；n. 授予物；补助金；授权【搭配】take...for granted 想当然，认为理所当然grant a request 答应请求

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

trans: v. 点头；点头赞同

sentences.english: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。

sentences.english: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
sentences.chinese: 我向门卫出示了卡片，他友善地点了点头。

detailed_translations.english: an act of nodding

name: permissible
trans: adj. 容许的；许可的

sentences.english: the maximum permissible level of radiation
sentences.chinese: 允许的最大辐射水平

detailed_translations.english: allowed by law or by the rules

name: permit
trans:
v. 许可；允许；/ˈpɜːmɪt/
 n. 许可证【同根】permissible adj. 容许的，可准许的

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: ratify
trans: v. 正式签署；批准；认可

sentences.english: The parliaments of Australia and Indonesia have yet to ratify the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚和印度尼西亚议会还未批准该条约。

detailed_translations.english: to make a written agreement official by signing it

name: reception
trans: n. 接收；反响；接待，招待会【记忆】词根记忆：re+cept（拿，抓）+ion→抓住→接受

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

trans: adj. 默认的；默许的；不言而喻的

sentences.english: a tacit agreement between the three big companies
sentences.chinese: 三家大公司之间的默契

detailed_translations.chinese: 缄默的；不言而喻的；心照不宣的；默许的
detailed_translations.english: tacit agreement, approval, support etc is given without anything actually being said

name: tolerate
trans: v. 容许，承认；容忍，忍受

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: applicant
trans: n. 申请人

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

name: apply
trans: v. 申请【搭配】apply for申请

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: between jobs
trans: 待业中

name: certificate
trans: n. 证（明）书，执照【搭配】teaching certificate 执教证书birth certificate 出生证明

sentences.english: birth/death/marriage certificate (=giving details of someone’s birth, death, or marriage)
sentences.chinese: 出生/死亡/结婚证书

sentences.english: a degree certificate
sentences.chinese: 学位证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 证书，证件，执照；（毕业）文凭，合格证书
detailed_translations.english: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

name: collect information
trans: 收集信息

name: credential
trans: n. 证明书；（学历、资历）资格；证件【搭配】professional credential职业资格证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交使节所递的国书, 信任状

name: CV (curriculum vitae)
trans: n. 履历表

name: degree
trans: n. 学位【搭配】degree in... …方面的学位

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

name: educational background
trans: 教育背景

name: educational history
trans: 学历

name: face-to-face
trans: adj. 面对面的

sentences.english: The experts agreed that a face-to-face talk might be a good idea .
sentences.chinese: 专家们一致同意，举行一次面对面的会谈也许是一个好主意。

sentences.english: The scene was set for a face-to-face confrontation between defiant Jews and the man behind the Final Solution.
sentences.chinese: 于是演出便成了无畏的犹太人与操纵灭绝犹太人计划者之间的一场面对面的对抗。

sentences.english: The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation.
sentences.chinese: 向开发团队及在开发团队中传达信息的最有效率和最有效的方法是：面对面的交谈。

name: headhunting company
trans: 猎头公司

name: hobby
trans: n. 爱好【搭配】individual hobby个人爱好

sentences.english: What are your hobbies?
sentences.chinese: 你有些什么爱好？

sentences.english: Susan’s hobbies include reading, cooking, and drama.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊的业余爱好包括阅读、烹饪和戏剧。

sentences.english: Retirement gave him the time to pursue his hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 退休以后他有充裕的时间来做自己喜欢做的事。

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

name: hunt
trans: v. 寻找【搭配】hunt for寻找

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: job description
trans: 职务说明

name: job fair
trans: 招聘会

name: job hunting
trans: 找工作

name: job opportunity
trans: 就业机会

name: job hunter
trans: 求职者，找工作的人

name: opening
trans: n. （职位的）空缺

sentences.english: the opening match of the season
sentences.chinese: 本赛季的首场比赛

sentences.english: the opening chapter of the book
sentences.chinese: 本书的第一章

sentences.english: at the opening of the trial
sentences.chinese: 审判伊始

detailed_translations.english: first or beginning
the beginning or first part of something

name: profile
trans: n. 人物简介；外形；v. 为…描绘【搭配】personal profile 个人资料

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格，合格；技能；限定，条件；合格证【搭配】qualification test 资格考试minimum qualification 最低资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: qualified
trans: adj. 有资格的；合格的【搭配】qualified for 有担任…的资格qualified personnel 人才；合格人员

sentences.english: You are one of us, and you are qualified to be a member of this Republic.
sentences.chinese: 你是我们中的一员，你有资格成为这个共和国中的一份子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制（qualify的过去分词）；描述；授权予

name: recruiter
trans: n. 招聘人员

sentences.english: If that doesn't work, do a Web search on the term "recruiter" or "HR director" along with the name of your employer of choice.
sentences.chinese: 如果这招无效的话，那就在网站上输入你可选择的雇主名单加上“招聘人员”或“人力资源部经理”一起搜索。

sentences.english: If you feel the recruiter can't meet the challenge, you may need to raise the issue with the head of recruiting or human resources.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得招聘人员无法完成这一挑战，你可能就得把问题提交给招聘或人力资源部门的负责人了。

sentences.chinese: 一首极其美妙的钢琴独奏曲

sentences.english: He had just completed his final solo album.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚完成他最后一张个人专辑。

sentences.english: When did you first fly solo?
sentences.chinese: 你第一次单独飞行是什么时候？

sentences.english: a solo effort
sentences.chinese: 独自的努力

sentences.english: a solo album
sentences.chinese: 独唱专辑

detailed_translations.english: a piece of music for one performer
done alone without anyone else helping you

name: include
trans: v. 包括，包含，计入【记忆】词根记忆：in（进入）+clud（关）+e→关进里面→包括，包含【搭配】be included in... 被包括在…【同义】contain v. 包括

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: fare
trans: n. 费，票价；v. 进展【记忆】联想记忆：若愿与我同行，我不在乎（care）船费（fare）

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.chinese: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc

name: agency
trans: n. 代理（处），代办处，机构【记忆】词根记忆：ag（做）+ency（表性质）→代理【搭配】an employment agency 职业介绍所travel agency 旅行社

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: atlas
trans: n. 地图集

sentences.english: The atlas was published by our company.
sentences.chinese: 这个地图集是由我们公司出版的。

sentences.english: The atlas should help the eradication fight by letting health officials know just where the problem areas are.
sentences.chinese: 而这些地图集刚好能帮助卫生局高清楚问题地区所在，然后将虫虫们斩草除根。

sentences.english: He also feared that a map in the atlas, along with news accounts repeating an error in the news release, could pull climate scientists into another vortex of damaging controversy.
sentences.chinese: 他还担心新闻评述会同地图集里的地图一道，在新闻发布的时候，一而再再而三地犯着同一个错误，反而将气象学家们拉入争辩的漩涡之中。

detailed_translations.english: a book containing maps, especially of the whole world

name: backpack
trans: n. 背包

detailed_translations.english: a  rucksack

name: knapsack
trans: n. 背包

sentences.english: Squatting by one of the walls, I took a little book from my knapsack.
sentences.chinese: 我蹲在胡同的墙根，从背包里拿出一本最近出版的小开本的书。

sentences.english: He unstrapped his knapsack, put it, with his stick, on the hedge-bank, and opened the gate.
sentences.chinese: 他把背包从身上取下来，连同手中的棍子一起放在树篱坡上，把门打开了。

sentences.english: Fascinated by this magic light-generating globe, he cut it off with his bayonet and put it in his knapsack so he could carry around the light with him wherever he went.
sentences.chinese: 他对这个会发光的小球很痴迷，于是用刺刀把它割了下来，放进自己的背包，他觉得这样他就可以把光带到任何他想去的地方了。

detailed_translations.english: a bag that you carry on your shoulders

name: coach
trans: n. 长途公共汽车；旅客车厢【搭配】on a coach 乘长途客车

sentences.english: a tennis coach
sentences.chinese: 网球教练

sentences.english: the Norwegian national coach
sentences.chinese: 挪威国家队教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

name: excursion
trans: n. 短途旅行，游览【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+curs（跑）+ion（表动作）→跑出去→短途旅行【搭配】Saturday excursion 周六短途旅行

sentences.english: They've gone on an excursion to York.
sentences.chinese: 他们到约克旅游去了。

detailed_translations.english: a short journey made for pleasure, especially one that has been organized for a group of people

name: expedition
trans: n. （为特定目的而组织的）旅行，出行，远征；远征队，探险队，考察队；迅速，动作敏捷【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+ped（脚）+ition→出行

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

name: guide
trans: v. 为…领路，指导，引导；n. 领路人；指南，导游【搭配】tour guide 旅途向导spiritual guide 精神向导

sentences.english: a tour guide
sentences.chinese: 导游

sentences.english: an experienced mountain guide
sentences.chinese: 一位有经验的登山向导

sentences.english: We were guided around the museums.
sentences.chinese: 我们在导游的带领下参观了博物馆。
