to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them

name: hike
trans: v. 徒步旅行

sentences.english: He wants to hike round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他打算徒步旅行环游世界一周。

sentences.english: You can organize a picnic in the park, a group hike or bike ride, or meet up with friends for one of those free local events.
sentences.chinese: 你可以组织在公园野餐一群徒步旅行或者骑自行车或者和朋友会面为其中的一个免费本地事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside
a long walk in the mountains or countryside
to increase a price, tax etc by a large amount

name: hostel
trans: n. 旅舍；青年旅舍；学生宿舍【记忆】词根记忆：host（客人）+el（表地点）→客人住的地方→旅舍【搭配】student hostel 学生宿舍youth hostel 青年旅馆

sentences.english: The 260-bed hostel on Second Street, just two blocks from the beach, had come highly recommended by an Angeleno I’d met on a recent trip to the Caribbean.
sentences.chinese: 这家有260张床位的招待所离海滩只有两个街区，是我在最近一次去加勒比海的旅途上遇见的一个洛杉矶人极力推荐的。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people can stay and eat fairly cheaply

name: itinerary
trans: n. 行程；旅行计划

sentences.chinese: 我们旅行计划的下一站是塞多纳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅程，路线； 旅行日程
detailed_translations.english: An itinerary is a plan of a trip, including the route and the places that you will visit

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅程的； 巡回的，流动的

name: route
trans: n. 路线，路程【搭配】cycling route 骑自行车游览路线shipping route 航线【同义】way n. 道路path n. 道路

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

name: tram
trans: n. 有轨电车【搭配】tram tour 有轨电车游览

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburge with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车的脚步声淹没了带有香波的火腿汉堡。

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburger with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 来自有轨电车的流浪者用洗发水淹没火腿汉堡。

sentences.english: In Rio de Janeiro, an extensive network of tram lines, including the Santa Teresa line, operated for more than a century.
sentences.chinese: 在里约热内卢，一个包括圣特雷莎线在内的巨大电车线路网络运行了逾一个世纪。

trans: n. 旅行

sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.

sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

sentences.chinese: 我仍在纽约，正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

name: charge
trans: v. 索（价），收费；控告；掌管；充电；n. [常pl.]费用，代价；电荷【搭配】take charge of 负责free of charge 免费extra charge 额外的费用

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

trans: n. 花费，消费，消耗【搭配】at the expense of 代价；由…付费miscellaneous expenses 杂费

sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

trans: n. 费用

sentences.english: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
sentences.chinese: 月付35英镑，即可使用健身房和游泳池。

trans: n. 价格

sentences.chinese: 燃料价格持续上涨。

sentences.english: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.chinese: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

trans: adj. 价格高的；昂贵的

trans: adv. 而且；prep. 除…之外

sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

trans: adj. 例外的；异常的【记忆】词根记忆：exception（例外）+al（…的）→例外的【同义】extraordinary adj. 非常的，特别的outstanding adj. 突出的unusual adj. 不平常的【反义】ordinary adj. 平常的，普通的common adj. 普通的

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

trans: v. 把…排斥在外；将（某物）排除，不包括【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+clud（关闭）+e→扔出关上→把…排除在外【搭配】exclude...from... 把…排除在…之外

sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

trans: n. 排斥

sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: exclusive
trans: adj. 专有的，独占的；专用的；除外的，排他的【搭配】an exclusive interview 独家采访，专访exclusive of 不包括

sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared

name: extra
trans: adj. 额外的，附加的；n. 附加物，额外的东西【同义】spare adj. 多余的

sentences.english: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.english: Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.english: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

detailed_translations.english: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number

name: extraneous
trans: adj. 无关的【记忆】词根记忆：extr（a）（以外）+aneous（有…特征的）→…以外的→无关的

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: principle
trans: n. 原则，原理；规范，准则；基本信念；道德准则【记忆】词根记忆：prin（第一）+cip（取）+le →须第一位选取的→原则，原理

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: turbine
trans: n. 涡轮机，汽轮机【记忆】词根记忆：turb（扰乱）+ine→涡轮机

sentences.english: The new ship will be powered by two gas turbines and four diesel engines.
sentences.chinese: 那艘新轮船将由2台燃气涡轮机和4台柴油机驱动。

detailed_translations.english: an engine or motor in which the pressure of a liquid or gas moves a special wheel around

name: power
trans: n. 能；能量；功率

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: tidal
trans: adj. 潮汐的；潮水般的【搭配】tidal current 潮流tidal wave 浪潮

sentences.english: tidal currents
sentences.chinese: 潮流

detailed_translations.chinese: 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea

name: current
trans: n. 电流，气流；潮流；adj. 当前的；通用的，流行的【记忆】词根记忆：curr（跑）+ent（…的）→跑的→流动的【搭配】air current 气流current affairs 时事【同义】present adj. 目前的existing adj. 目前的，现存的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: blade
trans: n. （机器上旋转的）叶片；桨叶；刀片；草叶【记忆】联想记忆：热门电影《刀锋战士》英文为Blade

sentences.english: a razor blade
sentences.chinese: 剃刀刀片

detailed_translations.english: the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

name: similar
trans: adj. 相像的；相仿的；类似的【搭配】be similar to与…相似

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: propeller
trans: n. （轮船或飞机的）螺旋桨，推进器【搭配】propeller shaft螺旋轴【同根】propel v. 推进

sentences.english: ...a fixed three-bladed propeller.
sentences.chinese: …一个固定的三叶螺旋桨。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move

name: tide
trans: n. 潮汐；潮流【搭配】the ebb and flow of tide潮汐涨落

sentences.english: Is the tide going out or coming in ?
sentences.chinese: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？

sentences.english: We went for a walk and got cut off by the tide .
sentences.chinese: 我们去散步，结果被潮水困住了。

detailed_translations.english: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

name: predictable
trans: adj. 可预言的，可预报的

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

name: input
trans: n. 投入，输入；输入的数据；vt. 把…输入计算机【记忆】来自词组put in（进入；输入）

sentences.english: to input text/data/figures
sentences.chinese: 把文本 / 数据 / 数字输入计算机

sentences.english: data input
sentences.chinese: 数据输入

detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer
the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

name: constant
trans: adj. 经常发生的；始终如一的；忠实的；n. 常数，恒量【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+stant（站，立）→一直站着→不变的【搭配】constant temperature 恒温constant speed 恒定速度constant value 不变价值【同根】constantly adv. 不变地；不断地constancy n. 恒定不变

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: dampen
trans: v. 使潮湿

sentences.english: The light rain dampened the crowd’s enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 小雨使观众的热情减退了。

sentences.english: Raising interest rates might dampen the economy.
sentences.chinese: 提高利率可能会抑制经济发展。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a feeling or activity less strong

name: dip
trans: v. 浸【搭配】dip into 浸在…里

sentences.english: Dip each apple in the syrup until thickly coated.
sentences.chinese: 把每个苹果在糖浆里蘸一下，直到被厚厚地裹上糖浆。

detailed_translations.english: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again
to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

name: drift
trans: n. 漂移；趋势；v. 漂流【搭配】the drift of the tide 潮汐的缓缓流动drift off 渐渐离去，迷迷糊糊地睡去【同义】float v. 漂浮【同根】drifter n. 流浪汉

sentences.english: Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 我们前方的丛林里有烟升起。

sentences.english: Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮这一年来一直在欧洲各地漂泊。

sentences.english: a drift towards longer working hours
sentences.chinese: 工作时间不知不觉的变长

sentences.english: the drift from the countryside to the cities
sentences.chinese: 大量人口从乡村往城市的流动

detailed_translations.english: to move slowly on water or in the air
a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

name: exude
trans: v. 流出，渗出（液体）【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+ud（=sud汗）+e →出汗→渗出（液体）

sentences.english: The plant exudes a sticky liquid.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物会分泌一种黏液。

detailed_translations.english: to flow out slowly and steadily, or to make something do this

name: gush
trans: v. （从…中）喷出，涌出

sentences.english: All that pent-up frustration gushed out in a torrent of abuse.
sentences.chinese: 所有压抑着的失望与不快通过一阵痛骂全都发泄了出来。

detailed_translations.english: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly
a large quantity of something, usually a liquid, that suddenly pours out of something

name: immerse
trans: v. 沉浸；使陷入【记忆】词根记忆：im（进入）+mers（沉，没）+ e →沉进去→沉浸【搭配】be immersed in thought 陷入沉思

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

name: influx
trans: v. 使潮湿

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

name: infuse
trans: vt. 灌输，注入【记忆】词根记忆：in（向内，进入）+fus（流）+ e →流进去→灌输

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: meander
trans: v. （河流、道路等）蜿蜒而行；迂回曲折

sentences.english: We took a gravel road that meandered through farmland.
sentences.chinese: 我们走上了一条蜿蜒穿越农田的石子路。

detailed_translations.english: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

name: moisten
trans: v. 使潮湿【记忆】词根记忆：moist（潮湿的）+en（使…）→使潮湿【同义】humidify v. 使潮湿

sentences.english: Moisten the clay if it seems too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果黏土太干，就把它润润湿。

sentences.english: She moistened her lips (= made her lips wet with her tongue ) .
sentences.chinese: 她润了润嘴唇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something slightly wet

name: overflow
trans: v. 漫出；溢出

sentences.english: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
sentences.chinese: 下水道被淹，水溢到了大街上。

sentences.english: The river had overflowed its banks.
sentences.chinese: 河水漫堤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 满得外溢，外流，泛滥；充满，洋溢
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 淹没， 从…中溢出， 多得无法容纳
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 容纳不下的物； 溢出， 满出； 溢流口， 溢流管
detailed_translations.english: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full

name: saturate
trans: v. 使湿透，浸透；使充满，使饱和【记忆】词根记忆：satur（饱）+ate（使…）→（使）饱和【搭配】saturate with... 以…使饱和【同义】drench vt. 使湿透，使浸透soak vt. 使浸透

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: splash
trans: v. 溅；泼【同义】splatter vi. 飞溅sprinkle v. 喷洒

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: spout
trans: v. 喷出；喷射

sentences.english: She lifted the kettle a little and tilted its spout over the tea-pot.
sentences.chinese: 她稍稍提起烧水壶，将壶嘴向茶壶倾斜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷口；水龙卷；水落管；水柱
detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong stream of liquid which comes out of somewhere very fast

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷出；喷射；滔滔不绝地讲；把…典当掉
detailed_translations.english: if liquid or fire spouts from somewhere, it comes out very quickly in a powerful stream

name: spray
trans: n. 浪花，喷雾，飞沫；v. 喷射，喷，（使）溅散【记忆】联想记忆：sp（音似：四泼）+ray（光线） →光线向四面射去→喷射

sentences.english: spray from the waves
sentences.chinese: 海浪溅起的水雾

sentences.english: a new hair styling spray
sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.english: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.
sentences.chinese: 她往身上喷了香水。

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

name: spurt
trans: v. 喷出；冒出

sentences.english: A spurt of diesel came from one valve and none from the other.
sentences.chinese: 一股股柴油从一个阀门喷涌而出，但另一个没有。

detailed_translations.english: when an amount of liquid or flame suddenly comes quickly out of something

name: submerge
trans: v. 浸没；潜入水中【记忆】词根记忆：sub（下）+merg（沉，没）+ e→沉下去→浸没

sentences.english: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯埋头工作，试图忘记汤姆。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it

name: forecast
trans: v./n. 预报；预测；预想【记忆】词根记忆：fore（预先）+cast（扔）→预先扔出（消息）→预测【搭配】weather forecast 天气预报

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: foresee
trans: vt. 预见，预知【记忆】词根记忆：fore（预先）+see（看）→预先看到→预见，预知【同义】predict v. 预言，预测

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: foresight
trans: n. 深谋远虑；先见之明【记忆】词根记忆：fore（预先）+sight（眼光）→先见之明

sentences.english: It was an example of the authorities’ lack of foresight .
sentences.chinese: 这是当权者缺乏远见的一个例证。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先见，远见；预见；深谋远虑
detailed_translations.english: the ability to imagine what is likely to happen and to consider this when planning for the future

name: foretell
trans: v. 预言，预示

sentences.english: the birth of Christ, foretold by prophets
sentences.chinese: 先知们所预言的基督的诞生

detailed_translations.english: to say what will happen in the future, especially by using special magical powers

name: imminent
trans: adj. 即将来临的【记忆】词根记忆：im（进入）+min（伸出）+ ent→伸进去了→即将来临的

sentences.english: A new trade agreement is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的贸易协定即将签署。

detailed_translations.english: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

name: prediction
trans: n. 预言，预料，预报

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: promising
trans: adj. 有希望的；有前途的【同义】hopeful adj. （怀）有希望的bright adj. 前景光明的，充满希望的【反义】hopeless adj. 没有希望的

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

name: prospect
trans: n. 前景【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+spect（看）→向前看→前景

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: prospective
trans: adj. 预期的；未来的；可能的【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+spect（看）+ive（…的）→向前看的→未来的【同义】anticipated adj. 预期的

sentences.english: The story should act as a warning to other prospective buyers.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报道应该可以对其他可能的购买者起到警告作用。

detailed_translations.english: You use prospective to describe someone who wants to be the thing mentioned or who is likely to be the thing mentioned

name: provident
trans: adj. 未雨绸缪的，有远虑的【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+vid（看）+ent（…的） →向前看的→有远虑的

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；有先见之明的；顾及未来的
detailed_translations.english: careful and sensible in the way you plan things, especially by saving money for the future

name: surmise
trans: v. 推测；猜测

sentences.english: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有什么可继续进行的，我们只能猜测发生过的事。

sentences.english: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.chinese: 博斯画这幅画时头脑里想着勃朗特的诗，这只是猜测而已。

detailed_translations.english: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

name: tendency
trans: n. 倾向，趋向【记忆】词根记忆：tend（趋向）+ency→倾向，趋向

sentences.english: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
sentences.chinese: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

detailed_translations.chinese: 趋向， 趋势， 倾向
detailed_translations.english: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

name: discovery
trans: n. 发现【搭配】scientific discovery 科学发现

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: lead
trans: v. 指引；领导；致使【搭配】lead to 导致

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: field
trans: n. 领域；运动场

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: known as
trans: 被称为，公认为

name: neuroeconomics
trans: n. 神经经济学

name: study
trans: v. 研究；调查

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: secret
trans: n. 秘密；秘诀

sentences.english: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你，这是个秘密。

sentences.english: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人相互仇视，这算不得什么秘密。

sentences.english: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (= I won’t tell anyone about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我会替你保守秘密。

sentences.english: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
sentences.chinese: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？

sentences.english: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。

detailed_translations.english: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

name: success
trans: n. 成功

sentences.english: The experiment was a big success.
sentences.chinese: 实验非常成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成功，成就；胜利；大获成功的人或事物
detailed_translations.english: when you achieve what you want or intend

name: economic
trans: adj. 经济的，经济上的，经济学的；n. [pl.]经济学；经济状况【搭配】economic climate 经济形势，经济气候

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

name: environment
trans: n. 周围状况；环境【同根】environmental adj. 环境的

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: demand
trans: n. 要求；需求（量）；v. 要求；需要；询问【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+mand（命令）→一再命令→要求，需求【搭配】in great demand 需求量大demand for 对…的需求

sentences.english: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

sentences.english: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
sentences.chinese: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services

name: innovation
trans: n. 革新，创新【记忆】词根记忆：in（进入）+nov（新的）+ ation→革新【搭配】technological innovation 技术革新【同义】novelty n. 新奇，新奇的事物reformation n. 改革，革新

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: able
trans: adj. 能干的【搭配】be able to能够

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

sentences.english: one of my more able students
sentences.chinese: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

detailed_translations.english: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

name: differently
trans: adv. 不同地，相异地

sentences.english: Words written alike are often pronounced differently.
sentences.chinese: 拼法相同的词往往读音不同。

sentences.english: Different lawyers may construe the same law differently.
sentences.chinese: 对同一法律，不同的律师可以做出不同的解释。

sentences.english: For me, this uncertainty lies at the heart of what we need to know if we are to understand ourselves and behave differently.
sentences.chinese: 对我而言，这样的不确定性就存在于我们需要去了解的内心，即我们懂得我们自己和行为本身是不同的。

name: competitor
trans: n. 对手【搭配】strategic competitor 战略竞争者【同根】competition n. 比赛

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: abundance
trans: n. 大量，丰富，充足，充裕【搭配】in abundance 丰富【同义】profusion n. 丰富affluence n. 富足wealth n. 大量【反义】scarcity n. 缺乏，不足deficiency n. 缺少

sentences.english: an abundance of wavy red hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的红色鬈发

sentences.english: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
sentences.chinese: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something

name: affluence
trans: n. 富足【记忆】词根记忆：af（加强）+flu（流动）+ ence→（钱多得）不断流出→富足

sentences.english: The postwar era was one of new affluence for the working class.
sentences.chinese: 战后时期是工人阶级新富期。

detailed_translations.english: Affluence is the state of having a lot of money or a high standard of living

name: bankruptcy
trans: n. 破产【记忆】词根记忆：bankrupt（破产的）+cy（表状态）→破产

sentences.english: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 1999年他被披露几近破产。

sentences.english: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀加剧，破产个案也会增加。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to pay your debts

name: brand
trans: n. 商标；品牌；vt. 铭刻；打烙印【搭配】name-brand 名牌co-branded card 联名卡leading brand 驰名品牌brand image 品牌形象

sentences.english: products which lack a strong brand image
sentences.chinese: 缺乏鲜明品牌形象的产品

sentences.english: The owner couldn't be bothered to brand the cattle.
sentences.chinese: 主人懒得给这牛打上烙印。

detailed_translations.english: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭刻， 打烙印于； 加污名于， 谴责
detailed_translations.english: When you brand an animal, you put a permanent mark on its skin in order to show who it belongs to, usually by burning a mark onto its skin

name: budget
trans: n. 预算，预算拨款；v. 做预算【搭配】budget deficit 预算赤字cut down the budget 减少预算plan a budget 做预算on a budget 节省费用

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: collateral
trans: n. 抵押金，抵押物；adj. 附属的，附带的

sentences.english: There may be collateral benefits to the scheme.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划可能有附带的益处。

detailed_translations.english: relating to something or happening as a result of it, but not as important

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵押品；[法] 担保品；旁系亲属
detailed_translations.english: property or other goods that you promise to give someone if you cannot pay back the money they lend you

name: commission
trans: vt. 授权，委托【记忆】词根记忆：com（加强）+miss（送）+ ion→送交给某人→委托

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: currency
trans: n. 货币；流行【搭配】currency form 货币申请单a paper currency 纸币

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: deflation
trans: n. 通货紧缩【搭配】deflation policy紧缩政策

sentences.english: Deflation is beginning to take hold in the clothing industry.
sentences.chinese: 服装业开始出现通货紧缩。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the amount of money in a country’s  economy  , so that prices fall or stop rising

name: distribution
trans: n. 分发，分配；配给物；散布，分布【搭配】distribution channel 分配渠道

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: enterprise
trans: n. 公司；事业【记忆】词根记忆：enter（进入）+pris（抓）+e →进入抓事业的状态→事业【搭配】a backbone enterprise 骨干企业joint enterprise 合资企业state enterprise 国有企业

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: expenditure
trans: n. 支出【搭配】public expenditure 公共支出

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: financial
trans: adj. 财政的，金融的

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: industrialisation
trans: n. 工业化，产业化

sentences.english: It points to the onset of industrialisation and rising greenhouse gas emissions as the cause of the trend.
sentences.chinese: 论文指出，工业化的开始和不断增长的温室气体排放是造成这种趋势的原因。

sentences.chinese: 苏联顾问在1944年来到保加利亚，为了确认这个新的社会主义国家没有背离国有化、工业化和社会主义化的进程。

name: merge
trans: v. （使）结合【记忆】词根记忆：merg（沉没）+e→沉没其中→结合

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

name: monetary
trans: adj. 货币的，财政的【搭配】monetary policy 货币政策

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

name: patronage
trans: n. 赞助，资助；支持；光顾，惠顾【记忆】词根记忆：patron（赞助人）+age→赞助

sentences.english: Thank you for your patronage.
sentences.chinese: 感谢您的惠顾。

name: poverty
trans: n. 贫穷【搭配】live in poverty 贫困中成长combat poverty 和贫困做斗争poverty line 贫困线

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: privatise
trans: v. 使归私有，使私人化【记忆】词根记忆：priv（单个）+at+ise（…化）→个人化→使私人化

name: profitability
trans: n. 盈利率，收益率【搭配】profitability analysis 盈利分析

sentences.english: a decline in company profitability
sentences.chinese: 公司利润的下降

trans: n. 繁荣，成功【记忆】词根记忆：pro（在前）+sper（希望）+ ity→希望在前方→繁荣，成功

sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

name: quota
trans: n. 定额，限额，配额【同义】allotment n. 分配；份额portion n. 一部分，一份

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: ransom
trans: n. 赎金

sentences.english: The same system was used for ransoming or exchanging captives.
sentences.chinese: 同一系统也被用来赎回或交换俘虏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回，赎；勒索赎金；救赎；得赎金后释放
detailed_translations.english: If you ransom someone who has been kidnapped, you pay the money to set them free
an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner

name: refund
trans:
n. 退款；/rɪˈfʌnd/
 vt. 退还（钱款）【记忆】词根记忆：re（向后）+fund（资金）→退回资金→退还【搭配】full refund 全额偿还give sb. a refund 给某人退款

sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

name: sponsorship
trans: n. 赞助者的地位

name: stock
trans: n. 储备品；股票

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: surplus
trans: adj. 过剩的【记忆】词根记忆：sur（超，外加）+plus（加）→加了又加→过剩的

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业人数【记忆】词根记忆：un（不）+employ（雇用）+ ment→没人雇佣→失业【反义】employment n. 雇用，使用，工作

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: detrimental
trans: adj. 损害的，造成伤害的，有害的；n. 有害的人或物【记忆】词根记忆：detriment（损害，伤害）+ al（…的）→损害的【搭配】be detrimental to 对…有害detrimental effect 不良影响，损害效应

sentences.english: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染对环境的不利影响

detailed_translations.english: causing harm or damage

detailed_translations.chinese: 有害的人（或物）；不受欢迎的求婚者

name: effect
trans: n. 作用，影响；结果；效果，效力；vt. 产生，招致【记忆】词根记忆：ef（出）+fect（做）→做出效果→效果【搭配】carry/bring into effect 使生效，实施in effect 有效；实际上take effect 生效，起作用side effect 副作用positive effect 积极影响cause and effect 原因和结果【同根】effective adj. 有效的；被实施的effectively adv. 有效地effectiveness n. 效力ineffective adj. 无效的

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

name: noise
trans: n. 噪音【搭配】noise pollution 噪音污染

sentences.english: What’s that noise?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么声音？

sentences.english: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

sentences.english: There was a lot of noise outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面很吵闹。

sentences.english: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
sentences.chinese: 噪音水平下降了20%。

detailed_translations.english: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

name: situation
trans: n. 情况，状况；形势；局面

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: limit
trans: n. 限定；限制【搭配】maximum limit 最大限度

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

name: disability
trans: n. （身体上的）残疾，伤残；缺陷，障碍

sentences.english: Facilities for people with disabilities are still insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 供残疾人使用的设施仍然不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件
detailed_translations.english: A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life

name: speech
trans: n. 说话的能力

sentences.english: He has to make a lot of after-dinner speeches .
sentences.chinese: 他经常要发表席后演说。

sentences.english: Collins gave the keynote speech (= most important speech ) .
sentences.chinese: 科林斯作了主题发言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲；讲话；[语] 语音；演说
detailed_translations.english: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people

name: verbal
trans: adj. 口头的；用言辞的，用文字的；动词的【记忆】词根记忆：verb（言，词）+al（…的）→口头的

sentences.english: verbal skills
sentences.chinese: 语言技能

detailed_translations.chinese: 口头的； 用言辞的， 用文字的； 动词的
detailed_translations.english: spoken rather than written

name: communication
trans: n. 交流【搭配】daily communication 日常交际

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: extremely
trans: adv. 极端地；非常地【同义】exceptionally adv. 非常地intensely adv. 极度地

sentences.english: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 地震非常难以预测。

sentences.english: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 给你添了麻烦，我十分抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: vulnerable
trans: adj. 易受攻击的，易受伤的；易受影响的

sentences.english: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.english: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脆弱的, 易受影响的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt

name: bondage
trans: n. 奴役；束缚

sentences.english: the bondage of early motherhood
sentences.chinese: 刚刚做母亲时所受的束缚

detailed_translations.english: the state of having your freedom limited, or being prevented from doing what you want

name: bound
trans: adj. 必然的；受约束的；v. 跳跃；弹回；n. 跳跃；[常作pl.]界限【搭配】bound for 开往…的out of bounds 禁止入内；出界

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

name: circumscribe
trans: vt. 在…周围画线；限制【记忆】词根记忆：circum（绕圈）+scribe（画）→画地为牢→限制

detailed_translations.chinese: 外切，外接；限制；在…周围画线
detailed_translations.english: to limit power, rights, or abilities

trans: v. 限制，局限于；管制，禁闭；n. 边界【搭配】confine to... 限制于…之内confine oneself to 把自己局限于【同义】boundary n. 边界

sentences.english: We confined our study to ten cases.
sentences.chinese: 我们把研究限定在十个案例以内。

sentences.english: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks (= made to stay in the barracks ) .
sentences.chinese: 任何擅离职守的士兵都要受到在营房里关禁闭的处罚。

sentences.english: within the confines of the prison

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
limits or borders

name: fetter
trans: n. 脚镣；v. 给（某人）带上脚镣

sentences.english: fettered by family responsibilities
sentences.chinese: 受家庭责任的束缚

detailed_translations.english: to restrict someone’s freedom and prevent them from doing what they want

name: quell
trans: vt. 制止，镇压，压制【搭配】quell the violence 平息暴乱

sentences.english: ‘Jerry?’ she called, trying to quell the panic inside her.
sentences.chinese: “杰里？”她叫道，试图减轻内心的惊慌。

detailed_translations.english: to end a situation in which people are behaving violently or protesting, especially by using force

name: restrain
trans: vt. 阻止；抑制【记忆】词根记忆：re+strain（拉紧）→重新绷紧神经→阻止；抑制【同根】restraint n. 抑制；约束措施

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: restrict
trans: vt. 限制，约束【记忆】联想记忆：re+strict（严格的）→严格限制→限制【搭配】restrict sb./sth. to sth. 限制某人/某事物

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: temperance
trans: n. 节制

sentences.english: ...a reformed alcoholic extolling the joys of temperance.
sentences.chinese: ...一个已戒掉酒瘾的人对戒酒的好处赞不绝口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戒酒；节欲；（气候等的）温和

trans: v. 勾勾搭搭，结交【记忆】词根记忆：con（共同）+sort（种类）→物以类聚→结交

sentences.chinese: 公众接受了作为前任情妇的卡米拉成为查尔斯王子的新配偶。

sentences.english: Dressed as the Hindu deity Shiva and his consort, Parvati, children beg for money from tourists in Pushkar.
sentences.chinese: 打扮成印度教湿婆神和他的配偶帕尔瓦蒂，儿童从普什卡游客那里乞讨钱财。

detailed_translations.english: the wife or husband of a ruler

name: correspondence
trans: n. 通信，信件；符合，一致；相当于，对应【搭配】keep correspondence with sb. 与某人保持通信commercial correspondence 商业信函

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

trans: v. 散布，传播【记忆】词根记忆：dis（加强）+semin（种子）+ ate →散布种子→散布，传播

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

name: impart
trans: v. 给予，赋予；传授；告知，透露【记忆】词根记忆：im（进入）+part（部分，分开） →（引导人）进入（知识的）一部分，以让他知道→传授；告知【搭配】impart knowledge 传授知识

sentences.english: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.english: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give a particular quality to something

name: liaison
trans: n. （尤指工作上的）联络；联络员

sentences.english: Liaison between police forces and the art world is vital to combat art crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方和艺术界之间的联络对于打击艺术犯罪是至关重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the regular exchange of information between groups of people, especially at work, so that each group knows what the other is doing

name: propagate
trans: v. 繁殖，增殖；传播，宣传，使普及【同义】produce vt. 生产；繁殖multiply v. 增加；繁殖【同根】propagation n. 繁殖；传播

sentences.english: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

name: reciprocal
trans: adj. 互惠的

sentences.english: Such treaties provide reciprocal rights and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的
detailed_translations.english: a reciprocal arrangement or relationship is one in which two people or groups do or give the same things to each other

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

name: boredom
trans: n. 厌烦，令人厌烦的事物【记忆】词根记忆：bore（使厌烦）+dom（表名词，总称）→令人厌烦的事物

sentences.english: a game to relieve the boredom of a long journey
sentences.chinese: 长途旅行中解闷的一个游戏

sentences.english: the sheer boredom of being in jail
sentences.chinese: 牢狱生活的单调乏味

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are bored, or the quality of being boring

name: boring
trans: adj. 无趣的，乏味的【搭配】boring life 无趣的生活

sentences.english: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。

sentences.english: The job was dull and boring.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的
detailed_translations.english: not interesting in any way

trans: adj. 令人讨厌的

name: disarrange
trans: v. 使紊乱；弄乱【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+ar+range（列）→不按顺序排列→弄乱

trans: vt. 转移（注意力）；使分心【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+tract（拉）→（精神）被拉开→使分心【同根】distraction n. 分心；娱乐

sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

trans: adj. 令人沮丧的，抑郁的【搭配】gloomy outlook 暗淡的前景

sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

trans: v. 烦恼

sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

trans: n. 吵闹；喧嚣；叫喊

name: time
trans: v. 计时；测定…所需的时间

sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦改变了我们的时空概念。

sentences.chinese: 长期建立起来的亲密关系

sentences.chinese: 顾客只有有限的时间可以检查商品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数

trans: n. 运输，载运；转变；v. 通过，经过【记忆】词根记忆：trans（变换，转移）+it（走）→转移走→运输，载运【同义】transportation n. 运输，运载delivery n. 传送，运送【搭配】transition n. 过渡；转变transitional adj. 过渡期的

sentences.chinese: 在运输过程中丢失或损坏的行李

trans: adj. 相距甚远的

sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

trans: n. 差别；差异

sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

trans: n. 位置，方位；职位，职务；姿势；见解，立场；vt. 安放，安置【搭配】be in a position to do sth. 能够做某事leave...in the position of... 使…处于…

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

trans: adj. 天文学的【搭配】astronomical unit 天文单位astronomical phenomena 天象

sentences.chinese: 该小区里的房子在以天价出售。

detailed_translations.english: astronomical prices, costs etc are extremely high

name: observer
trans: n. 观察者；观测者；目击者

sentences.english: political observers
sentences.chinese: 政治观察员

sentences.english: Observers are predicting a fall in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 观察员预测利率会下降。

detailed_translations.english: someone who regularly watches or pays attention to particular things, events, situations etc

name: marked
trans: adj. 显而易见的；明显的；显著的【同根】markedly adv. 明显地

sentences.chinese: 换药治疗后病人的病情明显好转。

sentences.chinese: 米勒的桌子上整理得井井有条，和办公室里的其他桌子形成明显的对比。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数

name: outstanding
trans: adj. 杰出的；显著的

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: pronounced
trans: adj. 显著的；很明显的；表达明确的

sentences.chinese: 明显的波兰口音

sentences.english: This disability is more pronounced in men.
sentences.chinese: 这种障碍在男性中表现得更为明显。

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的；断然的；讲出来的
detailed_translations.english: very great or noticeable

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 值得注意的；显著的，异常的，非凡的【搭配】remarkable achievement 了不起的成就【同义】unusual adj. 不寻常的extraordinary adj. 非凡的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: sensible
trans: adj. 明智的，达理的；可觉察的，明显的，觉察到的【记忆】词根记忆：sens（感觉）+ible（可…的）→可感觉到的→合情理的【同根】sensibility n. 敏感性；情感

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

name: aerolite
trans: n. 陨石

name: asteroid
trans: n. 小行星

sentences.english: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.english: Look at the movies that we see all the time. It's easy to imagine the end of the world. An asteroid destroying all life and so on.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧那些我们一直在看的电影，要想像世界末日那是很容易的事，比如一个小行星毁灭了所有生命之类的。

sentences.english: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter

name: astrology
trans: n. 占星学；占星术

sentences.english: Astronomy inherits from astrology.
sentences.chinese: 天文学的前身是占星术。

sentences.english: This should be contrasted with nonscientific programs and the best example of a nonscientific program is astrology.
sentences.chinese: 这点与非科学假说正好相反,非科学假说最好的例子便是占星术了。

sentences.english: It was a great innovator in medicine, astronomy, astrology, mathematics and banking; the Babylonians may even have believed that the world was round.
sentences.chinese: 它在医药，天文学，占星术，数学和银行业方面都堪称一个伟大的改革者。 甚至，古巴比伦人可能已经相信地球是圆的。

name: celestial

trans: v. 招致，惹起，遭受【搭配】incur debt 负债incur losses 遭受损失

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: inflict
trans: v. 把…强加给，使…遭受，使…承担【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+flict（打击）→使…遭受打击→使…遭受

sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: infliction
trans: n. （强加于人身的）痛苦，刑罚

name: suffer
trans: v. 遭受，忍受，忍耐；容许；受痛苦，患病；受损失

sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

name: withstand
trans: v. 抵挡；经受

sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

trans: n. 大使

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

trans: n. 贵族

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个有造诣的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: He was an accomplished politician and a crafty autocrat.
sentences.chinese: 他是个杰出的政治家，也是个狡黠的独裁者。

sentences.english: She wrote a lot of books that exposed the avarice of the authoritarian . the autocracy of the autocrat and the falsity of the autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 她写了许多书，暴露了权力主义者的贪婪，独裁者的独裁政体和自治权的虚伪。

sentences.english: our platoon commander

sentences.chinese: 英国驻巴黎领事

detailed_translations.english: a government official sent to live in a foreign city to help people from his or her own country who are living or staying there

sentences.chinese: 默里已经加入其他民主党参议员反对这项立法了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in democracy, or works to achieve it

trans: n. 独裁者【记忆】词根记忆：dictat（e）（命令）+or（人）→唯一发布命令的人→独裁者

name: emperor
trans: n. 皇帝，君主

sentences.english: The daughter of an emperor does not worry about finding a husband.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝女儿不愁嫁。

sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

sentences.english: She’s been an outspoken feminist for over twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 20多年来，她一直是个直言不讳的女权主义者。

Feminist groups, ideas, and activities are involved in feminism

name: general
trans: n. 将军

sentences.chinese: 道德水准普遍下降。

sentences.chinese: 全面提高身体素质的方法

sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

name: jury

trans: n. 律师

sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.chinese: 衣帽间 / 停车服务员；博物馆接待员

name: auditor

name: delegate
trans:
n. 代表；/ˈdelɪɡeɪt/
 v. 委派（或选举）…为代表；授（权）【搭配】delegate sb. to do sth. 委派某人做某事

sentences.english: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
sentences.chinese: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

name: deputy
trans: n. 代理人；代表

sentences.english: ...Jack Lang, France's minister for culture, and his deputy, Catherine Tasca.
sentences.chinese: …法国文化部长杰克·朗和他的副手凯瑟琳·塔斯卡。

name: novice

sentences.chinese: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

sentences.english: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
sentences.chinese: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity

sentences.english: I am the proprietor of the company.
sentences.chinese: 我是这个公司的经营者。

sentences.english: Marketing concept is the reflection of the marketing activity in the consciousness of the proprietor.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销观念是市场营销活动在经营者意识中的反映。

sentences.chinese: 你可以请人代你投票。

detailed_translations.english: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

name: representative

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people

name: adherent
trans: n. 信徒；追随者【记忆】词根记忆：adher(e)（依附）+ent（表人）→ 依附别人的人→信徒

sentences.english: The Nation of Islam and its most famous adherent, Malcolm X, preached a message of self-reliance and racial separatism.
sentences.chinese: “伊斯兰民族”及其最著名的追随者马尔科姆∙艾克斯（Malcolm X）宣扬自力更生和种族分离。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports a particular belief, plan, political party etc

name: atheist
trans: n. 无神论者

sentences.english: I was an atheist at the time.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候我是一个无神论者。

sentences.english: So the assumption at that time of course, was that if you were an atheist there was nothing for you to make you moral.
sentences.chinese: 当然了这在当时只是假设而已，如果你是一个无神论者,那么对你来说将没有任何道德上的教义。

detailed_translations.english: An atheist is a person who believes that there is no God. Compare .

name: believer
trans: n. 信徒

sentences.english: I made no secret of the fact that I was not a believer.
sentences.chinese: 我对自己不是一个宗教信徒的事实并不隐瞒。

name: clergy
trans: n. 牧师

sentences.chinese: 因此，他的讲道面向的不只是世俗之人，也面向神职人员。

sentences.chinese: 在大多数的高校，你能够得到神职人员的劝导。有些学校有很多来自不同宗教的代表。

detailed_translations.english: the official leaders of religious activities in organized religions, such as priests,  rabbi s  , and  mullah s

name: disciple
trans: n. 信徒，弟子，门徒

sentences.chinese: …一位信徒遍布欧洲的重要知识分子。

trans: n. 怀疑论者；无神论者

sentences.english: You're a skeptic.
sentences.chinese: 你是个怀疑论者。

sentences.english: And, most importantly to the skeptic, Jesus did all this in history.
sentences.chinese: 而，最能取信于怀疑者的一点是，耶稣确实在历史上做过这些事情。

name: zealot
trans: n. 狂热者【记忆】词根记忆：zeal（热心）+ot（表人）→狂热者

sentences.english: religious zealots
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

name: assassin
trans: n. 暗杀者，刺客

sentences.english: Kennedy’s assassin is assumed to have been Lee Harvey Oswald.
sentences.chinese: 暗杀肯尼迪的人据说是李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德。

detailed_translations.english: someone who murders an important person

name: bandit
trans: n. 强盗

sentences.english: They travelled 30 miles through bandit country.
sentences.chinese: 他们走了30英里，穿过强盗横行的乡间。

detailed_translations.english: someone who robs people, especially one of a group of people who attack travellers

name: barbarian
trans: n. 粗鲁无礼的人，野蛮人【记忆】词根记忆：barbar（胡说）+ian（…人的）→野蛮人说的话听不懂→野蛮人

sentences.english: We need to fight this barbarian attitude to science.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要向这种对待科学的野蛮态度作斗争。

detailed_translations.english: Barbarian is also an adjective
someone from a different tribe or land, who people believe to be wild and not  civilized

name: burglar
trans: n. 窃贼，破门盗窃者【搭配】burglar alarm 窃贼报警器【同义】robber n. 强盗；盗贼

sentences.english: Burglars broke into their home.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼闯进了他们家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

name: exile
trans: n. 流放，流亡；被流放者，背井离乡者；v. 流放，使流亡【搭配】in exile 流放中drive sb. into exile 流放某人

sentences.english: the exiled former president
sentences.chinese: 流亡国外的前总统

sentences.english: political exiles
sentences.chinese: 政治流亡者

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons
a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

name: figurehead
trans: n. 傀儡

sentences.english: The Queen is merely a figurehead.
sentences.chinese: 女王只是名义上的元首。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破浪神；有名无实的领袖；装饰船头的人像
detailed_translations.english: a wooden model of a woman that used to be placed on the front of ships

name: foe
trans: n. 反对者；敌人；危害物

sentences.english: Britain’s friends and foes
sentences.chinese: 英国的朋友和敌人

detailed_translations.english: an enemy

name: malcontent
trans: adj. 不满的；n. 不满者【记忆】词根记忆：mal（坏）+content（满意的）→不满的

name: rebel
trans:
n. 造反者，叛逆者，反抗者；/rɪˈbel/
 v. 造反，反叛【记忆】词根记忆：re（相反）+bel（战斗）→反过来打自己人→反叛

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: artisan
trans: n. 工匠，技工

sentences.english: That allowed England to harness the creative potential of its artisan classes in a way that no other country had managed before.
sentences.chinese: 如此，使得英国得以在某种程度上利用本国工匠阶层创造性潜能产生巨大的能量，此为他国以前没有做到之事。

sentences.english: All of it appeared to be handmade, probably by a 17th century artisan.
sentences.chinese: 这里的一切似乎都是手工制作的，很可能出自一位17世纪工匠之手。

sentences.english: That would certainly not be true of the members of the artisan class or the military class for that reason.
sentences.chinese: 那对工匠阶级,与军人阶级,绝对不可能为真。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does skilled work, making things with their hands

name: artist
trans: n. 艺术家，画家

sentences.english: an exhibition of paintings by local artists
sentences.chinese: 当地画家的画展

detailed_translations.english: someone who produces art, especially paintings or drawings

name: aviator
trans: n. 飞行员，飞行家【记忆】词根记忆：avi（鸟）+ator（人）→像鸟一样飞翔的人→飞行员

sentences.english: In fact, the history of aviator jackets can be traced back to the First World War.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，飞行员夹克的历史可以追溯到第一次世界大战时期。

sentences.english: Other hats are inspired by history and fashion, such as the iconic aviator helmet or the cabbie cap which resembles old fashioned "newsboy" hats.
sentences.chinese: 其他一些帽子则是受了历史或时尚的启发，比如标志性的飞行员头盔，或是与旧风尚‘报童帽’相似的司机帽。

detailed_translations.english: a pilot

name: biographer
trans: n. 传记作家【同根】biography n. 传记

sentences.english: ...Picasso's biographer.
sentences.chinese: …毕加索的传记作者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes a biography of someone else

name: choreographer
trans: n. 舞蹈指导【记忆】词根记忆：choreo（=chor舞）+graph（写）+er（人）→写舞蹈的人→编舞指导

sentences.english: My choreographer keeps chiseling away at me, hoping to shape me into perfection.
sentences.chinese: 我的舞蹈编导总是不断雕琢我，一心将我塑造成完美的舞蹈家。

sentences.english: "A choreographer told me that what professionals are looking for in a good dancer is core body strength, " said Dr Neave.
sentences.chinese: “一个舞蹈编导告诉我专家们寻找优秀舞蹈演员的核心指标就是身体力量，”内尔博士透露。

sentences.english: The old master even invited him over to his house, where Jackson taught the moonwalk to him and his choreographer Hermes Pan.
sentences.chinese: 这位老前辈甚至邀请他到家里来，在这儿杰克逊为阿斯泰尔和他的舞蹈教练展示了太空步。

detailed_translations.english: A choreographer is someone who invents the movements for a ballet or other dance and tells the dancers how to perform them

name: connoisseur
trans: n. 鉴赏家，行家

sentences.english: a wine connoisseur
sentences.chinese: 品酒专家

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about something such as art, food, or music

name: crew
trans: n. 全体人员，（工作）队

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.english: a crew member
sentences.chinese: 一名机组人员

detailed_translations.english: all the people who work on a ship or plane

trans: n. 批评家，评论家；吹毛求疵者

sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

trans: n. 教育家

sentences.english: What more could an educator hope for than a student's desire to learn.
sentences.chinese: 除了学生的学习兴趣，教育者们别无所求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 教育家；教育工作者；教师
detailed_translations.english: a teacher or someone involved in the process of educating people

name: pilot
trans: n. 飞行员，领航员，引水员

sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: benefactor
trans: n. 恩人；捐助者【记忆】词根记忆：bene（好）+fact（=fac做）+ or （表人）→做好事的人→恩人【同根】beneficiary n. 受惠者，受益人

sentences.english: An anonymous benefactor donated $2 million.
sentences.chinese: 一位没留姓名的捐助人捐款二百万美元。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money for a good purpose

name: donor
trans: n. 捐赠人

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: humanitarian
trans: n. 人道主义者

sentences.english: And on each of those issues we have said that we would consider that and, in fact, have provided some humanitarian support.
sentences.chinese: 对于每一件这样的事情，我们都说过，我们将会对此进行考虑，事实上，我们向他们提供了人道主义援助。

sentences.english: But part of trying to do what is right for the Burmese people is to provide humanitarian assistance in this time of extreme need.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对缅甸人民来说，正确的行动部分是为他们提供人道主义援助，而在目前这个时刻更是极端的需要”。

sentences.english: But otherwise, it is best left to the humanitarian experts, who will be there after you are gone and therefore need to preserve their independence and their impartiality.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果不能，最好将这些任务留给人道主义专家，这些专家在部队撤退之后仍将留在那，因此需要保持他们的独立和公正。

name: resident
trans: n. 居民【记忆】词根记忆：resid(e)（居住）+ent（表人）→居民

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: spectator
trans: n. 观众；旁观者，目击者【搭配】spectator sport 吸引很多观众的体育运动【同义】viewer n. 观看者audience n. 听众，观众

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

trans: vt. 创造；产生【同根】creation n. 创造；作品recreation n. 消遣

sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: He walked with her, linking arms (= putting his arm around her arm ).
sentences.chinese: 他与她挽臂同行。

each ring of a chain

sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

sentences.chinese: 你腰围是多少？

name: survey
trans:
n. 调查；勘测；/səˈveɪ/
 v. 调查；勘测【记忆】联想记忆：surve（看作serve，服务）+y →前期调查是为后期工作服务的→调查【搭配】sample survey 抽样调查land survey 土地测量survey of reading 阅读习惯调查geological survey 地质勘测

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: field survey
trans: 实地调查

name: drone
trans: n. 无人遥控飞机

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

name: satellite imagery
trans: 卫星影像

trans: adj. （计算机系统）实时的【记忆】合成词：real（真实的）+time（时间）→实时的

name: data
trans: n. 数据；资料【记忆】联想记忆：数据（data）与日（date）更新【搭配】data analysis 数据分析data base 数据库data input 数据输入

sentences.english: The research involves collecting data from two random samples.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究需要从两个随机样本里收集资料。

detailed_translations.english: information or facts
information or facts

trans: adj. 土地的；耕地的【搭配】agrarian reform土地改革

sentences.english: This was a feature of agrarian development in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这是大不列颠土地发展的一个特征。

sentences.english: The patriarchal clan becomes the resistance revolution in the agrarian revolution the strength, therefore encounters suppresses and attacks.
sentences.chinese: 在土地革命中宗族成为对抗革命的力量，所以遭到抑制和打击。

detailed_translations.english: Agrarian means relating to the ownership and use of land, especially farmland, or relating to the part of a society or economy that is concerned with agriculture

name: arable
trans: adj. 可耕的；耕作的【搭配】arable land可耕地

sentences.english: arable farming
sentences.chinese: 耕作农业

sentences.english: arable land (=  land that is suitable for growing crops  )
sentences.chinese: 可耕地

detailed_translations.english: relating to growing crops

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。
