detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: bleak
trans: adj. 寒冷的；阴郁的；凄凉的；没有希望的【同义】cold adj. 冷淡的raw adj. 阴冷的dismal adj. 阴沉的，凄凉的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: clay
trans: n. 泥土，黏土【记忆】联想记忆：c+lay（层）→泥土成一层一层分布→泥土

sentences.english: Bricks are made from clay.
sentences.chinese: 砖是用黏土制成的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [土壤] 粘土；泥土；肉体；似黏土的东西
detailed_translations.english: a type of heavy sticky earth that can be used for making pots, bricks etc

name: clod
trans: n. 土块

name: contaminated land
trans: 受污染的土地

name: contaminated soil
trans: 受污染的土壤

name: desert
trans:
n. 沙漠；荒地；adj. 沙漠的；荒凉的；/dɪˈzɜːt/
 v. 舍弃【记忆】词根记忆：de（去掉）+sert（加入）→不加入，不让插入→舍弃

sentences.english: the Sahara Desert
sentences.chinese: 撒哈拉沙漠

sentences.english: This area of the country is mostly desert.
sentences.chinese: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

name: infertile
trans: adj. 贫瘠的；不能生育的【反义】fertile adj. 肥沃的；可繁殖的

sentences.english: infertile couples
sentences.chinese: 不孕的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 不肥沃的；不毛的；不结果实的；不能生殖的
detailed_translations.english: unable to have babies

name: land carrying capacity
trans: 土地承载能力

name: sterile
trans: adj. 无菌的；贫瘠的

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

name: terrace
trans: n. 梯田

sentences.english: Both a staircase and a lift connect the two floors with an enclosed terrace on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 通过一道楼梯和一台电梯连接两层楼和封闭的屋顶平台。

sentences.english: Mirrored walls, skylights and large plated windows overlooking the garden and terrace fill this modern space with light.
sentences.chinese: 镜墙、天窗和大型的金属镀窗俯瞰花园和阳台，让这个现代空间充满光线。

detailed_translations.english: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

name: topsoil
trans: n. 表土层【记忆】合成词：top（顶上的）+soil（土地）→表层土

sentences.english: Dump the topsoil here.
sentences.chinese: 把表土倒在这里。

sentences.english: Stone is the foundation, above which is soil, and then topsoil.
sentences.chinese: 石头是基础，上面是泥土，再上面是表土。

sentences.english: After shoveling out the topsoil, Garfinkel uncovered coins and other artifacts from the time of Alexander the Great.
sentences.chinese: 在铲去了表层土以后，加芬克尔发现了来自亚历山大大帝时期的硬币和其他人工制品。

detailed_translations.english: the upper level of soil in which most plants have their roots

name: tract
trans: n. （土地的）一大片

sentences.english: vast tracts of woodland
sentences.chinese: 大片大片的林地

detailed_translations.chinese: 束；大片土地，地带；小册子
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land

name: provide
trans: v. 提供【搭配】provide with 提供provide for 供给

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: accommodate
trans: v. 为…提供住所【同根】accommodation n. 膳宿；适应

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: furnish
trans: v. 为…配备家具；供应【反义】unfurnish v. 拆除…的家具

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: provision
trans: n. 供应；准备；条款【同义】preparation n. 准备，预备clause n. 子句；条款

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: enquire
trans: v. 打听；调查【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+quir（寻求，获得）+ e→使寻求获得→打听

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

name: fieldwork
trans: n. 实地调查；临时筑成的防御工事【记忆】合成词：field（野外的）+work（工作）→野外研究→实地调查

sentences.english: ...anthropological fieldwork.
sentences.chinese: ...人类学实地考察。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实地调查， 野外考察
detailed_translations.english: the study of scientific or social subjects, done outside the class or  laboratory

name: inquiry
trans: n. 调查，审查【同根】inspection n. 检查，审查

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查【记忆】联想记忆：invest（投资）+i+gate（大门）→调查是通往投资的大门→调查

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: observation
trans: n. 观察，观测【同根】observational adj. 观测的

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: observe
trans: vt. 观察；遵守【记忆】词根记忆：ob（加强）+serv（保持）+ e→一直保持→遵守

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: perspective
trans: n. （判断事物的）角度，方法；透视法【记忆】词根记忆：per（贯穿）+spect（看）+ ive→看穿→透视法

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: probe
trans: v. 探索 n. 探针；详尽调查【记忆】词根记忆：prob（检查，试）+e→探索

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: questionary
trans: n. 调查表，问卷

name: continue
trans: v. 继续，延续，延伸【反义】discontinue v. 中断；不连续

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

name: rage
trans: v. （火灾、疾病）迅速蔓延，快速扩散，肆虐

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: National Trust
trans: 国家信托

name: conservator
trans: n. 文物修复员；文物保护员

name: mobilise
trans: v. 动员；调动【搭配】mobilise the army调动军队

sentences.english: Israel, which has tried for years to mobilise international action against Iran , suddenly appears more sanguine.
sentences.chinese: 以色列， 多年来一直试图动员国际社会采取行动（果）霎时看到了转机和希望。

name: local
trans: adj. 当地的；地方的

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: stationer
trans: n. 文具店

name: especially
trans: adv. 特别，尤其

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

name: bulk
trans: n. 大量；大批【记忆】联想记忆：公牛（bull）总是大批（bulk）地行动

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: supply
trans: n. 供给，供应（量）；[常作pl.] 存货，必需品；v. 供给，供应；满足（需要），弥补（不足）【搭配】supply sth. to sb. 为…提供…

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: blotting paper
trans: 吸墨纸

name: desperately
trans: adv. 非常需要地

sentences.english: The doctors tried desperately to save her life.
sentences.chinese: 医生们不惜一切挽救她的生命。

sentences.english: He looked round desperately for someone to help him.
sentences.chinese: 他绝望地四处张望，希望有人来帮他。

detailed_translations.english: in a desperate way

name: anguish
trans: n. 痛苦【记忆】词根记忆：angu（苦恼）+ish→痛苦【搭配】in anguish在痛苦中

sentences.english: And we know of your anguish.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解你们的痛苦。

sentences.english: She suffered the anguish of despair.
sentences.chinese: 她忍受着绝望的痛苦。

sentences.english: And in their anguish, they both forgot the nearness of my bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 极度的痛苦让他们忘记我的卧室就在附近。

detailed_translations.english: mental or physical suffering caused by extreme pain or worry

name: avalanche
trans: n./v. 雪崩【搭配】snow avalanche 雪崩an avalanche of words 滔滔不绝的言辞【记忆】联想记忆：三个a像滚下的雪球→雪崩

sentences.english: Just after the avalanche.
sentences.chinese: 就在这雪崩后不久。

sentences.english: But what if the avalanche happened?
sentences.chinese: 不过，要是发生雪崩怎么办呢？

sentences.english: If the value was much lower than one, on the other hand, the avalanche would soon die out.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，如果结果是一个比一小很多的数字，那么雪崩很快就会停止。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of snow, ice, and rocks that falls down the side of a mountain

name: calamity
trans: n. 大灾祸，不幸事件【记忆】词根记忆：calam（不幸）+ity（表状况）→不幸事件【搭配】natural calamity 天灾

sentences.english: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.chinese: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering

name: casualty
trans: n. 伤亡（人员），伤亡者；损失的东西；伤亡事故【记忆】来自casual（adj. 偶然的）

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: cataclysm
trans: n. （突然降临的）大灾难，大灾变，大动乱【记忆】词根记忆：cata（向下）+clys（猛冲）+ m→向下猛冲→（突然降临的）大灾难

sentences.english: In The Possessed the earth quakes: it is not the catastrophe that befalls the imaginative individual, but a cataclysm in which a large portion of humanity is buried, wiped out forever.
sentences.chinese: 在《魔鬼》中发生了地震，这不仅是降临在富于想象力的人头上的大灾难，而是一大半人类被埋葬于其中、永远被消灭的大地震。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难； 大洪水；  大变动
detailed_translations.english: a violent or sudden event or change, such as a serious flood or  earthquake

name: catastrophe
trans: n. 大灾难【记忆】词根记忆：cat（看作cad，落下）+astro（星星）+phe→星星坠落，大难临头→大灾难

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

name: catastrophic
trans: adj. 悲惨的；灾难性的

sentences.english: A tidal wave caused by the earthquake hit the coast causing catastrophic damage.
sentences.chinese: 地震引发的海啸袭击了海岸，造成了灾难性的损失。

sentences.english: The water shortage in this country is potentially catastrophic.
sentences.chinese: 该国水资源的匮乏很可能是灾难性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灾难的；悲惨的；灾难性的，毁灭性的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is catastrophic involves or causes a sudden terrible disaster

name: debris
trans: n. 废墟，残骸；散落的碎片；[地理] 岩屑【记忆】发音记忆：“堆玻璃”→一堆碎玻璃→废墟

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: deluge
trans: n. 洪水，暴雨

sentences.english: There was a deluge of requests for interviews and statements.
sentences.chinese: 对接受访谈和发表声明的要求铺天盖地地涌来。

detailed_translations.english: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain

name: destroy
trans: v. 毁坏

sentences.english: companies that are polluting and destroying the environment
sentences.chinese: 污染和破坏环境的公司

detailed_translations.english: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be used or repaired

name: disaster
trans: n. 灾难

sentences.english: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
sentences.chinese: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。

sentences.english: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
sentences.chinese: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

sentences.english: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
sentences.chinese: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。

sentences.english: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一名登山者从山上滑落，他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。

sentences.english: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。

sentences.english: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
sentences.chinese: 灾难突然降临，两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。

sentences.english: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
sentences.chinese: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。

sentences.english: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
sentences.chinese: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机，侥幸避免了一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering

name: disastrous
trans: adj. 灾难性的，损失惨重的【搭配】disastrous flood 灾难性的洪水

sentences.english: a disastrous first marriage
sentences.chinese: 以失败告终的第一次婚姻

sentences.english: The move proved disastrous (= was disastrous ) for the company.
sentences.chinese: 这一行动对公司来说是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: very bad, or ending in failure

name: famine
trans: n. 饥饿，饥荒；奇缺

sentences.english: the great potato famine in Ireland
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰严重的土豆荒

sentences.english: A million people are facing famine .
sentences.chinese: 一百万人正面临饥荒。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large number of people have little or no food for a long time and many people die

name: massacre
trans: n. 大屠杀【搭配】massacre victim 大屠杀受害者

sentences.english: The army massacred more than 150 unarmed civilians.
sentences.chinese: 军队屠杀了150多名手无寸铁的平民。

sentences.english: the only survivor of the massacre
sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people or animals in a violent way, especially when they cannot defend themselves
when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

name: misfortune
trans: n. 不幸；灾祸，灾难【记忆】词根记忆：mis（坏）+fortune（好运）→没有好运→不幸【搭配】suffer great misfortune 遭到极大不幸companions in misfortune 难友【反义】fortune n. 运气

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

name: mishap
trans: n. 不幸

sentences.english: I had a slight mishap with one of the glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了一个小小的错误，把其中的一个玻璃杯打破了。

name: slaughter
trans: v. 屠杀，杀戮

sentences.english: Men, women and children were slaughtered and villages destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 村庄被毁，男人、女人和儿童惨遭杀戮。

sentences.english: Lack of chicken feed means that chicken farms are having to slaughter their stock.
sentences.chinese: 饲料不足意味着养鸡场将不得不宰杀鸡。

sentences.english: the slaughter of defenceless women and children
sentences.chinese: 对毫无自卫能力的妇孺的杀戮

sentences.english: the export of live animals for slaughter
sentences.chinese: 屠宰用活畜的出口

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people in a cruel or violent way
when large numbers of people are killed in a cruel or violent way

name: torment
trans:
v. 折磨；造成肉体或精神上的巨大痛苦；/ˈtɔːment/
 n. 折磨；拷问【记忆】词根记忆：tor（=tort扭曲）+ment→扭的状态→折磨【搭配】torture instruments 刑具tortured by anxiety 受焦虑的煎熬【同义】persecute v. 迫害

sentences.english: The journey must have been a torment for them.
sentences.chinese: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: severe mental or physical suffering
to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

name: unfortunate
trans: adj. 不幸的，倒霉的；遗憾的，可惜的【记忆】词根记忆：un（不）+fortunate（幸运的）→不幸的【搭配】unfortunate event不幸事件

sentences.english: When we entered the room, the teacher was yelling at some unfortunate student.
sentences.chinese: 我们进教室的时候，老师正在对着一个倒霉的学生吼叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is unfortunate has something bad happen to them

name: upheaval
trans: n. 剧变；激变；动乱；动荡【记忆】词根记忆：up（向上）+heaval（举起）→（矛盾）上升→动乱

sentences.english: political upheaval
sentences.chinese: 政治剧变

sentences.english: Moving house is a major upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 搬家很折腾。

detailed_translations.english: a very big change that often causes problems

name: victim
trans: n. 牺牲品，受害者【搭配】fall victim to 成为…的牺牲品；成为…的受害者【同义】sacrifice v./n. 牺牲

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

name: wreckage
trans: n. 残骸【搭配】aircraft wreckage 飞机残骸

sentences.english: Firemen managed to pull some survivors from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员设法从残骸中拖出了几名幸存者。

detailed_translations.chinese: （失事船或飞机等的）残骸；（船只等的）失事
detailed_translations.english: the parts of something such as a plane, ship, or building that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident

name: impetuous
trans: adj. 冲动的；轻率的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动，突如其来的念头；刺激，驱使；脉冲；v. 推动【记忆】词根记忆：im（使…）+puls（推）+e→推动【搭配】on (the) impulse (of...) 凭（…的）冲动

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: impulsive
trans: adj. 凭冲动行事的；易冲动的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

name: momentum
trans: n. 动力，冲力，势头；动量【记忆】联想记忆：moment（瞬间）+um→冲力在瞬间迸发→冲力【搭配】economic momentum 经济势头

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: motivate
trans: v. 激励，促进；成为…动机【记忆】词根记忆：motiv(e)（动机）+ate（使…）→使有动机→成为…动机

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: motivation
trans: n. 动力；动机，原因【搭配】motivation for... …的动机

name: motivational
trans: adj. 动机的，有关动机的

sentences.english: It may well be the case that the people raising the concerns have a personal or motivational problem with the improvement but don't feel comfortable voicing it.
sentences.chinese: 很可能那些提出个人担忧的人就有某种个人或动机问题需要改进，这是好事，但说出来以后并不一定会感到舒服一些。

sentences.english: My motivational system ensures that when I imagine the objectively better future it looks really great, far better than all the other options -- I'll be so happy!
sentences.chinese: 我的动机系统确保当我想象客观上更好的未来时，会感觉这种选择很棒，比其他所有选择都要棒得多──我会非常快乐！

detailed_translations.chinese: 动机的， 有关动机的

name: motive
trans: n. 动机，目的

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: stimulus
trans: n. 促进（因素），刺激（物）【搭配】fiscal stimulus 财政刺激

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: accidental explosion
trans: 意外爆炸

name: alarm bell
trans: 警铃

name: blast
trans: n. 一阵（大风）；冲击；v. 爆破；枯萎【搭配】blast wind 爆炸气浪

sentences.english: I had the gas fire going full blast .
sentences.chinese: 我把煤气取暖器开到最大。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind or air
to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

name: burning area
trans: 燃烧面积

name: burning intensity
trans: 燃烧强度

name: collapse
trans: v. 倒塌【记忆】词根记忆：col（共同）+laps（滑走）+e →一起滑落→倒塌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: combustible
trans: adj. 易燃的【搭配】combustible material可燃物；易燃材料

sentences.english: The ability of coal to release a combustible gas has long been known.
sentences.chinese: 煤能够释放易燃气体这一点早已为人所知。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易燃的；易激动的；燃烧性的
detailed_translations.english: able to burn easily

name: death by burning
trans: 烧死

name: death count
trans: 死亡数

name: devastating effect
trans: 毁灭性效果

name: elevated temperature
trans: 高温

name: elevator
trans: n. 电梯【搭配】take the elevator 乘电梯

sentences.english: We’ll have to take the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 我们只好坐电梯了。

detailed_translations.english: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building

name: emergency exit
trans: 安全出口

name: extinguish
trans: v. 熄灭；偿清【搭配】extinguish the flames 扑灭火焰

sentences.english: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 请把香烟都熄灭了。

sentences.english: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

sentences.english: All hope was almost extinguished.
sentences.chinese: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining

trans: 火警报警器

name: fire engine access
trans: 消防通道

name: fire engine
trans: 消防车

name: fire extinguisher
trans: 灭火器

name: fire hydrant
trans: 消防栓

name: fire injury
trans: 烧伤

name: fire inspection
trans: 防火检查

name: fire insurance
trans: 火灾保险

name: fire telephone
trans: 火警电话

name: firefighting
trans: n. 消防；防火

name: fireman
trans: n. 消防队员；救火队员【同义】firefighter n. 消防队员

sentences.english: Would you like to be a fireman?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意是一名消防队员吗？

sentences.english: Why would you like to be a fireman?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你愿意是一名消防队员？

sentences.english: When people asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up, I never said fireman or astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 每当有人来问我长大了要做什麽，我从来不会说消防员或是宇航员什麽的。

detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to stop fires burning

name: first aid telephone
trans: 急救电话

name: first aid
trans: 急救

sentences.english: Being given first aid at the scene of the accident probably saved his life.
sentences.chinese: 他在事故现场得到急救，这可能救了他的命。

detailed_translations.english: simple medical treatment that is given as soon as possible to someone who is injured or who suddenly becomes ill

trans: n. 抑制【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+hibit（拿）+ion→不让拿→禁止→抑制

sentences.english: She had no inhibitions about saying what she felt.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不顾忌地说出自己的感觉。

sentences.english: People tend to lose their inhibitions when they’ve drunk a lot of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 人们在喝多了酒之后往往会无所顾忌。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of shyness or embarrassment that stops you doing or saying what you really want

name: lifesaver
trans: n. 救生者，救生员

name: origin of the fire
trans: 火源

name: oxygen deficiency
trans: 缺氧

name: perish
trans: v. 死亡；丧生【搭配】perish from (of) 因…而死

sentences.english: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没，数百人罹难。

detailed_translations.english: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

name: poisonous atmosphere
trans: 有毒的大气

name: refuge
trans: v. 避难【搭配】take refuge 避难

sentences.english: a wildlife refuge
sentences.chinese: 野生动物保护区

detailed_translations.english: shelter or protection from someone or something

name: relief work
trans: 救援工作

name: rescue
trans: v./n. 营救，援救【搭配】rescue sb. from danger 营救某人脱险rescue work 营救工作【同义】save v. 挽救

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: self-contained breathing equipment
trans: 自给式呼吸设备

name: smoke
trans: v. 冒烟

sentences.english: I don’t smoke and I don’t drink much.
sentences.chinese: 我不吸烟，酒也喝得不多。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I smoke?
sentences.chinese: 我抽烟你介意吗？

sentences.english: He sat on the grass smoking a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在草地上吸烟。

sentences.english: He admitted that he had smoked marijuana when he was a student.
sentences.chinese: 他承认在读书时吸过大麻。

sentences.english: a smoking chimney
sentences.chinese: 冒烟的烟囱

sentences.english: Smoke from burning fields drifted across nearby roads.
sentences.chinese: 地里燃烧产生的烟雾飘到了附近的公路上。

name: stair
trans: n. 楼梯

sentences.chinese: 我们往上走了四段楼梯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

name: suffocation
trans: n. 窒息；闷死

name: water
trans: v. 给…浇水

sentences.english: There’s water all over the bathroom floor.
sentences.chinese: 浴室地面上都是水。

sentences.english: Does anyone want a drink of water?
sentences.chinese: 有谁想喝杯水吗？

sentences.english: a glass of sparkling mineral water
sentences.chinese: 一杯有气矿泉水

sentences.english: All rooms have hot and cold running water.
sentences.chinese: 所有房间都有冷热自来水供应。

sentences.english: Pour boiling water over the rice and let it soak.
sentences.chinese: 在大米中倒入沸水浸泡。

sentences.english: a fresh water spring
sentences.chinese: 淡水泉

sentences.english: When dealing with a burst pipe, always turn off the water first.
sentences.chinese: 处理破裂水管时，一定要先把水关掉。

sentences.english: contamination of the local water supply
sentences.chinese: 当地供水受到污染

sentences.english: Will you water my houseplants while I’m away?
sentences.chinese: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？

sentences.english: The garden needs watering daily.
sentences.chinese: 花园每天都需要浇水。

detailed_translations.english: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc

name: contribution
trans: n. 捐献，贡献【搭配】make contributions to... 捐赠（贡献）给…
