sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学【搭配】modern physics 近代物理，现代物理

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的【记忆】词根记忆：im（不）+mens（测量）+e →不能测量的→巨大的，广大的【搭配】an immense improvement 巨大的进步

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: demonstrate
trans: v. 论证，说明；演示；举行示威游行（或集会）【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+monstr（显示）+ ate（做）→加强显示→论证，说明【搭配】demonstrate one's ability 显示自己的能力【同根】demonstration n. 示范，表演【同义】display vt. 展览，显示show v. 说明，显示illustrate vt. 举例说明，阐明

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: subsequent
trans: adj. 随后的【记忆】词根记忆：sub（下面）+sequ（跟随）+ ent（…的）→在下面跟随→随后的【搭配】subsequent on 作为…的结果发生subsequent event 后来发生的事【同根】subsequently adv. 随后；接着

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: generation
trans: n. 一代；产生；一代人【搭配】generation gap代沟lost generation迷失的一代

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

name: nuclear
trans: adj. 核能的，原子能的【记忆】联想记忆：nu+clear（清除）→清除核危机→核能的【搭配】nuclear energy 核动力nuclear family 小家庭

sentences.english: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
sentences.chinese: 法国对核能的依赖

sentences.english: a nuclear power station
sentences.chinese: 核电站

sentences.english: a nuclear-powered submarine
sentences.chinese: 核动力潜艇

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the nucleus of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom

name: physicist
trans: n. 物理学家；物理学研究者【记忆】词根记忆：phys（自然）+ic+ist（从事某研究的人）→研究自然的人→物理学家

sentences.english: a nuclear physicist
sentences.chinese: 一位核物理学家

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in physics

name: chemist
trans: n. 化学家【记忆】词根记忆：chem（化学）+ist（从事某研究的人）→化学家

sentences.english: She worked as a research chemist.
sentences.chinese: 她是一名化学研究员。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in chemistry

name: colossal
trans: adj. 巨大的，庞大的

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

name: enormous
trans: adj. 巨大的，庞大的【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+norm（规则）+ous（…的）→超出规范的→巨大的【搭配】enormous expenditure 巨额开支enormous amount of 大量的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: enormously
trans: adv. 巨大地，庞大地

name: gigantic
trans: adj. 巨大的，庞大的【记忆】联想记忆：gigant（看作giant，巨人）+ic （…的）→巨大的【反义】tiny adj. 极小的，微小的microscopic adj. 极小的

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.english: extremely big

name: immeasurable
trans: adj. 不可估量的；无限的【记忆】词根记忆：im（不）+measur（测量）+ able （能…的）→不能测量的

sentences.english: The refugee problem has now reached immeasurable proportions.
sentences.chinese: 难民问题现在已经到了无法估量的程度。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is too big or too extreme to be measured

name: incalculable
trans: adj. 极大的；不可计算的；不可估量的

sentences.english: Her contribution to our work is incalculable.
sentences.chinese: 她对我们工作的贡献极大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可估量的，无法计算的
detailed_translations.english: too great to be calculated

name: magnitude
trans: n. 广大，巨大；重要（性）；星球的光亮度【记忆】词根记忆：magn（大）+itude（表状态）→广大

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

detailed_translations.english: the great size or importance of something

name: mammoth
trans: adj. 极其巨大的；庞大的

sentences.english: One of the two mammoth museums.
sentences.chinese: 两个猛犸象博物馆中的一个。

sentences.english: Partial remains of five mastodons, three Ice Age bison and a juvenile Columbian mammoth, as well as plant matter and insects, have also been found.
sentences.chinese: 同时发现的还有五头乳齿象、三头冰河期野牛和一只少年哥伦比亚猛犸象的遗骸，以及植物和昆虫。

detailed_translations.english: an animal like a large hairy  elephant  that lived on Earth thousands of years ago
extremely large

name: mighty
trans: adj. 巨大的；非凡的

sentences.english: the mighty Mississippi river
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的密西西比河

sentences.english: a mighty army
sentences.chinese: 强大的军队

detailed_translations.chinese: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的
detailed_translations.english: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
very

name: prodigious
trans: adj. 惊人的，奇妙的；巨大的【同义】wonderful adj. 奇妙的huge adj. 巨大的

sentences.english: the artist’s prodigious output
sentences.chinese: 那位艺术家惊人的高产

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的，异常的，奇妙的；巨大的
detailed_translations.english: very large or great in a surprising or impressive way

name: tremendous
trans: adj. 极大的；非常的；巨大的【记忆】词根记忆：trem（颤抖）+end（末，尾）+ ous（…的）→让人从头到尾颤抖的→非常的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: vast
trans: adj. 巨大的；大量的【记忆】联想记忆：古老的东方（east）地大物博，人口众多（vast）【同根】vastness n. 巨大

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: vastly
trans: adv. 巨大地；大量地

sentences.english: The jury has heard two vastly different accounts.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团听到了两种极为不同的陈述。

detailed_translations.english: Vastly means to an extremely great degree or extent

name: celebrated
trans: adj. 有名的，知名的【搭配】famous celebrated 著名的

sentences.english: a celebrated actress
sentences.chinese: 著名女演员

sentences.english: a celebrated legal case
sentences.chinese: 一宗备受关注的官司

detailed_translations.english: famous

detailed_translations.chinese: 庆祝（celebrate的过去式和过去分词）

name: complimentary
trans: adj. 表示钦佩的；赞美的

sentences.english: There was a complimentary bottle of champagne in the hotel room.
sentences.chinese: 酒店客房里有一瓶免费赠送的香槟。

sentences.english: I’ve got some complimentary tickets for the theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我有几张今晚的免费戏票。

detailed_translations.english: given free to people

name: eminent
trans: adj. 杰出的，显赫的【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+min（突出）+ent（…的） →杰出的，显赫的

sentences.english: an eminent lawyer
sentences.chinese: 杰出的律师

detailed_translations.english: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected

name: entitle
trans: vt. 给…权利（或资格）；给（书、文章等）题名；给…以称号【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+title（题目，标题） →给…题名【搭配】be entitled to... 有权…，有资格…

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: laudable
trans: adj. 值得赞美的

sentences.english: a laudable attempt
sentences.chinese: 值得称道的尝试

detailed_translations.english: deserving praise, even if not completely successful

name: legendary
trans: adj. 传说的，传奇的【记忆】词根记忆：legend（传说，传奇）+ary（…的）→传说的，传奇的

sentences.english: Lonnie Johnson, the legendary blues guitarist
sentences.chinese: 传奇蓝调吉他手朗尼·约翰逊

sentences.english: Her singing was legendary.
sentences.chinese: 她唱歌非常有名。

detailed_translations.english: very famous and admired

name: lofty
trans: adj. 崇高的；高傲的【搭配】lofty ideal 崇高的理想

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

name: matchless
trans: adj. 无比的，无敌的

name: notable
trans: adj. 值得注意的，显著的；杰出的；n. 名人，要人【同根】notably adv. 显著地，特别地

sentences.english: If there are any notable inconsistencies or discrepancies, think through how you are going to explain the situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

detailed_translations.english: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

name: noteworthy
trans: adj. 显著的，值得注目的

sentences.english: a noteworthy achievement
sentences.chinese: 显著的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的， 值得注目的
detailed_translations.english: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention

name: noted
trans: adj. 闻名的

sentences.english: a noted author
sentences.chinese: 著名作家

detailed_translations.english: well known or famous, especially because of some special quality or ability

name: pre-eminent
trans: adj. 卓越的，杰出的，超凡的

name: prominent
trans: adj. 突出的；著名的；显著的【记忆】词根记忆：pro（向前）+min（突出）+ ent（…的）→突出的

sentences.english: a prominent Russian scientist
sentences.chinese: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

sentences.english: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

sentences.english: a prominent nose
sentences.chinese: 高鼻子

detailed_translations.english: important

name: renowned
trans: adj. 有名的；受尊敬的

sentences.english: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区以其罗马式教堂闻名。

detailed_translations.english: known and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: supreme
trans: adj. （级别或地位）最高的，至高无上的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

name: commend
trans: v. 称赞，表扬【搭配】commend for... 为…赞扬

sentences.english: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。

sentences.english: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
sentences.chinese: 各位同事，我向你们推荐这份报告。

detailed_translations.english: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

name: compliment
trans:
n. 赞美；[pl.] 问候，祝贺；/ˈkɒmplɪment/
 v. 赞美【记忆】联想记忆：compli（看作accomplish，成功）+ment→成功后会收到许多赞美→赞美

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: laud
trans: v. 赞扬；赞美

sentences.english: He lauded the work of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees.
sentences.chinese: 他赞扬了联合国难民事务高级专员的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something

name: deference
trans: n. 敬意

sentences.english: "Manners used to be enforced through fear and deference to the Maker, the monarch, and the men, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他继续说：“礼仪规范过去通过对上帝，君主和男子的畏惧和顺从得以实现。

sentences.english: The second virtue they develop is deference, the willingness to listen and learn from the moral and intellectual storehouses of the people you are trying to elp.
sentences.chinese: 他们发展的第二个美德是顺从敬意，乐意听从其他他们试图帮助的品行端正和智慧的人，并从他们知识宝库中学习。

sentences.english: In practice, each public school is an independent kingdom that pays nominal deference to education authorities.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每一所公办学校都是一个独立的王国，名义上顺从教育当局。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

name: dignify
trans: vt. 使尊荣，使高贵【记忆】词根记忆：dign（高贵）+ify（使…）→使高贵

sentences.english: Tragic literature dignifies sorrow and disaster.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧性文学使悲伤和灾难显得尊贵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使高贵；增威严；授以荣誉

name: dignified
trans: adj. 有尊严的

sentences.english: a dignified old lady
sentences.chinese: 庄重的老太太

sentences.english: She made a dignified departure.
sentences.chinese: 她不失尊严地离去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 庄严的；有尊严的；高贵的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a calm and serious way, even in a difficult situation, which makes people respect you

name: prestige
trans: n. 威望，声望

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: respect
trans: vt. 尊敬；n. 尊敬；关心；方面【记忆】词根记忆：re（一再）+spect（看）→一再注视，以示尊敬→尊敬【同根】respectable adj. 值得尊敬的

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: revere
trans: v. 敬畏；崇敬【记忆】词根记忆：rever（敬畏）+e→敬畏【搭配】revere virtue 崇尚美德

sentences.english: The Chinese revered corn as a gift from heaven.
sentences.chinese: 中国人将谷物奉为天赐礼物。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something very much

name: reverence
trans: n./v. 尊敬【搭配】with reverence 诚惶诚恐

sentences.english: We stand together now in mutual support and in reverence for the dead.
sentences.chinese: 出于相互支持和对逝者的敬意，我们现在站到了一起。

detailed_translations.english: great respect and admiration for someone or something

name: accelerator
trans: n. 粒子加速器【记忆】词根记忆：ac（加强）+celer（快）+ ator→粒子加速器

name: atom
trans: n. 原子

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: beam
trans: n. 光柱，光束

sentences.english: ...high-energy laser beams.
sentences.chinese: …高能激光束。

detailed_translations.chinese: 横梁；光线；电波；船宽；[计量] 秤杆
detailed_translations.english: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 发送；以梁支撑；用…照射；流露
detailed_translations.english: to send a radio or television signal through the air, especially to somewhere very distant

name: chafe
trans: vt. （把身体某一部分）擦热

sentences.english: My shorts were chafing my thighs.
sentences.chinese: 我的短裤蹭得我大腿疼。

detailed_translations.english: to rub part of your body to make it warm

name: clutter
trans: n. 杂乱的东西；v. 塞满，乱堆

sentences.english: Could you get rid of some of that clutter in your bedroom?
sentences.chinese: 你能把你卧室那些杂物清理掉一些吗？

detailed_translations.english: a large number of things that are scattered somewhere in an untidy way
to cover or fill a space or room with too many things, so that it looks very untidy

name: cohesion
trans: n. 附着（力）

sentences.english: a sense of community and social cohesion
sentences.chinese: 社区意识和社会凝聚力

detailed_translations.chinese: 凝聚；结合；[力] 内聚力
detailed_translations.english: if there is cohesion among a group of people, a set of ideas etc, all the parts or members of it are connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: concave
trans: adj. 凹面的【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+cave（洞）→像洞一样→凹面的

sentences.english: a concave lens
sentences.chinese: 凹透镜

detailed_translations.english: a concave surface is curved inwards in the middle

name: conduction
trans: n. 传导

sentences.english: Temperature becomes uniform by heat conduction until finally a permanent state is reached.
sentences.chinese: 通过热传导，温度变得一致，直到最终达到一个恒定状态。

detailed_translations.english: the passage of electricity through wires, heat through metal, water through pipes etc

name: convex
trans: adj. 凸出的，凸面的

sentences.english: a convex lens
sentences.chinese: 凸透镜

sentences.english: a convex mirror
sentences.chinese: 凸镜

detailed_translations.english: curved outwards, like the surface of the eye

name: decelerate
trans: v. （使）减速【记忆】词根记忆：de（减少）+celer（速度）+ ate（使…）→（使）减速

sentences.english: ...the sensation of the train decelerating.
sentences.chinese: ... 火车减速的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: to go slower, especially in a vehicle

name: declivity
trans: n. 下斜，倾斜【记忆】词根记忆：de（向下）+cliv（倾斜）+ity →下斜

name: dilute
trans: v. 稀释，冲淡【记忆】词根记忆：di（分开）+lut（冲洗）+ e→ （用水）冲洗开→冲淡

sentences.english: dilute hydrochloric acid
sentences.chinese: 稀盐酸

detailed_translations.english: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

name: distillation
trans: n. 蒸馏【记忆】词根记忆：dis（分开）+till（小水滴）+ ation →通过形成水滴来分离→蒸馏

sentences.english: He tried to obtain another material by distillation.
sentences.chinese: 他试图通过蒸馏法获得另一种物质。

sentences.english: Also, in traditional black forest cakes, kirsch, which is a clear colorless fruit brandy which is made from double distillation of morellos is added.
sentences.chinese: 此外，传统的黑森林蛋糕中还会加入樱桃酒，这是一种清澈无色的水果白兰地，由欧洲酸樱桃经两次蒸馏后制成。

sentences.english: When carvone begins to distill, the condensation can be seen inside the thermometer adapter, thus the progress of carvone distillation can be readily monitored.
sentences.chinese: 当香芹酮开始蒸馏时，在温度计转接器内可看到有冷凝，因此能够容易地监察香芹酮的蒸馏过程。

name: dynamic
trans: n. 动力学【记忆】词根记忆：dynam（力量）+ic（…学）→力量学→动力学

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: elasticity
trans: n. 弹性【记忆】词根记忆：elastic（弹性的）+ity（表名词）→弹性【参考】elastic adj. 有弹性的

sentences.english: the skin’s natural elasticity
sentences.chinese: 皮肤天生的弹性

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to stretch and go back to its usual length or size

name: electricity
trans: n. 电流，电

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: electron
trans: n. 电子【记忆】词根记忆：electr（电）+on（物质结构成分）→电子

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点，焦距

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力；严重性；严肃【记忆】词根记忆：grav（重）+ity（表名词）→重力

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: inertia
trans: n. 惯性；惰性【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+ert（活力）+ia→没有活力→惰性

sentences.english: Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 飞机靠惯性着陆。

sentences.english: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

name: intensity
trans: n. 强烈，剧烈；强度【搭配】lower intensity 较低强度

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: liquid
trans: n. 液体，流体

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 磁的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: magnetism
trans: n. 磁性，磁力；吸引力

sentences.english: ...his research in electricity and magnetism.
sentences.chinese: …他在电、磁领域的研究。

sentences.english: his personal magnetism
sentences.chinese: 他的个人魅力

detailed_translations.english: the physical force that makes two metal objects pull towards each other or push each other apart

name: matter
trans: n. 物质

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: mechanics
trans: n. 机械学，力学

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

name: negative
trans: adj. 负电的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: neutron
trans: n. 中子【记忆】词根记忆：neutr（中间）+on（物理学名词）→中子

sentences.english: Each atomic cluster is made up of neutrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 每个原子团簇是由中子和质子组成的。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an atom that has no electrical charge

name: nucleus
trans: n. 核子

sentences.english: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.chinese: 在一个原子的核内，中子和质子聚合在一起。

sentences.english: the nucleus of an effective team
sentences.chinese: 高效团队的核心

detailed_translations.english: the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles

name: positive
trans: adj. （电）正极的，阳性的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: precipitate
trans: v. （使）淀析；促成，加速【记忆】词根记忆：pre（前）+cipit（头）+ate→头往前→加速

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入
detailed_translations.english: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的
detailed_translations.english: A precipitate action or decision happens or is made more quickly or suddenly than most people think is sensible

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: proton
trans: n. 质子

sentences.english: So we get at the number of neutrons indirectly because we know the proton number here.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们可以间接得到中子数,因为我们知道质子数了。

sentences.english: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.chinese: 原子内的一个中子衰变后会产生一个质子、一个电子和一个中微子。

sentences.english: Hydrogen, the most common molecule in the universe, is just two atoms—each with one proton and one electron.
sentences.chinese: 是宇宙中最普通的分子，仅有两个原子构成，每个原子仅包含一个质子和一个电子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical  charge  that is in the central part of an atom

name: quantum
trans: n. 量子；量子论【记忆】词根记忆：quant（量）+um→量子

sentences.english: But it does happen in quantum mechanics.
sentences.chinese: 但它在量子力学中就发生了。

sentences.english: What happens when you try to copy one quantum variable onto another?
sentences.chinese: 您试图把一个量子变量拷贝到另一个上时发生了什么事？

sentences.english: If quantum computing can become a reality in the near future, it can provide a more effective and safer way to interact with the Internet, even for the development of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 若量子计算在不久的将来能够成为现实，便可以与量子通信一起为互联网，甚至人类的发展提供一种更有效、更安全的信息交互方式。

detailed_translations.english: a unit of energy in nuclear physics

name: refraction
trans: n. 折光，折射【记忆】词根记忆：re（回）+fract（打碎）+ion →打碎（光线）→折射

sentences.english: If water had a negative index of refraction, then a straw placed in a glass would appear to bend back under itself.
sentences.chinese: 如果水具有负折射率，那么放在玻璃杯中的吸管似乎可能弯曲到自身下方。

sentences.english: With all that reflection and refraction, modernism creates the illusion that there is an illusion when in fact it is a straightforward statement of money and power.
sentences.chinese: 通过反射和折射，现代主义创造了一个幻觉存在的假象，而实际上它是对金钱和权力不加掩饰的声明。

sentences.english: Rapidly changing refraction due to turbulence along the line of sight affects different colors of light by different amounts and generally produces a twinkling effect for stars.
sentences.chinese: 由于湍流而快速变化的折射在视线中会影响到光的不同颜色，这种影响也各不相同，一般会给恒星产生一种闪烁的效果。

name: resonance
trans: n. 共鸣；共振；洪亮【记忆】词根记忆：re（回）+son（声音）+ance →回声→共振

sentences.english: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.chinese: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.english: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

detailed_translations.english: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences

name: solid
trans: n. 固体；adj. 固体的

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

name: temperature
trans: n. 温度

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

name: thaw
trans: v. （使）溶化，（使）融解

sentences.english: The lake thawed in March.
sentences.chinese: 3月里，湖水解冻了。

detailed_translations.english: if ice or snow thaws, or if the sun thaws it, it turns into water
a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt

name: thermodynamics
trans: n. 热力学【记忆】词根记忆：thermo（热）+dynamics（动力学）→热力学

sentences.english: But we know thermodynamics is all about equilibrium.
sentences.chinese: 但我们知道热力学都是关于平衡的。

sentences.english: And we went through that and saw what the thermodynamics worked out to be.
sentences.chinese: 我们算出了他们,并看到了它们的热力学应该是怎样的。

sentences.english: And so we can immediately start in deriving all of the thermodynamics, right?
sentences.chinese: 这样我们可以马上开始,得到所有热力学的量对吧？

detailed_translations.english: the science that deals with the relationship between heat and other forms of energy

name: thermometer
trans: n. 温度计【搭配】read a thermometer 看温度计读数

sentences.english: The thermometer registered over 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 温度计显示高于100摄氏度。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

name: vector
trans: n. 向量，矢量

sentences.english: Now, how do we get this unit vector?
sentences.chinese: 那我们怎么得到这单位矢量呢？

sentences.english: This new tutorial will change the way you use vector graphics.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的教程将改变你使用矢量图形的方式。

sentences.english: Multiplies every component of this vector by the same component of scale.
sentences.chinese: 由缩放的相同的组件对应乘以这个矢量的每个组件。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity such as force that has a direction as well as size

name: velocity
trans: n. 速度；迅速，快速；速率【同义】speed n. 迅速，速度，速率rapidity n. 速度，迅速

sentences.english: the velocity of light
sentences.chinese: 光速

sentences.english: The speedboat reached a velocity of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 快艇的时速达到了120英里。

sentences.english: a high velocity bullet
sentences.chinese: 高速子弹

detailed_translations.english: the speed of something that is moving in a particular direction

name: ventilation
trans: n. 空气流通；通风设备，通风方法【搭配】room with good ventilation 通风良好的房间

sentences.english: I see no ventilation to speak of, none from a window or a ventilator at least.
sentences.chinese: 我看不到通风设备，连窗户或至少一个通风扇也没有。

sentences.english: There is not a single pane of glass anywhere around the site, and the only mechanical ventilation installed is in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 基地内的任何地方都没有单一的玻璃窗格，而且唯一的机械通风设备安装在了画廊中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通风设备； 空气流通

name: taxonomist
trans: n. 分类学家【同根】taxonomy n. 分类学

name: overlook
trans: v. 忽略；俯瞰【同义】forget v. 忽略ignore v. 忽视【同根】ecology n. 生态学

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: limited
trans: adj. 有限的

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

name: specimen
trans: n. 范例，样品；样本，标本【记忆】词根记忆：speci（种类）+men（表名词） →种类的典型→样品【搭配】specimen page 标本页【同义】sample n. 标本

sentences.english: a blood specimen
sentences.chinese: 血样

detailed_translations.english: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

name: taxonomic
trans: adj. 分类的

name: investigation
trans: n. 调查；调查研究【搭配】investigation team 调查组

sentences.english: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 调查持续了近三年。

sentences.english: a criminal investigation
sentences.chinese: 刑事调查

sentences.english: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: devalue
trans: v. 使…贬值【记忆】词根记忆：de（去掉）+val（价值）+ ue→去掉价值→贬值【反义】appreciation n. 欣赏，感激appreciative adj. 感谢的，赞赏的appreciable adj. 值得重视的；可感知的

sentences.english: Nigeria has just devalued its currency .
sentences.chinese: 尼日利亚刚刚令自己的货币贬值。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money

name: estimate
trans:
v. 估计，估量；/ˈestɪmət/
 n. 估计，估量，估价【记忆】词根记忆：est（存在）+im+ate（做）→对存在的东西做评价【搭配】estimated time of arrival（ETA） 预测到达时间estimated time of departure（ETD） 预计出发时间estimated number of people 预计人数conservative estimate 保守估计

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: evaluate
trans: vt. 评价，估价【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+valu（价值）+ate（做）→出价→估价

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: invaluable
trans: adj. 无价的【记忆】词根记忆：in（不）+valuable（值钱的）→无价的

sentences.english: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
sentences.chinese: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常宝贵的， 极为贵重的， 无价的
detailed_translations.english: extremely useful

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的，赚钱的；有益的【记忆】词根记忆：profit（利益）+able（能…的）→能获利的→有利可图的【搭配】a highly profitable business 很有利可图的生意【同义】beneficial adj. 有益的，有利的lucrative adj. 赚钱的；有利可图的【反义】unprofitable adj. 无益的；无利润的worthless adj. 无价值的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: worthy
trans: adj. 有价值的；值得的【同根】unworthy adj. 没有价值的；不值得的

sentences.english: Leeds United were worthy winners of the competition.
sentences.chinese: 利兹联队是比赛当之无愧的获胜者。

sentences.english: a worthy opponent
sentences.chinese: 值得钦佩的对手

sentences.english: A couple of other books are worthy of mention.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些其他的书值得一提

detailed_translations.english: deserving respect from people

name: behalf
trans: n. 为了…的利益，利益；代表；方面；维护，支持【记忆】联想记忆：be（使…）+half（半）→使两半，一变二，当然生利→利益【搭配】on one's behalf 代表on behalf of 代表，为了

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: bolster
trans: n. 垫子；vt. 支持；支撑

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

name: endorse
trans: vt. 支持，赞同【搭配】endorse a candidate 支持候选人

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

name: supportive
trans: adj. 支持的，支援的；赞助的

sentences.english: My family were very supportive throughout the divorce.
sentences.chinese: 离婚过程中我的家人自始至终都很支持我。

detailed_translations.english: giving help or encouragement, especially to someone who is in a difficult situation – used to show approval

name: sustain
trans: v. 支撑，承受；维持，保持；经受，遭受【记忆】词根记忆：sus+tain（保持）→保持【搭配】sustain hardship 忍受艰苦sustain a person's spirit 使某人振作sustain growth 维持增长【同根】sustainable adj. 可持续的；足可支撑的

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: sympathetic
trans: adj. 同情的，体谅的；赞同的，支持的；和谐的【记忆】词根记忆：sym（共同）+path（感情）+ etic（…的）→有共同感情的→同情的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: check
trans: v. 检查，核对；突然停止，制止；做标记；n. 检查，核对；制止；支票，账单【同根】checker n. 检验员，审查员check-in n. 登记；登记处check-out n. 办理退房及退房手续checklist n. 清单checked adj. 有格子图案的

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: check-up
trans: n. 检查；体检

sentences.english: I went to the hospital for a check-up this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我到医院去做了一次检查。

sentences.english: Conclusion Taking full advantage of media and personal communication measures, we should strengthen health education for TB patients during check-up, treatment and supervision.
sentences.chinese: 结论应结合检查治疗督导，充分利用媒体和人际传播手段，加强对结核病患者的健康教育。

sentences.english: So, female friends must hide nothing from thy physician, regular gynaecological check-up can let we detected gynecological diseases, thus coming on earlier will complete cure disease.
sentences.chinese: 所以，女性朋友千万不要讳疾忌医，定期做妇科检查可以让我们及时的发现妇科疾病，从而在发病初期将疾病完全治愈。

name: examine
trans: vt. 检查；调查，研究；测验【同根】examiner n. 主考者examination n. 考试；检查

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: inspect
trans: vt. 检查，检阅【记忆】词根记忆：in（进入）+spect（看）→进去查看→检查，检阅【同根】inspector n. 检查员inspection n. 检查，视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: scrutiny
trans: n. 细察，详细检查【记忆】词根记忆：scru（音似：四顾）+tiny（微小的）→连微小的都要顾到→细察【同义】inquiry n. 调查，审查inspection n. 检查，审查【反义】neglect n. 疏忽，忽视

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

name: block
trans: n. 一块；栋，幢；一组，一批

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

name: countless
trans: adj. 无数的

sentences.english: a famous film clip which has been shown countless times
sentences.chinese: 播放了无数次的一段著名电影选段

detailed_translations.english: too many to be counted

name: fraught
trans: adj. 担心的，忧虑的；充满…的

sentences.english: The earliest operations employing this technique were fraught with dangers.
sentences.chinese: 最早采用这一技术的手术充满了危险。

detailed_translations.english: If a situation or action is fraught with problems or risks, it is filled with them

name: innumerable
trans: adj. 无数的

sentences.english: She’s served on innumerable committees.
sentences.chinese: 她在多个委员会担任委员。

detailed_translations.english: very many, or too many to be counted

name: majority
trans: n. 多数，大多数【搭配】majority status 成人身份

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: quantitative
trans: adj. 定量的；量的，数量的【搭配】quantitative analysis 定量分析

sentences.english: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

detailed_translations.english: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something

name: quantity
trans: n. 量

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: redundant
trans: adj. （因人员过剩而）被解雇的；多余的；累赘的【搭配】redundant staff 超额人员

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: suffuse
trans: vt. 充满【记忆】词根记忆：suf（下）+fus（流）+e→在下面流（得到处都是）→充满

sentences.english: The light of the setting sun suffused the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 落日的霞光映红了云层。

sentences.english: Hot colour suffused her cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸涨得又红又烫。

detailed_translations.english: if warmth, colour, liquid etc suffuses something or someone, it covers or spreads through them

name: total
trans: n. 总数，总量；adj. 总的

sentences.english: a total ban on cigarette advertising
sentences.chinese: 香烟广告的全面禁止

sentences.english: He looked at her with a total lack of comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 他一头雾水地望着她。

sentences.english: a sport that demands total commitment
sentences.chinese: 需要全身心投入的体育运动

detailed_translations.english: complete, or as great as is possible
to reach a particular total

name: volume
trans: n. 卷，册；体积；音量

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: dearth
trans: n. 缺乏，短缺【记忆】联想记忆：dear（珍贵的）+th→物以稀为贵→缺乏，短缺【搭配】a dearth of water 水源缺乏

sentences.english: EXCEPT as Pearl, in the dearth of human playmates, was thrown more upon the visionary throng which she created.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是由于缺乏玩伴，她同自己创造出来的幻想中的人群更加接近而己。

sentences.english: So for now, this dearth of data means that scientists must rely on climate models to estimate the effects of large-scale burning by aborigines.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在数据的缺乏也就意味着科学家必须依靠气候模型来估计土著大规模焚烧对于气候的影响。

sentences.english: See there is no dearth of knowledge and entrepreneurial skills in we Indians. The only question is that shall we be considered while opting for technology from abroad?
sentences.chinese: 看到没有，我们印度人并不缺乏知识与创业技能。唯一的问题在于我们在追求外国技术的同时有没有考虑去挖掘自身的能力。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

name: deficient
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的【搭配】deficient in 在某方面缺乏

sentences.english: Women who are dieting can become iron deficient.
sentences.chinese: 节食的女性有可能缺铁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的
detailed_translations.english: not containing or having enough of something

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不充分的，不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: lacking
trans: adj. 缺少的，不足的；没有的【搭配】lacking in 缺少，不足

name: paucity
trans: n. 不足，缺乏【搭配】paucity of缺乏

sentences.english: Even the film's impressive finale can't hide the first hour's paucity of imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影在开头一个小时中毫无想象力，即使有个让人印象深刻的结局也无法掩盖这个缺憾。

detailed_translations.english: less than is needed of something

name: rareness
trans: n. 稀有，罕见

name: scant
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的

sentences.english: The story has received scant attention in the press.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没在报界引起多少注意。

sentences.english: They produce goods with scant regard for quality.
sentences.chinese: 他们的产品不够重视质量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；缺乏的；勉强够的
detailed_translations.english: not enough

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀少的，罕见的【搭配】scarce metal 稀有金属

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: scarcity
trans: n. 不足，缺乏【搭配】scarcity of缺乏

sentences.english: ...an ever increasing scarcity of water.
sentences.chinese: …越来越匮乏的水资源。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something

name: skimpy
trans: adj. 不足的，不够的

name: sole
trans: adj. 唯一的；独有的；n. 鞋底，袜底，脚底【同根】solely adv. 唯一地；独自地

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: solitary
trans: adj. 单个的；单独的；孤独的；独居的【记忆】词根记忆：sol（单独）+it（走）+ary（…的）→一个人走→孤独的

sentences.english: a long, solitary walk
sentences.chinese: 独自一人的长距离散步

detailed_translations.english: doing something without anyone else with you
someone who lives completely alone

name: sparse
trans: adj. 稀少的，稀疏的【同根】sparsely adv. 稀少地，稀疏地

sentences.english: his sparse brown hair
sentences.chinese: 他那稀疏的棕色头发

sentences.english: rural areas with sparse populations
sentences.chinese: 人口稀少的农村地区

detailed_translations.english: existing only in small amounts

name: sporadic
trans: adj. 零星的【同根】sporadically adv. 偶发地；零星地

sentences.english: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
sentences.chinese: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: tiny
trans: adj. 极小的，微小的

sentences.english: a tiny community in the Midwest
sentences.chinese: 中西部地区一个极小的社区

sentences.english: The earrings were tiny.
sentences.chinese: 耳环很小。

sentences.english: a tiny little baby
sentences.chinese: 丁点大的婴儿

sentences.english: She always felt a tiny bit sad.
sentences.chinese: 她总是感到一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: Bad teachers are a tiny minority .
sentences.chinese: 差老师只占极少数。

sentences.english: tiny pieces of paper
sentences.chinese: 碎纸屑片

detailed_translations.english: extremely small

name: combine
trans: v. 联合，结合【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+bin（两个）+ e→使两个在一起→结合【搭配】combine...with... 联合…和…【同根】combination n. 结合

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: oppose
trans: vt. 反对，反抗【记忆】词根记忆：op（相反）+pos（放）+ e→摆出相反的姿态→反对，反抗【搭配】be opposed to... 反对…oppose reason to force 以理性对暴力oppose the south 面向南方oppose oneself to 反对

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: characteristic
trans: n. 特性；特征；adj. 特有的；典型的

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: confidence
trans: n. 信任；信心

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: capable
trans: adj. 有能力的；能够的【记忆】词根记忆：cap（握住）+able（能…的）→能握得住的→有能力的【搭配】be capable of有…能力的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: achievement
trans: n. 成就；达到，实现【记忆】来自achieve（vt. 完成）【搭配】sense of achievement 成就感

sentences.english: His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.english: As we climbed the final few metres, we felt a sense of achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我们攀登最后几米的时候，有一种成就感。

detailed_translations.english: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑【搭配】anxiety disorder焦虑症

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: director
trans: n. 总监【搭配】Director of Operations 运营总监【同根】directory n. 人名地址录；（电话）号码簿

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: aghast
trans: adj. 吓呆的，惊骇的【搭配】aghast at sth. 惊呆于…

sentences.english: Hank looked at her aghast.
sentences.chinese: 汉克惊恐地望着她。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or looking shocked by something you have seen or just found out

name: appall
trans: vt. 使惊骇，使恐怖【同根】appalling adj. 令人震惊的

name: collapse
trans: v./n. 崩溃；虚脱【记忆】联想记忆：col+lapse（滑倒）→一出门就滑倒，真让人崩溃→崩溃

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: cowardly
trans: adj. 胆小的，怯懦的【反义】bold adj. 大胆的

sentences.english: I was too cowardly to complain.
sentences.chinese: 我胆小得都不敢抱怨。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as cowardly, you disapprove of them because they are easily frightened and avoid doing dangerous and difficult things

name: cower
trans: vi. 畏缩【同义】recoil v. 退缩，畏缩

sentences.english: The hostages cowered in their seats.
sentences.chinese: 这些人质蜷缩在其座位上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 退缩；抖缩；蜷缩；弯腰屈膝
detailed_translations.english: to bend low and move back because you are frightened

name: craven
trans: adj. 懦弱的，畏缩的【同义】cowardly adj. 怯懦的

sentences.english: He had a craven fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 他非常害怕乘飞机。

detailed_translations.english: completely lacking courage

name: creep
trans: vi. 起鸡皮疙瘩；n. 毛骨悚然【同根】creepy adj. 令人毛骨悚然的

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: dread
trans: n. 畏惧；恐怖；v. 畏惧【同根】dreadful adj. 糟糕的

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: fear
trans: n./v. 害怕，恐惧

sentences.english: a fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 害怕坐飞机

sentences.english: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
sentences.chinese: 该团体担心发生暴力事件，所以请求警方保护。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen
to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

name: flutter
trans: vi. 振翅；飘动；（心脏因紧张而）乱跳【记忆】联想记忆：fl（看作fly）+utter（看作butter）→蝴蝶（butterfly）振翅而飞→振翅

sentences.english: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 枯叶缓缓飘落到地上。

sentences.english: The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘动。

detailed_translations.english: to make small gentle movements in the air

name: formidable
trans: adj. 可畏惧的，可怕的；难对付的【同义】frightening adj. 令人害怕的，吓人的awesome adj. 使人敬畏的

sentences.english: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.english: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.chinese: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；令人敬畏的，令人惊叹的
detailed_translations.english: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening

name: fright
trans: n. 惊吓【搭配】stage fright 怯场

sentences.english: You gave me such a fright creeping up on me like that!
sentences.chinese: 你这样不声不响地过来，吓了我一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

name: funk
trans: n. 恐惧，恐怖

sentences.english: She’s in a funk about giving her talk on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 她在为星期天的演讲犯愁。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid doing something because it is difficult, or because you are afraid

name: horrify

name: menace
trans: vt. 威吓；胁迫【搭配】a menace to sb./sth. 对某人/某物的威胁

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

sentences.chinese: 他的语气里带着威胁。

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is dangerous
to threaten
