trans: 文化身份

name: culture conflict
trans: 文化冲突

name: dialect
trans: n. 方言，土语

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

name: dialectal variation
trans: 方言差异

name: dominant language
trans: 主流语言

name: Indo-European language
trans: 印欧语系，印欧语言

name: intonation
trans: n. 语调

sentences.english: intonation patterns
sentences.chinese: 语调类型

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the level of your voice changes in order to add meaning to what you are saying, for example by going up at the end of a question

name: Latin
trans: n. 拉丁语；adj. 拉丁语的

sentences.english: He is well grounded in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 他拉丁语的功底很扎实。

sentences.english: I must brush up on my Latin.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把拉丁语重温一下。

sentences.english: This word comes from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这个词源于拉丁语。

detailed_translations.english: the language used in ancient Rome

name: linguistics
trans: n. 语言学【记忆】词根记忆：lingu（语言）+ist+ics（…学）→语言学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: It took three hours for the doctor of linguistics to tell us this. Again I quit.
sentences.chinese: 关于这一点，这个语言学博士足足讲了三个小时，我再次退出了。

sentences.english: Then we have research center in Grenoble, France where the focus is all on linguistics, machine learning.
sentences.chinese: 我们在法国格勒诺布尔也有研究中心,研究重点是语言学和机器学习。

detailed_translations.english: the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history

name: multilingual
trans: adj. 多种语言的【记忆】词根记忆：multi（多）+lingu（语言）+ al（…的）→多种语言的

name: paraphrase
trans: n. 释义，解释；v. 解释，改述

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

name: prefix
trans: n. 前缀【记忆】词根记忆：pre（前）+fix（固定）→固定在前面→前缀

sentences.english: To telephone from the U.S. use the prefix 011 33 before the numbers given here.
sentences.chinese: 从美国拨出电话，请在所给号码前加拨前置代码011 33。

detailed_translations.english: a group of letters that is added to the beginning of a word to change its meaning and make a new word, such as ‘un’ in ‘untie’ or ‘mis’ in ‘misunderstand’

detailed_translations.chinese: 加前缀；将某事物加在前面
detailed_translations.english: to add a prefix to a word, name, or set of numbers

name: Sanskrit
trans: n. 梵文

sentences.english: They got the name from Persian who in turn got it from Sanskrit, from the Indians themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他们从波斯人那里得知的名字，而波斯人是依次从梵文、从印第安人他们自己得知的名字。

sentences.english: An ancient Sanskrit saying says, woman is the home and the home is the basis of society. It is as we build our homes that we can build our country.
sentences.chinese: 一个古梵文谚语说，女人是家而家是社会的基础就像我们能建设自己的家园我们才能建设我们的国家。

detailed_translations.english: an ancient language of India

name: suffix
trans: n. 后缀【记忆】词根记忆：suf（下）+fix（固定）→固定在（单词）下面（末尾）→后缀

sentences.english: Otherwise, the suffix will not be added.
sentences.chinese: 否则，后缀将不会被添加。

sentences.english: This required that all subtrees are all under the same suffix, since there is no common parent between suffixes.
sentences.chinese: 这需要所有的子树都位于相同的后缀中，因为后缀之间不存在公共父节点。

sentences.english: But only if the GAC as a whole does not like a suffix must the board take these objections into account—and then issue a detailed explanation if it overrides them.
sentences.chinese: 但是，只有在GAC也不同意新域名后缀的情况下，董事会才会考虑这些反对意见。 而且如果要撤销这些域名的话，它需要发布一份详细的解释报告。

detailed_translations.english: a letter or letters added to the end of a word to form a new word, such as ‘ness’ in ‘kindness’ or ‘ly’ in ‘suddenly’

name: synonym
trans: n. 同义词【记忆】词根记忆：syn（共同）+onym（名字）→同名→同义词

sentences.english: The term "industrial democracy" is often used as a synonym for worker participation.
sentences.chinese: “工业民主”这一词语常被用作“工人参与”的同义词。

detailed_translations.english: a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

name: accentuate
trans: vt. 使突出，强调【搭配】accentuation n. 强调

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: clarify
trans: v. 澄清；阐明【同根】clarification n. 澄清，阐明

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: convey
trans: vt. 表达，传递；运送【搭配】convey a message 传递信息

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: delineate
trans: vt. 说明，阐明；描述【记忆】词根记忆：de（加强）+line（直线，线条）+ate（使…）→勾勒线条→描述

sentences.english: Biography must to some extent delineate characters.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，传记一定要描述人物。

detailed_translations.english: If you delineate something such as an idea or situation, you describe it or define it, often in a lot of detail

name: depict
trans: vt. 描绘；描述【同义】represent vt. 表现，描绘picture vt. 画，描绘

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: elucidate
trans: v. 阐明，使…清楚【记忆】词根记忆：e（加强）+lucid（照亮）+ate→弄清晰→阐明

sentences.english: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

detailed_translations.english: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information

name: emphasize
trans: vt. 强调，着重【记忆】联想记忆：em+phas（看作phrase，用短语表达）+ize→用短语表达是为了强调→强调

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: emphatic
trans: adj. 强调的【参考】emphasis n. 强调

sentences.english: an emphatic denial
sentences.chinese: 断然否认

detailed_translations.english: expressing an opinion, idea etc in a clear, strong way to show its importance

name: enunciate
trans: v. 清楚阐明【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+nunci（讲）+ate→讲出来→清楚表达

sentences.english: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.english: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地、仔细地读着。

detailed_translations.english: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly

name: exemplify
trans: vt. 作为…的例子

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: exposition
trans: n. 阐述；展览会【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+posit（放）+ion→放出来→展览会

sentences.english: a lucid exposition of educational theories
sentences.chinese: 对教育理论的清晰阐述

sentences.english: an art exposition
sentences.chinese: 一个艺术展览

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明，解释；展览会，博览会
detailed_translations.english: a clear and detailed explanation

name: expound
trans: v. 详解，阐述【记忆】词根记忆：ex（出）+pound（放）→把（意义）说出来→详细说明→详解

sentences.english: Schmidt continued to expound his views on economics and politics.
sentences.chinese: 施密特继续阐释他关于经济与政治的观点。

detailed_translations.english: to explain or talk about something in detail

name: highlight
trans: vt. 强调；n. 最精彩的部分【记忆】合成词：high（高的）+light（发光）→高调地发光→强调

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: illuminate
trans: v. 阐明；照亮【记忆】词根记忆：il（进入）+lumin（光）+ate（使…）→进入光明→照亮

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: illustrate
trans: vt. （用图等）说明，举例说明；给…作插图说明【搭配】illustrate the point 举例说明这一点

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: insinuate
trans: vt. 暗示【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+sinu（弯曲）+ate（做）→（说话）拐弯抹角；行运迂回→暗示

sentences.english: What are you trying to insinuate?
sentences.chinese: 你想暗示什么？

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入
detailed_translations.english: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest

name: interpretation
trans: n. 解释，说明，诠释【同义】explanation n. 解释

sentences.english: One possible interpretation is that they want you to resign.
sentences.chinese: 一种可能的解释是，他们想要你辞职。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to put an accurate interpretation on (= explain ) the survey results.
sentences.chinese: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。

sentences.english: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation (= able to be understood or explained in different ways ).
sentences.chinese: 作者这句话的确切含义可有各种理解。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc

name: narrate
trans: v. 叙述

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: reiterate
trans: v. 反复地说，重申【记忆】词根记忆：re（一再）+iter（重说）+ate（做）→反复地说

sentences.english: Let me reiterate the most important points.
sentences.chinese: 我来把最重要的几点重申一遍。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat a statement or opinion in order to make your meaning as clear as possible

name: specify
trans: vt. 指定；详细说明【记忆】词根记忆：spec（看）+ify（使…）→让人看清楚→详细说明

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

name: stress
trans: n. 压力；重音；强调；v. 强调，着重【搭配】stress management 对压力的管理

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

name: underline
trans: v. 在…下划线；强调，突出【记忆】合成词：under（下）+line（线）→在…下划线

sentences.english: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
sentences.chinese: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important

name: interdisciplinary
trans: adj. 跨学科的【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+ disciplin(e)（学科）+ary（…的）→跨学科的

sentences.english: an interdisciplinary research centre
sentences.chinese: 跨学科研究中心

detailed_translations.english: involving ideas, information, or people from different subjects or areas of study

name: contradictory
trans: adj. 互相矛盾的，互相对立的【搭配】contradictory relationship矛盾关系contradictory statement互相矛盾的说法

sentences.english: Customs officials have made a series of contradictory statements about the equipment.
sentences.chinese: 海关官员们对于这种设备做出了一系列相互矛盾的陈述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；反对的；反驳的；抗辩的
detailed_translations.english: two statements, beliefs etc that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct

name: clack
trans: v. （硬物相互撞击发出的）啪哒声，吧嗒声

name: heel
trans: n. 脚后跟；踵；v. 倾侧【搭配】at sb.'s heels 紧随某人之后kick up one's heels 欢蹦乱跳

sentences.english: black boots with high heels
sentences.chinese: 有高跟的黑靴子

detailed_translations.english: the curved back part of your foot
(of a vessel) to lean over; list

name: pavement
trans: n. 人行道，公路

sentences.english: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
sentences.chinese: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。

sentences.english: a pavement cafe
sentences.chinese: 路边咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on

name: hiss
trans: n. 嘶嘶声

sentences.english: the snake's hiss
sentences.chinese: 蛇发出的嘶嘶声

sentences.english: The performance was met with boos and hisses.
sentences.chinese: 演出换来一片倒彩声和嘘声。

sentences.english: The steam escaped with a loud hissing noise.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽大声地嘶嘶冒了出来。

sentences.english: The cat backed away, hissing.
sentences.chinese: 那只猫咝咝叫着退开了。

detailed_translations.english: a sound like a long ‘s ’; this sound used to show disapproval of sb
to make a noise which sounds like ‘ssss’

name: intrusive
trans: adj. 干涉的，打扰的

sentences.english: They found the television cameras too intrusive.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为电视摄像机太烦人了。

detailed_translations.english: affecting someone’s private life or interrupting them in an unwanted and annoying way

name: relax
trans: v. （使）放松【记忆】词根记忆：re（重新）+lax（松）→重新松开→（使）放松【搭配】relax your mind 放松思维relax controls 放松管制【同根】relaxation n. 放松

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: bark
trans: vi. 吠叫；n. 犬吠声；树皮【记忆】发音记忆：“巴克”→巴克是《野性的呼唤》中的狗→犬吠

sentences.english: In Finland purists insist that only birch bark should be added.
sentences.chinese: 在芬兰，纯化论者坚持说只能加白桦树皮。

sentences.english: Cork bark is closely intertwined with the lives of the people in these regions.
sentences.chinese: 软木橡树的树皮与这些地方的百姓生活密切地交织在一起。

sentences.english: In his workshop, a Kakunodate craftsman prepares the cherry bark before applying this as a veneer to a range of objects.
sentences.chinese: 在将这种工艺作为一系列物体的单板运用之前，角馆的工匠在自己的作坊准备樱花树皮。

detailed_translations.english: the outer covering of a tree

name: brittle
trans: adj. 易碎的；脆弱的；靠不住的；不友好的；（声音）尖利的【同根】brittleness n. 脆弱

sentences.english: In systems such as this we also often find that there are either no tests around this configuration code, or the tests that do exist are brittle and/or not realistic.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的系统中，我们经常会发现对于这些配置代码没有进行测试，或者尽管存在测试，但它很脆弱且/或不切实际。

sentences.english: But while our screens are brittle, theirs is flexible––at what they say is one tenth the price.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的屏幕都很脆弱，他们的却很柔软，而且价钱是我们的十分之一。

name: chink
trans: n. 裂缝，裂口；发出叮当声；v. （使）叮当响【记忆】联想记忆：chin（看作china，瓷器）+ k（口）→瓷器有缺口→裂口

sentences.english: They chinked their glasses and drank a toast to the couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们相互碰杯，向那对夫妇敬酒。

detailed_translations.english: if glass or metal objects chink, or if you chink them, they make a high ringing sound when they knock together

detailed_translations.chinese: 裂缝，裂口；一缕光；叮当声
detailed_translations.english: a small hole in a wall, or between two things that join together, that lets light or air through

name: clash
trans: v. 发生冲突；不协调；砰地相撞；n. 冲突；不协调；（金属等的）刺耳的撞击声【搭配】personality clashes 性格冲突

sentences.english: Troops clashed near the border.
sentences.chinese: 军队在边境附近发生了冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发生冲突；不协调；砰地相撞，发出刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲突； 不协调； 刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports

name: click
trans: v. 点击；（使）发咔哒声；n. 单击；滴答声

sentences.english: The door clicked shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 门在我身后咔嗒一声关上了。

sentences.english: Mother clicked her tongue (= made a short sound to show disapproval ) and sighed.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈咂咂嘴，叹了口气。

sentences.english: Edmund clicked his fingers (= made a short sound to get someone’s attention ) for John to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙弹了个响指示意约翰跟着他。

sentences.english: Vogel clicked his heels (= hit the heels of his shoes together ) and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 沃格尔咔嗒一声并拢脚跟，鞠了个躬。

sentences.english: Twist the lever and the gears click into place .
sentences.chinese: 转动变速杆，排挡就咔嗒一声到位了。

sentences.english: You can check your e-mail with a click of your mouse.
sentences.chinese: 通过鼠标的一点你就能查电子邮件。

detailed_translations.english: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound
Click is also a noun

name: crack
trans: v. （使）破裂，（使）发出爆裂声；打，击；n. 裂缝，爆裂声【搭配】crack up 精神崩溃crack down on 镇压

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

name: crash
trans: n./v. 碰撞，冲，闯；坠落；发出撞击（或爆裂）声；垮台 n. 碰撞；坠毁；撞击声；adj. 速成的【搭配】crash into 闯入

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: scream
trans: n. 尖叫声；vi. 尖叫【记忆】联想记忆：孩子们见到冰淇淋（ice-cream），立刻尖叫（scream）起来

sentences.english: After the first few shots, people started screaming.
sentences.chinese: 几声枪响过后，人们开始尖叫起来。

sentences.english: a screaming baby
sentences.chinese: 尖声哭叫的婴儿

sentences.english: The children were screaming with laughter .
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们在尖声欢笑。

sentences.english: She was screaming her head off (= screaming a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 她不停地尖叫。

sentences.english: She began to scream blue murder (= scream very loudly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始高声尖叫。

sentences.english: He was dragged kicking and screaming to a nearby van.
sentences.chinese: 他又踢又叫着被拖到附近的一辆小货车上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫；呼啸；发出尖锐刺耳的声音；令人触目惊心
detailed_translations.english: to make a loud high noise with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人
detailed_translations.english: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

name: hum
trans: vi. 哼曲子；发嗡嗡声；n. 嗡嗡声，嘈杂声【记忆】发音记忆：“哼”→蚊子苍蝇的哼哼声

sentences.english: He began to hum a tune.
sentences.chinese: 他开始哼唱一支曲子。

detailed_translations.english: to sing a tune by making a continuous sound with your lips closed
a low continuous sound

name: snap
trans: vi. 咔嚓折断；吧嗒一声（关上或打开）；猛咬；厉声说话；n. 猛咬；突然折断；噼啪声；adj. 突然的【搭配】snap at sth. 向…咬去，迫不及待地抓住机会snap up 迅速抓住，马上接受；抢购

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

name: stroke
trans: n. （病）突然发作；中风；一次努力；划水；一击；报时的钟声；笔划；抚摸；vt. 抚摸【记忆】strike（v. 打击）的过去式

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: thunder
trans: n. 雷；雷声；vi. 打雷；轰隆响【参考】thunderstorm n. 雷暴thundercloud n. 雷雨云

sentences.english: We were woken in the night by thunder.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to make a very loud deep noise

name: whisper
trans: n./v. 低语【记忆】联想记忆：whi（看作who，谁）+sper（看作speaker，说话）→谁在小声说话→低语

sentences.english: You don’t have to whisper, no one can hear us.
sentences.chinese: 你不必轻声轻语，没人听得到我们说话。

sentences.english: ‘I’ve missed you,’ he whispered in her ear.
sentences.chinese: “我想你了。”他在她耳边低语道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice
to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice

name: whistle
trans: n. 口哨；呼啸而过；v. 吹口哨【记忆】联想记忆：w+hist（嘘）+le→吹嘘声→吹口哨

sentences.english: The lifeguard blew his whistle.
sentences.chinese: 救生员吹响哨子。

sentences.english: Adam whistled happily on his way to work.
sentences.chinese: 亚当在上班路上愉快地吹着口哨。

detailed_translations.english: a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it
to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips

name: infringe
trans: v. 侵入，侵害；违反；干涉【搭配】infringe a rule 违反规章infringe a law 违法

sentences.english: A backup copy of a computer program does not infringe copyright.
sentences.chinese: 计算机程序的备份不侵犯版权。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that is against a law or someone’s legal rights

name: interfere
trans: v. 干涉，干扰，妨碍【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+fer（带来）+ e→来到中间→干涉，干扰【同根】interference n. 干涉，干扰

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: interpose
trans: vi. 置于…之间，介入【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+pos（放置）+e→置于…之间

sentences.english: She interposed herself between the general and his wife.
sentences.chinese: 她挡在将军和他妻子之间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提出（异议等）；使插入；使干涉
detailed_translations.english: to put yourself or something else between two other things

name: intervene
trans: vi. 干涉，干扰；介于其间【记忆】词根记忆：inter（在…之间）+ven（来）+ e →来到中间→干涉

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰，妨碍物【记忆】词根记忆：ob（逆）+st（站）+acle（物）→反着站的物体→障碍，妨碍物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: animate
trans: adj. 活的，有生命的；v. 赋予生命；鼓舞【记忆】词根记忆：anim（生命，精神）+ate（使…）→使有生命→赋予生命

sentences.english: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动
detailed_translations.english: to give life or energy to something
living

name: bouncing
trans: adj. 跳跃的，活泼的，巨大的

sentences.english: a bouncing baby girl
sentences.chinese: 一个健壮的女婴

detailed_translations.english: healthy and full of energy

name: frisky
trans: adj. 活泼的，快活的，爱嬉闹的

sentences.english: a frisky horse
sentences.chinese: 一匹欢蹦乱跳的马

detailed_translations.english: full of energy and fun

name: frolicsome
trans: adj. 快活的，爱嬉闹的

sentences.english: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and 26)frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.chinese: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.english: Grass was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1999 for his "frolicsome black fables [which] portray the forgotten face of history".
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯因他“嬉闹的黑色寓言、描绘历史被遗忘的一面”获得1999年诺贝尔文学奖。

detailed_translations.english: given to frolicking; merry and playful

name: playful
trans: adj. 活泼的，爱玩的

sentences.english: a playful little dog
sentences.chinese: 活泼的小狗

sentences.english: Babies are playful and alert when they first wake up.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝们刚醒来的时候很好动，而且反应敏捷。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开玩笑的；幽默的；爱嬉戏的
detailed_translations.english: very active, happy, and wanting to have fun

name: vibrant
trans: adj. 振动的；活泼的，充满生气的；兴奋的

sentences.english: a painting full of vibrant reds and blues
sentences.chinese: 满是鲜亮的红色和蓝色的画作

detailed_translations.chinese: 振动的；充满生气的；响亮的；战栗的
detailed_translations.english: a vibrant colour is bright and strong

name: vivacious
trans: adj. 活泼的，快活的【记忆】词根记忆：viv（生命）+acious→有生命力的→活泼的【搭配】vivacious personality 性格活泼

sentences.english: a vivacious personality
sentences.chinese: 活泼外向的个性

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼的；快活的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a woman, who is vivacious has a lot of energy and a happy attractive manner – used to show approval

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；与…发生矛盾【记忆】词根记忆：contra（相反）+dict（说）→说反对的话→反驳

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: contradiction
trans: n. 矛盾，不一致；否认，反驳【记忆】词根记忆：contra（相反）+dict（说）+ ion →反着说→否认，反驳

sentences.english: apparent contradictions in the defendant’s testimony
sentences.chinese: 被告证词中的明显矛盾

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾， 不一致； 否认， 反驳
detailed_translations.english: a difference between two statements, beliefs, or ideas about something that means they cannot both be true

name: discord
trans: n. 不和，纷争【记忆】词根记忆：dis（不）+cord（心）→心不齐→不和

sentences.english: marital discord
sentences.chinese: 婚姻不和

sentences.english: discord within NATO
sentences.chinese: 北约内部的纷争

detailed_translations.english: disagreement or arguing between people

name: friction
trans: n. 摩擦（力）；矛盾，冲突【反义】accord n. 一致，符合harmony n. 相符；和谐

sentences.english: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查绳索，因为与岩石摩擦会使它磨损。

detailed_translations.english: when one surface rubs against another

name: acoustician
trans: n. 声学家

name: acoustics technology
trans: 声学技术

name: audible
trans: adj. 听得见的【搭配】audible range 可听范围

sentences.english: His voice was barely audible (=  could only just be heard  ) above the roar of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 人声嘈杂，几乎听不见他的说话声。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it

name: audio
trans: adj. 音频的；声音的【搭配】audio signal 音频信号

sentences.english: audio and video equipment
sentences.chinese: 音频视频设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

name: auditory
trans: adj. 耳的；听觉的，关于听觉的【搭配】auditory stimulus 听觉刺激

sentences.english: ...the limits of the human auditory range.
sentences.chinese: …人类听觉范围的局限。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to hear

name: echo
trans: n. 回音【搭配】echo location 回波定位

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: harmonic
trans: adj. 和声的，谐音的【记忆】词根记忆：harm（适合）+on+ic（…的）→旋律适合的→和声的

sentences.english: harmonic scales
sentences.chinese: 和声音阶

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way notes are played or sung together to give a pleasing sound

name: hydrophone
trans: n. 水中听音器【记忆】词根记忆：hydro（水）+phone（听筒）→水中听音器

name: infrasound
trans: n. 次声【记忆】词根记忆：infra（下，低）+sound（声音）→次声

name: mechanical wave
trans: 机械波

name: rarefaction
trans: n. （声音）稀疏【搭配】rarefy v. 变稀薄

sentences.english: This is called a rarefaction and is represented by widely spaced dots.
sentences.chinese: 这个区域称为稀疏区，并用疏散的小点表示。

sentences.english: The formulas of both reflection shock waves and rarefaction waves are given.
sentences.chinese: 文中分别给出反射冲击波和反射稀疏波两种情况的迭代收敛计算公式。

name: resonate
trans: vi. 共鸣；共振【搭配】resonance n. 共振；共鸣

sentences.english: The bass guitar began to thump so loudly that it resonated in my head.
sentences.chinese: 低音吉他开始砰然作响，震得我的脑袋嗡嗡的。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as an event or a message resonates, it seems important or good to people, or continues to do this

name: reverberation
trans: n. 回声；回响【搭配】reverberate vi. 回响

name: sonar
trans: n. 声呐【搭配】sonar projector 声呐发射器

sentences.english: What good is a ship armed to the teeth if its radar and sonar are substandard?
sentences.chinese: 如果一艘武装到牙齿的舰船其雷达和声纳是不合格的，那能好到哪里？

sentences.english: In his work to develop radar, sonar and ultrasound he performed all the necessary tests and provided all the proofs required.
sentences.chinese: 在雷达、声纳和超声的开发工作中，他进行了所有的必要测试，并提供了所需的一切论证。

sentences.english: However, a spokesman for the Ministry of Defence said: 'The Royal Navy can confirm that they were not in the area using sonar and have not been for some time.
sentences.chinese: 英国国防部的一位发言人表示：“皇家海军能证明他们并没有在这一海域使用声纳，而且他们在这片水域逗留的时间也不长。

detailed_translations.english: equipment on a ship or  submarine  that uses  sound waves  to find out the position of objects under the water

name: sonic
trans: adj. 声音的；声波的【记忆】词根记忆：son（声音）+ic（…的）→声音的

sentences.english: ...the sonic boom of enemy fighter-bombers.
sentences.chinese: …敌人战斗轰炸机隆隆的轰鸣声。

detailed_translations.english: relating to sound,  sound waves  , or the speed of sound

name: sound waves
trans: 声波

name: supersonic
trans: adj. 超音速的；超声波的【搭配】supersonic wave 超声波

sentences.english: supersonic aircraft
sentences.chinese: 超音速飞机

detailed_translations.english: faster than the speed of sound

name: ultrasonic frequency
trans: 超声波频率

name: ultrasound
trans: n. 超声（波）【搭配】ultrasound wave 超声波

sentences.english: investigation of the liver by ultrasound
sentences.chinese: 对肝脏作的超声波检查

detailed_translations.english: sound that is too high for humans to hear

name: vocalization
trans: n. 发声，发音【记忆】词根记忆：vocal（声音的）+ization（行为的过程或结果）→发声

name: wave motion
trans: 波动

name: pagoda
trans: n. 宝塔

detailed_translations.chinese: （东方寺院的）宝塔；印度的旧金币
detailed_translations.english: a Buddhist  temple (= religious building )  that has several levels with a decorated roof at each level

name: taper
trans: v. （使）逐渐变窄

sentences.english: small boys holding lighted tapers
sentences.chinese: 拿着点燃的细蜡烛的小男孩

sentences.english: Unlike other trees, it doesn't taper very much. It stays fat all the way up.
sentences.chinese: 不像其他树，它不是越往上越细，而是自下往上一样粗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 细蜡烛，烛芯；逐渐变弱；锥形物
detailed_translations.english: a very thin  candle
If something tapers, or if you taper it, it becomes gradually thinner at one end

name: successive
trans: adj. 连续的

sentences.english: The team has had five successive victories.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。

sentences.english: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

name: floor plan
trans: 平面图

name: weight
trans: n. 重量；重物【搭配】by weight 按重量

sentences.english: The average weight of a baby at birth is just over seven pounds.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿的平均出生体重是七磅多一点。

sentences.english: It can be sewn into curtain hems to weight the curtain and so allow it to hang better.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它缝在窗帘的摺边里以增加窗帘的重量，使之更有下垂感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重量，重力；负担；砝码；重要性
detailed_translations.english: how heavy something is when you measure it

sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

detailed_translations.english: someone who travels and works in a spacecraft

name: embark
trans: v. 上飞机【搭配】embark on着手；登上船

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: enroute
trans: adv. 在航线上

name: microwave
trans: n. 微波【搭配】microwave communication 微波通信

sentences.english: Its molecules can be agitated by microwave energy.
sentences.chinese: 微波能量可以使其分子随之运动。

detailed_translations.english: a very short electric wave that is used in cooking food and sending messages by radio, and in radar

name: navigation
trans: n. 导航；航行【搭配】navigation equipment 导航设备

sentences.english: compasses and other instruments of navigation
sentences.chinese: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

detailed_translations.chinese: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
detailed_translations.english: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

name: navigation monitor
trans: 航行检测仪

name: observatory
trans: n. 天文台，观象台【记忆】词根记忆：observ（e）（观察）+atory（表场所、地点）→天文台

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

name: satellite communication
trans: 卫星通讯

name: shuttle
trans: vi. 穿梭往返【搭配】space shuttle 航天飞机

sentences.english: He took the Washington - New York shuttle.
sentences.chinese: 他乘坐华盛顿－纽约的往返班机。

detailed_translations.english: to travel frequently between two places

detailed_translations.chinese: 短程穿梭运行的飞机；航天飞机；梭子
detailed_translations.english: a  space shuttle
to travel frequently between two places

name: spaceship
trans: n. 太空船，宇宙飞船【同义】spacecraft n. 宇宙飞船

sentences.english: ...an alien spaceship.
sentences.chinese: …一艘外星人的宇宙飞船。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for carrying people through space

name: telescope
trans: n. 望远镜【记忆】词根记忆：tele（远）+scop（看）+e→看到远处→望远镜【搭配】optical telescope光学望远镜

sentences.english: The captain was rectifying his telescope.
sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.english: The telescope reveals many distant stars to our sight.
sentences.chinese: 望远镜把许多遥远的星球显现在我们的眼前。

sentences.english: With the aid of a telescope a ship could be made out on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

name: veer
trans: vi. 改变方向或路线

sentences.english: The plane veered off course.
sentences.chinese: 飞机偏离了航线。

sentences.english: Follow the path and veer left after 400m.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这条小路走400米，然后向左转。

sentences.english: The wind was veering north.
sentences.chinese: 风向往北偏了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转向；改变观点；风向顺时针转；调转船尾向上风
detailed_translations.english: to change direction
a change of course or direction

name: block up
trans: 拥堵

name: congestion
trans: n. 拥挤，拥塞【记忆】词根记忆：con（加强）+gest（带来）+ ion →带来很多→拥塞【搭配】traffic congestion 交通拥堵

sentences.english: The problems of traffic congestion will not disappear in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 交通堵塞问题不会很快消失。

detailed_translations.english: If there is congestion in a place, the place is extremely crowded and blocked with traffic or people

name: detour
trans: n. 弯路，便道 v. 迂回，绕道【搭配】take a detour 绕道，迂回

sentences.english: When I go to the neighborhood, see in the road, so I made a detour, from another trail walk home.
sentences.chinese: 当我走到居委会时，看到前面在修路，于是我绕道而行，从另外一条小路走回家。

sentences.english: But what if you could take a detour through a lobby that exhibits art, or down a lane that borders a green space?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你愿不愿意绕道穿过一个陈列着艺术品的大厅，或者行走在一条毗邻绿色空间的小巷子？

sentences.english: A meeting in a London bus with jewel thief Lady Christina takes a turn for the worst for the Doctor when the bus takes a detour to a desert-like planet, where the deadly Swarm awaits.
sentences.chinese: 一个在伦敦公共汽车上的一个会议在一个珠宝窃贼夫人克莉丝汀采取了转为医生的最坏的时候，公共汽车需要绕道沙漠般的行星，那里的致命的群等待。

detailed_translations.english: to make a detour
a way of going from one place to another that is longer than the usual way

name: devious
trans: adj. 弯曲的，迂回的；误入歧途的【记忆】词根记忆：de（离开）+vi（道路）+ous（…的）→离开正路的→误入歧途的【同根】deviousness n. 曲折

sentences.english: a devious route
sentences.chinese: 迂回的路线

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的
detailed_translations.english: not going in the most direct way to get to a place

name: GPS
trans: abbr. 全球定位系统【搭配】GPS navigation GPS导航

sentences.english: With GPS, they also now know where you are whenever you have your phone.
sentences.chinese: 利用全球定位系统，只要你带着电话，他们就知道你在哪里。

sentences.english: Used in combination with GPS, an accelerometer, a compass and the gyroscope can be used for in indoor navigation with floor accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 与全球定位系统、加速度计、陀螺仪和指南针结合使用，可用于具有地面精度的室内导航。

sentences.english: There are already USB GPS devices for tracking where you’ve been but here’s another device that will instead keep track of what the temperature was, if for some reason you need to know.
sentences.chinese: 已经有USB全球定位系统设备以追踪你的位置所在。 但是，如果你因某个原因需要知道温度的话,还有一个设备可以代替来追踪记录温度。

detailed_translations.english: a system that uses radio signals from  satellites  to show your exact position on the Earth on a special piece of equipment

name: jostle
trans: v. （在人群中）挤，推【搭配】jostle for sth. 争夺；争抢

sentences.english: A thousand thoughts were jostling around inside my mind.
sentences.chinese: 千头万绪在我脑海中翻涌。

detailed_translations.english: to push or knock against someone in a crowd, especially so that you can get somewhere or do something before other people

name: muddy
trans: adj. 泥泞的；混乱的【搭配】muddy street 泥泞的街道

sentences.english: Take your boots off outside if they’re muddy.
sentences.chinese: 要是靴子上都是泥，你就脱在门外吧。

sentences.english: the muddy waters of the lake
sentences.chinese: 浑浊的湖水

detailed_translations.english: covered with mud or containing mud

name: orderly
trans: adj. 有秩序的；整齐的【反义】disorderly adj. 无秩序的

sentences.english: She needs to organize her ideas in a more orderly way.
sentences.chinese: 她需要把自己的想法组织得更有条理些。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有秩序的；整齐的；值班的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way
someone who does unskilled jobs in a hospital

name: overcrowd
trans: vt. 使过度拥挤【同根】overcrowded adj. 挤满的

sentences.english: Do not overcrowd the fish.
sentences.chinese: 不要过度拥挤的鱼。

sentences.english: The manager of that theatre created a dangerous situation by allowing people to overcrowd the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 那家剧场的经理让过多的人拥挤在楼厅里，造成了一种危险的情形。

sentences.english: There are too many of them flying right now, they overcrowd the scene so proceed to erase some of them in order to maintain balance.
sentences.chinese: 现在，图上的飞行物太多了，它们让场景过渡拥挤。 所以，为了保持画面平衡，要删除一些。

detailed_translations.english: to fill (a room, vehicle, city, etc) with more people or things than is desirable

name: overspeed
trans: n. 超速【搭配】overspeed preventer 限速器

name: roundabout way
trans: 绕行路线

name: slippery
trans: adj. 滑的【同根】slip vi. 滑倒

sentences.english: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
sentences.chinese: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。

sentences.english: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
sentences.chinese: “标准”这一模糊概念

detailed_translations.english: something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or  greasy

name: smoothly
trans: adv. 流畅地；顺利地【同根】smooth adj. 流畅的

sentences.english: Traffic flowed smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 路上交通畅通。

detailed_translations.english: in a steady way, without stopping and starting again

name: traffic control
trans: 交通管制

name: traffic jam
trans: 交通堵塞

sentences.english: We were stuck in a traffic jam for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们遇上塞车，被堵了两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: a long line of vehicles on a road that cannot move or can only move very slowly

name: administrator
trans: n. 管理人；行政人员【同根】administrative adj. 行政的；管理的

sentences.english: On Friday the company's administrators sought permission from a Melbourne court to keep operating.
sentences.chinese: 在星期五，该公司的管理人员们从一家墨尔本法院取得了继续经营的许可。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job involves managing the work of a company or organization

name: allege
trans: vt. 断言，声称【同根】alleged adj. 据称的

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

name: charter
trans: n. 宪章；宣言；vt. 发许可证；特许【记忆】和chart（n. 航图；图表）一起记

sentences.english: ...the last charter plane carrying out foreign nationals.
sentences.chinese: …运出外国侨民的最后一班包机。

detailed_translations.english: A charter plane or boat is one which is rented for use by a particular person or group and which is not part of a regular service

detailed_translations.chinese: 宪章，共同纲领；特许状，许可证；包租
detailed_translations.english: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization
to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc

name: cohesion
trans: n. 凝聚；结合【搭配】cohesion force 凝聚力

sentences.english: a sense of community and social cohesion
sentences.chinese: 社区意识和社会凝聚力

detailed_translations.chinese: 凝聚；结合；[力] 内聚力
detailed_translations.english: if there is cohesion among a group of people, a set of ideas etc, all the parts or members of it are connected or related in a reasonable way to form a whole

name: enact
trans: vt. 颁布；制定法律【同根】enactment n. 规定，制定；颁布

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.chinese: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

detailed_translations.chinese: 颁布；制定法律；扮演；发生
detailed_translations.english: to act in a play, story etc

name: governance
trans: n. 统治，支配；管理【记忆】词根记忆：govern（管理）+ance（表名词） →管理

sentences.english: ...he will meet with officials from several countries to discuss ways to promote good governance.
sentences.chinese: ...他将与诸国官员会面，讨论如何促进对国家的良性管理。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of governing

name: macro-control
trans: n. 宏观调控【记忆】词根记忆：macro（宏大）+control（控制）→宏观调控

name: mandate
trans: n. 授权；命令；v. 授权；颁布【同根】mandatory n. 受托人 adj. 强制的

sentences.english: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
sentences.chinese: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作
detailed_translations.english: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
to give someone the right or power to do something

name: plenary
trans: adj. 全体的；全体出席的【搭配】plenary power 全权

sentences.english: The conference ended with a plenary debate.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议以一场全体辩论结束。

sentences.english: There'll be another plenary at the end of the afternoon after the workshop.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚专题讨论会后将另有一个全体会议。

detailed_translations.english: involving all the members of a committee, organization etc
Plenary is also a noun

name: pragmatic
trans: adj. 务实的；实事求是的；实用主义的【搭配】pragmatic approach 实际的方法

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实际的；实用主义的；国事的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

name: prohibit
trans: vt. 禁止；阻止【同根】prohibition n. 禁止，阻止；禁令

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: safeguard
trans: vt. 保卫【记忆】词根记忆：safe（安全）+guard（保卫）→保卫

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

name: social security
trans: 社会保障

name: supervise
trans: vt. 监督【同根】supervision n. 监督

sentences.english: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way

name: viable
trans: adj. 切实可行的【搭配】viable option 可行选项

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: tourist
trans: n. 旅游者

sentences.english: Cambridge is always full of tourists in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 剑桥在夏季总是挤满了游客。

sentences.english: The Statue of Liberty is a major tourist attraction .
sentences.chinese: 自由女神像是主要的旅游景点。

sentences.english: What effect will this have on the local tourist industry ?
sentences.chinese: 这对当地的旅游业会有什么影响？

detailed_translations.english: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday

name: flock
trans: v. 蜂拥而至，聚集；n. 一群【搭配】flock into成群结队涌到【同义】congregate v. 聚集assemble v. 聚集

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: far-flung
trans: adj. 遥远的；分布广泛的

name: gaze
trans: vi. 凝视（远方）【搭配】gaze at 凝视

sentences.english: Patrick sat gazing into space  (= looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing ).
sentences.chinese: 帕特里克坐着，茫然地看着前方。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so
a long steady look

name: marvel
trans: vi. 惊叹，感到惊讶【搭配】marvel at 对…惊奇【同根】marvelous n. 令人惊奇的；非凡的，奇迹般的；绝妙的

sentences.english: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
sentences.chinese: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

sentences.english: The whale, like the dolphin, has become a symbol of the marvels of creation.
sentences.chinese: 鲸，和海豚一样，已经成为造物杰作的象征。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

name: reminder
trans: n. 提醒的人或物；纪念品

sentences.english: a reminder from the dentist for your check-up
sentences.chinese: 牙医寄来的检查提醒函

detailed_translations.english: something, for example a letter, that reminds you to do something which you might have forgotten

name: ingenuity
trans: n. 心灵手巧，足智多谋；巧思，聪敏【记忆】词根记忆：in+gen（产生）+uity→能产生很多点子→巧思

sentences.english: It’s limited only by your ingenuity!
sentences.chinese: 被束缚的仅仅是你的独创性！

sentences.english: Sitting with my IV drip, I like to think about all the human labour and ingenuity that come together in this medical moment.
sentences.chinese: 坐在那里进行着静脉点滴，我想到了所有的人类劳动和独创性在这一时刻汇聚到了一起。

sentences.english: And as the president said last week, no one should bet against the American worker, American business and American ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 此外，正如总统上周所言，任何人都不应该小看美国的工人、美国的企业和美国的独创性。

name: artistry
trans: n. 艺术性【记忆】来自artist（n. 艺术家）

sentences.english: the artistry of dance
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈的艺术技巧

detailed_translations.chinese: 艺术性；工艺；艺术技巧；艺术效果；艺术工作
detailed_translations.english: skill in a particular artistic activity

name: ancestral hall
trans: 宗堂；宗祠

name: ancestral temple
trans: 宗庙

name: ancient architecture
trans: 古代建筑

name: ancient bridge
trans: 古代桥梁

name: ancient dwelling
trans: 古代民居建筑

name: ancient water infrastructure
trans: 古代水利工程

name: bridge
trans: n. 桥【搭配】arch bridge 拱形桥suspension bridge 吊桥

sentences.english: He walked back over the railway bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他从铁路桥上走了回去。

sentences.english: They recreate themselves with playing bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们以打桥牌作消遣。

detailed_translations.english: a structure built over a river, road etc that allows people or vehicles to cross from one side to the other

name: castle
trans: n. 城堡【搭配】Windsor Castle温莎城堡

sentences.english: Edinburgh Castle
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡城堡

sentences.english: a ruined castle
sentences.chinese: 破败的城堡

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong building, built in the past as a safe place that could be easily defended against attack

detailed_translations.chinese: 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

name: catacomb
trans: n. 陵寝；地下墓穴

name: Chinese ancient academy
trans: 书院

name: city defense project
trans: 城防工程

name: classical garden
trans: 古典园林

name: ecclesiastical building
trans: 宗教建筑

name: folk custom
trans: 民俗风情，民间习俗

name: Great Wall
trans: 长城

name: memorial hall
trans: 纪念馆

name: military defense project
trans: 军事防御工程

name: mosque
trans: n. 清真寺

sentences.english: Would you go to church or the synagogue or the mosque?
sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.english: Tell the congregation of a church or mosque that existence is too vulgar an attribute to fasten onto their God, and they will brand you an atheist.
sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

trans: n. 寺院，神殿【搭配】temple fair 庙会buddhist temple 佛堂；佛庙

sentences.english: They lighted the temple with many candles.
sentences.chinese: 他们用许多蜡烛照亮这个寺庙。

sentences.english: The entire valley reverberated with the sound of the temple bells.
sentences.chinese: 整个山谷回荡着庙宇的钟声。

sentences.english: After the fire, nothing remained of the magnificent buildings of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 大火过后， 寺院里的那些雄伟建筑已荡然无存。

trans: 天坛

trans: 秦始皇陵

name: astound
trans: vt. 使惊异【同义】surprise n./v. 惊讶astonish v. 使惊讶，使吃惊

sentences.english: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们所做的都是我们擅长的事情，我们最终将使自己大吃一惊。

sentences.english: “You astound me!” Mrs. Willoughby said, pressing her clasped hands to her lips, a gesture she normally bestowed upon seniors who were making their final appearance in the spring choral concert.
sentences.chinese: “你真是令我大吃一惊啊！” 威洛比太太说道，双手紧紧的按在嘴唇上——这是她通常在毕业班学生参加春季合唱音乐会上最后献唱时才会做出的姿势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使惊骇, 使大吃一惊

name: breathtaking
trans: adj. 惊人的，惊险的【同义】stunning adj. 极好的；令人震惊的exciting adj. 使人激动的，刺激的

sentences.english: The view from my bedroom window was absolutely breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 我卧室窗外的景色美得令人窒息。

sentences.english: an act of breathtaking arrogance
sentences.chinese: 令人咋舌的傲慢举动

detailed_translations.chinese: 惊人的；惊险的；令人激动的
detailed_translations.english: very impressive, exciting, or surprising

name: dismay
trans: vt. 使惊愕；使沮丧【同义】alarm v. （使）惊恐；（使）担心

sentences.english: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay .
sentences.chinese: 想到要离开，他心里充满了忧伤。

sentences.english: The committee was dismayed by what it had been told.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会被所告知的情况搞得焦虑不安。

detailed_translations.english: the worry, disappoint-ment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad

sentences.chinese: 这个建议使乔伊惊呆了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something dumbfounds you, they surprise you very much

sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

sentences.english: A few years ago a car fuelled by solar energy would have been inconceivable.
sentences.chinese: 几年前太阳能汽车还是不可思议的事。

sentences.english: It is inconceivable that a man in such a powerful position could act so unwisely.
sentences.chinese: 真是难以置信，这么大权在握的人行事竟如此愚蠢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可思议的；难以置信的；不能想象的；非凡的
detailed_translations.english: too strange or unusual to be thought real or possible

name: incredible
trans: adj. 难以置信的【同义】unbelievable adj. 难以置信的

sentences.english: It’s incredible that he survived the fall.
sentences.chinese: 他跌下去竟然能够生还，真不可思议。

sentences.english: It’s incredible how much Tom has changed since he met Sally.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见萨莉后，汤姆的变化之大简直令人难以置信。

sentences.english: I find it almost incredible that no one noticed these errors.
sentences.chinese: 没人发现这些错误，真让我无法相信。

detailed_translations.english: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

name: overwhelm

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

name: striking
trans: adj. 显著的；惊人的【同义】prominent adj. 著名的，显著的outstanding adj. 杰出的；显著的impressive adj. 给人深刻印象的

sentences.english: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
sentences.chinese: 显著的贫富差异

sentences.english: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.
sentences.chinese: 那些统计数据最显著的特征是高自杀率。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: antiseptic
trans: n. 防腐剂，杀菌剂；adj. 防腐的【记忆】词根记忆：anti（抗）+sept（烂）+ic（…的） →防腐的

sentences.english: The antiseptic properties of copper sulphate have never been questioned.
sentences.chinese: 硫酸铜具有防腐性，这是不曾有过问题的。

sentences.english: Polyurethane is a kind of excellent anticorrosion material, material has excellent antiseptic effect on metal substrate.
sentences.chinese: 聚胺又是一种优良的防腐材料，对金属底材具有优异的防腐作用。

sentences.english: Don't just give money, go volunteer somewhere so you can have direct interactions with people. Your life is too antiseptic and it is making you a bit boring.
sentences.chinese: 不要只是捐钱，去某个地方做志愿者吧，这样你就可以和别人直接互动。你的生活太“防腐”了，你开始觉得有点无聊了吧。

detailed_translations.english: a medicine that you put onto a wound to stop it from becoming infected

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

a short jump

trans: n. 社会；社区；团体；（动植物的）群落；共同体【记忆】词根记忆：com（共同）+mun（公共的）+ ity（状态）→公共状态→社区，团体【搭配】the Asian community 亚洲人聚居的社区sense of community 社区意识community spirit 团体精神

sentences.english: No Indian labourers under any employment program are given preventive information or materials — not even a bar of soap, even though 60 per cent of diseases are waterborne.
sentences.chinese: 在任何就业项目中的印度劳动者都没有获得预防信息或材料——即便60%的疾病是通过水传播的，他们甚至没有一块肥皂。

sentences.english: The researchers say their approach could also be used to identify the risk of other waterborne diseases, such as those caused by the bacteria Shigella, Salmonella, and Escherichia coli.
sentences.chinese: 这组科学家说，他们的方法还可以用于检测其他水传播疾病的风险，例如由志贺氏菌、沙门氏菌和埃希氏大肠杆菌引发的疾病。

name: boom
trans: n. 繁荣；vi. 迅速发展；激增【搭配】economic boom 经济繁荣

sentences.english: The boom has created job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

sentences.english: the economic boom of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.chinese: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

sentences.english: They set off at a brisk pace .
sentences.chinese: 他们踏着轻快的步伐上路了。

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.

sentences.english: Julia’s enthusiasm was catching.

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

sentences.english: The trip was made all the worse by Frankie’s morbid fear of flying.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗基对坐飞机有种病态的恐惧，使得旅途变得更加糟糕。

sentences.english: His head was full of morbid thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑袋里全是不健康的思想。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的；由病引起的；恐怖的；病变部位的

adj. 孤独的，凄凉的；/ˈdesəˌleɪt/
 v. 使孤独凄凉【同义】deserted adj. 荒凉的

trans: n. 秘密；保密【记忆】词根记忆：secre(t)（秘密）+cy（性质）→秘密

sentences.english: I must stress the need for absolute secrecy about the project.
sentences.chinese: 我必须强调这项计划一定要绝对保密。

sentences.english: His work was shrouded in secrecy .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作秘而不宣。

sentences.english: the veil of secrecy that covered the talks
sentences.chinese: 笼罩在会谈上的神秘面纱

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping something secret, or when something is kept a secret

name: surround
trans: v. 围绕；包围【记忆】联想记忆：sur+round（圆）→在圆的外边→围绕；包围【搭配】be surrounded by sth. 被某物围绕surround yourself with sth. 用某物把自己包围住

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: openly
trans: adv. 公开的

sentences.english: Sarah talked openly about her problems.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉毫不掩饰地说起自己的问题。

sentences.english: He was openly critical of his colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 他公开批评自己的同事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that does not hide your feelings, opinions, or the facts

name: communicate
trans: v. 交流【搭配】communicate with... 和…交流

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: remuneration
trans: n. 报酬【搭配】remuneration package 薪酬福利条件

sentences.english: high rates of remuneration
sentences.chinese: 很高的报酬

detailed_translations.english: the pay you give someone for something they have done for you

name: publicise
trans: v. 宣传；推广

name: bonus
trans: n. 奖金，红利；好处【记忆】联想记忆：bon（好的）+us（我们）→发奖金啦，我们都说好！→奖金【搭配】annual bonus 年终分红

sentences.english: Long-term savers qualify for a cash bonus.
sentences.chinese: 长期储户可获现金红利。

sentences.english: Further additions to your pay may take the form of bonus payments.
sentences.chinese: 工资以外的钱可能以奖金的形式发放。

sentences.english: a Christmas bonus
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节奖金

sentences.english: Each worker receives an annual bonus.
sentences.chinese: 每个员工都可获得一笔年度奖金。

sentences.english: a £20,000 bonus
sentences.chinese: 一笔2万英镑的奖金

detailed_translations.english: money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work

name: allocate
trans: vt. 分配；分派【记忆】词根记忆：al（加强）+loc（地方）+ate（做）→不断往地方送→分配

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: annual
trans: adj. 每年的，年度的；n. 年鉴；一年生的植物【记忆】词根记忆：ann（年）+ual（…的）→每年的【搭配】annual income 年收入annual leave 年假annual salary 年薪

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: salary
trans: n. 薪水（按月、年发放）

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

name: lump
trans: n. 块，肿块；v. 结块；将…归并在一起【搭配】a lump sum 一次总付的钱款

sentences.english: You are the one with a lump.
sentences.chinese: 你是那个有了肿块的人。

sentences.english: One day, I noticed a lump in her skin.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我注意到她皮肤上有个肿块。

sentences.english: Then the lump or cancer attaches itself to this wall.
sentences.chinese: 然后肿块或癌就附着在那钙壁上。

detailed_translations.english: to collect into a mass or group
a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape
to put two or more different people or things together and consider them as a single group, sometimes wrongly

name: sum
trans: n. 总数；金额；算术；vi. 共计【搭配】in sum 简言之sum up 计算…的总数；概括

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: spread out
trans: 散开；伸展

name: action
trans: n. 行为；动作【记忆】词根记忆：act（做）+ion（表名词）→行为【搭配】put into action将…付诸行动take action采取行动in action在运转

sentences.english: The government must take action (=do something) now to stop the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在必须采取行动遏止暴力犯罪的上升。

detailed_translations.english: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

name: reward
trans: n. 奖赏；报酬；vt. 酬谢；奖励【记忆】联想记忆：re（重新）+ward（看作word，话语）→再次发话给予奖赏→奖赏

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: visible
trans: adj. 可见的；有形的；显而易见的【记忆】词根记忆：vis（看）+ible（可…的）→可见的【同根】invisible adj. 看不见的，无形的

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: potentially
trans: adv. 可能的；潜在的【同根】potential adj. 潜在的 n. 潜能

sentences.english: a potentially dangerous situation
sentences.chinese: 有潜在危险的局势

detailed_translations.english: something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future

name: motivating
trans: adj. 激励人的【记忆】词根记忆：motivat（e）（激励）+ing（令人…的）→激励人的

name: added
trans: adj. 额外的，附加的【搭配】added expense 额外花销

name: allowance
trans: n. 津贴；允许，容忍【记忆】词根记忆：allow（允许）+ance（状态）→允许，容忍【搭配】housing allowance 住房津贴

sentences.english: Sales staff get a generous mileage allowance or a company car.
sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.english: If you are entitled to sickness allowance, you must claim it from your employer.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有资格领取疾病津贴，必须向雇主申请索要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 津贴， 补贴； 零用钱
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose

name: base on
trans: 基于…

name: basic wage
trans: 基本工资

name: daily wage
trans: 日工资

name: day-off
trans: n. 休息日

name: flexible time
trans: 弹性工时

name: give a raise
trans: 加薪

name: hourly wage
trans: 计时工资

name: income
trans: n. 收入

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: longevity pay
trans: 工龄津贴

name: merit pay
trans: 绩效工资

name: perquisite
trans: n. 固定津贴；利益【记忆】词根记忆：per（贯穿）+quis（获得）+ ite（物）→要求全部获得→利益

sentences.english: In so many countries that I covered in Southeast Asia it was a given that the elites would take over public land as a kind of perquisite of power.
sentences.chinese: 在我报道过的许多东南亚国家，精英阶层拥有将公有土地挪为私用的特权，是人尽皆知的常态。

name: plus
trans: prep. 加，加上

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

name: post wage
trans: 岗位工资

name: premium
trans: n. 保险费；额外费用；奖金，津贴；adj. 优质的；售价高的【记忆】词根记忆：pr(e)（前）+em（拿，引申为买）+ium→提前买保险→保险金【搭配】premium loan （缴付）保费贷款

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: probation
trans: n. 试用【记忆】词根记忆：prob（证明）+ation→证明能力→试用

sentences.english: The judge sentenced Jennings to three years’ probation.
sentences.chinese: 法官判詹宁斯三年缓刑。

detailed_translations.english: a system that allows some criminals not to go to prison or to leave prison, if they behave well and see a probation officer regularly, for a particular period of time

name: probationary period
trans: 试用期

name: reasonable request
trans: 合理的请求

name: regular
trans: adj. 正式的【搭配】regular worker 正式工人

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: salary man
trans: 上班族

name: salary range
trans: 薪酬范围

name: seniority pay
trans: 工龄工资

name: starting salary
trans: 起薪

name: subsidy
trans: n. 津贴，补助金【记忆】词根记忆：sub（下面）+sid（坐）+y→在台下就座领津贴→津贴

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

name: title allowance
trans: 职称津贴

name: wage
trans: n. 薪水（按周、日发放）

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name: elevate
trans: vt. 振奋情绪等；提升…的职位；举起【记忆】词根记忆：e（出）+lev（举起）+ate（使…） →举起【搭配】elevate to 提高至

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励；促进，激发【记忆】词根记忆：en（使…）+courage（勇气）→使有勇气→鼓励【搭配】encourage sb. to do sth. 鼓励某人做某事

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: encouragement
trans: n. 鼓励，激励【记忆】词根记忆：encourage（鼓励）+ment（表名词）→鼓励【搭配】moral encouragement 精神鼓励

sentences.english: With encouragement, Sally is starting to play with the other children.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉受到了鼓励，开始和其他孩子玩起来。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["words of encouragement"]}
sentences.chinese: 鼓励的话

detailed_translations.english: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them

name: hearten
trans: v. 鼓励，激励【搭配】hearten up激励

sentences.english: The news heartened everybody.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息鼓舞了每个人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel happier and more hopeful

name: incentive
trans: n. 刺激；动机【记忆】联想记忆：in+cent（分，分币）+ive→用钱（分币）刺激→刺激【同义】motivation n. 刺激impetus n. 推动，刺激

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: inspire
trans: v. 鼓舞，激起；给…以灵感【记忆】词根记忆：in（使…）+spir（呼吸）+e →使…呼吸澎湃→鼓舞【同根】inspired adj. 有创作力的inspiring adj. 鼓舞人心的

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something
